event: November – Swedish troops evacuate Finland. Tsar Alexander I of Russia proclaims Finland a part of Russia.

title: Battle of Tudela
event: November 23 – Battle of Tudela: French Marshal Lannes defeats a Spanish army at the

title: London
event: December 20 – The original Covent Garden Theatre in London is destroyed by a fire, along with most of the scenery, costumes and scripts.

title: Vienna
event: December 22 – Ludwig van Beethoven conducts and performs in concert at the Theater an der Wien, Vienna, with the premiere of his ''Fifth Symphony'', ''Sixth Symphony'', ''Fourth Piano Concerto'' (performed by Beethoven himself) and ''Choral Fantasy'' (with Beethoven at the piano).

title: USS Constitution
event: The ''USS Constitution'' (Old Ironsides) is recommissioned as the flagship of the North Atlantic Squadron.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 16 – Peninsular War – Battle of Corunna: The French were defeated by the British.

title: France
event: February 8 – Franz I of Austria declares war on France.

title: Miami University
event: February 17 – Miami University (Ohio) is established on the township of land required to be set aside for it under the conditions of the Miami Purchase in 1794.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: A decision by the Supreme Court of the United States states that the power of the federal government is greater than any individual state.

title: Gripsholm Castle
event: March 13 – A military coup ousts Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden; he is confined in the Gripsholm Castle.

title: Grand Duchy of Finland
event: At the Diet of Porvoo, Finland's four Estates pledge allegiance to Alexander I of Russia, commencing the secession of the Grand Duchy of Finland from Sweden.

title: France
event: April 9 – Tiroleans rise under the command of Andreas Hofer against French and Bavarian occupation.

title: Switzerland
event: The Swiss canton of Aargau denies Jews citizenship.

title: Papal States
event: May 17 – Napoleon I of France orders the annexation of the Papal States to the French Empire. When he announces that the Pope's secular power has ended, the Pope excommunicates him.

title: Battle of Aspern-Essling
event: May 21 – Battle of Aspern-Essling: Austrian troops under Archduke Karl beat the French under Napoleon in a hard fought battle.

title: Battle of Wagram
event: July 5–6 – Battle of Wagram: Napoleon defeats the Austrians.

title: Bolivia
event: July 16 – The city of La Paz (current Bolivia) declares its independence from the Spanish Crown and forms the ''Junta Tuitiva'', the first independent government in Spanish America, led by Pedro Domingo Murillo.

title: Battle of Talavera
event: July 28 – Battle of Talavera: Sir Arthur Wellesley's British, Portuguese and Spanish army defeats a French force.

title: Treaty of Fredrikshamn
event: September 17 – The Peace of Hamina is signed between Russia and Sweden in the Finnish War. The territory to become the Grand Duchy of Finland is ceded to Russia by the Treaty of Fredrikshamn.

title: London
event: September 18 – A new theatre to hold the Royal Opera House opens in London to replace the first, burnt down in a fire in 1808. The price increases lead to the Old Price Riots which last for 64 days.

title: Tennessee
event: October 11 – Along the Natchez Trace in Tennessee, explorer Meriwether Lewis dies under mysterious circumstances at an inn called Grinder's Stand.

title: France
event: October 14 – The Treaty of Schoenbrunn cedes the Illyrian provinces to France.

title: London
event: November 10 – Berners Street Hoax: Theodore Hook manages to attract dozens of people to 54 Berners Street in London.

title: Battle of Ocana
event: November 19 – Battle of Ocana: A Spanish army is ridden down and 20,000 are killed by French forces.

title: Massachusetts
event: December 30 – Wearing masks at balls is forbidden in Boston, Massachusetts.

title: United Kingdom
event: King George III of the United Kingdom is recognized as insane.

title: Caucasus
event: Moose become extinct in the Caucasus.

title: Sukhumi
event: Russia acquires Sukhumi through a treaty with the Abkhazian dukes, and declares a protectorate over the whole of Abkhazia.

title: Brazil
event: 18,000 Angolans are sold at Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

title: Manchester
event: Adult cotton spinners stage a general strike in Manchester.

title: United Kingdom
event: Palm oil sales from West Africa to Britain reach 1,000 tons.

title: China
event: 4,500 chests of opium are sold in China.

title: Portugal
event: March 4 – The French Army, under the command of Massena, retreats from Portugal.

title: France
event: May 1 – Macon's Bill Number 2 becomes law in the United States, intending to motivate Britain and France to stop seizing American vessels during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Buenos Aires
event: May 10 – Revolutionaries occupy Buenos Aires' town hall.

title: Argentina
event: May 25 – May Revolution: Armed citizens of Buenos Aires expel the Viceroy from Spain and establish a provincial government for Argentina.

title: Dedham Massachusetts
event: June 4 – The Society in Dedham for Apprehending Horse Thieves is founded in Dedham, Massachusetts.

title: Santa Cruz de Mompox
event: August 6 – The city of Santa Cruz de Mompox, in modern-day Colombia, declares independence from the Spanish Empire.

title: New York Harbor
event: September 8 – The ''Tonquin'' sets sail from New York Harbor with 33 employees of John Jacob Astor's newly created Pacific Fur Company on board. After a 6-month journey around the tip of South America, the ship arrives at the mouth of the Columbia River and Astor's men establish the fur-trading town of Astoria.

title: West Florida
event: September 23 –  The Republic of West Florida declares independence from Spain.

title: Oktoberfest
event: October 12 – First Oktoberfest: The Bavarian royalty invites the citizens of Munich to join the celebration of the marriage of Crown Prince Ludwig of Bavaria to Princess Therese of Saxe-Hildburghausen.

title: West Florida
event: October 27 – The United States annexes the Republic of West Florida.

title: Manitoba
event: The Red River Colony is founded in Manitoba, Canada.

title: Louisiana
event: January 8 – An unsuccessful slave revolt is led by Charles Deslandes in St. Charles and St. James, Louisiana.

title: Texas
event: January 22 – The Casas Revolt begins in San Antonio, Texas.

title: Battle of Lissa (1811)
event: March 13 – Battle of Lissa (1811): The British fleet defeats the French.

title: Denmark
event: March 27 – Battle of Anholt: The British Navy defeats Denmark.

title: Buenos Aires
event: April 5–April 6 – Revolutionary riots occur in Buenos Aires.

title: France
event: May 16 – Battle of Albuera: Spain, Portugal and Great Britain defeat the French.

title: 1811 Great fire of Podil
event: June 9 – The Great fire of the Podil breaks out in Kiev, Ukraine.

title: Italy
event: July 11 – Italian scientist Amedeo Avogadro publishes his memoire about the molecular content of gases.

title: Bernese Alps
event: August 3 – First ascent of Jungfrau, third highest summit in the Bernese Alps,

title: Woodford County Kentucky
event: The Old Oscar Pepper Distillery (now the Woodford Reserve Distillery), the oldest Kentucky Bourbon distillery, is established along Glenn's Creek in Woodford County, Kentucky.

title: Finland
event: The capital of Finland is moved from Turku to Helsinki.

title: New Madrid Missouri
event: February 7 – The last New Madrid Earthquake strikes New Madrid, Missouri, with an estimated moment magnitude of over 8;

title: Massachusetts
event: February 11 – Massachusetts governor Elbridge Gerry invents gerrymandering.

title: Nottinghamshire
event: February 27 – Poet Lord Byron gives his first address as a member of the House of Lords, in defense of Luddite violence against Industrialism in his home county of Nottinghamshire.

title: West Yorkshire
event: March 15 – Luddites attack the wool processing factory of Frank Vickerman in West Yorkshire.

title: 1812 Caracas earthquake
event: March 26 – An earthquake destroys Caracas, Venezuela.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 4 – U.S. President James Madison enacts a 90-day embargo on trade with the United Kingdom.

title: Louisiana
event: April 30 – Louisiana is admitted as the 18th U.S. state.

title: Felling mine disaster
event: May 25 – Felling mine disaster: A mine explosion at the Felling colliery near Jarrow, England leaves 96 dead.

title: Bessarabia
event: May 28 – Russian Field Marshal Mikhail Kutuzov signs the Treaty of Bucharest, ending the Russo-Turkish War, 1806-1812 and making Bessarabia a part of Imperial Russia.

title: Great Britain
event: June 1 – War of 1812: U.S. President James Madison asks the U.S. Congress to declare war on Great Britain.

title: Louisiana
event: June 4 – Following Louisiana's admittance as a U.S. state, the territory by that name is renamed the Missouri Territory.

title: Battle of Klyastitsy
event: July 18 – Russia's Patriotic War – Battle of Klyastitsy: Kulnev defeats Oudinot but sustains a mortal wound.

title: Salamanca
event: July 22 – Peninsular War – Battle of Salamanca: British forces led by Lord Wellington defeat French troops near Salamanca in Spain.

title: Battle of Salamanca
event: August 12 – Peninsular War: The combined English and Portuguese army under the command of Wellington enters Madrid following the Battle of Salamanca.

title: USS Constitution
event: August 19 – War of 1812: The ''USS Constitution'' defeats the British frigate ''Guerrière'' off the coast of Nova Scotia. The British shot is said to have bounced off the ''Constitution'''s sides, earning her the nickname Old Ironsides.

title: Battle of Borodino
event: September 7 – Napoleonic Wars – Battle of Borodino: The bloodiest battle of the Napoleonic wars ends in a draw.

title: Harrisburg Pennsylvania
event: October – The capital of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, United States is permanently moved from Lancaster to Harrisburg.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 9 – War of 1812: American naval forces under Lieutenant Jesse Duncan Elliott capture two British warships, {{HMSDetroit18126}} and HMS ''Caledonia''.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 13 – War of 1812 – Battle of Queenston Heights: As part of the Niagara campaign in Ontario, Canada, United States forces under General Stephen Van Rensselaer are repulsed from invading Canada by British and native troops led by Sir Isaac Brock (although he dies during the battle).

title: France
event: October 24 – Napoleonic Wars – Battle of Maloyaroslavets: An inconclusive encounter between the French vanguard and a Russian force leads Napoleon to decide to retreat along the same line as his advance, with disastrous results.

title: France
event: Russian troops reach and take Berlin without a fight after the French garrison evacuates the city.

title: Vienna
event: George Hamilton-Gordon serves as ambassador extraordinaire in Vienna.

title: Shewa
event: Following the death of his father Wossen Seged, Sahle Selassie arrives at the capital Qundi before his other brothers, and is made Meridazmach of Shewa.

title: University of Pennsylvania
event: The Philomathean Society of the University of Pennsylvania is founded (the oldest continuously existing literary society in the United States).

title: Bass Islands
event: February – General Harrison sends out an expedition to burn the British vessels at Malden by going across Lake Erie via the Bass Islands in sleighs, but the ice is not hard enough and the expedition returns.

title: Kentucky
event: March 22 – Col. R. M. Johnson puts out an order for raising a regiment of mounted volunteers in Kentucky.

title: Bexar County Texas
event: March 29 – Mexican War of Independence – Battle of Rosillo Creek: The Republican Army of the North defeats the Spanish Royalist Army in present-day Bexar County, Texas.

title: Ontario
event: April 27 – War of 1812 – Battle of York: United States troops raid, destroy, but do not hold the capital of Ontario, York (present day Toronto, Ontario).

title: Battle of Lützen (1813)
event: May 2 – Battle of Lützen: Napoleon wins against the German alliance.

title: Battle of Bautzen
event: May 20–May 21 – Battle of Bautzen: Napoleon again defeats his combined enemies.

title: Fort George Ontario
event: May 27 – War of 1812: In Canada, American forces capture Fort George.

title: United Kingdom
event: War of 1812 – Battle of Stoney Creek: A British force of 700 under John Vincent defeat an American force 3 times its size under William Winder and John Chandler.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 5 – War of 1812: Three weeks of British raids on Fort Schlosser, Black Rock and Plattsburgh, New York begin.

title: Burma
event: July 13 – Missionaries Adoniram Judson and his wife Ann Hasseltine Judson arrive in Burma.

title: Battle of Großbeeren
event: August 23 – Battle of Großbeeren: Napoleon is defeated by Prussia and Sweden.

title: Battle of Dresden
event: August 26–August 27 – Battle of Dresden: Napoleon's troops are victorious.

title: Battle of Kulm
event: August 29–August 30 – Battle of Kulm: Napoleon's troops are defeated by Russia, Prussia and Austria.

title: Battle of Dennewitz
event: September 6 – Battle of Dennewitz: The armies of Napoleon are again defeated by Prussia and Russia.

title: United Kingdom
event: September 10 – War of 1812 – Battle of Lake Erie: An American squadron under Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry defeats a British squadron, capturing 6 ships.

title: Battle of the Thames
event: October 5 – War of 1812 – Battle of the Thames: William Henry Harrison defeats the British, and native leader Tecumseh is killed in battle.

title: Battle of Leipzig
event: October 16–October 19 – Battle of Leipzig: Napoleon is defeated.

title: Aras River
event: October 24–November 5 – Persia and Russia sign the Treaty of Gulistan of 1813 at the end of the Russo-Persian War by which Persia (Iran) loses all its territories to the north of Aras River to the Russians.

title: Battle of Crysler's Farm
event: November 11 – War of 1812 – Battle of Crysler's Farm: the Americans are defeated by the British.

title: Lewiston New York
event: December 18–December 19 – War of 1812:  British soldiers and native allies invade the United States and are successful in the Capture of Fort Niagara and attack Lewiston, New York.

title: United Kingdom
event: December 29 – War of 1812: British soldiers burn Buffalo, New York.

title: London Beer Flood
event: October – A large vat full of porter (beer) owned by Meux's Brewery of London bursts, demolishing houses and killing 9 people. See London Beer Flood.

title: British Guiana
event: Guyana is transferred from the Netherlands to Britain; it is renamed ''British Guiana''.

title: Pomerania
event: January 14 – Denmark cedes Norway to Sweden in exchange for west Pomerania, as part of the Treaty of Kiel.

title: France
event: January 29 – Battle of Brienne: The French army of Emperor Napoleon I wins.

title: Argentina
event: January 31 – Gervasio Antonio de Posadas becomes Supreme Director of Argentina.

title: London
event: February 12 – A fire destroys the Custom House in London.

title: Battle of Craonne
event: March 7 – Napoleon wins the Battle of Craonne.

title: Caribbean
event: March 9 – the USS Enterprise reaches Wilmington, North Carolina, returning from the Caribbean.

title: France
event: March 10 – Napoleon is defeated at the Battle of Laon in France.

title: Alabama
event: March 27 – War of 1812 – Battle of Horseshoe Bend: In northern Alabama, United States forces under General Andrew Jackson defeat the Creek Indians.

title: Fort Ontario
event: May 5 – British-American War (War of 1812): The British attack Fort Ontario at Oswego, New York.

title: Denmark
event: May 17 – The Constitution of Norway is signed and the Danish Crown Prince Christian Frederik is elected King of Norway by the Norwegian Constituent Assembly.

title: France
event: May 17 – The occupation of Monaco changes from French to Austrian hands.

title: Elba
event: May 30 – The First Treaty of Paris is signed returning France's borders to their 1792 extent. Napoleon I of France is exiled to Elba on the same day.

title: Chippawa Ontario
event: July 5 – War of 1812 – Battle of Chippawa: American Major General Jacob Brown defeats British General Phineas Riall at Chippawa, Ontario.

title: Niagara Falls Ontario
event: July 24 – War of 1812: General Phineas Riall advances toward Niagara Falls, Ontario to halt Jacob Brown's American invaders.

title: Fort Erie
event: War of 1812 – Battle of Lundy's Lane : Reinforcements arrive near Niagara Falls, Ontario for General Riall's British and Canadian force, and a bloody, all-night battle with Jacob Brown's Americans commences at 1800 hours; Americans retreat to Fort Erie.

title: Society of Jesus
event: August 7 – Pope Pius VII decrees the bull Sollicitudo omnium ecclesiarum reestablishing the Society of Jesus (Jesuits) all over the world, after having approved their survival and existence in Russia.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 28 – Alexandria, Virginia offers surrender to the British fleet without a fight.

title: Battle of Plattsburgh
event: September 11 – War of 1812 – Battle of Lake Champlain: An American squadron under Thomas MacDonough defeats the British squadron, ultimately forcing the invading army to retreat back into Canada.

title: Congress of Vienna
event: November – Congress of Vienna: The settling of the many issues arising from the French Revolutionary Wars, the Napoleonic Wars, and the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire.

title: Florida
event: November 7 – War of 1812: Andrew Jackson seizes Pensacola, Florida.

title: New Zealand
event: British missionaries arrive in New Zealand.

title: United Kingdom
event: In Britain, use of the pillory is limited to punishment for perjury.

title: Veracruz Veracruz
event: The Spanish Empire is expelled from Veracruz.

title: Congress of Vienna
event: Congress of Vienna (1814–1815)

title: France
event: January 3 – Austria, Britain, and Bourbon-restored France form a secret defensive alliance treaty against Prussia and Russia.

title: Battle of New Orleans
event: January 8 – War of 1812 – Battle of New Orleans: American forces under General Andrew Jackson defeat an invading British force.

title: Switzerland
event: February 3 – The first commercial cheese factory is founded in Switzerland.

title: New Jersey
event: February 6 – New Jersey grants the first American railroad charter to a John Stevens.

title: Elba
event: February 26 – Napoleon Bonaparte escapes from Elba.

title: Elba
event: March 1 – Napoleon returns to France from his banishment on Elba.

title: Elba
event: March 20 – Napoleon enters Paris after escaping from Elba with a regular army of 140,000 and a volunteer force of around 200,000 beginning his Hundred Days rule.

title: Dutch East Indies
event: April 5–April 12 – Mount Tambora in the Dutch East Indies blows its top explosively during an eruption, killing upwards of 92,000 and propelling thousands of tons of aerosols (Sulfide gas compounds) into the upper atmosphere (stratosphere). The high level gases reflect sunlight and cause the widespread cooling (known as a volcanic winter) and heavy rains of 1816, causes snows in June and July in the northern hemisphere, widespread crop failures, and subsequently famine, which is why 1816 is later known as the Year Without a Summer.

title: Takovo
event: April 23 – The Second Serbian Uprising against Ottoman rule takes place in Takovo, Serbia. By the end of the year Serbia is acknowledged as a semi-independent state; the ideals of the First Serbian Uprising have thus been temporarily achieved.

title: Corsica
event: May 3 – Battle of Tolentino: Austria defeats the Kingdom of Naples, which quickly ends the Neapolitan War. Joachim Murat, the defeated King of Naples, is forced to flee to Corsica and is later executed.

title: South Africa
event: May 30 – The ''Arniston'', an East Indiaman repatriating wounded troops to England from Ceylon, is wrecked near Waenhuiskrans, South Africa with the loss of 372 of the 378 people on board.

title: Congress of Vienna
event: June 9 – Congress of Vienna: A new European political situation is set.

title: Battle of Waterloo
event: June 18 – Battle of Waterloo: The Duke of Wellington decisively defeats Napoleon, ending the Napoleonic wars.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 17 – In France, Napoleon surrenders at Rochefort to British forces.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: October 15 – Napoleon I of France begins his exile on Saint Helena in the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Switzerland
event: July – Lord Byron, Mary Wollstonecraft Godwin, Percy Bysshe Shelley and John Polidori, gathered at the Villa Diodati by Lake Geneva in a rainy Switzerland, tell each other tales. This gives rise to two classic Gothic narratives, Mary Shelley's ''Frankenstein'' and Polidori's ''The Vampyre''.

title: Society of Jesus
event: January 1 – Tsar Alexander I of Russia signs an order for the expulsion of the Jesuits from the Russian Empire.

title: Newfoundland and Labrador
event: February 12 – Fire nearly destroys the city of St. John's, Newfoundland.

title: Largo di Torre Argentina
event: February 20 – Gioachino Rossini's ''The Barber of Seville'' debuts at Teatro Argentina, with a ''fiasco''.

title: Estonia
event: March 23 – Estonia emancipates its peasants from serfdom.

title: Philadelphia
event: April 11 – In Philadelphia, the African Methodist Episcopal Church is established by Richard Allen and other African-American Methodists, the first such denomination completely independent of White churches.

title: Manitoba
event: June 19 – Battle of Seven Oaks: The Hudson's Bay Company is defeated by the North West Fur-Trading Company, near Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.

title: Argentina
event: July 9 – Argentina gains independence from Spain.

title: France
event: July 17 – The French passenger ship ''Medusa'' runs aground off the coast of Senegal, with 140 lives lost in the botched rescue that takes weeks, leading to a scandal in the French government.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: August 24 – The Treaty of St. Louis is signed in St. Louis, Missouri.

title: Indiana
event: December 11 – Indiana is admitted as the 19th U.S. state.

title: Brazil
event: The Pernambucan Revolt breaks out in Brazil.

title: Argentina
event: January 19 – An army of 5,423 soldiers, led by General José de San Martín, starts crossing the Andes from Argentina to liberate Chile and then Peru.

title: Argentina
event: February 12 – Battle of Chacabuco: The Argentine/Chilean patriotic army defeats the Spanish.

title: Alabama Territory
event: U.S. Congress passes law to split the Mississippi Territory, after Mississippi drafts a constitution, creating the Alabama Territory effective in August.

title: Gloucestershire
event: April 3 – Princess Caraboo appears in Almondsbury in Gloucestershire, England.

title: Hartford Connecticut
event: April 15 – The first American school for the deaf opens in Hartford, Connecticut.

title: New York City
event: May – The General Convention of the Episcopal Church founds the General Theological Seminary while meeting in New York City.

title: Erie Canal
event: July 4 – At Rome, New York, construction on the Erie Canal begins.

title: Mississippi
event: August 15 – By act of the U.S. Congress (March 3), the Alabama Territory is created by splitting the Mississippi Territory in half, on the day the Mississippi constitution is drafted, 4 months before Mississippi becomes a U.S. state.

title: Brazil
event: August 22 – The city of Araraquara, Brazil is founded.

title: Helike
event: August 23 – An earthquake near the site of the ancient Greek city of Helike results in 65 deaths.

title: Florida
event: November 20 – The first Seminole War begins in Florida.

title: Mississippi
event: December 10 – Mississippi is admitted as the 20th U.S. state, formerly the Mississippi Territory.

title: Singapore
event: Lord Hastings, governor-general of India, gives approval to Sir Stamford Raffles to establish trading station at the southern tip of the Malay Peninsula (modern-day Singapore).

title: France
event: October 5 – Claudine Thévenet (known as 'Mary of St. Ignatius') founded the Roman Catholic order, ''Religious of Jesus And Mary/Religieuses de Jésus-Marie'' in Lyon, France.

title: Northwest Angle
event: October 20 – The Treaty of 1818 between the U.S. and the United Kingdom establishes the northern boundary as the 49th parallel from the Lake of the Woods to the Rocky Mountains, also creating the Northwest Angle.

title: Ying Wa College
event: November 11 – Anglo-Chinese College is founded by Robert Morrison in Malacca (later renamed Ying Wa College).

title: Illinois
event: December 3 – Illinois is admitted as the 21st U.S. state.

title: Hawaii
event: The 'Ai Noa Movement takes power in Hawaii.

title: University of Virginia
event: January 25 – Thomas Jefferson founds the University of Virginia.

title: Singapore
event: January 29 – Sir Stamford Raffles lands on the island of Singapore.

title: Dartmouth College
event: February 2 – The Supreme Court under John Marshall rules in favor of Dartmouth College in the famous ''Dartmouth College v. Woodward'' case, allowing Dartmouth to keep its charter and remain a private institution.

title: Singapore
event: February 6 – A formal treaty between Hussein Shah of Johor and the British Sir Thomas Stamford Raffles establishes a trading settlement in Singapore.

title: Florida
event: February 22 – Spain cedes Florida to the United States (see Adams-Onís Treaty).

title: Burlington Arcade
event: March 20 – Burlington Arcade opens in London.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: May 22 –  The ''SS Savannah'' leaves port at Savannah, Georgia on a voyage to become the first steamship to cross the Atlantic Ocean. The ship arrives at  Liverpool, England on June 20.

title: Vermont
event: August 6 – Norwich University is founded by Captain Alden Partridge in Vermont as the first private military school in the United States.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 16 – Peterloo Massacre:  The cavalry charges into a crowd of protesters in Manchester, UK, resulting in 11 deaths and over 400 injuries.

title: German Confederation
event: September 20 – The Carlsbad Decree is issued throughout the German Confederation.

title: Alabama
event: December 14 – Alabama is admitted as the 22nd U.S. state.

title: Falkland Islands
event: The Argentine Confederation (Argentina) establishes a penal colony in the Malvinas.

title: Mount Rainier
event: Mount Rainier erupts over what is today Seattle.

title: Luanda
event: 18,957 black slaves leave Luanda, Angola.

title: History of Antarctica
event: January 28 – A Russian expedition led by Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen and Mikhail Petrovich Lazarev approaches the Antarctic coast (see History of Antarctica).

title: History of Antarctica
event: January 30 – Edward Bransfield lands on the Antarctic mainland (see History of Antarctica).

title: New York City
event: 86 free African American colonists sail from New York City to Freetown, Sierra Leone.

title: Santa María Chiquimula
event: February 20 – A revolt begins in Santa María Chiquimula, Totonicapán department of Guatemala.

title: Maine
event: March 15 – Maine is admitted as the 23rd U.S. state.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 1 – The last hanging, drawing and quartering in Britain is meted out to the Cato Street conspirators for treason (only hanged and beheaded).

title: France
event: May 20 – John Stuart Mill sets out on his formative boyhood trip to France.

title: Republic of Ireland
event: July 20 – Saint Cronan's Boys National School opens in Bray, Co. Wicklow, Ireland under the title ''Bray Male School''. It is the oldest school in Bray and its notable past pupils include the former President of Ireland, Cearbhall Ó Dálaigh.

title: Portugal
event: August 24 – A Constitutionalist insurrection breaks out at Oporto, Portugal.

title: Lisbon
event: September 15 – A revolution breaks out in Lisbon (see Portugal's crises of the Nineteenth Century).

title: Essex (whaleship)
event: November 20 After the sinking of the Essex (whaleship) of Nantucket by a whale the survivors were left floating in three small whaleboats. They eventually resorted, by common consent, to cannibalism to allow some to survive.

title: Greece
event: March 25 (O.S.)/April 6 (N.S.) – Greece declares its liberation from the Ottoman Empire, beginning the Greek War of Independence.

title: Saint Helena
event: May 5 – Emperor Napoléon I dies in exile on Saint Helena of stomach cancer.

title: Wallachia
event: June 19 – The Philikí Etaireía are decisively defeated by the Ottomans at Drăgăşani (in Wallachia).

title: Battle of Carabobo
event: June 24 – Battle of Carabobo: Simón Bolívar wins Venezuela's independence from Spain (see Venezuela's independence).

title: New Hampshire
event: June 27 – The New Hampton School is founded in the United States state of New Hampshire.

title: Florida
event: July 10 – The United States takes possession of its newly bought territory of Florida from Spain.

title: Missouri
event: August 10 – Missouri is admitted as the 24th U.S. state (see History of Missouri.

title: Jarvis Island
event: August 21 – Jarvis Island is discovered by the crew of the Eliza Frances.

title: Nicaragua
event: September 15 – Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, Nicaragua and Costa Rica gain independence from Spain (see History of Central America).

title: Massachusetts
event: September 18 – Amherst College is founded in Massachusetts.

title: Santa Fe Trail
event: November 16 – American Old West: The Santa Fe Trail is used by the first White American.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: Ashley's Hundred leave from St. Louis, setting off a major increase in fur trade.

title: United Kingdom
event: Britain repeals the death penalty for over 100 crimes (see Capital punishment in the United Kingdom).

title: Monrovia
event: The first group of freed slaves from the USA arrive in modern-day Liberia and found Monrovia (see History of Liberia).

title: Bound Brook New Jersey
event: The Graham Cracker is developed in Bound Brook, New Jersey by the Presbyterian minister Sylvester Graham.

title: West Virginia
event: Gist Masion is built in Wellsburg, West Virginia (used some 100 years later for the Brooke Hills Spooktacular.

title: South China Sea
event: February 6 – Chinese junk ''Tek Sing'' sinks in the South China Sea with the loss of around 1600 people onboard.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 8 – The Chippewas turn over huge tract of land in Ontario to the United Kingdom.

title: Thermopylae
event: July 13 – Greek War of Independence: Greeks defeat Ottoman forces at Thermopylae.

title: University of Wales Lampeter
event: August 12 – St David's College (now the University of Wales, Lampeter) is founded by Bishop Thomas Burgess.

title: Portugal
event: September 7 – Brazil declares its independence from Portugal (see Brazilian independence).

title: United Kingdom
event: September 16 – George Canning is appointed British Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.

title: Portugal
event: September 22 – Portugal approves its first Constitution.

title: France
event: October–December – Congress of Verona: Russia, Austria and Prussia approve French intervention in Spain.

title: Greece
event: November 13 – Greek War of Independence: Nafplion falls to the Greek rebels.

title: Brazil
event: December 1 – Peter I is crowned as Emperor of Brazil (see The reign of Pedro I, 1822–31).

title: Tennessee
event: Jackson Male Academy, precursor of Union University, is founded in Tennessee.

title: Oxford Union
event: The Oxford Union is founded.

title: North America
event: July 1– The congress of Central America declares absolute independence from Spain, Mexico, and any other foreign nation, including North America and a Republican system of government is established.

title: Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls
event: July 15 – The Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls in Rome is almost completely destroyed by fire.

title: Burma
event: The British take Rangoon, Burma.

title: Crete
event: The Egyptians capture Crete.

title: France
event: The ''Cimetière du Montparnasse'' is established in Paris, France.

title: Australia
event: The name ''Australia'', recommended by Matthew Flinders in 1804, is finally adopted as the official name of the country once known as ''New Holland''.

title: Fort Vancouver
event: The Fort Vancouver trading post  is established on the lower Columbia River by the Hudson Bay Company.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 22 – The Ashanti crush British forces in the Gold Coast, killing the British governor Sir Charles MacCarthy (see also Wars between Britain and Ashanti in Ghana and Ashanti Confederacy).

title: St. Augustine Florida
event: March 7 – Florida State Capitol moves from St. Augustine, Florida to Tallahassee, Florida

title: Vienna
event: May 7 – One of Beethoven's great masterpieces, his ''Symphony No. 9'', premieres in Vienna.

title: Great Britain
event: June 16 – Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals is established in Great Britain.

title: Sydney
event: September 13 – With his crew and 29 convicts aboard the ''Amity'', John Oxley arrives at and founds the Moreton Bay Penal Settlement at what is now Redcliffe in Queensland, Australia, after leaving Sydney.

title: France
event: September 16 – Charles X succeeds his brother Louis XVIII as King of France.

title: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute
event: November 5 – Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (the first technological university in the English-speaking world) is founded in Troy, New York.

title: Welland Canal
event: November 30 – The first sod is turned in Ontario, for the first of four Welland Canals (the canal opens for a trial run exactly 5 years later to the day).

title: St John's College Cambridge
event: September – The Lady Margaret Boat Club is founded by 12 members of St John's College, Cambridge.

title: London
event: The first horse-drawn omnibuses established in London.

title: Brisbane
event: The City of Brisbane is founded (see History of Brisbane).

title: Beijing
event: Estimation: London becomes the largest city of the world, taking the lead from Beijing.[http://geography.about.com/library/weekly/aa011201a.htm]

title: Denmark
event: February 3 – Vendsyssel-Thy, once part of the Jutland peninsula that formed westernmost Denmark, becomes an island after a flood drowns its 1 km wide isthmus.

title: Georgia (U.S. state)
event: February 12 – The Creek cede the last of their lands in Georgia to the United States government, and migrate west.

title: Denmark
event: July 6 – The Duke of Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Beck gains possession of Glücksburg and changes his title to Friedrich Wilhelm, Duke of Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg. The line of Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg later becomes the Royal House of Greece, Denmark and Norway.

title: University of Virginia
event: July 14 – The Jefferson Literary and Debating Society is founded by 16 disgruntled members of the now-defunct Patrick Henry Society, in Room 7, West Lawn, of the University of Virginia.

title: Brazil
event: July 18 – Uruguay declares independence from Brazil (see Uruguay's independence).

title: Pacific Ocean
event: July 30 – Malden Island (an uninhabited island in the central Pacific Ocean) is discovered.

title: Bolivia
event: August 6 – Bolivia gains its independence from Spain as a republic with the instigation of Simón Bolívar.

title: Miramichi Fire
event: October 7 – The Miramichi Fire breaks out in New Brunswick.

title: Lake Erie
event: October 26 – The Erie Canal opens, providing passage from Albany, New York to Buffalo and Lake Erie.

title: Mount Willey
event: August – The town of Crawford Notch suffers a landslide.  Those killed include the Willey family, after whom Mount Willey is named.

title: Isle of Wight
event: 10 August – The first Cowes Regatta is held on the Isle of Wight in the UK.

title: Manchester
event: The first railway tunnel is built en route between Liverpool and Manchester in England.

title: Straits Settlements
event: The British crown colony of the Straits Settlements is established.

title: United Kingdom
event: Britain annexes Assam.

title: Menai Suspension Bridge
event: January 30 – The Menai Suspension Bridge, built by engineer Thomas Telford, is opened between the island of Anglesey and the mainland of Wales.

title: Argentina
event: February 8 – Unitarian Bernardino Rivadavia becomes the first President of Argentina.

title: University College London
event: University College London is founded, under the name ''University of London''.

title: Istanbul
event: June 14–June 15 – The Auspicious Incident: Mahmud II, sultan of Ottoman Empire, crushes the last mutiny of janissaries in Istanbul.

title: Americas
event: June 22 – The Pan-American Congress of Panama tries (unsuccessfully) to unify the American republics.

title: Rideau Canal
event: September 21 – Construction of the Rideau Canal begins in Canada.

title: Massachusetts
event: October 7 – The first train operates over the Granite Railway in Massachusetts.

title: West Point New York
event: The Eggnog Riot breaks out at the United States Military Academy in West Point, New York during the early morning hours, but is squelched by Christmas chapel service.

title: Albany Western Australia
event: Major Edmund Lockyer arrives at King George Sound to take possession of the western part of Australia, establishing a settlement near Albany.

title: Nakhon Ratchasima
event: Laos: King Anouvong of Vientiane declares war on Siam and successfully attacks Nakhon Ratchasima (the Siamese later invade Vientiane and nearly destroy the whole city).

title: Argentina
event: February 20 – Battle of Ituzaingo (Passo do Rosário): A force of the Brazilian Imperial Army meets Argentine–Uruguayan troops in combat.

title: Argentina
event: March 7 – Brazilian marines sail up the Rio Negro and attack the temporary naval base of Carmen de Patagones, Argentina; they are defeated by the local citizens.

title: New Zealand
event: March 7 – Shrigley Abduction: Ellen Turner, a wealthy heiress in Cheshire, England, is abducted by Edward Gibbon Wakefield, the future politician in colonial New Zealand.

title: New York City
event: March 16 – ''Freedom's Journal'', the first African-American owned and published newspaper in the United States, is founded in New York City by John Russwurm.

title: France
event: April – Ottoman Algeria: Husain Dei slaps the French consul Decalina on the face, eventually leading to war and French rule in Algeria.

title: Argentina
event: April 7–April 8 – Battle of Monte Santiago: A squadron of the Brazilian Imperial Navy defeats Argentine vessels in a major naval engagement.

title: France
event: May 25 – Romanian inventor Petrache Poenaru receives a French patent for the invention of the first fountain pen with a replaceable ink cartridge.

title: Greece
event: July 6 – Greek War of Independence: The Treaty of London between France, Britain, and Russia, demands that the Turks agree to an armistice in Greece.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 31 – UK: Frederick John Robinson, 1st Viscount Goderich, becomes Prime Minister of the UK, following the death of George Canning.

title: Finland
event: September 4 – Finland: The Great Fire of Turku destroys 3/4 of the city, with many human casualties.

title: Yerevan
event: October 1 – Russo-Persian War, 1826-1828: The Russians under Ivan Paskevich storm Yerevan, ending a millennium of Muslim domination in Eastern Armenia.

title: Greece
event: October 20 – Greek War of Independence – Battle of Navarino: British, French, and Russian naval forces destroy the Turko-Egyptian fleet in Greece. This is the last naval action to be fought under sail alone.

title: Brazil
event: 32,000 Angolans are sold in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

title: Iran
event: February 22 –Treaty of Turkmenchay: Russian-Persian peace treaty: Russia captures Eastern Armenia from Persia.

title: Denmark
event: April 26 – Treaty of Commerce and Navigation signed between Brazil and Denmark, establishing diplomatic relations between the two countries.

title: Argentina
event: August 27 – South America: Brazil and Argentina recognize the independence of Uruguay.  Simón Bolívar declares himself dictator of Gran Colombia.

title: King's College London
event: King's College London is founded by King George IV and the Prime Minister The Duke of Wellington. With its royal charter it becomes the third official university in England.

title: Ireland
event: Religious freedom is restored in Ireland (see History of Ireland, particularly Catholic Emancipation).

title: Chalmers University of Technology
event: The Chalmers University of Technology is founded.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 22 – Greece receives autonomy from the Ottoman Empire. This effectively ends the Greek War of Independence. Greece continues to seek full independence through diplomatic negotiations with the Empire as well as with Russia, France and Britain.

title: Morelos
event: April 4 – The Mexican city of Cuautla, Morelos is founded.

title: Western Australia
event: June 3 – The Swan River Colony (later to become the cities of Perth and Fremantle) is founded in Western Australia. This secures the western 'third' of the Australian landmass for the British.

title: Istanbul
event: July 2 – Russo-Turkish War, 1828-1829: Russian Field-Marshal Hans Karl von Diebitsch launches the Transbalkan offensive, which brings the Russian army within 68 km of Istanbul.

title: Bernese Alps
event: August 10 – First ascent of Finsteraarhorn, the highest summit of the Bernese Alps.

title: Western Australia
event: August 12 – Mrs. Helen Dance, wife of the captain of the ship ''Sulphur'', cuts down a tree to mark the day of the founding of the town of Perth, Western Australia.

title: Black Sea
event: September 16 – Russo-Turkish War, 1828-1829: The Treaty of Adrianople gains for Russia some territory at the mouth of the Danube and along the eastern coast of the Black Sea.

title: Welland Canal
event: November 30 – The original Welland Canal opens for a trial run with a ceremony at Port Dalhousie.

title: India
event: December 4 – India: In the face of fierce opposition, British Lord William Bentinck carries a regulation declaring that all who abet suttee in India are guilty of culpable homicide.

title: China
event: 10,000 chests of opium are sold in China.

title: Alabama
event: January 11 – LaGrange College (now the University of North Alabama) opens its doors, becoming the first publicly chartered college in Alabama.

title: Massachusetts
event: January 12–January 27 – Robert Y. Hayne of South Carolina debates the question of states' rights vs. federal authority with Daniel Webster of Massachusetts in the United States Congress.

title: Greece
event: February 3 – Greece is liberated from the Ottoman forces as the final result of the Greek War of Independence.

title: New York
event: March 26 – The Book of Mormon is published in Palmyra, New York.

title: New York
event: April 6 – Joseph Smith and 5 others organize the Church of Christ (later renamed the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints), the first formally organized church of the Latter Day Saint movement, in northwestern New York.

title: Gran Colombia
event: May 13 – Ecuador separates from Gran Colombia.

title: United Kingdom
event: June 26 – William IV succeeds his brother George IV as King of the United Kingdom.

title: India
event: July 13 – The General Assembly's Institution, now the Scottish Church College, one of the pioneering institutions that ushered the Bengal Renaissance, is founded by Alexander Duff and Raja Ram Mohan Roy, in Calcutta, India.

title: France
event: July 17 – Barthélemy Thimonnier is granted a patent (#7454) for a sewing machine in France; it chains stitches at 200/minute.

title: Greece
event: July 20 – Greece grants citizenship to Jews.

title: France
event: August 9 – France: Louis Philippe becomes King of the French.

title: Brussels
event: October 4 – The Provisional Government in Brussels declares the creation of the independent state of Belgium, in revolt against the United Kingdom of the Netherlands.

title: Granville Ohio
event: Denison University in Granville, Ohio

title: Wesleyan University
event: Wesleyan University in Middletown, Connecticut

title: New York City
event: New York University in New York City

title: Massachusetts
event: January 1 – William Lloyd Garrison begins publishing ''The Liberator'', an antislavery newspaper, in Boston, Massachusetts.

title: Papal States
event: February–March – Revolts in Modena, Parma and the Papal States are put down by Austrian troops.

title: Tigray Province
event: February 14 – Battle of Debre Abbay: Ras Marye of Yejju marches into Tigray and defeats and kills the warlord Sabagadis.

title: Brazil
event: April 7 – Pedro I of Brazil abdicates as emperor of Brazil in favor of his son Pedro II of Brazil.

title: University of Alabama
event: April 18 – University of Alabama founded

title: Merthyr Tydfil
event: May–June – Merthyr Rising 1831: Coal miners and others riot in Merthyr Tydfil, Wales for improved working conditions.

title: France
event: August 2 – The Dutch ten-day campaign in Belgium is halted by a French army.

title: Southampton County Virginia
event: August 21 – USA: Nat Turner's slave rebellion breaks out in Southampton County, Virginia.

title: Brazil
event: November 7 – Slave trading is forbidden in Brazil.

title: New York City
event: December 31 – Gramercy Park is deeded to New York City.

title: Canterbury
event: William Howley Archbishop of Canterbury has his coach attacked by an angry mob on his first official visit to Canterbury.

title: Jacksonville Florida
event: February 9 – The Florida Legislative Council grants a city charter for Jacksonville, Florida.

title: North America
event: February 12 – Cholera breaks out in London, claiming at least 3,000 victims. It spreads to France and North America later this year.

title: Hiram Ohio
event: March 24 – In Hiram, Ohio a group of men beat, tar and feather Mormon leader Joseph Smith, Jr..

title: Greece
event: May 7 – The Treaty of London creates an independent Kingdom of Greece. Otto of Wittelsbach, Prince of Bavaria is chosen King. Thus begins the history of modern Greece.

title: Greece
event: May 11 – Greece is recognized as a sovereign nation; the Treaty of Constantinople ends the Greek War of Independence in July.

title: Ontario
event: Canada: The Rideau Canal in eastern Ontario is first opened.

title: China
event: August 17 – China ceases production of iron shuriken.

title: Belvedere College
event: September – Belvedere College, Dublin, is founded by the order of the Jesuit Society of Ireland.

title: France
event: December 4 – Battle of Antwerp: The last remaining Dutch enforcement, the citadel, is under French attack.

title: Anatolia
event: December 21 – Battle of Konya: The Egyptians defeat the main Ottoman army in central Anatolia.

title: Acropolis of Athens
event: Greece recaptures the Acropolis.

title: Kalamazoo College
event: Kalamazoo College in Kalamazoo, Michigan

title: Oberlin College
event: Oberlin College in Oberlin, Ohio

title: Puget Sound
event: June 29 – William Fraser Tolmie experiences an earthquake at Fort Nisqually. His journal entry records the first written eyewitness account of an earthquake in the Puget Sound region.

title: Isle of Man
event: King William's College on the Isle of Man officially opens.

title: Chicago River
event: August 12 – The city of Chicago is established at the estuary of the Chicago River by 350 settlers.

title: Ohio
event: August 20 – Future United States President Benjamin Harrison is born in Ohio. From this date until the death of Former U.S. President James Madison on June 28 1836, there are a total of 19 Presidents of the United States (3 former, 1 current, and 15 known future) living; which is more than any other time period in U.S. history.

title: Parliament of the United Kingdom
event: August 29 – The British Parliament enacts the Factory Acts limiting child labour (''see also History of the United Kingdom)''.

title: Alabama
event: November 12–November 13 – Stars Fell on Alabama: A spectacular occurrence of the Leonid meteor shower is observed in Alabama.

title: Sumatra
event: November 25 – A major 8.7 earthquake strikes Sumatra.

title: China
event: The British East India Company monopoly on China trade ends.

title: Greece
event: Athens becomes Greece's capital city.

title: New Orleans
event: Medical School of Louisiana is founded, later to become Tulane University in New Orleans.

title: Science Museum (London)
event: Charles Babbage begins the conceptual design of an analytical engine, a mechanical forerunner of the modern computer. It will not be built in his lifetime.Science Museum (London)accessdate=2010-10-01}}<

title: North Carolina
event: The Wilmington and Raleigh Railroad is chartered in Wilmington, North Carolina.

title: Greece
event: June 7 – Greek independence general Theodoros Kolokotronis is sentenced to death for treason for resisting the rule of Otto of Greece (he is released next year).

title: London
event: June 10 – Thomas Carlyle moves to Cheyne Row, (Carlyle's House), London.

title: Portugal
event: July 24 – The Liberal Wars end in Portugal.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 14 –  The Poor Law Amendment Act in the UK states that no able-bodied British man can receive assistance unless he enters a workhouse (a kind of poorhouse).

title: Palace of Westminster
event: October 16 – The Palace of Westminster is destroyed by fire.

title: United Kingdom
event: December 10 – Sir Robert Peel succeeds Lord Melbourne as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

title: Orange River
event: December 11 – The Sixth Xhosa War is characterized by severe clashes between white settlers and Bantu peoples in Cape Colony; Dutch speaking settlers colonize the area north of Orange River.

title: Lacock Abbey
event: August – H. Fox Talbot exposes the world's first photographic negatives at Lacock Abbey in England.

title: India
event: ''Cachar Levy'', forerunner of Assam Rifles, is founded in India.

title: Fort Cass
event: Fort Cass is established, the military headquarters and site of the largest internment camps during the 1838 Trail of Tears.

title: India
event: English becomes the official language of India.

title: Argentina
event: Juan Manuel de Rosas becomes Caudillo of Argentina.

title: Chonos Archipelago
event: January 7 – The ''HMS Beagle'' anchors off the Chonos Archipelago, on the voyage of 1831–1836 with Charles Darwin.

title: United States Capitol
event: January 30 – An assassination is attempted against President Andrew Jackson in the United States Capitol (the first assassination attempt against a President of the United States).

title: Mauritius
event: February 1 – Slavery is abolished in Mauritius.

title: Concepción Chile
event: February 20 – Concepción, Chile is destroyed by an earthquake.

title: Brussels
event: In Belgium a railway is opened between Brussels and Mechelen. It is the first railway in continental Europe (see Rail transport in Belgium).

title: Ontario
event: June 1 – Kingston Penitentiary in Kingston , Ontario opens.

title: Melbourne
event: June 8 – The Australian city of Melbourne is founded by John Batman and John Pascoe Fawkner.

title: Ireland
event: August 28 – Castleknock College is founded by the Vincentian order in Dublin, Ireland.

title: Brazil
event: September 20 – Farroupilha's Revolution begins in Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil.

title: Gonzales Texas
event: October 2 – Texas Revolution – Battle of Gonzales: Mexican soldiers attempt to disarm the people of Gonzales, Texas but encounter stiff resistance from a hastily assembled militia.

title: Chatham Islands
event: November 19 – A force of 500 Māori invade and enslave the peoples of the Chatham Islands.

title: Goliad Texas
event: December 20 – The Texas Declaration of Independence is first signed at Goliad, Texas.

title: North Carolina
event: December 21 – The Raleigh and Gaston Railroad is chartered in Raleigh, North Carolina.

title: New York City
event: The New Board brokerage group is founded in New York City.

title: Texas
event: January 5 – Davy Crockett arrives in Texas.

title: Sydney
event: January 12 – HMS ''Beagle'' with Charles Darwin reaches Sydney.

title: Miami-Dade County Florida
event: January 18 – Dade County, Florida, is formed.

title: Battle of the Alamo
event: February 23 – The Alamo is surrounded by Santa Anna's army, in a 13-day ordeal.

title: Madrid
event: Antonio García Gutiérrez's play ''El Trovador'' is performed for the first time in Madrid, Spain.

title: Washington-on-the-Brazos Texas
event: A Convention of delegates from 57 Texas communities gathers in Washington-on-the-Brazos, Texas, to deliberate independence from Mexico.

title: Texas
event: March 6 – The Battle of the Alamo ends; 182 Texans are slaughtered by about 5,000 Mexicans.  (Numbers from The World Book Encyclopedia, (C) 1970, U.S.A., Library of Congress catalog card number 70-79247)

title: Wisconsin
event: April 20 – The Territory of Wisconsin is created.

title: Texas
event: April 21 – Battle of San Jacinto: Mexican forces under General Santa Anna are defeated at San Jacinto, Texas.

title: Battle of San Jacinto
event: April 22 – Texas Revolution: A day after the Battle of San Jacinto, forces under Texas General Sam Houston capture Mexican General Antonio López de Santa Anna.

title: Fort Parker massacre
event: May 19 – Fort Parker massacre: Among those captured by Native Americans is 9-year-old Cynthia Ann Parker; she later gives birth to a son named Quanah, who becomes the last chief of the Comanche.

title: Arkansas
event: June 15 – Arkansas is the 25th state admitted into the United States of America.

title: Ascension Island
event: July 20 – Charles Darwin climbs Green Hill on Ascension Island.

title: Quebec
event: July 21 – The first Canadian railroad opens, between Laprairie and St. John, Quebec.

title: South Australia
event: July 27 – Adelaide, South Australia is founded.

title: Hawaii
event: July 30 – The first English newspaper is published in Hawaii.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 2 – Charles Darwin returns to Britain aboard the HMS ''Beagle'' with biological data he will later use to develop his theory of evolution.

title: Weldon North Carolina
event: October 25 – Construction begins on the Wilmington and Raleigh Railroad in North Carolina.  Due to a lack of support in Raleigh, the route is revised to run from Wilmington to the Petersburg Railroad in Weldon.

title: South Australia
event: December 26 – The colony of South Australia is officially proclaimed (now celebrated in the state of South Australia as Proclamation Day).

title: Lewes avalanche
event: December 27 – An avalanche at Lewes in Sussex, England kills 8 of 15 people buried when a row of cottages is engulfed in snow.

title: Buckingham Palace
event: Queen Victoria announces she is officially moving from St. James's Palace to Buckingham Palace

title: Antikensammlung Berlin
event: The Berlin Foundry Cup acquired for the Antikensammlung at Berlin, Germany.

title: Galilee earthquake of 1837
event: January 1 – Galilee earthquake of 1837.

title: Michigan
event: January 26 – Michigan is the 26th state admitted to the United States of America.

title: Philadelphia
event: February 25 – In Philadelphia, The Institute for Colored Youth (ICY) is founded as the first institution for the higher education of Blacks.

title: Massachusetts
event: June 11 – The Broad Street Riot occurs in Boston, Massachusetts, fueled by ethnic tensions between the Irish and the Yankees.

title: United Kingdom
event: June 20 – Queen Victoria accedes to the throne of the United Kingdom.

title: Mount Holyoke College
event: November 8 – Mount Holyoke Female Seminary, later Mount Holyoke College, is founded in South Hadley, Massachusetts.

title: United Kingdom
event: The People's Charter is drawn up in the United Kingdom, demanding universal suffrage.

title: North Carolina
event: Duke University is established in North Carolina.

title: China
event: 40,000 chests of opium are sold in China.

title: London
event: January 10 – A fire destroys Lloyd's Coffee House and the Royal Exchange in London.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: April 4–April 22 – The paddle steamer SS ''Sirius'' (1837) makes the Transatlantic Crossing to New York from Cork, Ireland, in eighteen days, the first steamship to cross the Atlantic.

title: Avonmouth
event: April 8–April 23 – Isambard Kingdom Brunel's paddle steamer SS ''Great Western'' (1838) makes the Transatlantic Crossing to New York from Avonmouth, England, in fifteen days, inaugurating a regular steamship service.

title: Nicaragua
event: April 30 – Nicaragua declares independence from the Central American Federation (''see'' Nicaragua's early history).

title: Farne Islands
event: September 7 – Grace Darling and her father rescue thirteen survivors from the SS ''Forfarshire'' off the Farne Islands.

title: Battle of Maella
event: October 1 – Supporters of Infante Carlos, Count of Molina, are victorious in the Battle of Maella during the First Carlist War.

title: France
event: December – Pastry War: Mexico is invaded by French forces.

title: Limburg (Netherlands)
event: Half of the Limburg province of Belgium is added to the Netherlands (since 1839 there is a Belgian Limburg and Dutch Limburg).

title: Manchester
event: The Anti-Corn Law League is founded in Manchester.

title: Guangzhou
event: The Chinese government dispatches Lin Zexu to Guangzhou.

title: Aden
event: January 19 – The British East India Company captures Aden.

title: Bolivia
event: January 20 – Battle of Yungay: Chile defeats a Peruvian-Bolivian alliance.

title: University of Missouri
event: February 11 – The University of Missouri is established, becoming the first public university west of the Mississippi River.

title: Virginia
event: March 5 – Longwood University is founded in Farmville, Virginia.

title: Maryland
event: March 7 – Baltimore City College, the third public high school in the United States, is established in Baltimore, Maryland.

title: Hong Kong
event: August 23 – British forces seize Hong Kong as a base, as it prepares to wage war against Qing China.  The ensuing 3-year conflict becomes known as the First Opium War.

title: France
event: October 15 – Abd al-Kader declares a jihad against the French.

title: Virginia
event: November 11 – The Virginia Military Institute is founded in Lexington, Virginia.

title: India
event: November 25 – A disastrous cyclone slams India with terrible winds and a giant 40-foot storm surge, wiping out the port city of Coringa; 300,000 people die.

title: Massachusetts
event: November 27 – In Boston, Massachusetts, the American Statistical Association is founded.

title: Sackville New Brunswick
event: Mount Allison University is founded in Sackville, New Brunswick, Canada.

title: Long Island
event: January 13 – The steamship ''Lexington'' burns and sinks in icy waters, 4 miles off the coast of Long Island; 139 die, only 4 survive.

title: Antarctica
event: January 19 – Captain Charles Wilkes circumnavigates Antarctica, claiming what becomes known as Wilkes Land for the United States.

title: Antarctica
event: January 20 – Dumont D'Urville discovers Adélie Land, Antarctica.

title: Wellington
event: January 22 – British colonists reach New Zealand, officially founding Wellington.

title: Rhodes
event: February – The Rhodes blood libel is made against the Jews of Rhodes.

title: Damascus
event: February 5 – The murder of a Capuchin friar and his Greek servant leads to the Damascus affair, a highly publicized case of blood libel against the Jews of Damascus.

title: New Zealand
event: February 6 – The Treaty of Waitangi, granting British sovereignty in New Zealand, is signed.

title: New Zealand
event: William Hobson, the first Governor of New Zealand, suffers a stroke.

title: France
event: Adolphe Thiers becomes prime minister of France.

title: Weldon North Carolina
event: March 9 – The Wilmington and Raleigh Railroad is completed from Wilmington, North Carolina to Weldon, North Carolina.  At 161.5 miles, it is the world's longest railroad.

title: King's College Hospital
event: April 15 – King's College Hospital opens in Portugal Street, London.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 1 – Britain issues the Penny Black, the world's first postage stamp.

title: Nova Scotia
event: July 4 – The Cunard Line's 700-ton wooden paddlewheel steamer RMS ''Britannia'' departs from Liverpool, bound for Halifax, Nova Scotia on the first transatlantic passenger cruise.

title: Brazil
event: Pedro II is declared of age prematurely and begins to reassert central control in Brazil.

title: Beirut
event: September 10 – Ottoman and British troops bombard Beirut and land troops on the coast to pressure Egyptian Muhammad Ali to retreat from the country.

title: Derby Arboretum
event: September 16 – Joseph Strutt hands over the deeds and papers concerning the Arboretum, which later becomes England's first public park.

title: France
event: September 30 – The frigate ''Belle-Poule'' arrives in Cherbourg, bringing back the remains of Napoléon from Saint Helena to France.  He is buried in the Invalides.

title: David Livingstone
event: December 7 – David Livingstone leaves Britain for Africa.

title: Greater Manchester
event: December 7 – The Stockport Viaduct (located in Greater Manchester, England) is completed. It is the largest brick structure in Western Europe.

title: Society of Jesus
event: Fordham University is founded in The Bronx by the Society of Jesus. Its name at its founding is St. John's College.

title: Yale University
event: The Scroll and Key secret society of Yale University is established.

title: Hong Kong
event: January 26 – The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland occupies Hong Kong. Later during the year, the first census of the island records a population of about 7,500.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: March 9 – ''Amistad'': The Supreme Court of the United States rules in the case that the Africans who seized control of the ship had been taken into slavery illegally.

title: Puget Sound
event: May 11 – Lt. Charles Wilkes lands at Fort Nisqually in Puget Sound.

title: Salle Le Peletier
event: June 28 – Ballet ''Giselle'' first presented by the Ballet du Théâtre de l'Académie Royale de Musique at the Salle Le Peletier in Paris, France.

title: White House
event: August 16 – U.S. President John Tyler vetoes a bill which called for the re-establishment of the Second Bank of the United States. Enraged Whig Party members riot outside the White House in the most violent demonstration on White House grounds in U.S. history.

title: Brunei
event: September 24 – The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland annexes Sarawak from Brunei; James Brooke is appointed rajah.

title: Ontario
event: October 16 – Queen's University is founded in Kingston, Ontario, by Rev. Thomas Liddell, who carries a Royal Charter from Queen Victoria and becomes the school's first principal.

title: Tower of London
event: October 30 – A fire at the Tower of London destroys its Grand Armoury and causes a quarter of a million pounds worth of damage.

title: New York City
event: The Sons of Temperance is founded in New York City.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Income Tax Act 1842 is passed in the United Kingdom; 7 pence on the pound sterling, for incomes over 150 pounds.

title: New Zealand
event: The New Zealand seat of government moves from Russell to Auckland.

title: Ohio Wesleyan University
event: Wesleyan University

title: University of Notre Dame
event: University of Notre Dame (by Father Edward Sorin, CSC of the Congregation of Holy Cross)

title: Hollins University
event: Hollins University (in Roanoke, Virginia by Charles Cocke)

title: Villanova University
event: Villanova University (in Villanova, Pennsylvania by the Augustinian order)

title: Indiana University (Bloomington)
event: Indiana University (Bloomington)

title: Willamette University
event: Willamette University in Salem, Oregon

title: Aintree Racecourse
event: March 2 – Gaylad, ridden by Tom Olliver, wins the Grand National at Aintree Racecourse.

title: Texas
event: March 5 – Mexican troops led by Rafael Vasquez invade Texas, briefly occupy San Antonio, and then head back to the Rio Grande. This is the first such invasion since the Texas Revolution.

title: Italy
event: March 9 – Giuseppe Verdi's third opera ''Nabucco'' premieres in Milan; its success establishes Verdi as one of Italy's foremost opera writers.

title: Middleton Junction and Oldham Branch Railway
event: March 31 – Middleton Junction and Oldham Branch Railway line opened up to Werneth in North West England.

title: South Africa
event: June 4 – In South Africa, hunter Dick King rides into a British military base in Grahamstown to warn that the Boers have besieged Durban (he had left 11 days earlier). The British army dispatches a relief force.

title: Hong Kong
event: August 29 – The Treaty of Nanking ends the First Opium War and establishes Hong Kong as a British colony.

title: Iberian Peninsula
event: October 29 – The Iberian Peninsula is struck by a category 2 hurricane.

title: The Citadel The Military College of South Carolina
event: December 20 – The Citadel, The Military College of South Carolina is established.

title: Saint Louis University School of Law
event: Saint Louis University School of Law becomes the first law school west of the Mississippi River

title: Denmark
event: The Danish government re-establishes the Althing in Iceland as an advisory body.

title: Thames Tunnel
event: The first tunnel under the Thames River is finished.

title: Argentina
event: Argentina supports Rosas of Uruguay and begins a siege of Montevideo.

title: Bishop's University
event: Bishop's University is founded.

title: Nova Scotia
event: Abbeville, Louisiana is founded by descendants of Acadians from Nova Scotia.

title: New York City
event: February 6 – The Virginia Minstrels perform the first minstrel show (Bowery Amphitheatre, New York City).

title: Victoria British Columbia
event: March 15 – Victoria, British Columbia, is founded by the Hudson's Bay Company as a trading post and fort.

title: Church of Scotland
event: May 18 – The Disruption in Edinburgh of the Free Church of Scotland from the Church of Scotland.

title: Strait of Magellan
event: May 23 – Chile takes possession of the Strait of Magellan.

title: Barbados
event: June 6 – In Barbados, Samuel Jackman Prescod is the first non-white person elected to the House of Assembly.

title: Bristol
event: July 19 – The ''SS Great Britain'' is launched from Bristol.

title: Denmark
event: August 15  – Tivoli Gardens, one of the oldest still intact amusement parks in the world, opens in Copenhagen, Denmark.

title: Greece
event: September 3 – Popular uprising in Athens, Greece, including citizens and military captains, to require from King Otto to issue a liberal Constitution to the state, which was governed since independence (1830) by various domestic and foreign centres of profits.

title: London
event: April – The Fleet Prison for debtors in London is closed.

title: Indiana
event: January 15 – The University of Notre Dame receives its charter from Indiana.

title: Ohio
event: March 12 – The Columbus and Xenia Railroad, the first railroad planned to be built in Ohio, is chartered.

title: London
event: June 6 – George Williams founds the Young Men's Christian Association (YMCA) in London.

title: Yale University
event: June 22 – Influential North American fraternity Delta Kappa Epsilon is founded at Yale University.

title: Carthage Illinois
event: June 27 – Joseph Smith, Jr., founder of the Latter Day Saint movement, and his brother Hyrum, are killed in Carthage Jail, Carthage, Illinois. John Taylor, future president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is severely injured but survives.

title: Eldey
event: The last pair of Great Auks are killed on the island of Eldey.

title: Nauvoo Illinois
event: August 8 – During a meeting held in Nauvoo, the Quorum of the Twelve, headed by Brigham Young, is chosen as the leading body of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

title: New York City
event: September 25–September 27 – The first ever international cricket match is played in New York City, United States v Canadian Provinces.

title: Largo di Torre Argentina
event: November 3 – Giuseppe Verdi's ''I due Foscari'' debuts at Teatro Argentina, Rome.

title: Rochdale
event: December 21 – The Rochdale Pioneers commence business at their cooperative in Rochdale, England.

title: Texas
event: In the ''United States Magazine and Democratic Review'' editor John L. O'Sullivan declares that foreign powers are trying to prevent American annexation of Texas in order to impede the fullfillment of our manifest destiny to overspread the continent allotted by Providence for the free development of our yearly multiplying millions.

title: Frederick Douglass
event: Frederick Douglass publishes his autobiography ''Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass, an American Slave''.

title: Texas
event: February 1 – Anson Jones, President of the Republic of Texas, signs the charter officially creating Baylor University.  Baylor is the oldest university in the State of Texas operating under its original name.

title: Texas
event: February 28 – The United States Congress approves the annexation of Texas.

title: Florida
event: March 3 – Florida is admitted as the 27th U.S. state.

title: Russell New Zealand
event: March 11 – Flagstaff War: Chiefs Kawiti and Hone Heke lead 700 Māoris in the burning of the British colonial settlement of Kororareka (now known as Russell, New Zealand).

title: Great Yarmouth
event: May 2 – A suspension bridge collapses in Great Yarmouth, England, leaving around 80 dead, mostly children.

title: Baffin Bay
event: May 19 – HMS ''Erebus'' and HMS ''Terror'' with 134 men, comprising Sir John Franklin's expedition to find the Northwest Passage, sail from Greenhithe on the Thames. They will last be seen in August entering Baffin Bay.

title: Walden Pond
event: July 4 – Near Concord, Massachusetts, Henry David Thoreau embarks on a 2-year experiment in simple living at Walden Pond (''see'' ''Walden'').

title: Australia
event: July 20 – Charles Sturt enters the Simpson Desert in central Australia.

title: New York City
event: July 26–August 10 – Isambard Kingdom Brunel’s iron steamship ''Great Britain'' makes the Transatlantic Crossing from Liverpool to New York, the first screw propelled vessel to make the passage.

title: Ireland
event: September 9 – Potato blight breaks out in Ireland: beginning of the Irish Potato Famine.

title: United States Naval Academy
event: October 10 – In Annapolis, Maryland, the Naval School (later renamed the United States Naval Academy) opens with fifty midshipmen students and seven professors.

title: Texas
event: October 13 – A majority of voters in the Republic of Texas approve a proposed constitution, that if accepted by the United States Congress, will make Texas a U.S. state.

title: France
event: November 20 – Battle of Vuelta de Obligado: The Argentine Confederation is narrowly defeated by an Anglo-French fleet on the waters of the Paraná River.

title: United Kingdom
event: December 22–December 23 – Battle of Ferozeshah: British forces defeat Sikhs in Punjab.

title: Jefferson Georgia
event: December 27 – Anesthesia is used for childbirth for the first time (Dr. Crawford Long in Jefferson, Georgia).

title: Texas
event: December 29 – Texas is admitted as the 28th U.S. state.

title: Ireland
event: December 30 – Queen's Colleges of Belfast, Cork, and Galway are incorporated in Ireland.

title: Portugal
event: 16 May– revolutionary insurrection in Portugal (would be crushed by royalist troops on 22 February on the next year)

title: Virginia
event: The portion of the District of Columbia that was ceded by Virginia in 1790 is re-ceded to Virginia.

title: United Kingdom
event: Electric Telegraph Company founded in Britain.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 5 – The United States House of Representatives votes to stop sharing the Oregon Territory with the United Kingdom.

title: Great Salt Lake
event: February 10 – Many Mormons begin their migration west from Nauvoo, Illinois to the Great Salt Lake, led by Brigham Young.

title: Texas
event: February 19 – In Austin, Texas, the newly formed Texas state government is officially installed.

title: Texas
event: April 25 – Mexican-American War: Open conflict begins over border disputes of Texas' boundaries.

title: Royal Geographical Society
event: May 25 – The Royal Geographical Society awards Paweł Edmund Strzelecki a Gold Medal for exploration in the south eastern portion of Australia.{{Citation neededdate=May 2008}}

title: California Republic
event: June 10 – Mexican-American War: The California Republic declares independence from Mexico.

title: California Republic
event: June 14 – Bear Flag Revolt: American settlers in Sonoma, California start a rebellion against Mexico and proclaim the California Republic.

title: Strait of Juan de Fuca
event: The Oregon Treaty establishes the 49th parallel as the border between the United States and Canada, from the Rocky Mountains to the Strait of Juan de Fuca.

title: California
event: July 7 – Acting on instructions from Washington, DC, Commodore John Drake Sloat orders his troops to occupy Monterey and Yerba Buena thus beginning the United States annexation of California.

title: Our Lady of La Salette
event: September 19 – The Virgin Mary is said to have appeared to two children in La Salette, France.

title: Australia
event: October 1 – Christ College, Tasmania opens with the hope that it would develop along the lines of an Oxbridge college and provide the basis for university education in Tasmania. Today, it is the oldest tertiary instituition in Australia.

title: Iowa
event: December 28 – Iowa is admitted as the 29th U.S. state.

title: Abadan Island
event: The Ottoman Empire cedes Abadan Island to the Persian Empire.

title: Architectural Association School of Architecture
event: The Architectural Association School of Architecture is founded.

title: Wayne County North Carolina
event: The North Carolina General Assembly incorporates the railroad town of Goldsborough, and the Wayne county seat is moved to the new town.

title: Radley College
event: Radley College, a famous English public school, is founded.

title: California
event: January 13 – The Treaty of Cahuenga ends the fighting in the Mexican-American War in California.

title: California
event: January 16 – John C. Fremont is appointed Governor of the new California Territory.

title: New York
event: January 17 – Saint Anthony Hall is founded at Columbia University, New York City, New York.

title: California
event: January 30 – Yerba Buena, California is renamed San Francisco.

title: Battle of Buena Vista
event: February 22 – Mexican-American War – The Battle of Buena Vista: 5,000 American troops under General Zachary Taylor use their superiority in artillery to drive off 15,000 Mexican troops under Antonio López de Santa Anna, defeating the Mexicans the next day.

title: Michigan
event: The state of Michigan formally abolishes the death penalty.

title: Teatro della Pergola
event: March 14 – Verdi's ''Macbeth (opera)'' premieres at Teatro della Pergola in Florence, Italy.

title: London
event: June 1 – The first congress of the Communist League is held in London.

title: New York University
event: June 1 – Zeta Psi Fraternity of North America is founded at New York University.

title: Denmark
event: June 27 – The first train journey in Denmark takes place from Copenhagen to Roskilde.

title: Salt Lake City
event: July 24 – After 17 months of travel, Brigham Young leads 148 Mormon pioneers into Salt Lake Valley, resulting in the establishment of Salt Lake City.

title: Liberia
event: July 26 – Liberia gains independence.

title: Tennessee
event: July 29 – The Cumberland School of Law is founded at Cumberland University in Lebanon, Tennessee.  At the end of 1847 only 15 law schools exist in the United States.

title: Lake Xochimilco
event: August 12 – U.S. troops of General Winfield Scott begin to advance along the aqueduct around Chalco and Xochimilco lakes in Mexico

title: United Kingdom
event: September 30 – The Vegetarian Society was formed in the United Kingdom. It remains the oldest in the world.

title: France
event: December 21 – Abd al-Kader surrenders and is imprisoned by the French.

title: Brazil
event: The Revolutions of 1848, a series of widespread but mostly failed struggles for more liberal governments, break out from Brazil to Hungary.

title: New York
event: A cholera epidemic in New York kills 5,000.

title: New York
event: The Associated Press founded in New York.

title: London
event: Queen's College for women is founded in London.

title: Massachusetts
event: The Boston Public Library is founded by an act of the Great and General Court of Massachusetts.

title: New Guinea
event: British, Dutch, and German governments lay claim to New Guinea.

title: Strait of Tartary
event: Admiral Nevelskoi explores Strait of Tartary.

title: University of Ottawa
event: The University of Ottawa is founded.

title: University of Mississippi
event: The University of Mississippi is founded.

title: University of Wisconsin–Madison
event: The University of Wisconsin–Madison is founded.

title: Pennsylvania
event: Geneva College in Pennsylvania is founded.

title: Rhodes College
event: Rhodes College is founded.

title: Ireland
event: The potato crop fails in Ireland.

title: Great Britain
event: Great Britain's first public health law, which creates a national health board and gives cities broad authority to build modern sanitary systems, is passed.

title: Sutter's Mill
event: January 24 – California Gold Rush: James W. Marshall finds gold at Sutter's Mill, in Coloma, California.

title: Republic of San Marco
event: March 22 – Republic of San Marco comes into existence in Venice.

title: Holstein
event: March 24 – The First Schleswig War begins ({{lang-deSchleswig-Holsteinischer Krieg}}) or '''Three Years' War''' ({{lang-daTreårskrigen}}) a military conflict in southern Denmark and northern Germany rooted in the Schleswig-Holstein Question, contesting the issue of who should control the Duchies of Schleswig and Holstein.

title: London
event: April 10 – A Chartist 'Monster Rally' is held in Kennington Park London, headed by Feargus O'Connor. A petition demanding the franchise is presented to parliament.

title: France
event: May 15 – Radicals invade the French Chamber of deputies.

title: Wisconsin
event: May 29 – Wisconsin is admitted as the 30th U.S. state.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 29 – Irish Potato Famine – Tipperary Revolt: In Tipperary, an unsuccessful nationalist revolt against British rule is put-down by a government police force.

title: California
event: August 19 – California Gold Rush: The ''New York Herald'' breaks the news to the East Coast of the United States that there is a gold rush in California (although the rush started in January).

title: North Wales
event: August 24 – The U.S. barque ''Ocean Monarch'' is burnt out off the Great Orme, North Wales, with the loss of 178, chiefly emigrants.

title: France
