event: August 28 – Mathieu Luis becomes the first black member to join the French Parliament as a representative of Guadaloupe.

title: Iberian Peninsula
event: October 28 – In Catalonia, Spain, the Barcelona–Mataró railroad route (the first to be constructed in all the Iberian Peninsula) is inaugurated.

title: Massachusetts
event: November 1 – In Boston, Massachusetts, the first medical school for women, The Boston Female Medical School (which later merges with Boston University School of Medicine), opens.

title: France
event: November 4 – France ratifies a new constitution. The Second Republic of France is set up, ending the state of temporary government lasting since the Revolution of 1848.

title: Michigan
event: November 7 – U.S. presidential election, 1848: Whig Zachary Taylor of Louisiana defeats Democrat Lewis Cass of Michigan in the first US presidential election held in every state on the same day.

title: French Second Republic
event: December 10 – Prince Louis-Napoleon Bonaparte is elected first president of the French Second Republic.

title: Strait of Magellan
event: December 18 – Punta Arenas, the first mayor settlement in the Strait of Magellan, is founded.

title: Réunion
event: December 20 – Slavery is abolished in Réunion. This day is celebrated every year since 1981.

title: Austin College
event: November – Austin College receives a charter in Huntsville.

title: Salisbury North Carolina
event: The North Carolina General Assembly incorporates the North Carolina Railroad to complete a rail line from Goldsboro through Raleigh and Salisbury to Charlotte.

title: France
event: France issues Ceres, France's first postage stamp.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 13 – Second Anglo-Sikh War – British forces retreat from the Battle of Tooele.

title: Papal States
event: January 21 – General elections are held in the Papal States.

title: Bethania North Carolina
event: January 27 – The Fayetteville and Western Plank Road Company is incorporated to build a plank road from Fayetteville, North Carolina to Bethania, North Carolina.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 31 – The Corn Laws are abolished in the United Kingdom (following legislation in 1846).

title: New York City
event: February 14 – In New York City, James Knox Polk becomes the first President of the United States to have his photograph taken.

title: Cape Horn
event: February 28 – Regular steamboat service from the west to the east coast of the United States begins with the arrival of the SS ''California'' in San Francisco Bay. The ''California'' leaves New York Harbor on October 6, 1848, rounds Cape Horn at the tip of South America, and arrives at San Francisco, California after the 4 month 21 day journey.

title: Minnesota
event: Minnesota becomes a United States territory.

title: Madagascar
event: March 28 – Four Christians are ordered burnt alive in Antananarivo, Madagascar by Queen Ranavalona I and 14 others are executed.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 29 – The United Kingdom annexes the Punjab.

title: Montreal
event: April 25 – The Governor General of Canada, Lord Elgin, signs the Rebellion Losses Bill, outraging Montreal's English population and triggering the Montreal Riots.

title: Astor Place Riot
event: May 10 – The Astor Place Riot takes place over a dispute between two Shakesperean actors. Over 20 people are killed.

title: Denmark
event: June 5 – Denmark becomes a constitutional monarchy.

title: Denmark
event: July 6 – The Danish Army beats the Prussian army at Fredericia, Jutland, thereby putting an end to the Prussian/Danish War until 1864.

title: Harrisburg Pennsylvania
event: September 1 – The first segment of the Pennsylvania Railroad, from Lewiston, Pennsylvania to Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, opens for service.

title: Birmingham
event: Bingley Hall, the world's first purpose-built exhibition hall, opens in Birmingham, England.

title: Brazil
event: Entre Ríos Province in Argentina revolts, backed by Brazil in alliance with Paraguay and the Uruguayan Colorado Party.

title: University of Dayton
event: St. Mary’s Institute (the future University of Dayton) is founded in Dayton, OH.

title: Manchester
event: Manchester reaches 400,000 inhabitants.

title: Jamaica
event: 1850 – 1880 – 144,000 East Indian laborers go to Trinidad and 39,000 East Indians come to Jamaica.

title: University of Rochester
event: University of Rochester is founded in Rochester, NY.

title: Utah
event: February 28 – The University of Utah opens in Salt Lake City, Utah.

title: Nicaragua Canal
event: April 19 – Clayton-Bulwer Treaty is signed by the United States and Great Britain, allowing both countries to share Nicaragua and not claim complete control over the proposed Nicaragua Canal.

title: France
event: May 16 – The French battleship ''Le Napoléon'' is launched.

title: New York
event: May 23 – The ''USS Advance'' puts to sea from New York to search for John Franklin's Arctic expedition.

title: Jackson County Missouri
event: June 3 – The traditional date of Kansas City, Missouri's founding. This is the date on which it is incorporated by Jackson County, Missouri as the Town of Kansas.

title: California
event: California is admitted as the 31st U.S. state.

title: New Mexico Territory
event: The New Mexico Territory is organized by order of the United States Congress.

title: Piz Bernina
event: September 13 – First ascent of Piz Bernina, the highest summit of the eastern Alps.

title: Australia
event: October 1 – The University of Sydney (the oldest in Australia) is founded.

title: University of Pennsylvania
event: October 19 – Phi Kappa Sigma International Fraternity was founded at the University of Pennsylvania.

title: Indiana
event: October 28 – Delegate Edward Ralph May delivers speech on behalf of African American suffrage to the Indiana Constitutional Convention.

title: German Confederation
event: November 29 – The treaty called Punctation of Olmütz is signed in Olomouc. It means diplomatic capitulation of Prussia to the Austrian Empire, which takes over the leadership of the German Confederation.

title: New Zealand
event: December 16 – The first settlers for the settlement of Christchurch arrive at the Port of Lyttelton (New Zealand).

title: St. Paul's College Hong Kong
event: St. Paul's College, Hong Kong is founded.

title: Massachusetts
event: January 23 – The flip of a coin determines whether a new city in the Oregon Territory is named after Boston, Massachusetts, or Portland, Maine, with Portland winning.

title: Northwestern University
event: January 28 – Northwestern University is founded.

title: Australia
event: February 12 – Edward Hargraves claims to have found gold in Australia.

title: France
event: March 1 – Victor Hugo uses the phrase ''United States of Europe'' in a speech to the French National Assembly.

title: La Fenice
event: March 11 – Giuseppe Verdi's opera ''Rigoletto'' is first performed at ''La Fenice'' in Venice.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 30 – A population census is taken in the United Kingdom.

title: Taos New Mexico
event: April 9 – San Luis, the oldest permanent settlement in the state of Colorado, is founded by settlers from Taos, New Mexico.

title: Santa Clara University
event: April 28 – Santa Clara College is chartered in Santa Clara, California.

title: London
event: May 1 – The ''Great Exhibition of the Works of Industry of All Nations'' in the Crystal Palace, Hyde Park, London is opened by Queen Victoria (it runs until October 18).

title: Macon Georgia
event: Alpha Delta Pi Sorority, the first secret society for women, is founded at Wesleyan College in Macon, Georgia.

title: Bangkok
event: Mongkut (Rama IV) is crowned King of Siam at the Grand Palace in Bangkok.

title: New South Wales
event: The Colony of Victoria separates from New South Wales.

title: France
event: Serial poisoner Hélène Jégado is arrested in Rennes, France.

title: University of the Pacific (United States)
event: July 10 – The University of the Pacific is chartered as California Wesleyan College in Santa Clara, California.

title: Italy
event: July 29 –  Annibale de Gasparis, in Naples, Italy discovers asteroid ''15 Eunomia''.

title: Virginia
event: August 1 – Virginia closes its Reform Constitutional Convention deciding that all white men have the right to vote.

title: Pennsylvania
event: September 15 – Saint Joseph's University is founded in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

title: Umbriel (moon)
event: October 24 – Ariel and Umbriel, moons of Uranus, are discovered by William Lassell.

title: English Channel
event: First protected submarine telegraph cable laid, across the English Channel.

title: London
event: November 14 – Herman Melville's novel ''Moby-Dick; or The Whale'' is published in the U.S. by Harper & Brothers, New York, after being first published on October 18 in London by Richard Bentley, in 3 volumes as ''The Whale''.

title: French Second Republic
event: December 2 – In what amounts to a coup, Louis Napoleon, president of France, dissolves the French National Assembly and declares a new constitution to extend his term. A year later he declares himself as Emperor Napoleon III, ending the Second Republic.

title: North America
event: December 9 – The first YMCA (1844) in North America is established in Montreal, Quebec.

title: Library of Congress
event: December 24 – The Library of Congress burns.

title: Epe Nigeria
event: December 26–December 27 – A Royal Navy warship bombards Lagos Island; Oba Kosoko is wounded and flees to Epe.

title: Devil's Island
event: The Devil's Island penal colony opens.

title: Hawaii
event: In Hawaii sugar planters bring over the first Chinese laborers on 3 or 5 year contracts, giving them 3 dollars per month plus room and board for working a 12-hour day, 6 days a week.

title: Maryland
event: Loyola College is chartered in Baltimore, Maryland.

title: Antioch College
event: Antioch College is founded, its first president is Horace Mann.

title: Mills College
event: Mills College is founded.

title: New York City
event: January 15 – Nine men representing various Hebrew charitable organizations come together to form what will become the Mount Sinai Hospital in New York City.

title: South African Republic
event: January 17 – The United Kingdom recognizes the independence of the Transvaal.

title: Brazil
event: February 3 – Battle of Caseros or Battle of Monte Caseros, Argentina: The Argentine provinces of Entre Rios and Corrientes allied with Brazil and members of Colorado Party of Uruguay, defeat Buenos Aires troops under Juan Manuel de Rosas.

title: London
event: February 11 – The first British public toilet for women opens in Bedford Street, London.

title: London
event: February 15 – The Great Ormond Street Hospital for Sick Children, London, admits its first patient.

title: Canonsburg Pennsylvania
event: February 19 – The Phi Kappa Psi Fraternity is founded at Jefferson College in Canonsburg, Pennsylvania.

title: South Africa
event: February 25 – The ''HMS Birkenhead'' sinks near Cape Town, South Africa. Only 193 of the 643 on board survive after troops stand firm on the deck so as not to flood the lifeboats containing women and children.

title: Hunan
event: June 12 – Taiping Rebellion: Taiping forces enter Hunan.

title: United States Capitol rotunda
event: July 1 – United States statesman Henry Clay is the first to receive the honor of lying in state in the United States Capitol rotunda.

title: Rochester New York
event: July 4 – Frederick Douglas delivers his famous speech The Meaning of July Fourth for the Negro in Rochester, New York.

title: Harvard University
event: August 3 – The first Boat Race between Yale and Harvard, the first American intercollegiate athletic event, is held.

title: Virginia
event: November 2 – U.S. presidential election, 1852: Democrat Franklin Pierce of New Hampshire defeats Whig Winfield Scott of Virginia.

title: United Kingdom
event: November 11 – The new Palace of Westminster opens in Britain.

title: Cumnock North Carolina
event: December – The Western Railroad is chartered to build a rail line from Fayetteville, North Carolina to the coal fields of Egypt, North Carolina.

title: London Zoo
event: The first Public Aquarium opens at the London Zoo.

title: New Orleans
event: An outbreak of yellow fever kills 7,790 in New Orleans.

title: Steinway & Sons
event: The American and German piano manufacturer Steinway & Sons is founded.

title: University of Florida
event: The University of Florida is established.

title: West Chicago Illinois
event: Wheaton Academy founded in West Chicago, Illinois

title: Hunan
event: January 8 – Taiping Rebellion: Zeng Guofan is ordered to assist the governor of Hunan in organising a militia force to search for local bandits.

title: Nanjing
event: February 10 – Taiping Rebellion: Taiping forces assemble at Hanyang, Hankou and Wuchang for the march on Nanjing.

title: Reloncaví Sound
event: February 12 – Puerto Montt is founded in the Reloncaví Sound, Chile.

title: Washington University in St. Louis
event: February 22 – Washington University in St. Louis is founded as Eliot Seminary.

title: Yellow River
event: June 27 – Taiping Rebellion: The Northern Expeditionary Force crosses the Yellow River.

title: California
event: July 25 – Outlaw and bandit Joaquin Murietta is killed in California.

title: New Zealand
event: August 12 – New Zealand acquires self-government.

title: China
event: September 19 – Hudson Taylor first leaves for China.

title: Wallachia
event: October 28 – Crimean War: The Ottoman army crosses the Danube into Vidin/Kalafat in Wallachia.

title: Tianjin
event: October 30 – Taiping Rebellion: The Taiping Northern Expeditionary Force comes within three miles (5 km) of Tianjin.

title: La Paz
event: November 3 – Troops of William Walker capture La Paz in Baja California and declare the (short-lived) Republic of Lower California.

title: France
event: December 6 – Taiping Rebellion: French minister de Bourboulon arrives at the Heavenly Capital aboard the ''Cassini''.

title: Gadsden Purchase
event: December 30 – Gadsden Purchase: The United States buys land from Mexico to facilitate railroad building in the Southwest.

title: Rock Island Illinois
event: June – The Grand Excursion takes prominent Eastern United States inhabitants from Chicago, Illinois to Rock Island, Illinois by railroad, then up the Mississippi River to St. Paul, Minnesota by steamboat.

title: Yale University
event: Chemistry & Physics: Professor Benjamin Silliman of Yale University is the first person to fractionate petroleum into its individual components by distillation.

title: 1854 Broad Street cholera outbreak
event: An epidemic of cholera in London kills about 10,000 people. Dr. John Snow traces the source of one outbreak (the 1854 Broad Street cholera outbreak that killed 500) to a single well water pump, validating his theory that cholera is water-borne, and forming the starting point for the science of epidemiology.

title: Denmark
event: The Icelandic trade is opened to merchants other than Danes.

title: RMS Titanic
event: January 21 – The ''RMS Tayleur'' is lost; 380 drown (a disaster later dubbed the first Titanic).

title: Marshall Texas
event: February 14 – Texas is linked by telegraph with the rest of the United States, when a connection between New Orleans and Marshall, Texas is completed.

title: Orange Free State
event: February 17 – The British recognize the independence of the Orange Free State; its official independence is declared 6 days later.

title: Wallachia
event: February 27 – Britain sends Russia an ultimatum to withdraw from two Romanian provinces it had conquered, Moldavia and Wallachia.

title: Ripon Wisconsin
event: February 28 – The Republican Party (United States) is founded in Ripon, Wisconsin.

title: Charlottenburg
event: March 1 – German psychologist Friedrich Eduard Beneke disappears; 2 years later his remains are found in the canal near Charlottenburg.

title: Melbourne
event: March 3 – Australia's first telegraph line, linking Melbourne and Williamstown, opens.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 11 – A Royal Navy fleet sails from Britain under Vice Admiral Sir Charles Napier.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 27 – Crimean War: The United Kingdom declares war on Russia.

title: France
event: March 28 – France declares war on Russia.

title: University College Dublin
event: May 18 – The Catholic University of Ireland (forerunner of University College Dublin) is founded.

title: Pacific Ocean
event: May 30 – The Kansas-Nebraska Act becomes law, replacing the Missouri Compromise (of 1820), which had already been declared unconstitutional by the Supreme Court of the United States. Thus act creating the Kansas Territory and the Nebraska Territory, west of the State of Missouri and the State of Iowa. The Kansas-Nebraska Act also declared that these two new Territories would decide either to allow or disallow slavery depending on ballots by the residents of these two territories. These areas would have been strictly free territory by the Missouri Compromise, which allowed slavery in the State of Missouri but disallowed it everywhere north of the latitude 36 degrees, 30 minutes, which forms most of the southern boundary of Missouri. This prohibiition of slavery extended all the way from the western boundary of Missouri to the Pacific Ocean. This provision of the Missouri Compromise had already been declared null-and-void by the Supreme Court.

title: Annapolis Maryland
event: June 10 – The first class of the United States Naval Academy graduated at Annapolis, Maryland.

title: Finland
event: June 21 – Battle of Bomarsund in the Åland Islands (which later became part of Finland - in 1920:) The Royal Navy seaman's mate Charles D. Lucas throws a live Russian artillery shell overboard by hand before it explodes, for which he was awarded the first Victoria Cross in 1857.

title: Jackson Michigan
event: July 6 – In Jackson, Michigan, the first convention of the U.S. Republican Party is held.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 16 – Russian troops in the island of Bomarsund in Åland surrender to French–British troops.

title: United Kingdom
event: September 20 – Crimean War – Alma: The French–British alliance wins the first battle of the war.

title: Waltham Massachusetts
event: October 1 – The watch company founded in 1850 in Roxbury, Massachusetts by Aaron Lufkin Dennison relocates to Waltham to become the Waltham Watch Company, pioneer in the American System of Watch Manufacturing.

title: Australia
event: October 17 – ''The Age'' newspaper is founded in Melbourne, Australia.

title: Charge of the Light Brigade
event: October 25 – Crimean War – Battle of Balaclava: The allies gain an overall victory, except for the disastrous cavalry Charge of the Light Brigade, from which only 200 of 700 men survive.

title: Battle of Inkerman
event: November 5 – Crimean War – Battle of Inkerman: The Russians are defeated.

title: Suez Canal
event: November 17 – In Egypt, the Suez Canal company is formed

title: Australia
event: December 3 – The Eureka Stockade Miner's Rebellion breaks out in Ballarat, Victoria, Australia.

title: United Kingdom
event: Stamp duty is removed from newspapers in Britain, creating mass market media in the United Kingdom.

title: United Kingdom
event: Palm oil sales from West Africa to Britain reach 40,000 tons.

title: New Zealand
event: The region of Wairarapa, New Zealand is hit by the strongest earthquake ever recorded in New Zealand (Magnitude 8.1 on the Richter Scale); there are 5 deaths.

title: Pacific Ocean
event: January 27 – The Panama Railway becomes the first railroad to connect the Atlantic Ocean and Pacific Ocean.

title: Michigan State University
event: February 12 – Michigan State University (the pioneer land-grant college) is established.

title: Salisbury North Carolina
event: February 15 – The North Carolina General Assembly incorporates the Western North Carolina Railroad to build a rail line from Salisbury to the western part of the state.

title: Pennsylvania State University
event: February 22 – Pennsylvania State University is founded as the Farmers' High School of Pennsylvania.

title: Lewiston Maine
event: March 16 – Bates College is founded by abolitionists in Lewiston, Maine.

title: Anhui
event: March 17 – Taiping Rebellion: A Taiping army of 350,000 invades Anhui.

title: Missouri
event: March 30 – Elections are held for the first Kansas Territory legislature.  Missourians cross the border in large numbers to elect a pro-slavery body.

title: New York City
event: May 17 – The Mount Sinai Hospital is dedicated (as the Jews' Hospital) in New York City; it opens to patients on June 5.

title: Miami University
event: June 28 – The Sigma Chi Fraternity is founded at Miami University in Oxford, Ohio.

title: Monte Rosa
event: August 1 – First ascent of Monte Rosa, the second highest summit in the Alps.

title: London
event: September 3 – The last Bartholomew Fair is held in London, England.

title: British Library
event: October 17 – Henry Bessemer files his patent in the United Kingdom for the Bessemer process of steelmaking.British Libraryyear=2001isbn=0-7123-0881-4pages=30-1}}<

title: Victoria Falls
event: November 17 – David Livingstone becomes the first European to see Victoria Falls in what is now present-day Zambia–Zimbabwe.

title: St. Paul's School Belgaum
event: St. Paul's School, Belgaum is founded in Belgaum, India.

title: India
event: Legal protection of widow remarriage is extended in India.

title: British Guiana
event: British Guiana 1c magenta postage stamp issued in British Guiana in limited numbers; the one surviving specimen is regarded as the world's rarest stamp.

title: Battle of Seattle (1856)
event: January 26 – First Battle of Seattle (1856):  Marines from the ''USS Decatur'' drive off American Indian attackers after an all day battle with settlers.

title: Salisbury North Carolina
event: The 223-mile North Carolina Railroad is completed from Goldsboro through Raleigh and Salisbury to Charlotte.

title: Utah
event: February – The Tintic War breaks out in Utah.

title: Auburn University
event: February 1 – Auburn University is first chartered as the East Alabama Male College.

title: London
event: March 5 – Fire destroys the Covent Garden Theatre in London.

title: University of Maryland College Park
event: March 6 – Maryland Agricultural College (present-day University of Maryland, College Park) is chartered.

title: Tuscaloosa Alabama
event: March 9 – National Fraternity Sigma Alpha Epsilon is founded at the University of Alabama in Tuscaloosa, Alabama.

title: Anhui
event: March 24 – Taiping Rebellion: Suspecting treachery on the part of East King Yang Xiuqing, Shi Dakai garrisons Anhui and begins his march back to the Heavenly Capital, having defeated a strong Xiang Army dettachment.

title: Nelson New Zealand
event: April 7 – Nelson College is founded in Nelson, New Zealand.

title: Norwich University
event: April 10 – The Theta Chi Fraternity is founded at Norwich University.

title: Philippines
event: May 1 – Isabela Province is created in the Philippines in honor of Queen Isabela II of Spain.

title: Norfolk Island
event: May 3 – Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom gives Norfolk Island to the population of the colony at Pitcairn Island.

title: Sacking of Lawrence
event: May 21 – Lawrence, Kansas is captured and burned by pro-slavery forces (the Sacking of Lawrence).

title: Kansas
event: May 22 – Congressman Preston Brooks of South Carolina beats Senator Charles Sumner with a cane in the hall of the United States Senate, for a speech Sumner had made attacking Southerners who sympathized with the pro-slavery violence in Kansas (Bleeding Kansas). Sumner is unable to return to duty for 3 years while he recovered; Brooks becomes a hero across the South.

title: Franklin County Kansas
event: May 24 – Pottawatomie Massacre: A group of followers of radical abolitionist John Brown kill 5 homesteaders in Franklin County, Kansas.

title: Battle of Black Jack
event: June 2 – Battle of Black Jack: Antislavery forces, led by John Brown, defeat proslavery forces in Bleeding Kansas.

title: Nanjing
event: June 13 – Taiping Rebellion: Shi Dakai arrives at Nanjing.

title: Seton Hall University
event: September 1 – Seton Hall University is founded by Archdiocese of Newark Bishop James Roosevelt Bayley, a cousin of U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt and nephew of Saint Elizabeth Ann Seton.

title: Pearl River (China)
event: October 8 – The Second Opium War between several western powers and China begins with the ''Arrow Incident'' on the Pearl River.

title: Great Britain
event: November 1 – Anglo-Persian War: War is declared between Great Britain and Persia.

title: Gadsden Purchase
event: November 17 – American Old West: On the Sonoita River in present-day southern Arizona, the United States Army establishes Fort Buchanan in order to help control new land acquired in the Gadsden Purchase.

title: Niagara Falls New York
event: November 21 – Niagara University is founded in Niagara Falls, New York.

title: Bushehr
event: December 9 – Bushehr surrenders to the British.

title: United Kingdom
event: Divorce without parliamentary approval becomes legal in Britain.

title: Las Vegas Nevada
event: The Mormons abandon Las Vegas, Nevada.

title: Kuala Lumpur
event: Kuala Lumpur, the future capital of Malaysia, is founded as a tin mining settlement.

title: Hollywood
event: Hollywood is founded.

title: Switzerland
event: La Tene culture artifacts are discovered in Switzerland by Hansli Kopp.

title: Normal Illinois
event: Illinois State University, the first public university in Illinois, is established in Normal, Illinois

title: Argentina
event: 1857–1924 – 7 out of 10 people who land in Argentina are single males between 13 and 40 years old.

title: Estonia
event: January 1 – The biggest Estonian newspaper ''Postimees'' is established by Johann Voldemar Jannsen.

title: California
event: January 9 – An earthquake with an estimated magnitude of 7.9 strikes near Parkfield, California (see Fort Tejon earthquake).

title: Kolkata
event: January 24 – The University of Calcutta is established in Kolkata as the first multidisciplinary modern university in South Asia.

title: Gallaudet University
event: February 3 – The National Deaf Mute College (later renamed Gallaudet University) is established in Washington, DC, becoming the first school for the advanced education of the deaf.

title: China
event: March 3 – France and the United Kingdom formally declare war on China in the Second Opium War.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: March 6 – ''Dred Scott v. Sanford'': The Supreme Court of the United States rules that Blacks are not citizens and slaves can not sue for freedom, driving the country further towards the American Civil War (the ruling is not overturned until the 14th Amendment in 1868).

title: Tokyo
event: March 21 – An earthquake in Tokyo, Japan kills over 100,000.

title: New York City
event: March 23 – Elisha Otis' first elevator is installed (at 488 Broadway, New York City).

title: Delhi
event: May 11 – Indian rebellion of 1857: Indian combatants capture Delhi from the East India Company.

title: Utah
event: September 11 – Mountain Meadows massacre in Utah.

title: SS Central America
event: September 12 – The ''S.S. Central America'' sinks off the coast of North Carolina, killing 425 people.

title: Sheffield
event: October 24 – Sheffield F.C., the world's first association football team, is founded in Sheffield, England.

title: India
event: November 1 – Present-day Pakistan officially becomes part of Indian empire of the British Raj

title: Italy
event: December 16 – An earthquake with an estimated magnitude of 6.9 kills 11,000 people in Naples, Italy.

title: Ringstraße
event: December 20 – Emperor Franz Joseph I of Austria issues a decree, ''Es ist Mein Wille'', which leads to the demolition of the city walls of Vienna, allowing the construction of the Ringstraße.

title: Da Nang
event: September – French warships under Charles Rigault de Genouilly attack and occupy Da Nang in Vietnam.

title: India
event: India starts to be ruled by the British Parliament and administered by a civil service in India.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Miners Association is established in Cornwall, UK.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: Abraham Lincoln accepts the Republican Party (United States) nomination for a seat in the US Senate.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 14 – Felice Orsini and his accomplices fail to assassinate Napoleon III in Paris but their bombs kill 8 and wound 142 people. Because of the involvement of French émigrés living in Britain, there is a brief anti-British feeling in France, but the emperor refuses to support it. Orsini is executed by guillotine on March 13 of the same year.

title: London
event: January 25 – The ''Wedding March'' by Felix Mendelssohn becomes a popular wedding recessional after it is played on this day at the marriage of Queen Victoria's daughter Victoria, Vicky, the Princess Royal to Prince Friedrich of Prussia in St. James's Palace, London.

title: Minnesota
event: May 11 – Minnesota is admitted as the 32nd U.S. state.

title: New Bern North Carolina
event: June 17 – The Atlantic & North Carolina Railroad opens, operating 95 miles from Goldsboro, North Carolina to New Bern, North Carolina.

title: Gwalior
event: June 20 – The last rebels of the Indian Mutiny surrender in Gwalior.

title: Papal States
event: June 23 – Police of the Papal States seize Jewish boy Edgardo Mortara and take him away to be raised as a Catholic.

title: Lloyd's of London
event: July 17 – The Lutine bell, is salvaged and subsequently hung in Lloyd's of London.

title: India
event: July 28 – In Bengal/India, British officer William James Herschel uses the hand impression of Rajyadhar Konai as a contract fingerprint signature.

title: Scotch College Melbourne
event: August 7 – A football match played under unknown set of rules is held between Melbourne Grammar School and Scotch College.

title: Eiger
event: August 11 – First ascent of the Eiger.

title: Dom (Mischabel)
event: September 11 – First ascent of Dom, the third highest summit in the Alps.

title: Macy's
event: October 28 – Macy's department store, founded by R.H. Macy, opens for business.

title: Colorado
event: Pike's Peak Gold Rush begins in the Colorado Territory.

title: Portugal
event: The island of Timor is divided between Portugal and the Netherlands.

title: Santa Clara County California
event: The Rancho Rincon de Los Esteros Land Grant is confirmed to Rafael Alvisa, (part of the present Santa Clara County, California).

title: Saint Catherine's Monastery Mount Sinai
event: The ''Codex Sinaiticus'' is found by Constantin von Tischendorf on his third visit to Saint Catherine's Monastery, Mount Sinai.

title: Australia
event: Brisbane is declared the capital of newly separated colony Queensland, Australia.

title: University of Michigan Law School
event: The University of Michigan Law School is founded.

title: Wallachia
event: January 24 – Wallachia and Moldavia are united under Alexander John Cuza under the name Romania (see December 1, 1918 for the final unification, Transylvania and other regions are still missing at that time).

title: Olympia Washington
event: January 28 – The city of Olympia is incorporated in the Territory of Washington in the United States of America.

title: Oregon
event: February 14 – Oregon is admitted as the 33rd U.S. state.

title: France
event: February 18 – French forces under Charles Rigault de Genouilly capture Sai Gon in Vietnam.

title: Suez Canal
event: April 25 – Ground is broken for the Suez Canal.

title: Cornwall
event: May 4 – The Cornwall Railway opens across the Royal Albert Bridge, linking the counties of Devon and Cornwall in England.

title: Brazil
event: May 5 – Border Treaty between Brazil and Venezuela: The two countries agree their borders should be traced at the water divide between the Amazon and the Orinoco basins.

title: Battle of Palestro
event: May 30 – Battle of Palestro: The Sardinians defeat the Austrian army.

title: London
event: May 31 – The Great Clock at the Palace of Westminster, London was started.

title: Battle of Magenta
event: June 4 – Austro-Sardinian War – Battle of Magenta: The French and Sardinians defeat the Austrians.

title: New South Wales
event: June 6 – The British Crown colony of Queensland in Australia is created by devolving part of the territory of New South Wales (Queensland Day).

title: Pig War
event: June 15 – The so-called Pig War border dispute between the Americans and the British on the San Juan Islands begins by the death of the namesake pig.

title: Bernese Alps
event: June 18 – Aletschhorn, second summit of the Bernese Alps, is first ascended.

title: Italy
event: June 24 – Battle of Solferino: The Kingdom of Sardinia and the armies of Napoleon III of France defeat Franz Josef I of Austria in northern Italy; the battle inspires Henri Dunant to found the Red Cross.

title: Niagara Falls
event: June 30 – Charles Blondin crosses Niagara Falls on a tightrope for the first time.

title: Williams College
event: July 1 – The first intercollegiate baseball game is played, between Amherst and Williams Colleges.

title: London
event: July 11 – The chimes of Big Ben ring for the first time in London.

title: Grand Combin
event: July 30 – Grand Combin, one of the highest summits in the Alps, is first ascended.

title: Titusville Pennsylvania
event: August 27 – Edwin Drake drills the first oil well in the United States, near Titusville, Pennsylvania, starting the Pennsylvanian oil rush.

title: Virginia
event: October 16 – John Brown raids the Harpers Ferry Armory in Harper's Ferry, Virginia, in an unsuccessful bid to spark a general slave rebellion.

title: Royal Charter (ship)
event: October 26 – The steamship ''Royal Charter'' is wrecked on the coast of Anglesey, Wales with 454 dead.

title: North Carolina
event: November 1 – The current Cape Lookout, North Carolina, lighthouse is lighted for the first time (its first-order Fresnel lens can be seen for 19 miles).

title: United Kingdom
event: November 24 – British naturalist Charles Darwin publishes ''The Origin of Species'', a book which argues that species gradually evolve through natural selection (it immediately sells out its initial print run).

title: Harpers Ferry West Virginia
event: December 2 – Militant abolitionist leader John Brown is hanged for his October 16 raid on Harpers Ferry, West Virginia.

title: Ateneo de Manila University
event: December 10 – The Ateneo Municipal de Manila is founded.

title: Vatican City
event: Victor Emmanuel, King of Sardinia seizes the whole of the Papal States except Rome (see Vatican City) and unites Italy.

title: Buenos Aires
event: Buenos Aires leader Bartolomé Mitre subverts the Argentine Confederation and begins to establish a new centralist government with the help of Uruguayan Colorado party leader Venancio Flores.

title: Illinois
event: Augustana College is founded in Chicago, Illinois, United States by Swedish immigrants. The college moves to Paxton, Illinois, in 1862, and to its eventual home in Rock Island, Illinois, in 1875.

title: Lawrence Massachusetts
event: January 10 – The Pemberton Mill collapses in Lawrence, Massachusetts, killing 145 workers.

title: Waitara New Zealand
event: March 17 – The First Taranaki War began at Waitara, New Zealand, when Māori refused to sell land to British settlers.

title: Sacramento California
event: April 3 – The Pony Express begins its first run from Saint Joseph, Missouri to Sacramento, California.

title: New Concord Ohio
event: May 1 – A Chondrite type meteorite falls to earth in Muskingum County, Ohio near the town of New Concord.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: May 18 – Abraham Lincoln is selected as the U.S. presidential candidate for the Republican Party.

title: Grand Duchy of Baden
event: September 3–September 5 – The First International Chemistry Congress is held in Karlsruhe, Baden.

title: Lake Michigan
event: The ''Lady Elgin'' is accidentally rammed and sunk in Lake Michigan; hundreds drown.

title: Papal States
event: September 10 – Piedmontese forces invade the Papal States, hoping to link up with Garibaldi in Naples.

title: Battle of Guayaquil
event: September 24 – Battle of Guayaquil: Ecuadorian forces led by Juan José Flores and Gabriel García Moreno take the port of Guayaquil from Supreme Chief Guillermo Franco, who is backed by Peruvian forces.

title: Zanzibar
event: October? – John Hanning Speke and James Augustus Grant leave Zanzibar to search for the source of the Nile River.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 5 – Austria, Britain, France, Prussia and the Ottoman Empire form a commission to investigate the causes of the massacres of Maronite Christians, committed by Druzes in Lebanon earlier in the year.

title: Ayrshire
event: October 17 – The Open Championship, also known as the British Open, is played for the first time at Prestwick Golf Club in Ayrshire, Scotland. The event was won by Willie Park Snr.

title: Old Summer Palace
event: October 18–21 – Beijing's Old Summer Palace is burned to the ground by orders of British general Lord Elgin in retaliation for mistreatment of several prisoners of war during the Second Opium War.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: November 6 – U.S. presidential election: Abraham Lincoln beats John C. Breckinridge, Stephen A. Douglas, and John Bell and is elected as the 16th President of the United States, the first Republican to hold that office.

title: South Carolina
event: December 20 – South Carolina becomes the first state to secede from the United States Union.

title: HMS Warrior (1860)
event: December 29 – The world's first ocean-going (all) iron-hulled and armoured battleship, the (British) ''HMS Warrior'', is launched.

title: Angkor Wat
event: News of Henri Mouhot's discovery of Angkor Wat is published.

title: Lagos
event: The British Empire establishes bases in Lagos to stop the slave trade.

title: Fray Bentos
event: First industrial meat packing plant in Uruguay established at Fray Bentos.

title: Delaware
event: January 3 – American Civil War: Delaware votes not to secede from the Union.

title: Mississippi
event: January 9 – American Civil War: Mississippi becomes the second state to secede from the Union.

title: Florida
event: January 10 – American Civil War: Florida secedes from the Union.

title: Alabama
event: January 11 – American Civil War: Alabama secedes from the Union.

title: Georgia (U.S. state)
event: January 19 – American Civil War: Georgia secedes from the Union.

title: Louisiana
event: January 26 – American Civil War: Louisiana secedes from the Union.

title: Kansas
event: January 29 – Kansas is admitted as the 34th U.S. state.

title: Texas
event: February 1 – American Civil War: Texas secedes from the Union.

title: Alabama
event: February 4 – American Civil War: In Montgomery, Alabama, the Provisional Confederate Congress is formed by representatives from the first six break-away states.

title: Montgomery Alabama
event: February 9 – American Civil War: Jefferson Davis is elected the Provisional President of the Confederate States of America by the Weed Convention at Montgomery, Alabama.

title: Siege of Gaeta (1860)
event: February 13 – Italian unification: The Siege of Gaeta, last stronghold of the Neapolitan King Francis II, is ended by Piedmontese forces.  Francis goes into exile.

title: Italy
event: Italian unification: Victor Emmanuel of Piedmont-Sardinia becomes King of Italy.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: February 23 – President-elect Abraham Lincoln arrives secretly in Washington, D.C. after an assassination attempt in Baltimore, Maryland.

title: Warsaw
event: February 27 – Russian troops fire upon a crowd in Warsaw protesting Russian rule over Poland, killing 5 protesters.

title: Colorado
event: February 28 – Colorado is organized as a United States territory.

title: Nevada
event: Nevada is organized as a United States territory.

title: Texas
event: American Civil War: Texas is admitted to the Confederate States of America.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: President Abraham Lincoln takes office, succeeding James Buchanan.

title: New Zealand
event: March 19 – The First Taranaki War ends in New Zealand.

title: 1861 Mendoza earthquake
event: An earthquake completely destroys Mendoza, Argentina.

title: South Carolina
event: April 12 – The American Civil War begins with the bombardment of Fort Sumter, South Carolina.

title: Virginia
event: April 17 – American Civil War: The state of Virginia secedes from the Union.

title: Virginia
event: April 20 – American Civil War: Robert E. Lee resigns his commission in the United States Army in order to command the forces of the state of Virginia.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: President Abraham Lincoln suspends the writ of habeas corpus in the United States.

title: Virginia
event: West Virginia secedes from Virginia.

title: Arkansas
event: May 6 – American Civil War: Arkansas secedes from the Union.

title: Tennessee
event: May 7 – American Civil War: Tennessee secedes from the Union.

title: Richmond Virginia
event: May 8 – American Civil War: Richmond, Virginia is named the capital of the Confederate States of America.

title: Australia
event: Comet C/1861 J1 (the Great Comet of 1861) is discovered in Australia.

title: North Carolina
event: May 20 – American Civil War: Kentucky proclaims its neutrality which lasts until September 3, when Confederate forces enter the state. North Carolina secedes from the Union.

title: London Fire Brigade
event: June 22 – Tooley Street fire starts and takes the life of James Braidwood first director of the London Fire Brigade.

title: L'Osservatore Romano
event: July 1 – The first issue of the Vatican's newspaper ''L'Osservatore Romano'' is published.

title: Virginia
event: July 21 – American Civil War: First Battle of Bull Run: At Manassas Junction, Virginia, the first major battle of the war ends in a Confederate victory.

title: Kentucky
event: September 3 –  American Civil War: Confederate General Leonidas Polk invades neutral Kentucky, prompting the state legislature to ask for Union assistance.

title: Paducah Kentucky
event: September 6 – American Civil War: Forces under Union General Ulysses S. Grant bloodlessly capture Paducah, Kentucky, which gives the Union control the mouth of the Tennessee River.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: October 21 – American Civil War – Battle of Ball's Bluff: Union forces under Colonel Edward Baker are defeated by Confederate troops in the second major battle of the war. Baker, a close friend of Abraham Lincoln, is killed in the fighting.

title: HMS Warrior (1860)
event: October 24 – ''HMS Warrior'', the world's first ocean-going (all) iron-hulled armored battleship, is completed and commissioned.

title: Missouri
event: October 28 – American Civil War: The Missouri legislature takes up a bill for Missouri's secession from the Union.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: November 1 – American Civil War: U.S. President Abraham Lincoln appoints George B. McClellan as commander of the Union Army, replacing the aged General Winfield Scott.

title: Melbourne
event: November 5 – The first Melbourne Cup horse race is held in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

title: Mississippi County Missouri
event: November 7 – American Civil War – Battle of Belmont: In Belmont, Missouri, Union forces led by General Ulysses S. Grant overrun a Confederate camp but are forced to retreat  when Confederate reinforcements arrive.

title: United Kingdom
event: November 8 – American Civil War – ''Trent Affair'': The ''USS San Jacinto'' stops the United Kingdom mail ship ''Trent'' and arrests two Confederate envoys, James Mason and John Slidell, sparking a diplomatic crisis between the U.K. and U.S.

title: Kentucky
event: December 10 – American Civil War: Kentucky is accepted into the Confederate States of America.

title: Julia Creek Queensland
event: Donald McIntyre builds a property in northwest Queensland, which will later become the town of Julia Creek.

title: Nigeria
event: January 1 – Britain annexes Lagos Island in modern-day Nigeria.

title: Second French Empire
event: January 6 – French, Spanish, and British forces arrive in Veracruz, Mexico, beginning the French intervention in Mexico.

title: USS Monitor
event: January 30 – American Civil War: The first US ironclad warship, the USS ''Monitor'', is launched.

title: Northwestern University
event: January 31 –  Alvan Graham Clark makes the first observation of Sirius B, a white dwarf star, through an eighteen inch telescope at Northwestern University.

title: Tennessee
event: February 15 – American Civil War: General Ulysses S. Grant attacks Fort Donelson, Tennessee and captures it the next day.

title: New Mexico Territory
event: February 21 – American Civil War: Battle of Valverde fought near Fort Craig in New Mexico Territory.

title: Richmond Virginia
event: February 22 – American Civil War: Jefferson Davis is officially inaugurated in Richmond, Virginia, to a 6-year term as president of the Confederate States of America.

title: Missouri
event: March 7 – American Civil War – The Battle of Pea Ridge: The Confederates are shut out of Missouri.

title: Battle of Hampton Roads
event: March 8 – American Civil War: The iron-clad CSS ''Virginia'' (formerly USS ''Merrimack'') is launched at Hampton Roads, Virginia; the Battle of Hampton Roads starts the same day.

title: CSS Virginia
event: March 9 – American Civil War: First battle between two ironclad warships, the USS ''Monitor'' and the CSS ''Virginia'', begins.

title: New Mexico
event: March 28 – American Civil War – Battle of Glorieta Pass: In New Mexico, Union forces succeed in stopping the Confederate invasion of New Mexico territory (the battle began on March 26).

title: Richmond Virginia
event: April 5 – American Civil War – Battle of Yorktown: The battle begins when Union forces under General George B. McClellan close in on the Confederate capital Richmond, Virginia.

title: Battle of Shiloh
event: April 6 – American Civil War: In Tennessee, the Battle of Shiloh begins.

title: France
event: April 13 – Government of Vietnam is forced to cede the territories of Biên Hòa, Gia Định and Dinh Tuong to France.

title: North Carolina
event: April 26 – American Civil War: The besieged Confederate garrison at Fort Macon, North Carolina surrenders.

title: San Jose State University
event: May 2 – The California State Normal School (now San Jose State University) is created by an Act of the California Legislature.

title: France
event: May 5 – French intervention in Mexico – Battle of Puebla: Mexican General Ignacio Zaragoza defeats the French Army; commemorated each year as Cinco de Mayo (Spanish Fifth of May).

title: Norfolk Virginia
event: May 11 – American Civil War: The ironclad CSS ''Virginia'' is scuttled in the James River northwest of Norfolk, Virginia.

title: United States Department of Agriculture
event: May 15 – U.S. President Abraham Lincoln signs a bill into law creating the United States Bureau of Agriculture (later renamed USDA).

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: May 20 – U.S. President Abraham Lincoln signs the Homestead Act into law.

title: Westminster Bridge
event: May 24 – Westminster Bridge is opened. A completely new bridge designed by Thomas Page replacing the old bridge.

title: Memphis Tennessee
event: June 4 – American Civil War: Confederate troops evacuate Fort Pillow on the Mississippi River, leaving the way clear for Union troops to take Memphis, Tennessee.

title: Memphis Tennessee
event: June 6 – American Civil War – Battle of Memphis: Union forces capture Memphis, Tennessee from the Confederates

title: Battle of Cross Keys
event: June 8 – American Civil War – Battle of Cross Keys: Confederate forces under General Stonewall Jackson save the Army of Northern Virginia from a Union assault on the James Peninsula led by General George B. McClellan.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: United States president Abraham Lincoln signs into law the Pacific Railway Acts, authorizing construction of the First Transcontinental Railroad.

title: Russian State Library
event: The Russian State Library is founded.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: July 2 – U.S. President Abraham Lincoln signs the Morrill Land Grant Act into law, creating land-grant colleges to teach agricultural and mechanical sciences across the United States.

title: Oxford
event: July 4 – Charles Dodgson (better known as Lewis Carroll) extemporises the story that becomes ''Alice's Adventures in Wonderland'' for 10-year-old Alice Liddell and her sisters, on a rowing boat trip on ''The Isis'', from Oxford to Godstow.

title: Dent Blanche
event: July 18 – First ascent of Dent Blanche, one of the highest summits in the Alps.

title: Baton Rouge Louisiana
event: August 5 – American Civil War – Battle of Baton Rouge: Along the Mississippi River near Baton Rouge, Louisiana, Confederate troops drive Union forces back into the city.

title: Baton Rouge Louisiana
event: August 6 – American Civil War: The Confederate ironclad CSS ''Arkansas'' is scuttled on the Mississippi River after suffering damage in a battle with the USS ''Essex'' near Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

title: Battle of Cedar Mountain
event: August 9 – American Civil War – Battle of Cedar Mountain: At Cedar Mountain, Virginia, Confederate General Stonewall Jackson narrowly defeats Union forces under General John Pope.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: August 14 – Abraham Lincoln meets with a group of prominent African-Americans – the first time a President has done so. He suggests Black people should migrate to Africa or Central America, but this advice is rejected.

title: Minnesota
event: August 17 –  Dakota War of 1862 begins in Minnesota as Lakota Sioux attack white settlements along the Minnesota River. They are overwhelmed by the U.S. military 6 weeks later.

title: New Ulm Minnesota
event: August 19 – Dakota War of 1862: During an uprising in Minnesota, Lakota warriors decide not to attack heavily defended Fort Ridgely and instead turn to the settlement of New Ulm, killing white settlers along the way.

title: Vienna
event: August 21 – The Vienna Stadtpark opens its gates.

title: Second Battle of Bull Run
event: August 28–August 30 – American Civil War – Second Battle of Bull Run: Confederate forces inflict a crushing defeat on Union General John Pope.

title: Chantilly Virginia
event: September 1 – American Civil War – Battle of Chantilly: Confederate General Robert E. Lee leads his forces in an attack on retreating Union troops in Chantilly, Virginia, driving them away.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: September 2 – American Civil War: President Abraham Lincoln reluctantly restores Union General George B. McClellan to full command after General John Pope's disastrous defeat at the Battle of Second Bull Run.

title: Maryland
event: September 5 – American Civil War: In the Confederacy's first invasion of the North, General Robert E. Lee leads 55,000 men of the Army of Northern Virginia across the Potomac River at White's Ford near Leesburg, Virginia, into Maryland.

title: Sharpsburg Maryland
event: Battle of Antietam: Union forces defeat Confederate troops at Sharpsburg, Maryland, in the bloodiest day in U.S. history (with over 22,000 casualties).

title: Iuka Mississippi
event: September 19 – American Civil War – Battle of Iuka: Union troops under Major General William Rosecrans defeat a Confederate force commanded by Major General Sterling Price at Iuka, Mississippi.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: American Civil War: Preliminary announcement of the Emancipation Proclamation by President Abraham Lincoln

title: Perryville Kentucky
event: October 8 – American Civil War – Battle of Perryville: Union forces under General Don Carlos Buell halt the Confederate invasion of Kentucky by defeating troops led by General Braxton Bragg at Perryville, Kentucky.

title: Chambersburg Pennsylvania
event: October 11 – American Civil War: In the aftermath of the Battle of Antietam,  Confederate General J.E.B. Stuart and his men loot Chambersburg, Pennsylvania, during a raid into the North.

title: Granadine Confederation
event: October 25 – In the Granadine Confederation, rebel troops of southern states defeat the government troops.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: American Civil War:  Abraham Lincoln removes George B. McClellan as commander of the Union Army.

title: Minnesota
event: Indian Wars: In Minnesota, more than 300 Santee Sioux are found guilty of rape and murder of white settlers and are sentenced to hang.

title: Battle of Fredericksburg
event: November 14 – American Civil War: Union President Abraham Lincoln approves General Ambrose Burnside's plan to capture the Confederate capital at Richmond, Virginia (this leads to a dramatic Union defeat at the Battle of Fredericksburg on December 13).

title: Boston Mountains
event: November 28 – American Civil War – Battle of Cane Hill: Union troops led by General John Blunt push back Confederate forces commanded by General John Marmaduke into northwestern Arkansas' Boston Mountains.

title: Easter Island
event: December – Peruvian slave-raiders land on Easter Island, beginning a decade of near-genocide on the island.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: December 1 – In his State of the Union Address, President Abraham Lincoln reaffirms the necessity of ending slavery as ordered 10 weeks earlier in the Emancipation Proclamation.

title: Richmond Virginia
event: December 13 – Battle of Fredericksburg: The Union Army suffers massive casualties and abandons attempts to capture the Confederate capital of Richmond, Virginia.

title: Minnesota
event: December 26 – William D. Duly hangs 38 Dakota Sioux in Minnesota.

title: Battle of Chickasaw Bayou
event: December 26–29 – American Civil War – Battle of Chickasaw Bayou: Another victory for the Confederate Army, outnumbered 2 to 1, results in 6 times as many Union casualties, defeating several assaults coordinated by Union commander William T. Sherman.

title: North Carolina
event: December 30 – The USS ''Monitor'' sinks off Cape Hatteras, North Carolina.

title: Murfreesboro Tennessee
event: December 31 – American Civil War: Abraham Lincoln signs an act that admits West Virginia to the Union (thus dividing Virginia in two); meanwhile, the Battle of Stones River is fought near Murfreesboro, Tennessee.

title: Tynwald
event: Douglas becomes the capital of the Isle of Man, after its parliament (Tynwald) moves their chambers from Castletown.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: Abraham Lincoln signs the Emancipation Proclamation during the second year of the American Civil War, making the abolition of slavery in the confederate states an official war goal. It proclaimed the freedom of 3.1 million of the nation's 4 million slaves, and immediately freed 50,000 of them, with the rest freed as Union armies advanced. according to Eric Foner, ''The Fiery Trial: Abraham Lincoln and American Slavery'' (2010) pp 239-42

title: Nebraska
event: The first claim under the Homestead Act is made for a farm in Nebraska.

title: Sheffield
event: The Yorkshire County Cricket Club is founded at the Adelphi Hotel in Sheffield, England.

title: Veracruz Veracruz
event: January 15 – French intervention in Mexico – French forces bombard Veracruz.

title: New Zealand
event: February 7 – The ''HMS Orpheus'' sinks attempting to enter Manukau Harbour in New Zealand, with the loss of 189 lives.

title: New York City
event: The world-famous midgets General Tom Thumb and Lavinia Warren get married in New York City; P. T. Barnum takes an entrance fee.

title: Arizona
event: February 24 – Arizona is organized as a United States territory.

title: South Carolina
event: March 19 – The ''S.S. Georgiana'' is destroyed on her maiden voyage while attempting to run the blockade into Charleston, South Carolina. Lost to history, the wreck is discovered March 19, 1965, (exactly 102 years later) by E. Lee Spence.

title: Mississippi
event: April 17 – May 2 – The Grierson's Raid: Union cavalrymen are ambushed while crossing the Tickfaw river in Mississippi.

title: North Carolina
event: April 20 – American Civil War – The Battle of Washington ends inconclusively in Beaufort County, North Carolina.

title: Battle of Camarón
event: April 30 – Battle of Camarón in Mexico: 65 soldiers of the French Foreign Legion fight 2,000 Mexicans; 3 of them survive the battle.

title: Battle of Chancellorsville
event: May 1 – 4 – American Civil War – The Battle of Chancellorsville: General Robert E. Lee defeats Union forces with 13,000 Confederate casualties, among them Stonewall Jackson (lost to friendly fire), and 17,500 Union casualties.

title: Siege of Vicksburg
event: May 14 – American Civil War – Battle of Jackson (MS): Union General Ulysses S. Grant defeats Confederate General Joseph E. Johnston, opening the way for the Siege of Vicksburg.

title: Puebla
event: After a 2-month siege, the French army of Bazaine takes Puebla, Mexico.

title: Siege of Port Hudson
event: American Civil War: The Siege of Port Hudson, Louisiana by Union forces begins.

title: Siege of Vicksburg
event: May 26 – American Civil War – The Siege of Vicksburg starts.

title: Massachusetts
event: May 28 – American Civil War – The 54th Massachusetts, the first African-American regiment, leaves Boston, Massachusetts to fight for the Union.

title: Virginia
event: June 9 – American Civil War – The Battle of Brandy Station, Virginia ends inconclusively.

title: Winchester Virginia
event: June 14 – American Civil War – Second Battle of Winchester: A Union garrison is defeated by the Army of Northern Virginia in the Shenandoah Valley town of Winchester, Virginia.

title: Battle of Aldie
event: June 17 – American Civil War – The Battle of Aldie in the Gettysburg Campaign ends inconclusively.

title: West Virginia
event: June 20 – West Virginia is admitted as the 35th U.S. state.

title: Battle of Gettysburg
event: July 1 – 3 – American Civil War: Union forces under George G. Meade turn back a Confederate invasion by Robert E. Lee at the Battle of Gettysburg, the largest battle of the war (28,000 Confederate casualties, 23,000 Union).

title: Vicksburg Mississippi
event: July 4 – American Civil War: Battle of Vicksburg – Ulysses S. Grant and the Union army capture the Confederate city Vicksburg, Mississippi, after the town surrendered. The siege lasted 47 days.

title: Siege of Port Hudson
event: July 9 – The Siege of Port Hudson ends and the Union controls the entire Mississippi River for the first time.

title: New York City
event: July 13 – American Civil War – (New York Draft Riots): In New York City, opponents of conscription begin 3 days of violent rioting, which would later be regarded as the worst in the history of the United States.

title: Fort Wagner
event: July 18 – American Civil War: The first formal African American military unit, the 54th Massachusetts Volunteer Infantry, unsuccessfully assaults Confederate-held Fort Wagner but their valiant fighting still proves the worth of African American soldiers during the war. Their commander, Colonel Robert Shaw is shot leading the attack and was buried with his men (450 Union, 175 Confederate).

title: Salineville Ohio
event: July 26 – American Civil War – Morgan's Raid: At Salineville, Ohio, Confederate cavalry leader John Hunt Morgan and 375 of his volunteers are captured by Union forces.

title: Utah
event: July 30 – Indian Wars: Chief Pocatello of the Shoshone tribe signs the Treaty of Box Elder, promising to stop harassing the emigrant trails in southern Idaho and northern Utah.

title: France
event: August 11 – Cambodia becomes a protectorate of France.

title: Lawrence Kansas
event: August 21 – American Civil War – Battle of Lawrence: Lawrence, Kansas is attacked by William Quantrill's raiders, who kill an estimated 200 men and boys. The raid  becomes notorious in the North as one of the most vicious atrocities of the Civil War.

title: Cumnock North Carolina
event: September – The Western Railroad from Fayetteville, North Carolina to the coal fields of Egypt, North Carolina is completed.

title: South Carolina
event: September 6 – American Civil War: Confederates evacuate Battery Wagner and Morris Island in South Carolina.

title: Istanbul
event: September 16 – Robert College of Istanbul–Turkey, the first American educational institution outside the United States, is founded by Christopher Robert, an American philanthropist.

title: Battle of Chickamauga
event: September 19–September 20 – American Civil War: Confederate forces turn back a Union invasion of Georgia in the Battle of Chickamauga.

title: Virginia
event: October 14 – American Civil War: Battle of Bristoe Station – Confederate General Robert E. Lee forces fail to drive the Union army out of Virginia.

title: Battle of Wauhatchie
event: American Civil War – Battle of Wauhatchie: Forces under Union General Ulysses S. Grant ward-off a Confederate attack led by General James Longstreet. Union forces thus open a supply line into Chattanooga, Tennessee.

title: Knoxville Tennessee
event: November 16 – American Civil War – Battle of Campbell's Station: Near Knoxville, Tennessee, Confederate troops led by General James Longstreet unsuccessfully attack Union forces under General Ambrose Burnside.

title: German Confederation
event: November 18 – King Christian IX of Denmark decided to sign the November constitution, which declared Schleswig as part of Denmark, what was seen by the German Confederation as a violation of the London Protocol and lead to the German–Danish war of 1864.

title: Battle of Lookout Mountain
event: November 24 – American Civil War – Battle of Lookout Mountain: Near Chattanooga, Tennessee, Union forces under General Ulysses S. Grant capture Lookout Mountain and begin to break the Confederate siege of the city led by General Braxton Bragg.

title: Tennessee
event: November 25 – American Civil War – Battle of Missionary Ridge: At Missionary Ridge in Tennessee, Union forces led by General Ulysses S. Grant break the Siege of Chattanooga by routing Confederate troops under General Braxton Bragg.

title: Nanjing
event: Imperial forces assault the Taiping capital of Nanking in the last great battle of the civil war.

title: Brazil
event: Brazil invades Uruguay in support of Venancio Flores. Paraguay attacks Brazil and loses terribly.

title: Sumatra
event: The Dutch conquer southern Sumatra.

title: Denmark
event: February 1 – Danish-Prussian War (Second war of Schleswig): 57,000 Austrian and Prussian troops cross the Eider River into Denmark.

title: Andersonville Georgia
event: February 25 – American Civil War: The first Northern prisoners arrive at the Confederate prison at Andersonville, Georgia (the 500 prisoners had left Richmond, Virginia 7 days before).

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: March 9 – American Civil War: Abraham Lincoln appoints Ulysses S. Grant commander in chief of all Union armies.

title: Alexandria Louisiana
event: March 10 – American Civil War: The Red River Campaign begins as Union troops reach Alexandria, Louisiana.

title: Great Sheffield Flood
event: March 11 – A reservoir near Sheffield, England bursts; 250 die.

title: Battle of Dybbøl
event: April 18 – Danish-Prussian War (Second War of Schleswig) – Battle of Dybbøl: The Prussian army fielding 10,000 men defeats the Danish defending army of 9,200 at Dybbøl Mill, after an artillery bombardment from April 7 to April 18.

title: Spotsylvania County Virginia
event: May 5 – American Civil War: The Battle of the Wilderness begins in Spotsylvania County, Virginia.

title: Cutty Sark
event: May 7 – Clipper Ship ''City of Adelaide'' launched in Sunderland, United Kingdom.  The ship has become the world's oldest surviving clipper ship of only two that survive - ''Cutty Sark'' is the other.

title: Battle of the Wilderness
event: May 7 –  American Civil War: The Army of the Potomac, under General Ulysses S. Grant, breaks off from the Battle of the Wilderness and moves southwards.

title: Battle of Yellow Tavern
event: May 11 – American Civil War – Battle of Yellow Tavern: Confederate General JEB Stuart is mortally wounded at Yellow Tavern, Virginia.

title: Battle of Spotsylvania Court House
event: May 12 – American Civil War – Battle of Spotsylvania Court House: The Bloody Angle – thousands of Union and Confederate soldiers die.

title: Shenandoah Valley
event: May 15 – American Civil War – Battle of New Market: Cadets from the Virginia Military Institute fight alongside the Confederate Army to force Union General Franz Sigel out of the Shenandoah Valley.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: May 18 – Civil War gold hoax: The ''New York World'' and the ''New York Journal of Commerce'' publish a fake proclamation that President Abraham Lincoln has issued a draft of 400,000 more soldiers.

title: Koorawatha New South Wales
event: May 20 – Australian Bushranger Ben Hall and his gang escape from a shootout with police after attempting to rob the Bang Bang Hotel in Koorawatha, New South Wales.

title: Bermuda Hundred Campaign
event: May 20 – American Civil War – Battle of Ware Bottom Church: In the Virginia Bermuda Hundred Campaign, 10,000 troops fight in this Confederate victory.

title: Montana
event: May 28 – Montana is organized as a United States territory out of parts of Washington Territory and Dakota Territory, and is signed into law by President Abraham Lincoln.

title: Piedmont West Virginia
event: June 5 – American Civil War – Battle of Piedmont: Union forces under General David Hunter defeat a Confederate army at Piedmont, West Virginia, taking nearly 1,000 prisoners.

title: Kennesaw Georgia
event: June 10 – American Civil War: Battle of Noonday Creek near Kennesaw, Georgia.

title: Mississippi
event: June 10 – American Civil War – Battle of Brice's Crossroads: Confederate troops under Nathan Bedford Forrest defeat a much larger Union force led by General Samuel D. Sturgis in Mississippi.

title: Battle of Cold Harbor
event: June 12 – American Civil War – Battle of Cold Harbor: General Ulysses S. Grant pulls his troops from their positions at Cold Harbor, Virginia and moves south.

title: Arlington National Cemetery
event: June 15 – Arlington National Cemetery is established when 200 acres (0.8 km²) of the grounds of Robert E. Lee's home Arlington House are officially set-aside as a military cemetery by U.S. Secretary of War Edwin M. Stanton.

title: Kennesaw Georgia
event: June 27 – American Civil War: Battle of Kennesaw Mountain near Kennesaw, Georgia.

title: Battle of Peachtree Creek
event: July 20 – American Civil War – Battle of Peachtree Creek: Near Atlanta, Georgia, Confederate forces led by General John Bell Hood unsuccessfully attack Union troops under General William T. Sherman.

title: Battle of Atlanta
event: July 22 – American Civil War – Battle of Atlanta: Outside of Atlanta, Georgia, Confederate General Hood leads an unsuccessful attack on Union troops under General Sherman on Bald Hill.

title: Battle of Ezra Church
event: July 28 – American Civil War – Battle of Ezra Church: Confederate troops led by General Hood make a third unsuccessful attempt to drive Union forces under General Sherman from Atlanta, Georgia.

title: Battle of the Crater
event: July 30 – American Civil War – Battle of the Crater: Union forces attempt to break Confederate lines by exploding a large bomb under their trenches.

title: Elgin Illinois
event: August 1 – The Elgin Watch Company is founded in Elgin, Illinois.

title: Mobile Bay
event: August 5 – American Civil War – Battle of Mobile Bay: At Mobile Bay near Mobile, Alabama, Admiral David Farragut leads a Union flotilla through Confederate defenses and seals one of the last major Southern ports.

title: London
event: August 13 – The first fish and chips shop opens in London.

title: Petersburg Virginia
event: August 18 – American Civil War – Battle of Globe Tavern: Forces under Union General Ulysses S. Grant try to cut a vital Confederate supply-line into Petersburg, Virginia, by attacking the Wilmington and Weldon Railroad, forcing the Confederates to use wagons.

title: International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement
event: August 22 – First Geneva Convention: The International Red Cross is founded.

title: London
event: September 28 – The International Workingmen's Association was founded in London.

title: Saltville Virginia
event: October 2 – American Civil War – Battle of Saltville: Union forces  attack Saltville, Virginia but are defeated by Confederate troops.

title: India
event: October 5 – A cyclone kills 70,000 in Calcutta, India.

title: Richmond Virginia
event: October 28 – American Civil War – Second Battle of Fair Oaks: Union forces under General Ulysses S. Grant withdraw from Fair Oaks, Virginia, after failing to breach the Confederate defenses around Richmond, Virginia.

title: Holstein
event: October 30 – The Second war of Schleswig is concluded. Denmark renounces all claim to Schleswig, Holstein and Lauenburg, which come under Prussian and Austrian administration.

title: Helena Montana
event: October 30 – Helena, Montana is founded after four prospectors (the so-called ''Four Georgians'') discover gold at ''Last Chance Gulch''; it is their last and agreed final attempt at weeks of trying to find gold in the northern Rockies.

title: Nevada
event: October 31 – Nevada is admitted as the 36th U.S. state.

title: Battle of Johnsonville
event: November 4 – American Civil War – Battle of Johnsonville: At Johnsonville, Tennessee, troops under the command of Confederate General Nathan Bedford Forrest bombard a Union supply base with artillery and destroy millions of dollars in material.

title: Lewiston Idaho
event: November 7 – The capital of Idaho Territory is moved from Lewiston to Boise; North Idaho declares the move illegal and proposes secession.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: November 8 – U.S. presidential election, 1864: Abraham Lincoln is reelected in an overwhelming victory over George B. McClellan.

title: Tennessee
event: November 22 – American Civil War – Sherman's March to the Sea: Confederate General John Bell Hood invades Tennessee in an unsuccessful attempt to draw Union General Sherman from Georgia.

title: New York City
event: November 25 – American Civil War: A group of Confederate operatives calling themselves the Confederate Army of Manhattan starts fires in more than 20 locations in an unsuccessful attempt to burn down New York City.

title: Colorado
event: November 29 – Indian Wars – Sand Creek Massacre: Colorado volunteers led by Colonel John Chivington massacre at least 400 Cheyenne and Arapahoe noncombatants at Sand Creek, Colorado (where they had been given permission to camp). Many of the dead are subsequently mutilated.

title: Waynesboro Georgia
event: December 4 – American Civil War – Sherman's March to the Sea: At Waynesboro, Georgia, forces under Union General Judson Kilpatrick prevent troops led by Confederate General Joseph Wheeler from interfering with Union General Sherman's campaign of destroying a wide swath of the South on his march to Savannah, GA (Union forces suffer more than 3 times the casualties as the Confederates, however).

title: Battle of Nashville
event: December 15–December 16 – American Civil War – Battle of Nashville: Union forces decisively defeat the Confederate Army of Tennessee.

title: London
event: July – The Christian Mission, later renamed the Salvation Army, is founded in Whitechapel, London by William and Catherine Booth.

title: Beijing
event: French missionary Father Armand David, working in Peking, first makes the existence of Père David's Deer known to the West.

title: North Carolina
event: January 13 – American Civil War: The Second Battle of Fort Fisher begins when United States forces launch a major amphibious assault against the Confederate stronghold of Fort Fisher, North Carolina.

title: Columbia South Carolina
event: February – American Civil War: Columbia, South Carolina burns as Confederate forces flee from advancing Union forces.

title: Tennessee
event: February 22 – Tennessee adopts a new constitution that abolishes slavery.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: March 4 – U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is inaugurated for a second term; Andrew Johnson becomes Vice President.

title: Four Oaks North Carolina
event: March 19 – American Civil War: The Battle of Bentonville begins; by the end of the battle on March 21 the Confederate forces retreat from Four Oaks, North Carolina.

title: Vernon County Wisconsin
event: The Claywater Meteorite explodes just before reaching ground level in Vernon County, Wisconsin; fragments having a combined mass of 1.5 kg are recovered.

title: Virginia
event: American Civil War: In Virginia, Confederate forces capture Fort Steadman from the Union. Lee's army suffers heavy casualties during the battle of Fort Stedman—about 2,900, including 1,000 captured in the Union counterattack. Confederate positions are weakened. After the battle, Lee's defeat is only a matter of time.

title: Petersburg Virginia
event: April 1 – American Civil War – Battle of Five Forks: In Petersburg, Virginia, Confederate General Robert E. Lee begins his final offensive.

title: Richmond Virginia
event: April 2 – American Civil War: Confederate President Jefferson Davis and most of his Cabinet flee the Confederate capital of Richmond, Virginia, which is taken by Union troops the next day.

title: BASF
event: April 6 – German chemicals producer ''Badische Anilin- und Sodafabrik(BASF)'' is founded in Mannheim.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: U. S. President Abraham Lincoln is shot at Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C. by John Wilkes Booth.

title: Hemshof
event: April 21 – German Chemicals producer ''BASF'' moves its headquarters and factories from Mannheim to the Hemshof District of Ludwigshafen.

title: North Carolina
event: American Civil War: General Joseph Johnston surrenders his army to Major General William Tecumseh Sherman at Durham Station, North Carolina.

title: Andersonville Georgia
event: The steamboat ''Sultana'', carrying 2,300 passengers, explodes and sinks in the Mississippi River, killing 1,700, most of whom were Union survivors of the Andersonville Prison.

title: Cornell University
event: Governor of New York Reuben Fenton signs a bill formally creating Cornell University in the U.S.

title: Brazil
event: May 1 – The Triple Alliance of Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay against Paraguay is formally signed; the War of the Triple Alliance has already begun.

title: Citronelle Alabama
event: May 4 – American Civil War: Lieutenant General Richard Taylor, commanding all Confederate forces in Alabama, Mississippi, and eastern Louisiana, surrenders his forces to Union General E.R.S. Canby at Citronelle, Alabama, effectively ending all Confederate resistance east of the Mississippi.

title: North Bend Ohio
event: In North Bend, Ohio (a suburb of Cincinnati), the first train robbery in the United States takes place.

title: Irwinville Georgia
event: May 10 – American Civil War: Jefferson Davis is captured by Union troops near Irwinville, Georgia.

title: Texas
event: May 13 – American Civil War – Battle of Palmito Ranch: In far south Texas, more than a month after Confederate General Lee's surrender, the last land battle of the civil war ends with a Confederate victory.

title: Texas
event: June 19 – American Civil War: Union Major General Gordon Granger lands at Galveston, Texas and informs the people of Texas of the Emancipation Proclamation. (an event now celebrated each year as Juneteenth).

title: Oklahoma Territory
event: June 23 – American Civil War: At Fort Towson in Oklahoma Territory, Confederate General Stand Watie, a Cherokee Indian, surrenders the last significant Rebel army.

title: United Kingdom
event: The first speed limit is introduced in Britain: {{convert2mi/hkm/habbr=on}} in town and {{convert4mi/hkm/habbr=on}} in the country.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: July 7 – Following Abraham Lincoln's assassination on April 14, the 4 conspirators condemned to death during the trial are hanged, including David Herold, George Atzerodt, Lewis Payne and Mary Surratt. Her son, John Surratt, escapes execution by fleeing to Canada, and ultimately to Egypt.

title: Matterhorn
event: July 14 – The summit of the Matterhorn in the Alps is reached for the first time; 4 of the party of 7 die in a fall during the descent.

title: Springfield Missouri
event: July 21 – In the market square of Springfield, Missouri, Wild Bill Hickok shoots Dave Tutt dead in what is regarded as the first true western showdown.

title: Argentina
event: July 27 – Welsh settlers arrive in Argentina at Chubut Valley.

title: Australia
event: July 31 – The first narrow gauge mainline railway in the world opens at Grandchester, Australia.

title: Jamaica
event: October 11 – Paul Bogle leads hundreds of black men and women in a march in Jamaica, starting the Morant Bay rebellion.

title: Georgia (U.S. state)
event: October 25 – The paddlewheel steamer ''SS Republic'' sinks off the Georgia coast, with a cargo of $400,000 in coins.

title: CSS Shenandoah
event: November 6  – American Civil War. Surrender to the British at Liverpool of the commerce raider CSS Shenandoah (Captain James Waddell), last significant organized Confederate unit.

title: Battle of Papudo
event: November 26 – Battle of Papudo: The Spanish ship ''Covadonga'' is captured by the Chileans and the Peruvians, north of Valparaiso, Chile.

title: Argentina
event: Federalist revolts occur in Argentina.

title: Parliament of Sweden
event: In Sweden, the Riksdag of the Estates is replaced by an elected 2-chamber assembly, the Riksdag.

title: Alfred Nobel
event: Alfred Nobel invents dynamite in Germany.

title: London
event: January 12 – The ''Royal Aeronautical Society'' is formed (London).

title: Wesley College Melbourne
event: January 18 – Wesley College, Melbourne was established.

title: Chiloé Island
event: February 7 – Battle of Abtao: A Spanish naval squadron fights a combined Peruvian-Chilean fleet, at the island of Abtao in the Chiloé Archipelago of central Chile.

title: Liberty Missouri
event: February 13 – The first daylight bank robbery in United States history during peacetime takes place in Liberty, Missouri. This is considered to be the first robbery committed by Jesse James and his gang, although James's role is disputed.

title: American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
event: April 10 – The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (ASPCA) is founded in New York City by Henry Bergh.

title: Unter den Linden
event: May – Student Ferdinand Cohen-Blind fails to assassinate Otto von Bismarck in Unter den Linden in Berlin.

title: Battle of Fort Erie (1866)
event: June 2 – Fenian forces skirmish with Canadian militia at Ridgeway and Fort Erie.

title: Ottawa
event: June 8 – The Canadian Parliament meets for the first time in Ottawa.

title: Allahabad High Court
event: June 11 – The Agra High Court is established (later shifted to the Allahabad High Court).

title: Austro-Prussian War
event: June 14 – The Austro-Prussian War begins, when the Austrians and most of the medium German states declare war on Prussia.

title: Italy
event: June 20 – The Kingdom of Italy declares war on Austria.

title: Battle of Lissa (1866)
event: July 20 – Naval Battle of Lissa: The Austrian fleet under Wilhelm von Tegetthoff defeats the Italian fleet of Carlo di Persano.

title: Tennessee
