event: June 30 – The Homestead Strike begins in Homestead, Pennsylvania, culminating in a battle between striking workers and private security agents on July 6.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 4–July 18 – British general election: The Unionist government loses its majority.

title: New York
event: Homestead Strike: The arrival of a force of 300 Pinkerton detectives from New York and Chicago results in a fight in which about 10 men are killed.

title: St. John's Newfoundland and Labrador
event: July 8 – The Great Fire of 1892 devastates the city of St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador.

title: Mont Blanc
event: July 12 – A hidden lake bursts out of a glacier on the side of Mont Blanc, flooding the valley below and killing around 200 villagers and holidaymakers in Saint-Gervais-les-Bains.

title: Fall River Massachusetts
event: August 4 – The father and stepmother of Lizzie Borden are found murdered in their Fall River, Massachusetts home.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 18 – William Ewart Gladstone assumes British premiership at head of Liberal government, with Irish Nationalist Party support.

title: Coffeyville Kansas
event: The Dalton Gang, attempting to rob 2 banks in Coffeyville, Kansas, is shot by the townspeople; only Emmett Dalton, with 23 wounds, survives, to spend 14 years in prison.

title: Abomey
event: November 17 – French troops occupy Abomey, capital of the kingdom of Dahomey.

title: Mariinsky Theatre
event: December 18 – ''The Nutcracker'' ballet with music by Tchaikovsky is premiered at the Imperial Mariinsky Theatre in St Petersburg, Russia.

title: France
event: France conquers Laos.

title: Millbank Prison
event: Millbank Prison in London is demolished.

title: London
event: The Ardabil Carpet is brought to London.

title: Illinois
event: Evergreen Park, Illinois is founded.

title: Ontario
event: Sudbury, Ontario, Canada is incorporated as a town.

title: Ireland
event: William Ewart Gladstone introduces a bill to give Ireland self-government but it fails to pass.

title: São Paulo
event: 71.2% of the working population of São Paulo is foreign-born.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 13 – The Independent Labour Party of the UK has its first meeting.

title: Hawaii
event: January 17 – The U.S. Marines intervene in Hawaii, resulting in overthrow of the government of Queen Liliuokalani of Hawaii.

title: Marion Iowa
event: January 21 – The Cherry Sisters first perform in Marion, Iowa.

title: West Orange New Jersey
event: February 1 – Thomas A. Edison finishes construction of the first motion picture studio in West Orange, New Jersey.

title: American University
event: February 24 – American University is established by an Act of Congress in Washington, D.C.

title: France
event: March 10 – Côte d'Ivoire becomes a French colony.

title: New Brighton Pennsylvania
event: April 8 – The first recorded college basketball game occurs in Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania between the Geneva College Covenanters and the New Brighton YMCA.

title: World's Columbian Exposition
event: May 1 – The 1893 World's Fair, also known as the World's Columbian Exposition, opens to the public in Chicago, USA. The first United States commemorative postage stamps are issued for the Exposition.

title: India
event: June 7 – Gandhi commits his first act of civil disobedience in India.

title: Western Australia
event: June 17 – Gold is found in Kalgoorlie, Western Australia.

title: Wengernalpbahn
event: June 20 – The Wengernalpbahn railway in Wengen, Switzerland (Canton of Bern) is opened.

title: Pomeroy Iowa
event: July 6 – The small town of Pomeroy, Iowa is nearly destroyed by a tornado; 71 people are killed and 200 injured.

title: Sea Islands
event: August 27 – The Sea Islands Hurricane hits Savannah, Charleston, and the Sea Islands, killing 1,000–2,000.

title: Italy
event: September 7 – The Genoa Cricket & Athletic Club, the oldest Italian football club, is formed.

title: Belgian Federal Parliament
event: September 7 – Under the pressure of a general strike, the Belgian Federal Parliament accepts a proposal to accept general multiple suffrage.

title: New Zealand
event: New Zealand becomes the first country in the world to grant women the right to vote.

title: Massachusetts
event: September 21 – Brothers Charles and Frank Duryea drive the first gasoline-powered motorcar in America on public roads in Springfield, Massachusetts.

title: Portugal
event: September 28 – The Portuguese sports club Futebol Clube do Porto is founded.

title: France
event: October 10 – The first car number plates appear in Paris, France.

title: Thessaloniki
event: October 23 – The Internal Macedonian Revolutionary Organization (IMRO) is founded by the Bulgarians in the town of Thessaloniki.Its aim was to libarate the region of Macedonia from the Ottoman Turks.

title: World's Columbian Exposition
event: October 30 – The 1893 World's Fair, also known as the World's Columbian Exposition, closes.

title: United Kingdom
event: November – In the United Kingdom, the Local Government Act 1894 is read for the second time in the House of Commons.

title: Colorado
event: November 7 – Colorado women are granted the right to vote.

title: Antarctica
event: December – Carl Anton Larsen becomes the first man to ski in Antarctica.

title: Reichenbach Falls
event: December – Arthur Conan Doyle surprises the reading public by revealing in the story 'The Adventure of the Final Problem', published in this month's ''Strand Magazine'', that his character Sherlock Holmes had apparently died at the Reichenbach Falls on May 4, 1891.

title: New South Wales
event: December 5 – Plural voting is abolished in New South Wales.

title: New York City
event: December 16 – Antonín Dvořák's Symphony No. 9 From the New World receives its premiere at Carnegie Hall, New York City.

title: World's Columbian Exposition
event: July – A fire at the site of the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago destroys most of the remaining buildings.

title: Virginia
event: Chatham Episcopal Institute (now know as Chatham Hall ) is founded in Chatham Virginia , U.S.

title: China
event: In Korea, peasant unrest erupts in the Donghak Peasant Revolution,  a massive revolt of followers of the Donghak movement. Both China and Japan send military forces, claiming to come to the Korean government's aid. They end up fighting each other instead.

title: New Zealand
event: New Zealand enacted the world's first minimum wage law.

title: Lexington Massachusetts
event: January 9 – New England Telephone and Telegraph installs the first battery-operated telephone switchboard in Lexington, Massachusetts.

title: London
event: February 15 – At 04:51 GMT, French anarchist Martial Bourdin attempts to destroy the Royal Greenwich Observatory, London, England with a bomb.

title: Shanghai
event: March 4 – First Sino-Japanese War: A great fire in Shanghai destroys over 1,000 buildings.

title: Massillon Ohio
event: March 25 – Coxey's Army, the first significant American protest march, departs from Massillon, Ohio for Washington D.C.

title: Hong Kong
event: May – The bubonic plague breaks out in the Tai Ping Shan area of Hong Kong (by the end of the year, the death toll is 2,552 people).

title: Illinois
event: May 11 – Pullman Strike: Three thousand Pullman Palace Car Company workers go on a wildcat (without union approval) strike in Illinois.

title: France
event: A meteor shower is seen in Southern France.

title: Lancashire
event: Blackpool Tower is opened in Blackpool, Lancashire, England.

title: Manchester Ship Canal
event: May 21 – The Manchester Ship Canal and Docks are opened by Queen Victoria.

title: France
event: June 22 – Dahomey becomes a French colony.

title: University of Paris
event: June 23 – The International Olympic Committee is founded at the Sorbonne, Paris, at the initiative of Baron Pierre de Coubertin.

title: Tower Bridge
event: June 30 – The Tower Bridge in London opens for traffic.

title: Republic of Hawaii
event: The short-lived Republic of Hawaii is proclaimed by Sanford B. Dole.

title: Korea
event: August 1 – War is declared between the Qing Empire of China and the Empire of Japan, over their rival claims of influence on their common ally, the Joseon Dynasty of Korea. The event marks the start of the first Sino-Japanese War.

title: Hinckley Minnesota
event: September 1 – Great Hinckley Fire: A forest fire in Hinckley, Minnesota kills more than 450 people.

title: New York City
event: September 4 – In New York City, 12,000 tailors strike against sweatshop working conditions.

title: South Africa
event: October 1 – The Owl Club of Cape Town, South Africa has its first formal meeting.

title: Alfred Dreyfus
event: October 15 – Dreyfus affair: French Army officer Alfred Dreyfus is arrested for spying.

title: Australia
event: December 18 – Women in South Australia become the first in Australia to gain the right to vote and to be elected to Parliament.

title: Alfred Dreyfus
event: December 22 – Dreyfus Affair: French Army officer Alfred Dreyfus is convicted of treason.

title: London
event: The London School of Economics and Political Science is founded in London, England.

title: Harvard University
event: W. E. B. Du Bois becomes the first African American to receive a Ph.D. from Harvard University.

title: Tasmania
event: The Duck Reach Power Station, Tasmania opens.

title: Ireland
event: Dundela FC (Belfast, Ireland)

title: Devil's Island
event: January 5 – Dreyfus Affair: French officer Alfred Dreyfus is stripped of his army rank and sentenced to life imprisonment on Devil's Island.

title: Holyoke Massachusetts
event: February 9 – Mintonette, later known as volleyball, is created by William G. Morgan at Holyoke, Massachusetts.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 11 – The lowest ever UK temperature of {{convert-27.2°C°Fabbr=onlk=off}} is recorded at Braemar in Aberdeenshire. This record is equalled in 1982 and again in 1995.

title: London
event: February 14 – Oscar Wilde's last play ''The Importance of Being Earnest'' is first shown at St. James' Theatre in London.

title: Taiwan
event: March 4 – Japanese troops capture Liaoyang and land in Taiwan.

title: Ireland
event: March 15 – in County Tipperary, Ireland, Bridget Cleary is killed by her husband, believing her to be a fairy changeling.

title: 1895 Ljubljana earthquake
event: April 14 – A major earthquake severely damages Ljubljana, Slovenia.

title: Taiwan
event: April 17 – The Treaty of Shimonoseki is signed between China and Japan. This marks the end of the first Sino-Japanese War, and the defeated Qing Empire is forced to renounce its claims on Korea and to concede the southern portion of Fengtien province, Taiwan, and the Pescadores Islands to Japan.

title: Taiwan
event: May 24 – Anti-Japanese officials led by Tang Ching-sung in Taiwan declare independence from the Qing Dynasty, forming the short-lived Republic of Formosa.

title: Reading (HM Prison)
event: May 25 – Oscar Wilde is convicted of sodomy and gross indecency and is sentenced to serve 2 years in prison at Reading.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: May 27 – ''In re Debs'': The Supreme Court of the United States decides that the federal government has the right to regulate interstate commerce, legalizing the military suppression of the Pullman Strike.

title: Nicaragua
event: June 28 – The union of Nicaragua, Honduras and El Salvador begins (ends in 1898).

title: El Paso Texas
event: August 19 – American frontier murderer and outlaw John Wesley Hardin is killed by an off-duty policeman in a saloon in El Paso, Texas.

title: George Hotel Huddersfield
event: August 29 – The Northern Rugby Football Union (now ''Rugby Football League'') is formed at a meeting in the George Hotel, Huddersfield, England. This event leads to the creation of the sport of rugby league football.

title: Latrobe Pennsylvania
event: September 3 – The first professional American football game is played, in Latrobe, Pennsylvania, between the Latrobe YMCA and the Jeannette Athletic Club (Latrobe wins 12–0).

title: Miyazaki Prefecture
event: September 18 – Tomoji Tanabe is born in Miyakonojo, Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan.  He would become the last living man born in 1895.  Tanabe died on June 19, 2009, at the age of 113.

title: Madagascar
event: October 1 – French troops capture Antananarivo in Madagascar.

title: Montparnasse
event: October 22 – A train wreck occurs at Montparnasse Station in Paris.

title: Empire of Japan
event: October 23 – The city of Tainan, last stronghold of the Republic of Formosa, capitulates to the forces of the Empire of Japan, ending the short-lived republic and beginning the Japanese rule era.

title: New Madrid Seismic Zone
event: October 31 – A major earthquake occurs in the New Madrid Seismic Zone, the last to date.

title: Times Square
event: November 25 – Oscar Hammerstein opens the Olympia Theatre, the first theatre to be built in NYC's Times Square district.

title: Alfred Nobel
event: November 27 – At the Swedish-Norwegian Club in Paris, Alfred Nobel signs his last will and testament, setting aside his estate to establish the Nobel Prize after his death.

title: Kingstown Lifeboat Disaster
event: December 24 – Kingstown Lifeboat Disaster- 15 lifeboat crew are lost when their lifeboat capsizes while trying to rescue the crew of the SS Palme off Kingstown, now Dún Laoighaire, near Dublin, Ireland.

title: Lumbini
event: Nepalese archaeologists rediscover the great stone pillar of Ashoka at Lumbini, using Fa Xian's records.

title: St Patrick's College Maynooth
event: The Pontifical University of Maynooth is established by decree of the Vatican.

title: France
event: France establishes an administrative post in Abengourou, Côte d'Ivoire.

title: Potsdam (village) New York
event: Clarkson University (in Potsdam, New York)

title: Pleasure Beach Blackpool
event: Pleasure Beach Blackpool, a popular English theme park (''Britain's Biggest Tourist Attraction''), is founded by Alderman William George Bean.

title: Utah
event: January 4 – Utah is admitted as the 45th U.S. state.

title: Kent
event: January 28 – Walter Arnold, of East Peckham, Kent, England, is fined 1 shilling for speeding at 8 mph, thus exceeding the contemporary speed limit of 2 mph. The first speeding fine.

title: Italy
event: February 1 – The opera ''La bohème'' premieres in Turin, Italy.

title: Italy
event: March 1 – Battle of Adwa: Ethiopia defends its independence from Italy.

title: Italy
event: April 3 – The first edition of the Italian sports newspaper ''La Gazzetta dello Sport'' is published.

title: Delaware Valley College
event: April 9 – The National Farm School (later Delaware Valley College) is chartered in Doylestown, PA.

title: Warwickshire
event: May 8 – Cricket: Against Warwickshire, Yorkshire sets a still-standing County Championship record when they accumulate an innings total of 887.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: May 27 – The costliest and third deadliest tornado in U.S. history levels a mile wide swath of downtown St. Louis, Missouri, incurring $2.9 billion (1997 USD) in normalized damages, killing more than 255 and injuring over 1,000 people.

title: 1896 Meiji-Sanriku earthquake
event: June 15 – An earthquake and tsunami in Sanriku, Japan, kills 27,000.

title: Pennsylvania
event: June 28 – An explosion in the Newton Coal Company's Twin Shaft Mine in Pittston City, Pennsylvania results in a massive cave-in that killed 58 miners.

title: London
event: July 26 –  International Socialist Workers and Trade Union Congress opens in London.

title: Estonia
event: July 27 – A causeway is opened between the islands of Saaremaa and Muhu in Estonia.

title: 1896 Atlantic City rail crash
event: July 30 – Shortly after 6:30 pm, at a crossing just west of Atlantic City, New Jersey, two trains collide, crushing five loaded passenger coaches, killing fifty and seriously injuring approximately sixty, in the 1896 Atlantic City rail crash.

title: Klondike Yukon
event: August 16 – Skookum Jim Mason, George Carmack and Dawson Charlie discover gold in the Klondike.

title: London
event: August 17 – Bridget Driscoll is run over by a Benz car in the grounds of The Crystal Palace, London, the world's first first motoring fatality.

title: New York Military Academy
event: September 17 – New York Military Academy was founded by Charles Jefferson Wright, a Civil War veteran and former school teacher from New Hampshire. The first year the school had 75 boarding students.

title: Canudos
event: October 5 – After a long siege, Brazilian government troops take Canudos in north Brazil, crushing Antonio Conselheiro and his followers.

title: St. Augustine Florida
event: November 30 – A large carcass, later postulated to be the remains of a gigantic octopus, is found washed ashore near St. Augustine, Florida.

title: Philippines
event: December 30 – Jose Rizal, Filipino scholar and poet, is executed in the Philippines.

title: France
event: France allows women to study at the ''Ecole des Beaux-Arts''.

title: Vienna
event: Karl Lueger becomes mayor of Vienna.

title: Zhejiang University
event: Zhejiang University is founded.

title: Benin City
event: January 4 – A British force is ambushed by Chief Ologbosere, son-in-law of the Oba of Benin. This leads to a punitive expedition against Benin.

title: West Virginia
event: January 23 – Elva Zona Heaster is found dead in Greenbrier County, West Virginia. The resulting murder trial of her husband is perhaps the only case in United States history where the testimony of a ghost helped secure a conviction.

title: Madagascar
event: February 10 – Freedom of religion is proclaimed in Madagascar.

title: Benin City
event: February 18 – Benin is put to the torch by the Punitive Expedition.

title: Vienna Secession
event: April 3 – Vienna Secession movement founded.

title: Headingley Stadium
event: April 24 – The first ever Challenge Cup final is played at Headingley.

title: New York
event: April 27 – Grant's Tomb is dedicated in New York.

title: Nashville Tennessee
event: May 1 – The Tennessee Centennial Exposition opens in Nashville, for 6 months, illuminated by many electric lights.

title: Isle of Man
event: May 10 – The Snaefell Mining Disaster occurs in the Isle of Man.{{Citation neededdate=June 2008}}

title: Teatro Massimo
event: May 16 – The Teatro Massimo is built in Palermo, the largest opera theatre in Italy, the 3rd largest in Europe.

title: United Kingdom
event: June 22 – British colonial officers Rand and Ayerst in Pune, Maharashtra, India are assassinated on their way back from a Government house party celebrating the diamond jubilee coronation anniversary of Queen Victoria, by the Chapekar brothers and Ranade, who are later caught and hanged. Considered the first martyrs to the cause of India's freedom from Britain. The film 22 June 1897 is based on the incident.

title: Mount Saint Elias
event: July 31 – Mount Saint Elias, the second highest peak in the United States and Canada, is first ascended.

title: Switzerland
event: August 29 – The First Zionist Congress convenes in Basel, Switzerland.

title: North America
event: September 1 – The Boston subway opens, becoming the first underground metro in North America.

title: Pennsylvania
event: September 10 – Lattimer Massacre: A sheriff's posse kills more than 19 unarmed immigrant miners in Pennsylvania.

title: Battle of Saragarhi
event: September 12 – The Battle of Saragarhi: Twenty-one Sikhs of the 36th Sikh of the Sikh Regiment of British India, defend an army post against 10,000 Afghan and Orakzai tribesmen. The battle occurs in the North-West Frontier Province Afghanistan, now a part of Pakistan, which then formed part of British India.

title: Greece
event: September 20 – Greece and Turkey sign a peace treaty to end the Greco-Turkish War.

title: Brazil
event: October 12 – The City of Belo Horizonte, Brazil is created. The construction of the first Brazilian Planned City is completed successfully, an immigration of 1,000,000 people is estimated.

title: Zulu Kingdom
event: December 30 – Natal annexes Zululand.

title: Oklahoma
event: Wakita is founded in the Cherokee Strip, Oklahoma.

title: Fork Union Military Academy
event: The Fork Union Military Academy is founded.

title: Benin City
event: The British conquer and burn Benin City.

title: Rotterdam
event: Wilhelm van Berkel invents the Berkel meat slicer, the first meat slicer in Rotterdam.

title: John D. Rockefeller
event: As a result of the merger of several small oil companies, John D. Rockefeller's Standard Oil Company controls 84% of the USA's oil and most American pipelines.

title: The Bronx
event: January 1 – New York City annexes land from surrounding counties, creating the City of Greater New York. The city is geographically divided into five boroughs: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, The Bronx, and Staten Island.

title: Alfred Dreyfus
event: January 13 – Emile Zola publishes ''J'Accuse'' a letter accusing the French government of anti-Semitism and wrongfully placing Alfred Dreyfus in jail.

title: Havana
event: February 15 – Spanish-American War: The USS ''Maine'' explodes and sinks in Havana harbor, Cuba, for then unknown reasons, killing 266 men.  This event helps lead the United States to declare war on Spain.

title: Port Carbon Pennsylvania
event: March 24 – Robert Allison of Port Carbon, Pennsylvania, becomes the first person to buy an American-built automobile when he buys a Winton automobile that had been advertised in ''Scientific American''.

title: South Africa
event: March 26 – The Sabi Game Reserve in South Africa, the first officially designated game reserve, is created.

title: Battle of Manila Bay
event: May 1 – Spanish-American War – Battle of Manila Bay: Commodore Dewey destroys the Spanish squadron. The first battle of the war, as well as the first battle in the Philippines Campaign.

title: Beijing
event: May 2 – Thousands of Chinese scholars and Beijing citizens protest in front of the Capital Control Yuan, asking for reform.

title: Italy
event: May 7–May 9 – Bava-Beccaris massacre: Hundreds of demonstrators are killed when General Fiorenzo Bava-Beccaris orders troops to fire on a rally in Milan, Italy (in 1900, King Umberto I of Italy is killed in an act of vengeance for his praise of the shooting).

title: Shroud of Turin
event: May 28 – Secondo Pia takes the first photographs of the Shroud of Turin and discovers that the image on Shroud itself appears to be a photographic negative.

title: Omaha Nebraska
event: June 1 – The Trans-Mississippi Exposition World's Fair opens in Omaha, Nebraska.

title: Philippines
event: June 12 – Philippine Declaration of Independence: General Emilio Aguinaldo declares the Philippines' independence from Spain.

title: Yukon
event: June 13 – Yukon Territory is formed, with Dawson chosen as its capital.

title: Joshua Slocum
event: July 3 – Joshua Slocum completes a 3-year solo circumnavigation of the world.

title: Hawaii
event: July 7 –  The United States annexes the Hawaiian Islands.

title: Gornergratbahn
event: August 20 – Opening of the Gornergratbahn railway, connecting Zermatt to the Gornergrat.

title: Cretan State
event: August 25 – 700 Greeks and 15 Englishmen are slaughtered by the Turks in Heraklion, Greece, leading to the establishment of the autonomous Cretan State.

title: Sudan
event: September 2 – Battle of Omdurman: British and Egyptian troops led by Horatio Kitchener defeat Sudanese tribesmen led by Khalifa Abdullah al-Taashi, thus establishing British dominance in the Sudan.

title: United Kingdom
event: September 18 – Fashoda incident: A diplomatic dispute between France and the United Kingdom ends in victory for the British.

title: China
event: September 21 – Empress Dowager Cixi of China engineers a coup d'etat, marking the end of the Hundred Days' Reform; the Guangxu Emperor is arrested.

title: Minnesota
event: October 3 – Battle of Sugar Point: Ojibwe tribesmen defeat U.S. government troops in northern Minnesota.

title: Mateur
event: October 12 – The first town council is established in Mateur.

title: New England
event: November 26 – A 2-day blizzard known as the Portland Gale piles snow in Boston, Massachusetts, and severely impacts the Massachusetts fishing industry and several coastal New England towns.

title: Dare County North Carolina
event: The North Carolina General Assembly incorporates the town of Manteo, which was originally laid out as the Dare county seat in 1870.

title: Nome Alaska
event: Gold is discovered in Nome, Alaska.

title: Easter Island
event: Riro, the last king of Easter Island, on a visit to Valparaiso, Chile, died either from alcohol poisoning or an assassination plot by the Chilean government.

title: HP Sauce
event: HP Sauce is founded.

title: Liebig's Extract of Meat Company
event: Oxo beef stock cubes introduced by Liebig's Extract of Meat Company.

title: New York City
event: Queens and Staten Island merge with New York City.

title: Wake Island
event: January 17 – The United States takes possession of Wake Island.

title: Australia
event: January 22 – The leaders of six Australian colonies meet in Melbourne to discuss the confederation of Australia as a whole.

title: Sydney
event: February 2 – The Australian Premiers' Conference held in Melbourne agrees that Australia's capital (Canberra) should be located between Sydney and Melbourne.

title: Florida
event: February 12–February 14 – Great Blizzard of 1899: Freezing temperatures and snow extend well south into North America, including southern Florida. It is the latest in a series of disasters to Florida's citrus industry.

title: Mount Rainier National Park
event: March 2 – In Washington State, USA, Mount Rainier National Park is established.

title: Queensland
event: March 4 – Cyclone Mahina sweeps in north of Cooktown, Queensland. A 12 m wave reaches up to 5 km inland, leaving over 400 dead.

title: Stanford University
event: April 15 – Students at the University of California, Berkeley steal the Stanford Axe from Stanford University yell leaders following a baseball game, thus establishing the Axe as a symbol of the rivalry between the schools.

title: Brazil
event: May 13 – Esporte Clube Vitória is founded in Salvador, Brazil.

title: Globe Arizona
event: May 30 – Female outlaw Pearl Hart robs a stage coach 30 miles southeast of Globe, Arizona.

title: New Richmond Wisconsin
event: June 12 – A tornado completely destroys the town of New Richmond, Wisconsin, killing 117 and injuring more than 200.

title: Long Island
event: June 30 – ''Mile-a-Minute Murphy'' earns his famous nickname this day, after he becomes the first man to ride a bicycle for one mile in under a minute on Long Island.

title: France
event: Battle of Togbao: The French Bretonnet–Braun mission is destroyed in Chad, by the warlord Rabih az-Zubayr.

title: New York
event: July 19 – The Newsboys Strike takes place when the Newsies of New York go on strike (strike lasts until August 2).

title: Illinois
event: August 3 – The John Marshall Law School is founded in Chicago, Illinois.

title: Outer Banks
event: August 17 – A hurricane makes landfall in North Carolina's Outer Banks, completely destroying the town of Diamond City.

title: Shikoku
event: August 28 – At least 512 are killed when a debris hill from the Sumitomo Besshi copper mine at Niihama, Shikoku, Japan, collapses after heavy rain; 122 houses, a smelting factory, hospital and many other facilities are destroyed.{{Citation neededdate=June 2008}}

title: Alfred Dreyfus
event: September 19 – Alfred Dreyfus is pardoned.

title: Orange Free State
event: October 11 – The Second Boer War: In South Africa, a war between the United Kingdom and the Boers of the Transvaal and Orange Free State erupts.

title: Augusta Kentucky
event: October 30 – The Augusta High School Building is completed in Augusta, Kentucky; Augusta Methodist College shuts down.

title: Michigan
event: November 4 – The Alpha Sigma Tau Sorority is founded in Ypsilanti, Michigan.

title: New York City
event: November 8 – The Bronx Zoo opens in New York City.

title: Stonehenge
event: December 31 – A large standing stone at Stonehenge falls over, the most recent time this has happened.

title: Louis' Lunch
event: U.S. New Haven, CT Louis Lassen of Louis' Lunch makes the first modern-day hamburger sandwich.

title: Beijing
event: Japan participates with the European powers in occupying Beijing to suppress the Boxer Rebellion.

title: Guangzhouwan
event: Kouang-Tchéou-Wan added to French Indochina.

title: India
event: Civil service consists of fewer than 3,500 top officials for a population of 300 million in India.

title: Oceania
event: Oceania: 6,000,000

title: Hawaii
event: January 1 – Hawaii asks for a delegate at the U.S. Republican National Convention.

title: New York City
event: The first electric bus becomes operational in New York City.

title: China
event: U.S. Secretary of State John Hay announces the Open Door Policy to promote American trade with China.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Irish leader John Edward Redmond calls for a revolt against British rule.

title: Alaska
event: January 8 – President William McKinley of the United States places Alaska under military governance.

title: Khartoum
event: January 9 – The first through passenger train goes from Cairo to Khartoum.

title: Samoan Islands
event: The U.S. Senate accepts the British-German treaty of 1899, in which the United Kingdom renounced its claims to the American Samoa portion of the Samoan Islands.

title: Utah
event: January 17 Brigham H. Roberts of Utah is not seated by the U.S. House of Representatives because of his plural marriage.

title: Battle of Spion Kop
event: January 24 – The Second Boer War: At the Battle of Spion Kop: Boer troops defeat the British troops.

title: Australia
event: January 26 – The Labor League Conference opens in Sydney, Australia, with plans to form a Federal Labor Party. This is spelled Labor even in Australia.

title: China
event: January 27 – Boxer Rebellion: Foreign diplomats in Peking, China demand that the Boxer rebels be disciplined.

title: Western Australia
event: February 1 – Western Australia announced its refusal to join the Australian Federation unless it is given five more years of fiscal freedom.

title: Kentucky
event: Governor William Goebel of Kentucky dies of wounds after being shot by several assassins on January 30. Goebel, who had prevailed in a dispute over the winner of the election in November 1899, had been sworn in on his deathbed. The former U.S. Secretary of State Caleb Powers is later found guilty in the  conspiracy to kill Goebel.

title: Brussels
event: Strikers in Aachen, Vienna, and Brussels demand an eight-hour working day and higher wages.

title: Nicaragua
event: The United Kingdom and the United States sign a treaty for the building of a Central American shipping canal across Central America in Nicaragua.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 8 – Second Boer War: British troops are defeated by the Boers at Ladysmith.

title: Finland
event: Russia responds to international pressure to free Finland by tightening imperial control over the country.

title: Orange Free State
event: Second Boer War – Battle of Paardeberg: 20,000 British troops invade the Orange Free State.

title: Siege of Kimberley
event: February 15 – Second Boer War: The Siege of Kimberley is lifted.

title: Battle of Paardeberg
event: February 17 – Second Boer War: Battle of Paardeberg: British troops defeat the Boers.

title: United Kingdom
event: Second Boer War: British military leaders accept the unconditional notice of surrender from Boer General Piet Cronje.

title: Australia
event: March 2 (beginning) – Groups of officials inspect towns around Australia in order to find a location the new Federal capital.

title: Nicaragua
event: March 5 – Two U.S. Navy cruisers are sent to Central America to protect American interests in a dispute between Nicaragua and Costa Rica.

title: Newgate
event: Baby-farmer Ada Williams is hanged at Newgate Prison for murdering a 21-month old girl.

title: West Virginia
event: A coal mine explosion in West Virginia kills 50 miners.

title: Buckingham Palace
event: March 7 – A fire at Buckingham Palace destroys part of its roof.

title: London
event: March 8 – Londoners celebrate as Queen Victoria makes a rare visit to the city.

title: Knossos
event: March 16 – The British archaeologist Sir Arthur Evans purchases the land on Crete on which the ruins of the palace of Knossos stand. He begins to unearth some of the palace three days later.

title: Manhattan
event: March 24 – The Mayor of New York, Van Wyck, breaks ground for a new underground Rapid Transit Railroad that will link Manhattan with Brooklyn.

title: Korea
event: March 27 – The arrival of a Russian naval fleet in Korea causes concern to the Imperial Japanese government.

title: Crete
event: King George of Greece becomes absolute monarch of Crete.

title: Hawaii
event: April 30 – Hawaii becomes an official U.S. territory.

title: Scofield Utah
event: May 1 – An explosion of blasting powder in coal mine in Scofield, Utah kills 200.

title: United Kingdom
event: Second Boer War: British troops relieve the Mafeking.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 18 – The United Kingdom proclaims a protectorate over Tonga.

title: Orange Free State
event: May 24 – Second Boer War: The British annex the Orange Free State as the Orange River Colony.

title: N'Djamena
event: May 29 – N'Djamena, the capital city of Chad, is founded as ''Fort-Lamy'' by French commander Émile Gentil.

title: China
event: May 31 – Boxer Rebellion: Peacekeepers from various European countries arrive in China.

title: United Kingdom
event: June 5 – Second Boer War: British soldiers take Pretoria.

title: Lake Constance
event: July 2 – The first zeppelin flight is carried out over Lake Constance near Friedrichshafen, Germany.

title: Italy
event: July 29 – King Umberto I of Italy is assassinated by the Italian-born anarchist Gaetano Bresci.

title: Madison Square Garden (1890)
event: November 3 – The first automobile show in the United States opens at New York City's Madison Square Garden.

title: Scotland Yard
event: Scotland Yard creates a fingerprint archive.

title: New Zealand
event: New Zealand inventor Ernest Godward invents the spiral hairpin, one of the most widely used devices on the planet.

title: India
event: The first reliable census in India is taken.

title: Western Australia
event: The British colonies of New South Wales, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria and Western Australia federate as the Commonwealth of Australia. Edmund Barton becomes first Prime Minister.

title: United Kingdom
event: Nigeria becomes a British protectorate.

title: Gallaudet University
event: January 4 – The first deaf Greek organization, Kappa Gamma Fraternity is founded at Gallaudet University.

title: Beaumont Texas
event: January 10 – In the first great Texas gusher, oil is discovered at Spindletop in Beaumont, Texas.

title: London
event: February 2 – Funeral of Queen Victoria in London.

title: Panama Canal
event: February 5 – Hay-Pauncefote Treaty signed by United Kingdom and United States, ceding control of the Panama Canal to the United States

title: India
event: February 12 – India Viceroy Lord Curzon creates new frontier province in the north of the Punjab, bordering Afghanistan

title: Hawaii
event: February 20 – The Hawaii Territory Legislature convenes for the first time.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 23 – United Kingdom and Germany agree the frontier between German East Africa and the British colony of Nyasaland

title: South Africa
event: February 26 – Middelburg peace conference fails in South Africa as Boers continue to demand autonomy

title: China
event: March 1 – United Kingdom, Germany and Japan protest at Sino-Russian agreement on Manchuria.

title: London
event: March 5 – Irish nationalist demonstrators ejected by police from House of Commons of the United Kingdom in London.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 11 – United Kingdom rejects amended Hay-Pauncefote treaty.

title: Jacksonville Florida
event: May 3 – The Great Fire of 1901 begins in Jacksonville, FL.

title: Melbourne
event: May 9 – Australia opens its first parliament in Melbourne.

title: New Jersey
event: May 27 – In New Jersey, the Edison Storage Battery Company is founded.

title: Iran
event: May 28 – Iran (known as Persia until 1935) grants William Knox D'Arcy a concession, giving him the right to prospect for oil.

title: United States Department of Agriculture
event: July 1 – Bureau of Chemistry within Department of Agriculture.

title: Hartland New Brunswick
event: July 4 – The 1,282 foot (390 m) covered bridge crossing the St. John River at Hartland, New Brunswick, Canada opens. It is the longest covered bridge in the world.

title: Antarctica
event: August 6 – Discovery Expedition: Robert Falcon Scott sets sail on the RRS ''Discovery'' to explore the Ross Sea in Antarctica.

title: Philippines
event: August 28 – Silliman University is founded in the Philippines.  The first American private school in the country.

title: Minnesota State Fair
event: September 2 – U.S. Vice President Theodore Roosevelt utters the famous phrase, Speak softly and carry a big stick at the Minnesota State Fair.

title: Leon Czolgosz
event: September 6 – American anarchist Leon Czolgosz shoots U.S. President William McKinley at the Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo, New York. McKinley dies 8 days later.

title: China
event: September 7 – The Boxer Rebellion in China officially ends with the signing of the Boxer Protocol.

title: Abraham Lincoln
event: September 26 – The body of U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is exhumed and reinterred in concrete several feet thick.

title: White House
event: October 16 – U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt invites African American leader Booker T. Washington to the White House. The American South reacts angrily to the visit, and racial violence increases in the region.

title: Yale University
event: October 23 – Yale University celebrates its bicentennial.

title: Niagara Falls
event: October 24 – Michigan schoolteacher Annie Taylor goes down Niagara Falls in a barrel and survives.

title: Leon Czolgosz
event: Leon Czolgosz, the assassin of William McKinley, is executed by electrocution.

title: Virginia
event: November 1 – Sigma Phi Epsilon is founded in Richmond, VA.

title: Longwood University
event: November 15 – The Alpha Sigma Alpha Fraternity is founded at Longwood University.

title: Alabama
event: November 28 – The new state constitution of Alabama requires voters to have passed literacy tests.

title: Alfred Nobel
event: December 10 – The first Nobel Prize ceremony is held in Stockholm on the fifth anniversary of Alfred Nobel's death.

title: Newfoundland and Labrador
event: December 12 – Guglielmo Marconi receives the first trans-Atlantic radio signal, sent from Poldhu in England to Newfoundland, Canada; it is the letter S in Morse.

title: Kenya
event: December 20 – The final spike is driven into the Mombasa-Victoria-Uganda Railway in what is now Kisumu, Kenya.

title: France
event: In France, Alfred Loisy writes ''L'évangile et l'Eglise'', which inaugurates the Modernist Crisis.

title: Americas
event: International Bureau of the American Republics is established.

title: Kentucky
event: Nathan B. Stubblefield demonstrates his mobile phone device in Kentucky.

title: Philippines
event: The insurrection ends in the Philippines.

title: Ho Chi Minh City
event: Capital of French Indochina moved from Saigon (in Cochinchina) to Hanoi (Tonkin).

title: Long Bien Bridge
event: Completion of Paul Doumer Bridge linking both sections of Hanoi.

title: South Bend Indiana
event: The Potawatomi Zoo (the oldest zoo in Indiana) opens in South Bend.

title: Pasadena California
event: January 1 – The first college football bowl game, the Rose Bowl between Michigan and Stanford, is held in Pasadena, California.

title: Park Avenue Tunnel (railroad)
event: January 8 – A train collision in the New York Central Railroad's Park Avenue Tunnel kills 17, injures 38, and leads to increased demand for electric trains.

title: Hakkōda Mountains incident
event: January 23 – A snowstorm at Mount Hakkoda, northern Honshu, Japan, kills 199 during a military training exercise.

title: Brussels
event: February 11 – Police and universal suffrage demonstrators are involved in a physical altercation in Brussels.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 7 – Second Boer War: South African Boers win their last battle over British forces, with the capture of a British general and 200 of his men.

title: Mount Pelée
event: May 8 – In Martinique, Mount Pelée erupts, destroying the town of Saint-Pierre and killing over 30,000.

title: London School of Economics
event: May 29 – Lord Rosebery opens London School of Economics.

title: Australia
event: June 16 – Australia: Female British subjects (with the exception of Asians, Aborigines and Africans) win the vote with the Uniform Franchise Act.

title: St Mark's Campanile
event: July 14 – St Mark's Campanile in Venice collapses.

title: Rio de Janeiro
event: July 21 – Fluminense Football Club is founded in Rio de Janeiro.

title: Australia
event: August 1 – 100 miners die in a pit explosion in Wollongong, Australia.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 9 – Edward VII is crowned King of the United Kingdom.

title: Hartford Connecticut
event: August 22 – Theodore Roosevelt becomes the first American President to ride in an automobile when he rides in a Columbia Electric Victoria through Hartford, Connecticut.

title: Martha Washington Hotel
event: March 2 – In New York City, the Martha Washington Hotel, the first hotel exclusively for women, opens.

title: Rosyth Dockyard
event: March 3 – The British admiralty announces plans to build a naval base at Rosyth.

title: University of Puerto Rico
event: March 12 – The University of Puerto Rico is founded.

title: Panama Canal
event: March 14 – The Hay-Herran Treaty, granting the United States the right to build the Panama Canal, is ratified by the United States Senate. The Colombian Senate later rejects the treaty.

title: Frank Alberta
event: April 29 – A 30-million-m<sup>3</sup> landslide kills 70 in Frank, Alberta.

title: London
event: July 30–August 23 (July 17–August 10, O.S.) – Second Congress of the All-Russian Social Democratic Labour Party held in exile in Brussels, transferring to London.

title: Milwaukee Mile
event: September 11 – The first stock car event is held at the Milwaukee Mile.

title: Joseph Chamberlain
event: September 14 – Joseph Chamberlain resigns as British Colonial Secretary, in order to campaign publicly for Imperial Preference.

title: Brazil
event: September 15 – Grêmio Foot-Ball Porto-Alegrense is founded in Porto Alegre, Brazil

title: Danville Virginia
event: September 27 – The Wreck of the Old 97 engine at Stillhouse Trestle near Danville, Virginia, which kills 9 people, inspires a ballad and song.

title: High Court of Australia
event: October 6 – The High Court of Australia sits for the first time.

title: Panama Canal Zone
event: November 18 – The Hay-Bunau-Varilla Treaty is signed by the United States and Panama, giving the U.S. exclusive rights over the Panama Canal Zone.

title: Cripple Creek Colorado
event: November 23 – Colorado Governor James Hamilton Peabody sends the state militia into the town of Cripple Creek to break up a miners' strike.

title: North Carolina
event: December 17 – Orville Wright flies an aircraft with a petrol engine at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina in the first documented, successful, controlled, powered, heavier-than-air flight.

title: Griffin Park
event: The Loftus Road and Griffin Park football stadiums open.

title: New York City
event: Stuyvesant High School is founded in New York City.

title: Bethune-Cookman University
event: The Daytona Educational and Industrial Training School for Negro Girls, now Bethune-Cookman University, is founded.

title: London
event: Halford Mackinder presents a paper on ''The Geographical Pivot of History'' to the Royal Geographical Society of London in which he formulates the Heartland Theory, originating the study of geopolitics.

title: German South-West Africa
event: January 12 – The Herero Rebellion in German South-West Africa begins.

title: New York City
event: January 16 – The first large-scale bodybuilding competition in America takes place at Madison Square Garden in New York City.

title: Congo Free State
event: February 10 – Roger Casement publishes his account of Belgian atrocities in the Congo.

title: Panama Canal
event: February 23 – For $10 million, the United States gains control of the Panama Canal Zone.

title: Portugal
event: February 28 – Sport Lisboa e Benfica is founded in Portugal.

title: Korea
event: March 4 – Russo-Japanese War: Russian troops in Korea retreat toward Manchuria, followed by 100,000 Japanese troops.

title: France
event: The Entente Cordiale is signed between the UK and France.

title: Times Square
event: Longacre Square in Midtown Manhattan is renamed Times Square after ''The New York Times''.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: April 30 – The Louisiana Purchase Exposition World's Fair opens in St. Louis, Missouri (closes December 1).

title: Panama Canal
event: May 4 – U.S. Army engineers begin work on The Panama Canal.

title: FIFA
event: May 21 – The International Federation of Association Football, FIFA, is established.

title: New York City
event: June 15 – A fire aboard the steamboat ''General Slocum'' in New York City's East River kills 1,021.

title: Ringsend
event: June 16 – James Joyce walks to Ringsend with Nora Barnacle; he later uses this date (Bloomsday) as the setting for his novel ''Ulysses''.

title: Rockall
event: June 28 – The Danish ocean liner ''SS Norge'' runs aground and sinks close to Rockall, killing 635, including 225 Norwegian emigrants.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: July 1 – The third Modern Olympic Games opens in St. Louis, Missouri, United States as part of the World's Fair.

title: Lhasa
event: August 3 – British expedition to Tibet: The British expedition under Colonel Francis Younghusband takes Lhasa in Tibet.

title: New Zealand
event: September 26 – New Zealand dolphin Pelorus Jack is individually protected by Order in Council under the Sea Fisheries Act.

title: New York University
event: October 5 – Alpha Kappa Psi, the co-ed Professional Business Fraternity, is founded on the campus of New York University

title: University of Minnesota
event: October 15 – Theta Tau, the Professional Engineering Fraternity, is founded at the University of Minnesota in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

title: North Sea
event: October 21 – Russo-Japanese War – Dogger Bank incident: The Russian Baltic Fleet fires on British trawlers it mistakes for Japanese torpedo boats in the North Sea.

title: Denmark
event: December 4 – The K.U. or Konservativ Ungdom (Young Conservatives) is founded by Carl F. Herman von Rosen in Denmark .

title: College of Charleston
event: December 10 – The Pi Kappa Phi Fraternity is founded at the College of Charleston in Charleston, SC.

title: London
event: December 27 – The stage play ''Peter Pan, or The Boy Who Wouldn't Grow Up'' premieres in London.

title: Times Square
event: December 31 – In New York City, the first New Year's Eve celebration is held in Times Square.

title: Queensland
event: Women are given the vote and admitted to the practice of law in Queensland.

title: Brooklyn Public Library
event: ''Huckleberry Finn'' and ''Tom Sawyer'' are banned from the Brooklyn Public Library for setting a bad example.

title: Stonehenge
event: Neo-Druidic rituals begin in Stonehenge.

title: China
event: Civil service examinations are abolished in China.

title: China
event: January 2 – Russo-Japanese War: The Russian Army surrenders at Port Arthur, China.

title: Premier Mine
event: January 26 – The Cullinan Diamond is found near Pretoria, South Africa at the Premier Mine.

title: Ireland
event: February 16 – At Haulbowline Base in Ireland, 2 explosions onboard the HM Submarine A5, due to petrol fumes after refueling, kill 6 of 11 crew.

title: Fremantle Western Australia
event: February 17 – At Fremantle, Western Australia, the R.M.S. ''Orizaba'' wrecks, but all 160 passengers and the mail are saved.

title: Rotary International
event: February 23 – Rotary International is founded.

title: South Australia
event: March 1 – Australian Conservative leader Richard Butler takes office as Premier of South Australia.

title: Shenyang
event: Russo-Japanese War: The Japanese capture of Mukden (now Shenyang) completes the rout of Russian armies in Manchuria.

title: Brockton Massachusetts
event: March 20 – Grover Shoe Factory disaster: A boiler explosion, building collapse and fire in Brockton, Massachusetts kills 58.

title: Australia
event: April 1 – Penny post established between the United Kingdom and Australia.

title: Kangra Himachal Pradesh
event: April 4 – In India, the  1905 Kangra earthquake  hits the Kangra valley, kills 20,000, and destroys most buildings in Kangra, Mcleodganj and Dharamshala.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: April 6 – ''Lochner v. New York'': The Supreme Court of the United States invalidates New York's 8-hour-day law.

title: Lüshunkou District
event: May 15 – The Russian minelayer ''Amur'' laid a minefield about {{convert15mikm}} off Port Arthur and sank Japan's battleship Hatsuse, 15,000 tons, with 496 crew.

title: Las Vegas Nevada
event: May 15 – Las Vegas, Nevada is founded when 110 acres (0.4 km²), in what later becomes downtown, are auctioned off.

title: Battle of Tsushima
event: May 27–May 28 – Russo-Japanese War – Battle of Tsushima: The Japanese fleet under Admiral Heihachiro Togo destroys the Russian fleet under Admiral Zinovi Petrovich Rozhdestvenski in a 2-day battle.

title: Northwest Territories
event: September 1 – The Canadian provinces of Alberta and Saskatchewan are established from the southwestern part of the Northwest Territories.

title: Sakhalin
event: September 5 – Russo-Japanese War – Treaty of Portsmouth: In New Hampshire, a treaty mediated by U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt is signed by victor Japan and Russia. Russia cedes the island of Sakhalin and port and rail rights in Manchuria to Japan.

title: Estonia
event: October 16 – Russian Revolution of 1905: The Russian army opens fire in a meeting on a street market in Estonia, killing 94 and injuring over 200.

title: Alberta
event: November 9 – The Province of Alberta, Canada holds its first general election.

title: Denmark
event: November 18 – Prince Carl of Denmark becomes King Haakon VII of Norway.

title: Ireland
event: November 28 – Irish nationalist Arthur Griffith founds Sinn Féin in Dublin, as a political party whose goal is independence for all of Ireland.

title: Idaho
event: December 30 – A bomb kills Frank Steunenberg, ex-governor of Idaho; the case leads to a trial against leaders of the Western Federation of Miners.

title: Great Mosque of Djenné
event: Construction begins on the current Great Mosque of Djenné.

title: Vancouver Island
event: January 22 – The SS ''Valencia'' strikes a reef off Vancouver Island, Canada, killing over 100 (officially 136) in the ensuing disaster.

title: 1906 Ecuador-Colombia earthquake
event: January 31 – An earthquake (8.8 on the Moment magnitude scale) and associated tsunami strikes Ecuador and Colombia.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 10 – HMS ''Dreadnought'' is launched and sparks the naval race between Britain and Germany.

title: France
event: March 10 – An explosion in a coal mine in Courrières, France kills 1,060.

title: San Andreas Fault
event: April 18 – The 1906 San Francisco earthquake (estimated magnitude 7.8) on the San Andreas Fault destroys much of San Francisco, California, USA, killing at least 3,000, with 225,000–300,000 left homeless, and $350 million in damages.

title: RMS Lusitania
event: June 7 – The RMS ''Lusitania'' is launched in Glasgow. It is the world's largest ship.

title: Alfred Dreyfus
event: July 12 – Alfred Dreyfus is exonerated.  He is reinstalled in the French Army on July 21, thus ending the Dreyfus Affair.

title: Hong Kong
event: September 18 – A typhoon and tsunami kill an estimated 10,000 in Hong Kong.{{citation neededdate=December 2009}}

title: Yorkshire
event: September 30 – The first Gordon Bennett Cup in ballooning is held, starting in Paris.  The winning team, piloting the balloon ''United States'', lands in Fylingdales, Yorkshire.

title: Grand Duchy of Finland
event: October 1 – The Grand Duchy of Finland becomes the first nation to include the right of women to stand as candidates when it adopts universal suffrage.

title: Köpenick
event: October 16 – Imposter Wilhelm Voigt impersonates a Prussian officer and takes over city hall in Köpenick for a short time.

title: France
event: October 23 – An aeroplane of Alberto Santos-Dumont takes off at Bagatelle in France and flies 60 meters (200 feet). This is the first officially recorded powered flight in Europe..

title: Jamaica
event: 14 January – An earthquake, in Kingston, Jamaica kills more than 1,000.

title: Shelter Cove California
event: 21 July – The ''SS Columbia'' sinks after colliding with the lumber schooner ''San Pedro'' off Shelter Cove, California, U.S.A., resulting in 88 deaths.

title: Korea
event: 25 July – Korea becomes a protectorate of Japan.

title: New York City
event: 7 September – The passenger liner ''RMS Lusitania'' makes its maiden voyage from Liverpool, England to New York City.

title: New Zealand
event: 26 September – New Zealand and Newfoundland become dominions.

title: Glace Bay Nova Scotia
event: 17 October – Guglielmo Marconi initiates commercial transatlantic radio communications between his high power longwave wireless telegraphy stations in Clifden Ireland and Glace Bay, Nova Scotia.

title: Monongah West Virginia
event: 6 December – Monongah Mining Disaster: A coal mine explosion kills 362 workers in Monongah, West Virginia, United States.

title: Mogao Caves
event: The ''Diamond Sutra'' of 868, a Buddhist scripture later dated as earliest example of block printing, is discovered in the Mogao Caves.

title: Moine Thrust Belt
event: The Moine Thrust Belt in Scotland becomes the first thrust belt to be discovered in the world.

title: Congo Free State
event: Due to the evidence collected by Roger Casement, Léopold II of Belgium is forced to make reforms in the Congo, his personal colony.

title: United Kingdom
event: Penny post established between the United Kingdom and United States.

title: France
event: Henri Matisse opens his own art academy in France.

title: France
event: A 40,000-year-old Neanderthal boy skeleton is found at Le Moustier in southwest France.

title: Eiffel Tower
event: January 12 – A long-distance radio message is sent from the Eiffel Tower for the first time.

title: Rhoads Opera House
event: January 13 – A fire at the Rhoads Opera House in Boyertown, Pennsylvania, U.S.A. kills 170.

title: Lisbon
event: February 1 – King Carlos I of Portugal and Infante Luis Filipe are shot dead in Lisbon.

title: Ohio
event: March 4 – The Collinwood School Fire, near Cleveland, Ohio, U.S.A., kills 174.

title: Gibraltar
event: March 27 – The first overseas Scout Troop is formed in Gibraltar.

title: Australia
event: April 20 – Sunshine train disaster:  Two trains collide in Melbourne, Australia, killing 44 people and injuring more than 400.

title: North Pole
event: April 21 – Frederick Cook claims to have reached the North Pole on this date.

title: London
event: April 27 – The 1908 Summer Olympics begin in London.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 26 – At Masjid-al-Salaman in southwest Persia, the first major commercial oil discovery in the Middle East is made. The rights to the resource are quickly acquired by the United Kingdom.

title: Siberia
event: June 30 – The Tunguska event, also known as the ''Russian explosion'', occurs near the Podkamennaya Tunguska River in Krasnoyarsk Krai, Siberia, Russian Empire.

title: Malmö
event: July 11–July 12 – The steamship ''Amalthea'', housing 80 British strikebreakers while in Malmö harbour, Sweden, is bombed by Anton Nilson; 1 is killed, 20 injured.

title: London
event: July 24 – Dorando Pietri wins the Olympic marathon in London in one of the most dramatic arrivals of the Olympic history, only to be disqualified soon afterwards.

title: Virginia
event: September 17 – At Ft. Myer, Virginia, U.S.A. Thomas Selfridge becomes the first person to die in an airplane crash. The pilot, Orville Wright, is severely injured in the crash but recovers.

title: Bolivia
event: November 6 – Western bandits Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are supposedly killed in Bolivia, after being surrounded by a large group of soldiers. There are many rumors to the contrary however, and their grave sites are unmarked.

title: China
event: December 2 – Child Emperor Pu Yi ascends the Chinese throne at age 2.

title: Belfast
event: December 16 – Construction begins on the RMS ''Olympic'' at the Harland and Wolff Shipyards in Belfast.

title: Bangkok
event: March 10 – The Anglo-Siamese Treaty of 1909 is signed in Bangkok.

title: North Pole
event: April 6 – Robert Peary, Matthew Henson, and four Eskimo explorers come within a few miles of the North Pole.

title: Tel Aviv
event: April 11 – The city of Tel Aviv (then known as Ahuzat Bayit) is founded.

title: Thessaloniki
event: April 27 – Sultan of the Ottoman Empire Abdul Hamid II is overthrown and succeeded by his brother, Mehmed V. He is sent to the Ottoman port city of Thessaloniki (Selanik) the next day.

title: Iran
event: July 16 – A revolution forces Mohammad Ali Shah, Persian Shah of the Qajar dynasty to abdicate in favor of his son Ahmad Shah Qajar. He proceeds to leave Persia for Imperial Russia, reportedly seeking the assistance of Nicholas II of Russia in regaining the throne.

title: English Channel
event: July 25 – Louis Bleriot is the first man to fly across the English Channel (thus a large open body of water) in a heavier-than-air craft.

title: China
event: September 4 – Japan and China sign the Jiandao/Gando Treaty, which gives Imperial Japan a way to receive railroad concessions in Manchuria.

title: Korea under Japanese rule
event: October 26 – Korean nationalist An Jung-geun assassinates Ito Hirobumi, a former Prime Minister of Japan, in Harbin, China, in protest of the Japanese annexation of Korea.

title: Nicaragua
event: November 18 – In Nicaragua 500 revolutionaries (including 2 Americans) are executed by order of dictator José Santos Zelaya. The United States responds by sending 2 warships.

title: Albania
event: March – An uprising against Ottoman rule breaks out in Albania.

title: China
event: Late December – A form of Pneumonic plague spreads through northeastern China, killing more than 40,000.

title: Great Britain
event: The electric streetcars of Austria-Hungary, France, Germany and Great Britain are carrying 6.7 million riders per year.

title: Vienna
event: Karl Lueger retires as mayor of Vienna.

title: California
event: January 10–January 20 – The first aviation meet to be held in the United States, the 1910 Los Angeles International Air Meet at Dominguez Field, is held near Los Angeles, California.

title: Ököritófülpös
event: March 27 – A fire during a barn-dance in Ököritófülpös, Hungary kills 312.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 6 – George V becomes King of the United Kingdom upon the death of his father, Edward VII.

title: Düsseldorf
event: June 22 – The DELAG Zeppelin dirigible, ''Deutschland'', makes the first commercial passenger flight from Friedrichshafen to Düsseldorf in Germany. The flight takes nine hours.

title: France
event: August 14 – A fire at the World Exhibition in Brussels destroys exhibitions of Britain and France.

title: Portugal
event: October 5 – Portugal becomes a republic; King Manuel II of Portugal flees to England.

title: Belfast
event: October 20 – The hull of the RMS ''Olympic'' is launched at the Harland and Wolff Shipyards in Belfast.

title: Allahabad
event: February 18 – The first official air mail flight takes place from Allahabad, India to Naini, India, when Henri Pequet carries 6,500 letters a distance of 13 km.

title: New York City
event: March 25 – A fire at the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory in New York City, United States, kills 146.

title: Arizona
event: April 13 – Mexican Revolution: Rebels take Agua Prieta on the Sonora–Arizona border; government troops take the town back April 17 when the rebel leader Red López is drunk.

title: France
event: May 25 – Mexican Revolution: Porfirio Diaz signs his resignation and leaves for Veracruz; on May 31 he leaves for exile in France.

title: Machu Picchu
event: July 24 – Hiram Bingham rediscovers Machu Picchu.

title: Italy
event: September 29 – Italy declares war on Ottoman Empire.

title: Austin Pennsylvania
event: September 30 – The Austin Dam breaks, wiping out the town of Austin, Pennsylvania, United States, killing 78.

title: Republic of China
event: October 10 – The Wuchang Uprising starts the Xinhai Revolution that leads to the founding of the Republic of China.

title: Veracruz
event: October 16 – Mexican Revolution: Felix Diaz, nephew of Porfirio Diaz, occupies the port of Veracruz as a sign of rebellion against Madero.

title: China
event: October 18 – Revolutionaries under Sun Yat-sen overthrow China's Qing Dynasty.

title: Italy
event: November 5 – Italy annexes Tripoli and Cyrenaica (this act is confirmed by an act of the Italian Parliament on February 25, 1912).

title: South Pole
event: December 14 – Roald Amundsen's expedition reaches the South Pole.

title: Republic of China
event: December 29 – Sun Yat-sen becomes the first President of the Republic of China.

title: Alfred Wegener
event: Alfred Wegener proposes the theory of continental drift.

title: Lake Guatavita
event: British treasure hunters try to drain Lake Guatavita to find gold; they find nothing.

title: Nicaragua
event: U.S. Marines intervene in Nicaragua to bolster the conservative government.

title: Villa Mondragone
event: Wilfrid Voynich discovers the eponymous manuscript in the Villa Mondragone.

title: Republic of China
event: January 1 – The Republic of China is established.

title: New Mexico
event: January 6 – New Mexico is admitted as the 47th U.S. state.

title: South Pole
event: January 17 – British polar explorer Robert Falcon Scott and a team of 4 become the second expeditionary group to reach the South Pole.

title: Arizona
event: February 14 – Arizona is admitted as the 48th U.S. state.

title: Tripoli
event: March 5 – Italian forces are the first to use airships for a military purpose by using them for reconnaissance west of Tripoli behind Turkish lines.

title: South Pole
event: Roald Amundsen announces his success in reaching the South Pole.

title: South Pole
event: March 16 – Lawrence Oates, dying member of Scott's South Pole expedition, leaves the tent saying, I am just going outside and may be some time.

title: RMS Titanic
event: April 10 – The British ocean liner ''RMS Titanic'' leaves Southampton, England on her maiden voyage for New York City.

title: RMS Titanic
event: April 11 – RMS Titanic arrives at Queenstown, Ireland (today known as Cobh) picking up her final complement of passengers before steaming westward for New York.

title: RMS Titanic
event: April 14 – RMS Titanic strikes  an iceberg in the northern Atlantic Ocean at 11:40 pm.

title: RMS Titanic
event: April 15 – RMS Titanic sinks at 2:20 a.m., taking with her the lives of more than 1,500 people.

title: English Channel
event: Harriet Quimby becomes first woman to fly across the English Channel.

title: Royal Ontario Museum
event: The Royal Ontario Museum is established in Toronto, Ontario.

title: RMS Carpathia
event: April 18 – The Cunard liner RMS ''Carpathia'' arrives in New York with ''Titanic''<nowiki>'s</nowiki> 706 survivors.

title: Tiger Stadium (Detroit)
event: Tiger Stadium opens in Detroit.

title: Fenway Park
event: Fenway Park, home of the Boston Red Sox, opens.

title: Indianapolis 500
event: May 30 – Joe Dawson wins the second Indianapolis 500-Mile Race after Ralph DePalma's Mercedes breaks down within sight of the finish.

title: Istanbul
event: June 4 – A fire in Istanbul destroys 1,120 buildings.

title: Alaska
event: June 6–June 8 – Mount Novarupta erupts in Alaska.

title: Navajo County Arizona
event: July 19 – A meteorite with an estimated mass of 190 kg explodes over the town of Holbrook in Navajo County, Arizona causing thousands of pieces of debris to rain down on the town.

title: Switzerland
event: August 1 –  The Jungfraubahn rack railway is inaugurated in Switzerland.

title: Edirne
event: Bulgarian pilots Radul Minkov and Prodan Toprakchiev perform the first bombing with an airplane in history, at the railway station of Karaagac near Edirne against Turkey.

title: Italy
event: October 18 – Italy and the Ottoman Empire signed a treaty in Ouchy near Lausanne ending the Italo-Turkish War.

title: İzmir
event: November 1 İzmir's first sport club  Karşıyaka Muaresei Bedeniye Kulübü (currently Karşıyaka Spor Kulübü) is founded.

title: Albania
event: November 28 – Albania declares independence from the Ottoman Empire.

title: United Kingdom
event: December 20 – Piltdown Man is presented in Britain.

title: Greece
event: December 30 – The First Balkan War ends temporarily: Bulgaria, Greece, Montenegro, and Serbia (the Balkan League) sign an armistice with Turkey, ending the two-month long war.

title: China
event: Following the assassination of his rival Song Jiaoren, Yuan Shikai uses military force to dissolve China's parliament and rules as a dictator.

title: Illinois
event: May – The Paul Emile Chabas painting ''September Morn'' creates a national sensation in the U.S., and results in a court case in Chicago, Illinois.

title: India
event: December – The Gateway of India is constructed at Mumbai, to commemorate the first entry of Queen Victoria into India.

title: Winston-Salem North Carolina
event: The cities of Winston, North Carolina and Salem, North Carolina officially merge to become Winston-Salem.

title: Ontario
event: Crescent School established in Toronto, Ontario, Canada

title: New York City
event: February 1 – New York City's Grand Central Terminal, having been rebuilt, reopens as the world's largest train station.

title: New York City
event: February 17 – The Armory Show opens in New York City. It displays the works of artists who are to become some of the most influential painters of the early 20th Century.

title: Philippines
event: March 5–March 7 – First Battle of Bud Dajo: American troops decisively defeat Moro rebels in the Philippines.

title: Canberra
event: March 12 – Australia begins building the new federal capital of Canberra.

title: New York City
event: April 24 – The Woolworth Building opens in New York City.

title: India
event: May 3 – Raja Harishchandra the first full-length Indian feature film was released, marking the beginning of the Indian film industry.

title: John D. Rockefeller
event: May 14 – New York Governor William Sulzer approves the charter for the Rockefeller Foundation, which begins operations with a $100,000,000 donation from John D. Rockefeller.

title: London
event: May 30 – First Balkan War: A peace treaty is signed in London, ending the war.

title: Deutsches Stadion (Berlin)
event: June 8 – The Deutsches Stadion in Berlin is dedicated with the release of 10,000 pigeons, in front of an audience of 60,000 people.  It has been constructed especially for the 1916 Summer Olympics, which are cancelled as a result of World War I.

title: New York
event: June 13 – An International Railway (New York – Ontario) trolley and passengers are buried under the contents of an overhead garbage chute, that breaks in Niagara Falls, New York.

title: Pennsylvania
event: July 3 – The 50th anniversary commemoration of the Battle of Gettysburg draws thousands of American Civil War veterans and their families to Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.

title: California
event: July 10 – Death Valley, California hits 134 °F (~56.7 °C) which is the highest temperature recorded in the United States ({{As of2008lc=on}}).

title: China
event: August 4 – In China, the province of Chungking declares independence; Chinese Republican forces crush the rebellion in a couple of weeks.

title: Sheffield
event: August 13 – Stainless steel is invented by Harry Brearley in Sheffield.

title: France
event: August 20 – {{convert700ftm}} above Buc, France, parachutist Adolphe Pegond jumps from an airplane and lands safely.

title: Bizerte
event: September 23 – French aviator Roland Garros crosses the Mediterranean in an airplane flying from Fréjus, France to Bizerte, Tunisia.

title: Kingdom of Bulgaria
event: September 29 – Second Balkan War: A peace treaty is signed in Constantinople between the Ottoman Empire and the Kingdom of Bulgaria.

title: Panama Canal
event: October 10 – U.S. President Woodrow Wilson triggers the explosion of the Gamboa Dike, ending construction on the Panama Canal.

title: South Africa
event: November 6 – Mohandas Gandhi is arrested while leading a march of Indian miners in South Africa.

title: New York
event: November 26 – Phi Sigma Sigma, the first non-sectarian sorority, is founded at Hunter College in New York.

title: France
event: November 29 – Fédération Internationale d'Escrime, the international organizing body of competitive fencing is founded in Paris, France.

title: Greece
event: Crete, having obtained self rule from Turkey after the first Balkan War, is annexed by Greece.

title: Yosemite National Park
event: December 19 – Woodrow Wilson signs the Raker Act into law, authorizing the destruction of Hetch Hetchy Valley in Yosemite National Park by the construction of a dam at the valley's mouth.

title: France
event: December 30 – Italy returns the ''Mona Lisa'' to France.

title: Orange Texas
event: The Port of Orange, Texas, is dredged for the fabrication of vessels for the United States Navy.

title: University of Chicago
event: Phi Sigma, a local undergraduate classical club, is founded by a group of students in the   Greek Department at the University of Chicago.

title: Belfast
event: February 26 – The ''Britannic'', sister to the ''Titanic'', is launched at Harland & Wolff Shipyards in Belfast.

title: Universal Postal Union
event: March 1 – The Republic of China joins the Universal Postal Union.

title: Albania
event: March 7 – Prince William of Wied arrives in Albania to begin his reign.

title: Easter Island
event: March 29 – Katherine Routledge and her husband arrive in Easter Island to make the first true study of it (they depart August 1915)

title: Veracruz Veracruz
event: April 9 – The Tampico Affair results in the occupation of the Mexican port city of Veracruz for over 6 months.

title: Irving Texas
event: April 14 – The city of Irving, Texas is incorporated.

title: Monaco
event: April 14–18 – First International Criminal Police Congress held in Monaco.

title: Ludlow Colorado
event: April 20 – Colorado coalfield Massacre or Ludlow Massacre: The Colorado National Guard attacks a tent colony of 1,200 striking coal miners in Ludlow, Colorado, killing 24 people.

title: Veracruz Veracruz
event: April 21 – 3,000 U.S. Marines land in Vera Cruz, Mexico.

title: San Luis Potosí
event: June 18 – Mexican Revolution: The ''Constitutionals'' take San Luis Potosí; Venustiano Carranza demands Victoriano Huerta's surrender.

title: Kiel Canal
event: June 23 – The Kiel Canal is reopened (having been deepened) by the Kaiser; the British Fleet under Sir G. Warrender visits; the Kaiser inspects the dreadnought {{HMSKing George V19116}}.

title: Sarajevo
event: June 28 – Serb nationalist Gavrilo Princip assassinates Austrian Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife, Duchess Sophie, in Sarajevo.

title: Vienna
event: Austria-Hungary: The Secretary of the Legation at Belgrade sends a dispatch to Vienna suggesting Serbian complicity in the crime of Sarajevo. Anti-Serb riots erupt in Sarajevo and throughout Bosnia generally.

title: Siberia
event: Chionya Gusyeva attempts and fails to assassinate Grigori Rasputin at his home town in Siberia.

title: House of Commons of the United Kingdom
event: June 30 – Among those addressing the Parliament of the United Kingdom on the murdered Archduke are Lords Crewe and Lansdowne in the House of Lords and Messrs Asquith and Law in the Commons.

title: Vienna
event: July 4 – The Archduke's funeral takes place at Artstetten (50 miles west of Vienna), Austria-Hungary.

title: House of Lords
event: The House of Lords completes the recasting of the Amendment Bill.

title: House of Lords
event: July 14 – The Government of Ireland Amending Bill is passed by the House of Lords.

title: Coatzacoalcos Veracruz
event: Mexican Revolution: Victoriano Huerta resigns the presidency of Mexico and leaves for Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz.

title: Jamaica
event: Marcus Garvey founds the Universal Negro Improvement Association (UNIA) in Jamaica.

title: HMS Amphion (1911)
event: The German minelayer ''Königin Luise'' lays a minefield about 40 miles off the Thames Estuary (Lowestoft). She is intercepted and sunk by the British light-cruiser HMS ''Amphion''.

title: Battle of Liège
event: August 5 – 16 – Battle of Liège: The German Army overruns and defeats the Belgians.

title: Panama Canal
event: The Panama Canal is inaugurated with the passage of the steamship USS ''Ancon''.

title: Battle of Tannenberg (1914)
event: August 17–September 2 – World War I: The Battle of Tannenberg begins between German and Russian forces.

title: Brussels
event: August 20 – World War I: German forces occupy Brussels.

title: Empire of Japan
event: August 23 – Japan declares war on Germany.

title: Battle of Tannenberg (1914)
event: August 26–August 30 – The Russian Second Army is surrounded and defeated in the Battle of Tannenberg.

title: Battle of Heligoland Bight
event: August 28 – Battle of Heligoland: British cruisers under Admiral Beatty sink 3 German cruisers.

title: Moronvilliers
event: September 2 – Moronvilliers is occupied by the Germans.

title: Namibia
event: September 13 – South African troops open hostilities in German South-West Africa (today Namibia) with an assault on the Ramansdrift police station.

title: Tory Island
event: October 27 – World War I: The British super-dreadnought battleship HMS ''Audacious'' (23,400 tons), is sunk off Tory Island, north-west of Ireland, by a minefield laid by the armed German merchant-cruiser ''Berlin''.

title: Battle of Penang
event: October 28 – World War I – Battle of Penang, Malaya: The German cruiser ''Emden'' sinks a Russian cruiser and French destroyer before escaping.

title: Black Sea
event: October 29 – World War I: Ottoman warships shell Russian Black Sea ports; Russia, France, and Britain declare war on November 1–November 5.

title: HMS Monmouth (1901)
event: November 1 – World War I – Battle of Coronel: A Royal Navy squadron commanded by Rear-Admiral Sir Christopher Cradock is met and defeated by superior German forces led by Vice-Admiral Graf Maximilian von Spee, in the first British naval defeat of the war, resulting in the loss of HMS ''Good Hope'' and HMS ''Monmouth''.

title: Jiaozhou Bay
event: November 7 – The Japanese seize Jiaozhou Bay in China, the base of the German East Asia Squadron.

title: Veracruz
event: November 23 – U.S. troops withdraw from Veracruz. Venustiano Carranza's troops take over and Carranza makes the town his headquarters.

title: Varsity Stadium
event: December 5 – The Toronto Argonauts win their first Grey Cup at Varsity Stadium.

title: Battle of the Falkland Islands
event: December 8 – Battle of the Falkland Islands, between Doveton Sturdee and Maximilian von Spee squadrons.

title: 1915 locust plague
event: March – The 1915 locust plague breaks out in Palestine; it continues until October.

title: Alfred Wegener
event: Alfred Wegener proposes the theory of Pangaea.

title: Oxford Georgia
event: Emory College is rechartered as Emory University, and plans to move its main campus from Oxford, Georgia to Atlanta.

title: Denmark
event: Women's suffrage is introduced in Denmark and Iceland.

title: HMS Formidable (1898)
event: World War I: The battleship HMS ''Formidable'' is sunk off Lyme Regis, Dorset, England, by a German U-Boat.

title: Australia
event: The Battle of Broken Hill, a train ambush near Broken Hill, New South Wales, in Australia.

title: Rocky Mountain National Park
event: The Rocky Mountain National Park is established by an act of the U.S. Congress.

title: Italy
event: January 13 – An earthquake (6.8 in Richter scale) in Avezzano, Italy, kills more than 29,000.

title: Republic of China
event: January 18 – Twenty-One Demands from Japan to China are made.

title: United Kingdom
event: German zeppelins bomb the cities of Great Yarmouth and King's Lynn in the United Kingdom for the first time, killing more than 20.

title: NASA
event: March 3 – NACA, the predecessor of NASA, is founded.

title: SMS Dresden (1907)
event: World War I: Off the coast of Chile, the Royal Navy force SMS ''Dresden'' to scuttle.

title: United Kingdom
event: Britain,

title: Dardanelles
event: March 18 – World War I: A British attack on the Dardanelles fails.

title: Hawaii
event: March 25 – The U.S. submarine F-4 sinks off Hawaii; 21 are killed.

title: RMS Lusitania
event: May 7 – World War I: The RMS ''Lusitania'' is sunk by a German U-boat, killing 1,198.

title: Republic of China
event: May 25 – China agrees to Twenty-One Demands.

title: Portuguese First Republic
event: May 29 – Teófilo Braga becomes president of Portugal.

title: RMS Lusitania
event: June 9 – U.S. Secretary of State William Jennings Bryan resigns over a disagreement regarding his nation's handling of the RMS ''Lusitania'' sinking.

title: Queenston Ontario
event: July 7 – An extremely overloaded International Railway (New York – Ontario) trolley with 157 passengers crashes near Queenston, Ontario, resulting in 15 casualties.

title: New Orleans
event: August 5–August 23 – Hurricane Two of the 1915 Atlantic hurricane season over Galveston and New Orleans leaves 275 dead.

title: Kingdom of Serbia
event: August 16 – The Entente promises the Kingdom of Serbia, should victory be achieved over Austro-Hungary and its allied Central Powers, the territories of Baranja, Srem and Slavonia from the Cisleithanian part of the Dual Monarchy; Bosnia and Herzegovina; and eastern Dalmatia (from the river of Krka to Bar).

title: London
event: September 8 – A Zeppelin raid destroys No.61Farringdon Road, London. It was rebuilt in 1917 and called The Zeppelin Building.

title: Harrisburg Pennsylvania
event: September 11 – The Pennsylvania Railroad begins electrified commuter rail service between Paoli and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, using overhead AC trolley wires for power.  This type of system is later used in long-distance passenger trains between New York City, Washington, D.C., and Harrisburg, Pennsylvania.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 12 – World War I: British nurse Edith Cavell is executed by a German firing squad for helping Allied soldiers escape from Belgium.

title: Greece
event: October 15 – World War I: Austria-Hungary invades the Kingdom of Serbia.  Kingdom of Bulgaria enters the war, invading Kingdom of Serbia. The retreat of the Serbian First Army towards Greece begins the Serbian Campaign (World War I).

title: Massillon Ohio
