event: November 23 – The ''Triangle Film Corporation'' opens its new motion picture theater in Massillon, Ohio.

title: Liverpool
event: December 23 – The HMHS ''Britannic'', the largest individual British loss in World War I, departs Liverpool on her maiden voyage.

title: Alberta
event: Rodeo's first side-delivery bucking chute is designed and made by the Bascom boys (Raymond, Mel, Earl) and their father John W. Bascom at Welling, Alberta Canada.

title: North Sea
event: The Netherlands is hit by a North Sea storm that floods the lowlands and kills 10,000 people.

title: Cornwall
event: The ''Enrico Parodi'' sinks while in tow off The Carracks in Cornwall, England.

title: Browning Montana
event: In Browning, Montana, the temperature drops from +6.7°C to -48.8°C (44°F to -56°F) in one day, the greatest change ever on record for a 24-hour period.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: ''Brushaber v. Union Pacific Railroad'': The Supreme Court of the United States upholds the national income tax.

title: Ottawa
event: February 3 – Parliament buildings in Ottawa, Canada are burned down.

title: France
event: February 21 – World War I: The Battle of Verdun begins in France.

title: British Columbia
event: March 1 – Liberal British Columbia Premier Harlan Carey Brewster's term in office ends.

title: Columbus New Mexico
event: March 8–March 9 – Mexican Revolution: Pancho Villa leads about 500 Mexican raiders in an attack against Columbus, New Mexico, killing 12 U.S. soldiers. A garrison of the U.S. 13th Cavalry Regiment fights back and drives them away.

title: Republic of China
event: The last Emperor of China, Yuan Shikai, abdicates the throne and the Republic of China is restored.

title: Wrigley Field
event: April 20 – The Chicago Cubs play their first game at Weeghman Park (currently Wrigley Field), defeating the Cincinnati Reds 7–6 in 11 innings.

title: China
event: April 22 – The Chinese steamer ship ''Hsin Yu'' capsizes off the Chinese coast; at least 1,000 are killed.

title: Ireland
event: April 24 – April 30 – The Easter Rising occurs in Ireland. The Rising was an attempt by militant Irish republicans to win independence from Britain.

title: France
event: May 16 – Britain and France conclude the secret Sykes-Picot Agreement, which is to divide Arab areas of the Ottoman Empire, following the conclusion of World War I, into French and British spheres of influence.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 21 – Britain initiates daylight saving time.

title: Battle of Jutland
event: May 31 – June 1 – Battle of Jutland: The British Navy and the German Navy battle to a draw.

title: HMS Hampshire (1903)
event: The HMS ''Hampshire'' sinks off the Orkney Islands, Scotland, with Lord Kitchener aboard.

title: Cochrane Ontario
event: July 29 – In Ontario, Canada, a lightning strike ignites a forest fire that destroys the towns of Cochrane and Matheson, killing 233.

title: Black Tom explosion
event: July 30 – German agents cause the Black Tom explosion in Jersey City, New Jersey, an act of sabotage destroying an ammunition depot and killing at least 7 people.

title: Portugal
event: August 7 – World War I: Portugal joins the Allies.

title: California
event: August 9 – Lassen Volcanic National Park is established in California.

title: Quebec Bridge
event: September 11 – A mechanical failure causes the central span of the Quebec Bridge, a cantilever-type structure, to crash into the Saint Lawrence River, killing 13 workers.

title: Perm State University
event: October 14 – Perm State University is founded in Russia.

title: Ireland
event: Honan Chapel, Cork, Ireland, a product of the Irish Arts & Crafts Movement (1894–1925), is dedicated.

title: Montana
event: Republican Jeannette Rankin of Montana becomes the first woman elected to the United States House of Representatives.

title: France
event: November 18 – World War I – Battle of the Somme: In France, British Expeditionary Force commander Douglas Haig calls off the battle, which started on July 1.

title: Mediterranean Sea
event: November 21 – The White Star Liner ''HMHS Britannic'', sister ship of the ''RMS Olympic'' and the legendary ''RMS Titanic'', sinks in the Mediterranean Sea after hitting a mine. 30 lives are lost.

title: Bucharest
event: November 23 – World War I – Eastern Front: Bucharest, the capital of Romania, is occupied by troops of the Central Powers.

title: Dolomites
event: December 12 – In the Dolomites, an avalanche buries 18,000 Austrian and Italian soldiers.

title: New Zealand
event: December 23 – World War I – Battle of Magdhaba: In the Sinai desert, Australian and New Zealand mounted troops capture the Turkish garrison.

title: North Augusta South Carolina
event: December 31 – The Hampton Terrace Hotel in North Augusta, South Carolina, one of the largest and most luxurious hotels in the nation at the time, burns to the ground.

title: Panama Canal
event: July – Panama Canal Department.

title: Beijing
event: The True Jesus Church is established in Beijing.

title: Shankend
event: A cholera outbreak kills several German prisoners-of-war being held at Shankend in Scotland.

title: Rose Bowl Game
event: January 1 – The University of Oregon defeats The University of Pennsylvania 14–0 in college football's 3rd Annual Rose Bowl.

title: Kingsland Explosion
event: January 11 – German saboteurs set off the Kingsland Explosion at Kingsland, NJ (now Lyndhurst, NJ), one of the events leading to U.S. involvement in World War I.

title: Iraq
event: January 13 – World War I: The Battle of Wadi occurs between Allied British and Ottoman Empire forces, during the Mesopotamian campaign in modern-day Iraq.

title: London
event: January 19 – Silvertown explosion: A blast at a munitions factory in London kills 73 and injures over 400. The resulting fire causes over £2,000,000 worth of damage.

title: Virgin Islands
event: The Danish West Indies is sold to the United States for $25 million.

title: Hallsands
event: January 26 – The sea defences at the English village of Hallsands are breached, leading to all but one of the houses becoming uninhabitable.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 24 – World War I: United States ambassador to the United Kingdom, Walter H. Page, is shown the intercepted Zimmermann Telegram, in which Germany offers to give the American Southwest back to Mexico if Mexico declares war on the United States.

title: Montana
event: Jeannette Rankin of Montana becomes the first woman member of the United States House of Representatives.

title: Philippines
event: March 10 – The Province of Batangas is formally founded as one of the Philippines' first encomiendas.

title: Russian Provisional Government
event: March 17 (N.S.) (March 4, O.S.) – Grand Duke Michael Alexandrovich of Russia refuses the throne, and power passes to the newly formed Provisional Government under Prince Georgy Lvov.

title: First Battle of Gaza
event: March 26 – World War I: First Battle of Gaza: British cavalry troops retreat after 17,000 Turks block their advance.

title: United States Virgin Islands
event: March 31 – The United States takes possession of the Danish West Indies, which become the US Virgin Islands, after paying $25 million to Denmark.

title: Battle of Vimy Ridge
event: April 9–April 12 – World War I: Canadian troops win the Battle of Vimy Ridge.

title: Brazil
event: April 11 – World War I: Brazil severs diplomatic relations with Germany.

title: Fátima Portugal
event: Three peasant children claim to see the Virgin Mary above a Holm Oak tree in Cova da Iria near Fátima, Portugal.

title: Italy
event: May 23 – A month of civil violence in Milan, Italy ends after the Italian army forcefully takes over the city from anarchists and anti-war revolutionaries. Fifty people are killed and 800 people are arrested.

title: France
event: May 27 – World War I: Over 30,000 French troops refuse to go to the trenches in Missy-aux-Bois.

title: France
event: June 1 – A French infantry regiment seizes Missy-aux-Bois and declares an anti-war military government. Other French army troops soon apprehend them.

title: London
event: June 13 – World War I: The first major German bombing raid on London leaves 162 dead and 432 injured.

title: Aqaba
event: World War I: Arabian troops led by T. E. Lawrence capture Aqaba from the Turks.

title: Bisbee Arizona
event: July 12 – The Phelps Dodge Corporation deports over 1,000 suspected IWW members from Bisbee, Arizona.

title: Finland
event: July 16–July 18 – Serious clashes in St. Petersburg in July Days; Lenin escapes to Finland; Trotsky is arrested.

title: Russian Provisional Government
event: July 20 (July 7, O.S.) – Alexander Kerensky becomes premier of the Russian Provisional Government, replacing Prince Georgy Lvov.

title: Tennessee
event: July 28 – The ''Silent Protest'' is organized by the NAACP in New York to protest the East St. Louis Riot of July 2, as well as lynchings in Texas and Tennessee.

title: Oklahoma
event: August – The Green Corn Rebellion, an uprising by several hundred farmers against the World War I draft, takes place in central Oklahoma.

title: Orkney
event: August 2 – Squadron Commander E.H. Dunning [http://www.royal-navy.mod.uk/server/show/nav.3919 lands his aircraft on the ship] {{HMSFurious476}} in Scapa Flow, Orkney.  He is killed 5 days later during another landing on the ship.

title: Craiglockhart Hydropathic
event: August 17 – One of English literature's important meetings takes place when Wilfred Owen introduces himself to Siegfried Sassoon at the Craiglockhart War Hospital in Edinburgh.

title: Greece
event: August 18 – The  Great Thessaloniki Fire of 1917 in Greece destroys 32% of the city, leaving 70,000 individuals homeless.

title: First Battle of Passchendaele
event: October 12 – World War I: The biggest loss of life in a single day for New Zealand. Over 800 men and 45 officers were killed at the First Battle of Passchendaele, roughly 1 in 1000 of the nation's population at the time.

title: Dallas Love Field
event: October 19 – Love Field in Dallas, Texas is opened.

title: Brazil
event: October 26 – World War I: Brazil declares war against the Central Powers.

title: Passendale
event: World War I: Battle of Passchendaele: After 3 months of fierce fighting, Canadian forces take Passchendaele in Belgium.

title: United Kingdom
event: World War I – Third Battle of Gaza: United Kingdom forces capture Gaza from the Ottoman Empire.

title: Finland
event: Finland takes a step towards full sovereignty, ending the personal union with Russia.

title: Jaffa
event: British troops occupy Tel Aviv and Jaffa in Palestine.

title: France
event: Georges Clemenceau becomes prime minister of France.

title: United Kingdom
event: November 17 – The People's Dispensary for Sick Animals is founded in the United Kingdom.

title: Montreal
event: November 22 – In Montreal, Canada, the National Hockey Association breaks up.

title: Wisconsin
event: November 24 – In Milwaukee, Wisconsin, 9 members of the Milwaukee Police Department are killed by a bomb, the most fatal single event in U.S. police history until the September 11, 2001 attacks.

title: Tanzania
event: November 25  – World War I:German forces defeat Portuguese army of about 1200 at Negomano on the border of modern-day Mozambique and Tanzania.

title: Don Republic
event: November 29 – Don Cossacks declare the Don Republic, which lasts two weeks.

title: Quebec Bridge
event: December 3 – After nearly 20 years of planning and construction, the Quebec Bridge opens to traffic (the bridge partially collapsed on August 29, 1907 and September 11, 1916).

title: Finland
event: Finland declares independence from Russia.

title: Nova Scotia
event: Halifax Explosion: Two freighters collide in Halifax Harbour at Halifax, Nova Scotia and cause a huge explosion that kills at least 1,963 people, injures 9,000 and destroys part of the city (until Hiroshima, the biggest manmade explosion in recorded history).

title: New York City
event: December 25 – ''Why Marry?'', the first dramatic play to win a Pulitzer Prize, opens at the Astor Theatre in New York City.

title: Constantinople
event: November – The Allied fleet enters Constantinople.

title: Grand Duchy of Baden
event: The Grand Duchy of Baden ceases to exist.

title: Katla
event: Katla erupts in Iceland, from 12 October – 4 November

title: Finland
event: January 12 – Finland enacts a Mosaic Confessors law, granting Finnish Jews civil rights.

title: SS Tuscania (1914)
event: February 5 – The SS Tuscania (1914) is torpedoed off the Irish coast, it is the first ship carrying American troops to Europe to be torpedoed and sunk.

title: Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic
event: February 24 – After 7 centuries of foreign rule, Estonia declares its independence from the Russian Empire. Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia also declare their independence from the Russian Empire but as the Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic.

title: Finland
event: March 7 – World War I: Finland forms an alliance with Germany.

title: Bessarabia
event: March 27 – Bessarabia votes to become part of Romania.

title: Delaware
event: May 2 – General Motors acquires the Chevrolet Motor Company of Delaware.

title: Mountainous Republic of the Northern Caucasus
event: May 11 – The Mountainous Republic of the Northern Caucasus is officially established.

title: Philadelphia
event: The United States Post Office Department (later renamed the United States Postal Service) begins the first regular airmail service in the world (between New York City, Philadelphia and Washington, DC).

title: Codell Kansas
event: May 20 – The small town of Codell, Kansas is hit for the third year in a row by a tornado.  Coincidentally, all three tornadoes hit on May 20, 1916, 1917, and 1918 respectively.

title: Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic
event: May 26 – The Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic is abolished.  Georgia declares its independence as the Democratic Republic of Georgia.

title: Democratic Republic of Armenia
event: May 28 – Armenia and Azerbaijan declare their independence as the Democratic Republic of Armenia and the Azerbaijan Democratic Republic respectively.

title: Nashville Tennessee
event: July 9 – Great train wreck of 1918: In Nashville, Tennessee, an inbound local train collides with an outbound express, killing 101.

title: Honshu
event: July 12 – , The Japanese Imperial Navy battle ship ''Kawachi'' blows up at Shunan, western Honshu, Japan killing at least 621.

title: Ipatiev House
event: July 17 – By order of the Bolshevik Party and carried out by the Cheka, Emperor Nicholas II of Russia, his wife Alexandra Feodorovna, their children,  Olga, Tatiana,  Maria, Anastasia, and Alexei, and retainers are executed at the Ipatiev House in Ekaterinburg, Russia.

title: Ireland
event: July 17 – The ''RMS Carpathia'', a rescue ship for the ''RMS Titanic'', is sunk off the coast of Ireland by the German submarine ''U-55'', with three lives lost.

title: Battle of Amiens (1918)
event: August 8 – World War I – Battle of Amiens: Canadian and Australian troops, begin a string of almost continuous victories with a push through the German front lines. German General Erich Ludendorff later calls this the black day of the German Army.

title: France
event: October 8 – World War I: In the Argonne Forest in France, U.S. Corporal Alvin C. York almost single-handedly kills 25 German soldiers and captures 132.

title: Cloquet Minnesota
event: October 12 – Cloquet Fire: The city of Cloquet, Minnesota and nearby areas are destroyed in a fire, killing 453.

title: Juneau Alaska
event: October 25 – The steamer ''Princess Sophia'' sinks on Vanderbilt Reef near Juneau, Alaska; 353 people die in the greatest maritime disaster in the Pacific Northwest.

title: Kingdom of Hungary
event: October 31 – The Hungarian government terminates the personal union with Austria, officially dissolving the Austro-Hungarian empire.

title: Brooklyn
event: Malbone Street Wreck: The worst rapid transit accident in world history occurs under the intersection of Malbone Street and Flatbush Avenue, in Brooklyn, New York City, with at least 93 dead.

title: Italy
event: November 4 – World War I: Austria-Hungary surrenders to Italy.

title: Lublin
event: November 6 – A new Polish government is proclaimed in Lublin.

title: Cape Trafalgar
event: British battleship HMS ''Britannia'' is sunk by German submarine ''U-50'' off Trafalgar with the loss of around fifty lives, the last major naval engagement of World War I.

title: France
event: World War I ends: Germany signs an armistice agreement with the Allies between 5:12 AM and 5:20 AM in Marshal Foch’s railroad car in Compiègne Forest in France. It becomes official on the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month.

title: Latvia
event: November 18 – Latvia declares its independence from Russia.

title: Brussels
event: The Belgian royal family returns to Brussels after the war.

title: Podgorica
event: November 26 – The Podgorica Assembly votes for a union of the people, declaring its union with the Kingdom of Serbia.

title: Estonia
event: November 28 – Estonian Freedom War: Bolshevist Russia invades Estonia, beginning the war. A socialist republic is established in Narva the next day.

title: Bessarabia
event: The Union of Alba Iulia is proclaimed: Following the March 27 incorporation of Bessarabia and Bucovina, Transylvania unites with Romania.

title: Estonia
event: December 5 – The British light cruiser HMS ''Cassandra'' strikes a mine and sinks in the Gulf of Finland while aiding Estonia against the Bolsheviks, with eleven sailors killed.

title: House of Commons of the United Kingdom
event: December 28 – Constance Markiewicz, while detained in Holloway prison, becomes the first woman to be elected MP to the British House of Commons.  She did not take her seat, along with the other Sinn Féin TDs members.

title: United Kingdom
event: December 31 – A British-brokered ceasefire ends two weeks of fighting between Armenians and Georgians.

title: Estonia
event: Estonian Freedom War: The Red Army is expelled from the entire territory of Estonia.

title: Alberta
event: Earl W. Bascom, rodeo cowboy and artist, along with his father John W. Bascom at Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada, designs and makes rodeo's first reverse-opening side-delivery bucking chute, now the world standard.

title: North America
event: XWA (now CINW), in Montreal, Quebec, becomes the first public radio station in North America to go on the air.

title: France
event: The International Astronomical Union is founded in France.

title: Philippines
event: US President Woodrow Wilson promises eventual independence for Philippines, though subsequent Republican administrations see it as a distant goal.

title: Estonia
event: January 7 – Estonian Freedom War: The Soviet Army meets resistance from Estonian forces.

title: France
event: World War I: A peace conference opens in Versailles, France.

title: Mansion House Dublin
event: The First Dáil Éireann meets in the Mansion House in Dublin.

title: Khotyn
event: January 23 – The Uprising of Khotin breaks out in Khotyn, Ukraine.

title: Oregon
event: February 25 – Oregon places a one cent per gallon (0.26¢/liter) tax on gasoline, becoming the first U.S. state to levy a gasoline tax.

title: Korea
event: March 1 – The March 1st Movement against Japanese colonial rule in Korea is formed.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: March 3 – The Supreme Court of the United States upholds the conviction of Charles Schenck.

title: Hungarian Soviet Republic
event: March 21 – The Hungarian Soviet Republic is established by Béla Kun.

title: Italy
event: March 23 – In Milan, Italy, Benito Mussolini founds his Fascist political movement.

title: Ruhr
event: March 31 – A general strike begins in the Ruhr.

title: India
event: Amritsar Massacre: British and Gurkha troops massacre 379 Sikhs in the Punjab in India.

title: Estonia
event: April 23 – The Constituent Assembly of Estonia convenes its first session.

title: Parral Chihuahua
event: Pancho Villa takes Parral, Chihuahua, in Mexico, and executed by hanging both the mayor and his two sons.

title: Weimar Republic
event: Weimar Republic troops and the Freikorps occupy Munich and crush the Bavarian Soviet Republic.

title: India
event: Amanullah Khan attacks British government in India.

title: Trepassey
event: A U.S. Navy Curtiss aircraft (NC-4), commanded by Albert Cushing Read, departs from Trepassey, Newfoundland, bound for the Azores and thence to Lisbon, Portugal on the first transatlantic flight.

title: İzmir
event: The Hellenic Army lands at Smyrna carried by British ships.

title: Black Sea
event: May 19 – Mustafa Kemal Atatürk lands at Samsun on the Anatolian Black Sea coast, marking the start of the Turkish War of Independence. The anniversary of this event is also an official day of remembrance for Pontic Greeks.

title: University of California Los Angeles
event: May 23 – The University of California opens its second campus in Los Angeles. Initially called [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_Branch_of_the_University_of_California#Southern_Branch_of_the_University_of_California_.281919-1927.29 Southern Branch of the University of California] (SBUC), it is eventually renamed the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA).

title: Brazil
event: Einstein's theory of general relativity is tested/confirmed by Arthur Eddington's observation of a total solar eclipse in Principe, and by Andrew Crommelin in Sobral, Ceará, Brazil.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 30 – By agreement with the United Kingdom, later confirmed by the League of Nations, Belgium is given the mandate over part of German East Africa (Ruanda and Urundi).

title: Ireland
event: June 14 – Sir John William Alcock KBE DSC together with navigator Lieutenant Arthur Whitten Brown, piloted the first non-stop transatlantic flight from St. John's, Newfoundland to Clifden, Connemara, Ireland.

title: United Kingdom
event: June 17 – British Police Sergeant Thomas Green killed during the Epsom Riot by Canadian troops

title: Royal Canadian Mounted Police
event: Winnipeg General Strike: Royal Northwest Mounted Police fire a volley of bullets into a crowd of unemployed war veterans, killing two of them.

title: Scapa Flow
event: Admiral Ludwig von Reuter scuttles the German fleet in Scapa Flow, Scotland. Nine German sailors are killed.

title: Latvia
event: June 23 – Estonian Freedom War – Battle of Cēsis: The Estonian army wins in Northern Latvia against the German Landeswehr.

title: Damascus
event: July 2 – Syrian National Congress in Damascus. Arab nationalist announce independence.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: July 6 – The British dirigible ''R34'' lands in New York, completing the first crossing of the Atlantic by an airship.

title: North America
event: July 7 – The U.S. Army sends a convoy across the continental U.S., starting in Washington, D.C., to assess the possibility of crossing North America by road. This crossing took many months to complete, because the building of the U.S. Highway System had not even commenced.

title: Hungarian Soviet Republic
event: August 1 Béla Kun's Soviet Republic collapses in Hungary.

title: Wisconsin
event: The first NFL team for Wisconsin (the Green Bay Packers) is founded by Curly Lambeau.

title: Baltic Sea
event: August 18 – The Bolshevik fleet at Kronstadt, near Petrograd, Russia, on the Baltic Sea, is mostly destroyed by German warplanes and torpedo boats in a combined operation.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 19 – Afghanistan gains independence from the United Kingdom.

title: Texas
event: September 10 – September 15: The Florida Keys Hurricane kills 600 in the Gulf of Mexico, Florida and Texas.

title: Centralia Washington
event: November 11 – The Centralia Massacre in Centralia, Washington results in the deaths of four members of the American Legion, and the lynching of a local leader of the Industrial Workers of the World (IWW).

title: Coatbridge
event: December 25 – Cliftonhill Stadium in Coatbridge opens (the home of the Albion Rovers F.C.) They lose the match 2–0 to St. Mirren.

title: China
event: North China Famine (1920-1921)

title: New York
event: January 9 – Thousands of onlookers watch as The Human Fly George Polley climbs the New York Woolworth Building. He reaches the 30th floor before being arrested.

title: Howard University
event: Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated, is founded on the campus of Howard University in Washington, D.C.

title: Australia
event: January 22 – The Australian Country Party is officially formed, led by Nelson Pollard.

title: Estonia
event: Estonian War of Independence: The Tartu Peace Treaty is signed, ending the war and recognizing Estonian independence.

title: France
event: France occupies Memel.

title: Spitsbergen
event: February 9 – The League of Nations gives Spitsbergen to Norway.

title: Gori Georgia
event: February 20 – An earthquake hits Gori Georgia, killing 114.

title: Philippines
event: February 21 – The island province of Marinduque in the Philippines archipelago is founded.

title: Emeryville California
event: February 22 – In Emeryville, California, the first dog racing track to employ an imitation rabbit opens.

title: Baylor University
event: March 10 – The Baylor Business Men's Club changes its name to the Baylor University Chamber of Commerce.  It has operated under this name since the change.

title: Ireland
event: Irish War of Independence: The Black and Tans special constables arrive in Ireland.

title: Parliament of the United Kingdom
event: March 31 – The Government of Ireland Act 1920 is presented in the British Parliament.

title: Ruhr
event: April 2 – The German army marches to the Ruhr to fight the Ruhr Red Army.

title: Siberia
event: April 6 – The short-lived Far Eastern Republic is declared in eastern Siberia.

title: Guerrero
event: April 11 – Mexican Revolution: Álvaro Obregón flees from Mexico City during a trial intended to ruin his reputation; he flees to Guerrero where he joins Fortunato Maycotte.

title: Chilpancingo
event: Mexican Revolution: Álvaro Obregón announces in Chilpancingo that he intends to fight against the rule of Venustiano Carranza.

title: Indiana
event: May 2 – The first game of Negro National League baseball is played in Indianapolis, Indiana.

title: Ukrainian People's Republic
event: Polish–Soviet War: Polish troops occupy Kiev. The government of the Ukrainian People's Republic returns to the city.

title: St. Peter's Basilica
event: Joan of Arc is canonised. Over 30,000 people attend the ceremony in Rome, including 140 descendants of Joan of Arc's family. Pope Benedict XV presides over the rite, for which the interior of St. Peter's Basilica in Rome is richly decorated.

title: Switzerland
event: A referendum in Switzerland is favorable to joining the League of Nations.

title: London
event: The first flight of Dutch air company KLM, from Amsterdam to London, takes place.

title: Ganja Azerbaijan
event: May 26 – Anti-Soviet opposition in the Azerbaijan SSR launches an abortive revolt in Ganja.

title: Duchy of Schleswig
event: June 15 – A new border treaty between Germany and Denmark gives northern Schleswig to Denmark.

title: Greece
event: June 22 – Greece attacks Turkish troops.

title: Batumi
event: July 20 – The United Kingdom cedes its brief control of the key Black Sea port of Batum to the Democratic Republic of Georgia.

title: Arthur Meighen
event: July 23 – Arthur Meighen becomes Canada's ninth prime minister.

title: France
event: July 23 – Battle of Maysalun: The French defeat the Syrian army.

title: Damascus
event: July 24 – French troops occupy Damascus and depose Faisal I of Syria as king.

title: Sabinas Hidalgo Nuevo León
event: July 26 – Mexican Revolution: Pancho Villa takes over Sabina and contacts de la Huerta to offer his conditional surrender. He signs his surrender on July 28.

title: France
event: July 31 – France prohibits the sale or prescription of contraceptives.

title: Ireland
event: August 2 – Irish War of Independence: The British Parliament passes a bill to restore order in Ireland, suspending jury trials.

title: Belfast
event: August 3 – Irish War of Independence: Catholics riot in Belfast.

title: Latvia
event: August 11 – Bolshevik Russia recognizes independent Estonia and Latvia.

title: Ireland
event: August 15 – Irish War of Independence: The town hall of Templemore, Ireland, is burned down during the riots.

title: Michigan
event: August 20 – The first commercial radio station in the United States, 8MK (WWJ), begins operations in Detroit, Michigan. It is owned by the Detroit News, the first U.S. radio station owned by a newspaper.

title: New York City
event: September 16 – The Wall Street bombing: A bomb in a horse wagon explodes in front of the J. P. Morgan building in New York City, killing 38 and injuring 400.

title: Vilnius
event: October 9 – Polish troops take Vilnius.

title: Carinthian Plebiscite
event: October 10 – Carinthian Plebiscite: A large part of Carinthia Province votes to become part of Austria rather than Yugoslavia.

title: Minsk
event: October 12 – Polish–Soviet War: After the Polish army captures Tarnopol, Dubno, Minsk, and Dryssa, the ceasefire is enforced.

title: Switzerland
event: October 27 – The League of Nations moves its headquarters to Geneva, Switzerland.

title: Pennsylvania
event: In the United States, KDKA AM of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (owned by Westinghouse) starts broadcasting as a commercial radio station. The first broadcast is the results of the presidential election.

title: Westminster Abbey
event: November 11 – The Unknown Warrior is buried in Westminster Abbey.

title: Free City of Danzig
event: November 17 – The council of the League of Nations accepts the constitution for the Free City of Danzig.

title: Croke Park
event: November 21 – Bloody Sunday: British forces open fire on spectators and players during a football match in Dublin's Croke Park, killing 14 Irish civilians. This follows the assassinations of 12 British agents by the IRA in an earlier attack elsewhere.

title: Kilmichael County Cork
event: November 28 – Kilmichael Ambush: The Third Cork Brigade Flying Column under Tom Barry successfully ambushes 2 lorries of British soldiers at Kilmichael, County Cork,

title: Greece
event: December 5 – A referendum in Greece is favorable to the reinstatement of the monarchy.

title: Ireland
event: December 11 – Martial law is declared in Ireland.

title: Finland
event: Finland joins the League of Nations.

title: China
event: An 8.6 Richter scale Haiyuan earthquake causes a landslide in Gansu Province, China, killing 180,000.

title: France
event: December 23 – The United Kingdom and France ratify the border between French-held Syria and British-held Palestine.

title: Oceanside California
event: December 25 – The Rosicrucian Fellowship's spiritual healing temple ''The Ecclesia'' is founded at Mount Ecclesia, Oceanside, California.

title: Italy
event: Regular radio broadcasting services begin in Italy.

title: Weimar Republic
event: Weimar Republic makes its first payment of reparations.

title: China
event: North China Famine (1920-1921)

title: Rose Bowl Game
event: January 1 – In American football, the University of California defeats Ohio State 28–0 in the Rose Bowl.

title: Brazil
event: The football club Cruzeiro Esporte Clube from Belo Horizonte is founded as Palestra Italia in Brazil.

title: Golden Gate Park
event: The DeYoung Museum opens in Golden Gate Park, San Francisco.

title: English Channel
event: January 20 – The British K class submarine HMS ''K5'' sinks in the English Channel with the loss of all 56 hands on board.

title: Iran
event: February 21 – Rezā Khan and Seyyed Zia'eddin Tabatabaee stage a coup d'état in Iran.

title: Tbilisi
event: February 25 – The Red Army enters Georgian capital Tbilisi and installs a Moscow-directed communist government.

title: Vienna
event: February 27 – The International Working Union of Socialist Parties is formed in Vienna.

title: Madrid
event: Spanish Premier Eduardo Dato Iradier is assassinated while exiting the parliament building in Madrid.

title: Düsseldorf
event: Allied forces occupy Düsseldorf, Ruhrort and Duisburg.

title: China
event: March 13 – The Russian White Army captures Mongolia from China.  Roman Ungern von Sternberg declares himself ruler.

title: Charlottenburg
event: March 14 – Armenian Soghomon Tehlirian assassinates Mehmed Talaat, former Interior Minister of Turkey, in Charlottenburg, Berlin.

title: Finland
event: The Red Army crushes the Kronstadt rebellion, and a number of sailors flee to Finland.

title: London
event: Marie Stopes opens the first birth control clinic in London, England.

title: Broadway theatre
event: April 20 – Ferenc Molnár's play ''Liliom'' is first produced on Broadway in English.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 3 – The province of Northern Ireland is created within the United Kingdom

title: Alexandria
event: May 14 – May 17 – Violent anti-European riots occur in Cairo and Alexandria.

title: Italy
event: July 4 – A new conservative government is formed in Italy by Ivanoe Bonomi.

title: Albania
event: July 17 – The Republic of Mirdita is proclaimed near the Albanian-Serbian border with Yugoslav support.

title: Battle of Annual
event: July 21 – Rif War – Battle of Annual: Spanish troops are dealt a crushing defeat at the hands of Muhammad Ibn 'Abd al-Karim al-Khattabi.

title: University of Toronto
event: July 27 – Researchers at the University of Toronto led by biochemist Frederick Banting announce the discovery of the hormone insulin.

title: Pittsburgh
event: August 5 – The first radio baseball game is broadcast; Harold Arlin announces the Pirates-Phillies game from Forbes Field over Westinghouse KDKA, in Pittsburgh.

title: Baghdad
event: August 23 – King Faisal I of Iraq is crowned in Baghdad.

title: Kingston upon Hull
event: August 24 – R38 class airship ZR-2 explodes on her fourth test flight near Kingston upon Hull, England, killing 44 of the 49 Anglo-American crew onboard.The Outlookvolume=129pages=14–15location=New Yorkurl=http://books.google.com/?id=sVroBrOJL64C&pg=PA14accessdate=2009-07-30}}<

title: Atlantic City New Jersey
event: September 7 – In Atlantic City, New Jersey, the first Miss America Pageant is held.

title: Finland
event: September 12 – The Lotta Svärd women's paramilitary auxiliary is founded in Finland.

title: BASF
event: September 21 – The Oppau explosion occurs at BASF's nitrate factory in Oppau, Germany; 500—600 are killed.

title: Lisbon
event: October 19 – A massacre in Lisbon claims the lives of Portuguese Prime-Minister António Granjo and other politicians.

title: Harvard University
event: Centre College's football team, led by quarterback Bo McMillin, defeats Harvard University 6–0 to break Harvard's five-year winning streak. For decades afterward, this is called football's upset of the century.

title: Reykjavík
event: Riots in Reykjavík injure most of the small police force.

title: Italy
event: The Partito Nazionale Fascista (PNF), National Fascist Party, is founded in Italy.

title: Tomb of the Unknowns
event: November 11 – During an Armistice Day ceremony at Arlington National Cemetery, the Tomb of the Unknowns is dedicated by U.S. President Warren G. Harding.

title: Vienna
event: December 1 – Rising prices cause riots in Vienna.

title: London
event: The Anglo-Irish Treaty establishing the Irish Free State, an independent nation incorporating 26 of Ireland's 32 counties, is signed in London.

title: France
event: December 13 – In the Four Power Treaty on Insular Possessions, Japan, the United States, United Kingdom, and France agree to recognize the status quo in the Pacific.

title: India
event: December 23 – Visva-Bharati University is inaugurated in India.

title: Alberta
event: Earl W. Bascom, rodeo cowboy and artist, designs and makes rodeo's first hornless bronc saddle at Lethbridge, Alberta Canada.

title: China
event: Japan signs a naval arms limitation treaty with the Western powers and returns some of its control over the Shandong Peninsula to China.

title: Weimar Republic
event: Wracked by rapid inflation and political assassinations and motivated by hostility and arrogance as well, the Weimar Republic announces its inability to pay more and proposes a moratorium on reparations for 3 years.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 13 – The flu epidemic has claimed 804 victims in Britain.

title: Libya
event: January 26 – Italian forces occupy Misurata in Libya. The reconquest of Libya begins.

title: William Desmond Taylor
event: February 1 – American actor William Desmond Taylor is murdered.

title: Italy
event: Five Power Naval Disarmament Treaty signed between United States, Britain, Japan, France, and Italy

title: White House
event: President of the United States Warren G. Harding introduces the first radio in the White House.

title: Finland
event: February 14 – Finnish Minister of the Interior Heikki Ritavuori is assassinated by Ernst Tandefelt.

title: Great Britain
event: February 22 – Following intense nationalist agitation after World War I, Great Britain proclaims Egypt formally independent but continues to occupy the country militarily and control its politics.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: February 27 –  A challenge to the Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution, allowing women the right to vote, is rebuffed by the Supreme Court of the United States.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 28 – The United Kingdom ends its protectorate over Egypt through a Unilateral Declaration of Independence.

title: India
event: March 13 – Prince of Wales Edward inaugurates the ''Prince of Wales Royal Indian Military College'' in Dehradun, India, marking a capitulation of the British Empire to growing pressure for the Indianization of the Officer Cadre of the British Indian Army.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 15 – Egypt having gained nominal independence from the United Kingdom, Fuad I becomes King of Egypt.

title: India
event: March 18 – In India, Mohandas Gandhi is sentenced to 6 years in prison for sedition (he serves only 2 years).

title: USS Langley (CV-1)
event: March 20 – The USS ''Langley'' is commissioned as the first United States Navy aircraft carrier.

title: Australia
event: March 23 – Queensland, Australia abolishes the Legislative Council (Upper House).

title: Wyoming
event: Teapot Dome scandal: The United States Secretary of the Interior leases Teapot Dome oil reserves in Wyoming.

title: France
event: The first midair collision occurs, between a Daimler Airway de Havilland DH.18 and a Compagnie des Grands Express Aériens Farman Goliath over Poix-de-Picardie, Amiens, France.

title: Massachusetts
event: April 13 – The State of Massachusetts opens all public offices to women.

title: Korea
event: April 15 – The United Kingdom's Prince of Wales visits the Japanese paramilitary youth group ''Seinendan'' in annexed Korea.

title: Weimar Republic
event: April 16 – The Treaty of Rapallo marks a rapprochement between the Weimar Republic and Bolshevik Russia.

title: Yankee Stadium (1923)
event: May 5 – In The Bronx, construction begins on Yankee Stadium.

title: KGU
event: May 11 – Radio station KGU begins broadcasting in Hawaii.

title: Blackstone Virginia
event: May 12 – A 20-ton meteorite lands near Blackstone, Virginia, USA.

title: Pablo Picasso
event: May 18 – Sergei Diaghilev, James Joyce, Pablo Picasso, Marcel Proust and Igor Stravinsky dine together in Paris, at the Majestic hotel, their only joint meeting.

title: Weimar Republic
event: June 24 – Weimar Republic foreign minister Walter Rathenau is assassinated; the murderers are captured July 17.

title: Monaco
event: June 26 – Louis Honoré Charles Antoine Grimaldi becomes Reigning Prince Louis II of Monaco.

title: Hollywood Bowl
event: July 11 – The Hollywood Bowl opens.

title: China
event: August 2 – A typhoon hits Shantou, China, killing more than 50,000 people.

title: Siberia
event: August 28 – Japan agrees to withdraw its troops from Siberia.

title: İzmir
event: September 9 – Turkish forces pursuing withdrawing Greek troops enter İzmir.

title: Gdynia
event: The Gdynia Seaport Construction Act is passed by the Polish Parliament.

title: Munich Kammerspiele
event: September 29 – ''Drums in the Night'' (''Trommeln in der Nacht'') becomes the first play by Bertolt Brecht to be staged, at the Munich Kammerspiele.

title: France
event: October 1 – G.I. Gurdjieff opens his Institute for the Harmonious Development of Man at Fontainebleau in France.

title: London
event: October 9 – Sir William Horwood, London Metropolitan Police Service commissioner, is poisoned by arsenic-filled chocolates.

title: Italy
event: In Italy, with the March on Rome, Fascism obtains power and Benito Mussolini becomes prime minister.

title: Italy
event: October 30 – Benito Mussolini becomes the youngest Premier in the history of Italy.

title: United Kingdom
event: A broadcasting licence fee of 10 shillings is introduced in the United Kingdom.

title: Valley of the Kings
event: November 4 – In Egypt, British archaeologist Howard Carter and his men find the entrance to Pharaoh Tutankhamun's tomb in the Valley of the Kings.

title: 2LO
event: November 14 – The British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) begins radio service in the United Kingdom. 2LO becomes the first radio station in the United Kingdom.

title: Italy
event: November 17 – Former Ottoman sultan Mehmed VI leaves for exile in Italy.

title: Georgia (U.S. state)
event: November 21 – Rebecca Felton of Georgia takes the oath of office, becoming the first woman United States Senator.

title: Irish Free State
event: November 24 – Popular author and Irish Republican Army member Robert Erskine Childers is executed by an Irish Free State firing squad for illegally carrying a revolver.

title: KV62
event: November 26 – Howard Carter and Lord Carnarvon become the first people to enter the tomb of Pharaoh Tutankhamun in over 3,000 years.

title: Irish Free State
event: December 6 – The Irish Free State officially comes into existence. George V becomes the Free State's monarch. Tim Healy is appointed first Governor-General of the Irish Free State and W. T. Cosgrave becomes President of the Executive Council.

title: Pablo Picasso
event: March – ''Antigone'' by Jean Cocteau appears on a Paris stage (settings by Pablo Picasso, music by Arthur Honegger, and costumes by Gabrielle Chanel).  Antonin Artaud plays the part of Tiresias.

title: Interpol
event: At the International Police Conference in Vienna, the International Criminal Police (Interpol) is set up.

title: Australia
event: Police strike in Australia.

title: China
event: Struggling for a foothold in southern China, Sun Yatsen decides to ally his Nationalist party or Guomindang (Kuomintang) with the Communist Third International and Chinese Communist Party.

title: United Kingdom
event: Grouping Act: All British railway companies are grouped into 4 larger companies.

title: France
event: January 11 – Despite strong British protests, troops from France and Belgium occupy the Ruhr area to force Germany to pay its reparation payments.

title: Greece
event: Greece adopts the Gregorian calendar.

title: Kandersteg International Scout Centre
event: April 12 – The ''Kandersteg International Scout Centre'' comes into existence.

title: Yankee Stadium (1923)
event: April 18 – Yankee Stadium (1923) opens its doors in the Bronx, NY

title: Westminster Abbey
event: April 26 – Prince Albert marries Lady Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon in Westminster Abbey.

title: Gdynia
event: April 29 – The Gdynia seaport is inaugurated.

title: Michigan
event: Southeastern Michigan receives a record 6 inches of snow after temperatures plummeted from 62 to 34 degrees between 1 and 6 pm on the previous day.

title: Residenz Theatre
event: The premiere of Bertolt Brecht's play ''In the Jungle (Im Dickicht)'' at the Residenztheater in Munich is interrupted by Nazi demonstrators.

title: China
event: June 13 – China President Li abandons his residence because a warlord has commanded forces to surround the mansion and cut off its water and electric supplies, in order to force him to abandon his post.

title: Siberia
event: June 16 – The storming of Ayan in Siberia concludes the Yakut Revolt and the Russian Civil War.

title: Italy
event: June 18 – Mount Etna erupts in Italy, making 60,000 homeless.

title: Greece
event: July 24 – The Treaty of Lausanne, settling the boundaries of modern Turkey, is signed in Switzerland by Greece, Bulgaria and other countries that fought in the First World War.

title: Weimar Republic
event: August 13 – Gustav Stresemann is named Chancellor of Germany and founds a coalition government for the Weimar Republic.

title: Yokohama
event: September 1 – The Great Kantō earthquake devastates Tokyo and Yokohama, killing  an estimated 142,807 people, but according to a Japanese construction research center report in 2005, 105,000 are confirmed dead.

title: Lakehurst New Jersey
event: September 4 – In Lakehurst, New Jersey, the first American airship, the USS ''Shenandoah'', takes to the sky for the first time.

title: Corfu
event: September 6 – The Italian navy occupies Corfu in retaliation for the murder of an Italian officer. The League of Nations protests and they leave on September 29.

title: California
event: September 8 – Honda Point Disaster: Seven U.S. Navy destroyers run aground off the California coast.

title: Ireland
event: September 10 – Ireland joins the League of Nations.

title: Berkeley California
event: September 17 – A major fire in Berkeley, California erupts, consuming some 640 structures, including 584 homes in the densely built neighborhoods north of the campus of the University of California.

title: Hispaniola
event: September 24 – Second hurricane of the season, a major hurricane north of Hispaniola.

title: Istanbul
event: October 6 – The great powers of World War I withdraw from Istanbul.

title: Istanbul
event: October 13 – Ankara replaces Istanbul as the capital of Turkey.

title: Oaxaca
event: October 13 – The third hurricane of the season, the first recorded example of a storm crossing from the Eastern Pacific basin into the Atlantic basin, occurred in Oaxaca.

title: Gulf of Mexico
event: October 16 – The sixth tropical storm developed in the Gulf of Mexico.  It was a rare occurrence, it consisted of four active tropical storms simultaneously.

title: Finland
event: November 1 – The Finnish flag carrier Finnair airline is started in Aero Oy.

title: Beer Hall Putsch
event: November 8 – Beer Hall Putsch: In Munich, Adolf Hitler leads the Nazis in an unsuccessful attempt to overthrow the German government; police and troops crush the attempt the next day.

title: London
event: November 12 – Her Highness Princess Maud of Fife marries Captain Charles Alexander Carnegie in Wellington Barracks, London.

title: Italy
event: December 12 – In Italy, the Po River dam bursts, killing 600.

title: Tokyo
event: December 27 – The crown prince of Japan survives an assassination attempt in Tokyo.

title: Alberta
event: Earl W. Bascom, rodeo cowboy and artist, designs and makes rodeo's first one-hand bareback rigging at Stirling, Alberta Canada.

title: New York
event: Alice Vanderbilt Morris, a wealthy heiress, founds the International Auxiliary Language Association in New York

title: New York City
event: The Earth Inductor Compass is invented in New York City.

title: English Channel
event: January 10 – The British submarine ''L-34'' sinks in the English Channel; 43 are killed.

title: France
event: January 25 – The 1924 Winter Olympics open in Chamonix, France (in the French Alps).

title: Red Square
event: January 27 – Lenin is buried in a mausoleum (Lenin's tomb) in Moscow's Red Square.

title: Beer Hall Putsch
event: Adolf Hitler is sentenced to 5 years in jail for his participation in the Beer Hall Putsch (he serves only 8 months).

title: Italy
event: April 6 – Fascists win the elections in Italy with  a ⅔ majority.

title: Greece
event: April 13 – A referendum in Greece favors the formation of the Hellenic Republic.

title: Greece
event: April 13 – The ''A.E.K.'' is founded in Greece.

title: War Office
event: April 26 – Harry Grindell Matthews demonstrates his death ray in London but fails to convince the British War Office.

title: Omaha Nebraska
event: May 3 – The Aleph Zadik Aleph, the oldest Jewish youth fraternity, is founded in Omaha, Nebraska.

title: Federal Bureau of Investigation
event: May 10 – J. Edgar Hoover is appointed head of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: University of Chicago
event: May 21 – University of Chicago students Richard Loeb and Nathan Leopold, Jr. murder 14-year-old Bobby Franks in a thrill killing.

title: London
event: June 1 – Harry Grindell Matthews returns from Paris to London; he tries to use a ''Pathé'' film to demonstrate that his death ray works.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: June 5 – Ernst Alexanderson sends the first facsimile across the Atlantic Ocean (to his father in Sweden).

title: Italy
event: June 10 – Fascists kidnap and kill Italian socialist leader Giacomo Matteotti in Rome.

title: China
event: June 16 – Whampoa Military Academy is founded in China.

title: Tasmania
event: July 17 – Voting in federal elections becomes compulsory in Australia, after a private member's bill proposed by Tasmanian Nationalist senator Herbert Payne results in the passing of the Commonwealth Electoral (Compulsory Voting) Act 1924.

title: Hawaii
event: The Hanapepe Massacre occurs on Kauai, Hawaii.

title: India
event: September 9–September 11 – The Kohat riots break out in India.

title: Lakehurst New Jersey
event: October 12–October 15 – Zeppelin LZ-126 makes a transatlantic delivery flight from Friedrichshafen, Germany, to Lakehurst, New Jersey.

title: India
event: October 25 – British authorities in India arrest Subhas Chandra Bose and jail him for the next 2½ years.

title: Wyoming
event: Nellie Tayloe Ross of Wyoming is elected as the first woman governor in the United States.

title: William Randolph Hearst
event: November 19 – In Los Angeles, California, famous silent film director Thomas Ince (The Father of the Western) dies, reportedly of a heart attack, in his bed (rumors soon surface that he was shot dead by publishing tycoon William Randolph Hearst).

title: New York City
event: November 27 – In New York City the first Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade is held.

title: Estonia
event: A communist coup attempt fails in Estonia.

title: Croydon Airport
event: An air crash at Croydon Air Field in London kills 8.

title: Albania
event: Albania becomes a republic.

title: Queensland
event: The Australian state of Queensland introduces a 44-hour working week.

title: London
event: New York City becomes the largest city in the world, taking the lead from London.About.comauthor=[http://geography.about.com/mbiopage.htm Matt Rosenberg]url=http://geography.about.com/library/weekly/aa011201a.htm}}<{{Verify credibilitydate=November 2008}}

title: London
event: London's first enclosed double-decker buses are introduced.

title: Tokyo
event: The Shueisha Publishing Company is founded in Tokyo.

title: Italy
event: January 3 – Benito Mussolini (''Il Duce'') announces he is taking dictatorial powers over Italy.

title: Alaska Territory
event: January 27–February 1 – The 1925 serum run to Nome (the Great Race of Mercy) relays diphtheria antitoxin by dog sled across the U.S. territory of Alaska, to combat an epidemic.

title: North America
event: February 2 – The 1925 Charlevoix-Kamouraska earthquake strikes northeastern North America.

title: Conway Arkansas
event: March 15 – The Phi Lambda Chi fraternity (original name The Aztecs) is founded on the campus of Arkansas State Teacher's College in Conway, Arkansas (now the University of Central Arkansas).

title: Griffin Indiana
event: March 18 – The Tri-State Tornado rampages through Missouri, Illinois, and Indiana, killing 695 people and injuring 2,027. It hits the towns of Murphysboro, Illinois; Gorham, Illinois; Ellington, Missouri; and Griffin, Indiana.

title: Tennessee
event: March 21 – Tennessee Governor Austin Peay signs the Butler Act, prohibiting the teaching of evolution in the state's public schools.

title: WOWO
event: March 31 – Radio station ''WOWO'' in Ft. Wayne, Indiana begins broadcasting.

title: Australia
event: April 3 – United Kingdom, South Africa and Australia return to the (bullion) gold standard.

title: Dayton Tennessee
event: May 5 – Scopes Trial: Dayton, Tennessee, biology teacher John Scopes is arrested for teaching Charles Darwin's Theory of Evolution.

title: Tom Lee Park
event: May 8 – Tom Lee rescues 32 people from the ''M.E. Norman'', a sinking steamboat.

title: Scopes Trial
event: May 25 – Scopes Trial: John T. Scopes is indicted for teaching Darwin's theory of evolution.

title: Aristotle University of Thessaloniki
event: June 14 – The Aristotle University of Thessaloniki in Greece is founded.

title: Tennessee
event: July 10 – Scopes Trial: In Dayton, Tennessee, the so-called Monkey Trial begins with John T. Scopes, a young high school science teacher, accused of teaching evolution in violation of a Tennessee state law.

title: Dayton Tennessee
event: July 21 – Scopes Trial: In Dayton, Tennessee, high school biology teacher John T. Scopes is found guilty of teaching evolution in class and fined $100.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: September 3 – The U.S. dirigible ''Shenandoah'' breaks up en route to Scottfield, St. Louis; 14 crewmen are killed.

title: Portugal
event: October – The major money forgery and fraud of Alves Reis is exposed in Portugal.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 30 – John Logie Baird creates Britain's first television transmitter.

title: Grand Ole Opry
event: November 28 – The country-variety show ''Grand Ole Opry'' makes its radio debut on station WSM (it later becomes the longest-running live music show).

title: Lafayette College
event: Alpha Phi Omega, a National service fraternity, is founded at Lafayette College.

title: Great Sphinx of Giza
event: December 26 – The Great Sphinx of Giza is unearthed after restoration.

title: Alberta
event: Earl W. Bascom, rodeo cowboy and artist, designs and makes rodeo's first high-cut rodeo chaps at Stirling, Alberta Canada.

title: London
event: The International African Institute is founded in London.

title: Nicaragua
event: U.S. Marines intervene in Nicaragua to bolster the conservative government.

title: Rhine
event: Flooding in the Rhine River strikes Cologne.

title: Greece
event: January 3 – Theodoros Pangalos declares himself dictator in Greece.

title: Hejaz
event: January 8 – Abdul-Aziz ibn Saud is crowned King of Hejaz.

title: Harlem
event: January 12 – Freeman Gosden and Charles Correll premiere their radio program ''Sam 'n' Henry'', in which the two white performers portrayed two black characters from Harlem looking to strike it rich in the big city. It is a precursor to Gosden and Correll's more popular later program, ''Amos 'n' Andy''.

title: New York City
event: February 1 – Land on Broadway and Wall Street in New York City is sold at a record $7 per sq inch.

title: London
event: February 9 – Flooding hits London suburbs.

title: Ireland
event: February 12 – The Irish minister for Justice, Kevin O'Higgins, appoints the Committee on Evil Literature.

title: Francisco Franco
event: February 25 – Francisco Franco becomes General of Spain.

title: Ireland
event: March 23 – Eamon de Valera organizes Fianna Fáil in Ireland.

title: Greece
event: April 4 – Greek dictator Theodoros Pangalos is elected president.

title: Iowa
event: April 12 – By a vote of 45–41, the United States Senate unseats Iowa Senator Smith W. Brookhart and seats Daniel F. Steck, after Brookhart had already served for over one year.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 21 – Queen Elizabeth II is born in Mayfair, United Kingdom.

title: Damascus
event: The French navy bombards Damascus because of the Druze riots.

title: North Pole
event: Admiral Richard E. Byrd and Floyd Bennett claim to have flown over the North Pole (later discovery of his diary seems to indicate that this did not happen).

title: North Pole
event: Roald Amundsen flies over the North Pole.

title: United Kingdom
event: UK General Strike 1926: In the United Kingdom, a general strike by trade unions ends (the strike began on May 3).

title: Estado Novo (Portugal)
event: May 28 – The 1926 coup d'état commanded by Manuel Gomes da Costa in Portugal installs the Ditadura Nacional (National Dictatorship), followed by António de Oliveira Salazar's Estado Novo.

title: Grand Ole Opry
event: June 19 – DeFord Bailey is the first African-American to perform on Nashville's Grand Ole Opry.

title: Arthur Meighen
event: June 29 – Arthur Meighen returns to office as Prime Minister of Canada.

title: Portugal
event: July 9 – General Antonio Carmona takes power in a military coup in Portugal.

title: Dover New Jersey
event: July 12 – A lightning strike destroys an ammunition depot in Dover, New Jersey.

title: English Channel
event: Gertrude Ederle becomes the first woman to swim the English Channel from France to England.

title: New York
event: In New York, the Warner Brothers' Vitaphone system premieres with the movie ''Don Juan'' starring John Barrymore.

title: Greece
event: August 22 – In Greece, Georgios Kondylis ousts Theodoros Pangalos.

title: Weimar Republic
event: September 8 – Weimar Republic joins the League of Nations.

title: New York City
event: September 16 – Philip Dunning and George Abbott's play ''Broadway'' premieres in New York City.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 19 – The 1926 Imperial Conference opens in London, the United Kingdom.

title: London
event: The Fazal Mosque (one of the first in London) is completed.

title: French Riviera
event: The village of Rocquebillier in the French Riviera is almost destroyed in a massive hailstorm.

title: Italy
event: November 25 – The death penalty is re-established in Italy.

title: University of Copenhagen
event: February – Werner Heisenberg formulates his famous uncertainty principle while employed as a lecturer at Niels Bohr's Institute for Theoretical Physics at the University of Copenhagen.

title: China
event: September – Autumn Harvest Uprising in China.

title: London
event: January 7 – The first transatlantic telephone call is made from New York City to London.

title: Portugal
event: January 9 – A military rebellion is crushed in Lisbon, Portugal.

title: China
event: January 19 – Britain sends troops to China.

title: Burgenland
event: January 30 – Right-wing veterans and the ''Republican Schutzbund'' clash in Schattendorf, Burgenland, Austria. One man and a child are killed by gunshots (see July 15).

title: Shanghai
event: February 12 – The first British troops land in Shanghai.

title: Yugoslavia
event: February 14 – An earthquake in Yugoslavia kills 100.

title: Shanghai
event: February 19 – A general strike in Shanghai protests the presence of British troops.

title: South Africa
event: March 4 – A diamond rush in South Africa includes trained athletes that have been hired by major companies to stake claims.

title: Honshu
event: March 7 – A Richter Scale 7.6 magnitude earthquake kills at least 2,925 at Toyooka and Mineyama area, western Honshu, Japan.

title: Albania
event: March 10 – Albania mobilizes in case of an attack by Yugoslavia.

title: New York City
event: In New York City, the ''Roxy Theater'' is opened by Samuel Roxy Rothafel.

title: Irish Free State
event: The Royal and Parliamentary Titles Act 1927 renames the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland to the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland. The change acknowledges that the Irish Free State is no longer part of the Kingdom.

title: Shanghai
event: Kuomintang troops kill number of communist-supporting workers in Shanghai. The incident is called the April 12 Incident, or Shanghai Massacre. The 1st United Front between the Nationalists and Communist ends, and the Civil War lasting until 1949 begins.

title: Wembley Stadium (1923)
event: April 23 – Cardiff City wins the FA Cup after beating Arsenal 1–0 at Wembley Stadium.

title: Fernando de Noronha
event: João Ribeiro de Barros becomes the first non-European to make a trans-Atlantic flight, from Genoa to Fernando de Noronha.

title: Nicaragua
event: May 7 – Civil war ends in Nicaragua.

title: Canberra
event: May 9 – The Australian Parliament first convenes in Canberra.

title: Michigan
event: May 18 – Bath School disaster: Bombings result in 45 deaths, mostly children, in Bath Township, Michigan.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 20 – Saudi Arabia becomes independent of the United Kingdom (Treaty of Jedda).

title: New York
event: May 20–May 21 – Charles Lindbergh makes the first solo non-stop trans-Atlantic flight, from New York to Paris in the single-seat, single-engine monoplane Spirit of St. Louis.

title: Xining
event: May 22 – An 8.6 magnitude earthquake in Xining, China kills 200,000.

title: Albania
event: June 4 – Yugoslavia severs diplomatic relations with Albania.

title: Warsaw
event: June 7 – Peter Voikov, Soviet ambassador to Warsaw, is assassinated.

title: France
event: Leon Daudet, leader of the French monarchists, is arrested in France.

title: New York City
event: A ticker-tape parade is held for  aviator Charles Lindbergh down 5th Avenue in New York City.

title: Irish Free State
event: July 10 – Kevin O'Higgins, vice president of the Irish Free State, is assassinated in Dublin.

title: Salt Jordan
event: July 11 – An earthquake strikes Palestine, killing around 300. The effects are especially severe in Nablus, but damage and fatalities are also reported in many areas of Palestine and Trans-Jordan such as Amman, Salt and Lydda.

title: Fort Erie Ontario
event: August 7 – The Peace Bridge opens between Fort Erie, Ontario and Buffalo, New York.

title: Hyde Park London
event: August 22 – In Hyde Park, London, 200 people demonstrate against the sentence of Italian immigrant anarchists Sacco and Vanzetti.

title: Brazil
event: August 26 – Paul R. Redfern leaves Brunswick, Georgia, flying his Stinson Detroiter Port of Brunswick to attempt a solo non-stop flight to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. He later crashes in the Venezuela jungle (the crash site is never located).

title: Brazil
event: September 7 – The University of Minas Gerais is founded in Brazil.

title: Veracruz Veracruz
event: October 9 – The Mexican government crushes a rebellion in Vera Cruz.

title: Brazil
event: October 27 – The Italian steamer ship ''Principessa Mafalda'' capsizes off Porto Seguro, Brazil; at least 314 are killed.

title: Vermont
event: November 3–November 4 – Floods devastating Vermont incur the worst natural disaster in the state's history.

title: Canton Ohio
event: November 10 – Unexplained explosions occur in Canton, Ohio.

title: New York City
event: The Holland Tunnel opens to traffic as the first Hudson River vehicular tunnel linking New Jersey to New York City.

title: Pennsylvania
event: November 14 – The Pittsburgh Gasometer Explosion: Three ''Equitable Gas'' storage tanks in the North Side of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania explode, killing 26 people and causing damage estimated between contemporary totals of $4 million and $5 million.

title: Oregon
event: December 15 – Marion Parker, 12, is kidnapped in Los Angeles. Her dismembered body is found on December 19, prompting the largest manhunt to date on the West Coast for her killer, William Edward Hickman, who is arrested on December 22 in Oregon.

title: Broadway theatre
event: December 27 – Kern and Hammerstein's musical play ''Show Boat'', based on Edna Ferber's novel, opens on Broadway and goes on to become the first great classic of the American musical theatre.

title: Tokyo
event: December 30 –  The first Japanese metro line, the Ginza Line in Tokyo, opens.

title: China
event: Drought leading to famine in China.

title: New York City
event: W2XBS, RCA's first television station, is established in New York City.

title: Estonia
event: January 1 – Estonia changes its currency from the mark to the kroon.

title: Tower of London
event: January 7 – The moat at the Tower of London, previously drained in 1843 (and planted with grass), is completely refilled by a tidal wave.

title: Ossining (town) New York
event: January 12 – U.S. murderer Ruth Snyder is executed at Ossining.

title: Switzerland
event: February 11 – The II Olympic Winter Games open in St. Moritz, Switzerland.

title: Malta
event: March 12 – Malta becomes a British dominion.

title: Los Angeles
event: March 12 – In California, the St. Francis Dam north of Los Angeles fails, killing 600.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: March 21 – Charles Lindbergh is presented the Medal of Honor for his first trans-Atlantic flight.

title: Republic of China
event: March 26 – The China Academy of Art is founded in Hangzhou, Republic of China (first named the National Academy of Art).

title: Greenly Island Canada
event: April 12–April 14 – The first ever east–west transatlantic aeroplane flight takes place from Dublin, Ireland, to Greenly Island, Canada, using German Junkers W33 ''Bremen''.

title: Plovdiv
event: April 14 – Two earthquakes in Chirpan and Plovdiv destroy more than 21000 buildings in Bulgaria and kill almost 130 persons.

title: China
event: May 3 – Jinan Incident, an armed conflict between the Japanese Imperial Army allied with Northern Chinese warlords against the Kuomintang's southern army, occurs in Jinan, China.

title: WGY (AM)
event: May 10 – The first regular schedule of television programming begins in Schenectady, New York by the General Electric's television station W2XB (the station is popularly known as WGY Television, after its sister radio station WGY).

title: Los Angeles
event: The animated short ''Plane Crazy'' is released by Disney Studios in Los Angeles, featuring the first appearances of Mickey and Minnie Mouse.

title: Buenos Aires
event: May 23 – A bomb attack against the Italian consulate in Buenos Aires kills 22 and injures 43.

title: North Pole
event: May 24 – The airship ''Italia'' crashes on the North Pole; one of the occupants is Italian general Umberto Nobile.

title: Huanggutun Incident
event: June 4 – Huanggutun Incident: Zhang Zuolin, President of the Republic of China and warlord, is killed by Japanese agents.

title: Vienna
event: June 11 – A medical doctors' strike begins in Vienna.

title: Argentina
event: June 14 – Students take over the medical wing of Rosario University in Argentina.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: June 17 – Aviator Amelia Earhart starts her attempt to become the first woman to successfully cross the Atlantic Ocean (she succeeds the next day). Wilmer Stultz was the pilot.

title: Yugoslavia
event: June 20 – Puniša Račić shoots 3 opposition representatives in the Yugoslavian Parliament, and injures 3 others.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Representation of the People Act 1928 becomes law, extending the right to vote to all women in the United Kingdom.

title: Potter Nebraska
event: July 6 – The world's largest hailstone falls in Potter, Nebraska.

title: New York City
event: July 12 – Mexican aviator Emilio Carranza dies in a solo plane crash in the New Jersey Pine Barrens, while returning from a goodwill flight to New York City.

title: China
event: July 25 – The United States recalls its troops from China.

title: Italy
event: August 2 – Italy and Ethiopia sign the Italo-Ethiopian Treaty.

title: Albania
event: August 25 – Ahmet Zogu proclaims himself ''King Zog I'' of Albania; he is crowned September 1.

title: Theater am Schiffbauerdamm
event: August 31 – ''The Threepenny Opera'' ({{lang-deDie Dreigroschenoper}}) by Bertolt Brecht and Kurt Weill opens at the Theater am Schiffbauerdamm, Berlin.

title: WMAK
event: September 11 – Kenmore's WMAK station starts broadcasting in Buffalo, New York.

title: Florida
event: September 16 – The 1928 Okeechobee Hurricane kills at least 2,500 people in Florida.

title: Opus Dei
event: October 2 – Saint Josemaria Escriva founds Opus Dei.

title: Republic of China
event: October 8 – Chiang Kai-shek is named as Generalissimo (Chairman of the National Military Council) of the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China.

title: International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement
event: October 26 – International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement (ICRM) formally established with the adoption of “Statutes of the International Red Cross”

title: New York City
event: November 4 – At Park Central Hotel in Manhattan, Arnold Rothstein, New York City's most notorious gambler, is shot to death over a poker game.

title: SS Vestris
event: November 12 – The SS Vestris developed a severe starboard list, was abandoned and sank approximately 200 miles off Hampton Roads, Virginia, USA.  Estimates of the dead vary from between 110-127.

title: Boston Garden
event: November 17 – The Boston Garden opens in Boston.

title: Palais Garnier
event: November 22 – Maurice Ravel's ''Boléro'' premieres at the Paris Opéra.

title: Rio de Janeiro
event: December 3 – In Rio de Janeiro, a seaplane sent to greet Alberto Santos-Dumont crashes near Cap Arcona, killing all on board.

title: Latvia
event: February 9 – The Litvinov Protocol is signed in Moscow among the USSR, Poland, Estonia, Romania and Latvia.

title: Italy
event: February 11 – Italy and the Vatican sign the Lateran Treaty.

title: Buenos Aires
event: June 1 – The 1st Conference of the Communist Parties of Latin America is held in Buenos Aires.

title: Vatican City
event: June 7 – The Lateran Treaty, making Vatican City a sovereign state, is ratified.

title: Apostolic Palace
event: July 25 – Pope Pius XI emerges from the Vatican and enters St. Peter's square in a huge procession witnessed by about 250,000 persons, thus ending nearly 60 years of papal self-imprisonment within the Vatican.

title: 1929 Hebron massacre
event: August 23 and August 24 – The 1929 Hebron massacre, in which 65–68 Jews are killed by Arabs and the remaining Jews are forced to leave Hebron.

title: 1929 Safed massacre
event: August 29 – The 1929 Safed massacre, in which 18–20 Jews by are killed by Arabs in Safed.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 18 – Women are announced to be persons by the Judicial Committee of the Privy Council in Britain. Women can be appointed to the Canadian Senate, an achievement by five Canadian women called the Famous Five.

title: Teapot Dome scandal
event: October 25 – Former U.S. Interior Secretary Albert B. Fall is convicted of bribery for his role in the Teapot Dome scandal, becoming the first Presidential cabinet member to go to prison for actions in office.

title: Museum of Modern Art
event: November 7 – In New York City, the Museum of Modern Art opens to the public.

title: 1929 Grand Banks earthquake
event: November 18 – 1929 Grand Banks earthquake

title: South Pole
event: November 29 – Bernt Balchen, U.S. Admiral Richard Byrd, Captain Ashley McKinley, and Harold June, become the first to fly over the South Pole.

title: Lahore
event: December 29 – The All India Congress in Lahore demands Indian independence.

title: Illinois
event: W9XAP in Chicago, Illinois, broadcasts the U.S. senatorial election returns, which is the first time a senatorial race, with non-stop vote tallies, is ever televised.

title: Nebraska
event: 1930–1931 – Crazy Horse's lifelong friend, He Dog, is interviewed by journalist Eleanor Hinman and Nebraska writer Mari Sandoz.

title: Ontario
event: Sudbury, Ontario, Canada is incorporated as a city.

title: Indianapolis
event: The first diesel engine automobile trip is completed (Indianapolis, Indiana, to New York City).

title: Springfield Massachusetts
event: March 6 – The first frozen foods of Clarence Birdseye go on sale in Springfield, Massachusetts.

title: Ankara
event: March 28 – Constantinople and Angora change their names to Istanbul and Ankara.

title: India
event: The Chittagong Rebellion begins in India.

title: London
event: The BBC Radio Service from London, somewhat infamously, reports on this day that There is no news.

title: Ohio Penitentiary
event: A fire in the Ohio Penitentiary near Columbus kills 320 people.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 22 – The United Kingdom, Japan and the United States sign the London Naval Treaty regulating submarine warfare and limiting shipbuilding.

title: Independence Kansas
event: April 28 – The first night game in organized baseball history takes place in Independence, Kansas.

title: Iran
event: May 6 – The Great Salmas Earthquake in Iran (7.3 on the Richter Scale) kills 4,000 people.

title: Oakland California
event: May 15 – Aboard a Boeing tri-motor, Ellen Church becomes the first airline stewardess (the flight was from Oakland, California to Chicago, Illinois).

title: Australia
event: May 24 – Amy Johnson lands in Darwin, Australia, becoming the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia (she left on May 5 for the 11,000 mile flight).

title: Hollywood
event: Sergei Eisenstein arrives in Hollywood to work for Paramount Pictures; they part ways by October.

title: Illinois
event: June 9 – ''Chicago Tribune'' journalist Jake Lingle is shot in Chicago, Illinois. Newspapers promise $55,000 reward for information. Lingle is later found to have had contacts with organized crime.

title: France
event: June 21 – One-year conscription comes into force in France.

title: Finland
event: The Lapua Movement marches in Helsinki, Finland.

title: Los Angeles
event: July 26 – Charles Creighton and James Hargis of Missouri begin their return journey to Los Angeles, driving 11,555 km using only a reverse gear; the trip lasts the next 42 days.

title: New York
event: New York station W2XBS is put in charge of NBC broadcast engineers.

title: Iran
event: August 12 – Turkish troops move into Persia to fight Kurdish insurgents.

title: Argentina
event: September 6 – José Félix Uriburu carries out a successful military coup, overthrowing Hipólito Yrigoyen, President of Argentina.

title: Brazil
event: October 24 – Revolution of 1930: Getúlio Dornelles Vargas takes power in Brazil.

title: Brazil
event: November 3 – Getúlio Vargas becomes president of Brazil.

title: Izu Peninsula
event: An earthquake in the Izu Peninsula of Japan kills 223 people and destroys 650 buildings.

title: Sheffield Royal Infirmary
event: Cecil George Paine, a pathologist at the Sheffield Royal Infirmary in England, achieves the first recorded cure (of an eye infection) using penicillin.

title: Massachusetts
event: December 7 – W1XAV in Boston, Massachusetts broadcasts video from the CBS radio orchestra program, ''The Fox Trappers''. The broadcast also includes the first television commercial in the United States, an advertisement for I.J. Fox Furriers, who sponsored the radio show.

title: London
event: December 24 – In London, Harry Grindell Matthews demonstrates his device to project pictures to the clouds.

title: Allahabad
event: December 29 – Sir Muhammad Iqbal's presidential address in Allahabad introduces the Two-Nation Theory, outlining a vision for the creation of Pakistan.

title: Australia
event: January 22 – Sir Isaac Isaacs is sworn in as the first Australian-born Governor-General of Australia.

title: India
event: January 25 – Mohandas Gandhi is released again in India.

title: New Zealand
event: February 3 – Hawke's Bay earthquake: Much of the New Zealand city of Napier is destroyed in an earthquake measuring 7.9 on the Richter scale.

title: India
event: February 10 – New Delhi becomes the capital of India.

title: Finland
event: February 16 – Pehr Evind Svinhufvud is elected president of Finland.

title: San Francisco – Oakland Bay Bridge
event: February 20 – California gets the go-ahead by the U.S. Congress to build the San Francisco – Oakland Bay Bridge.

title: Lima
event: February 21 – Peruvian revolutionaries hijack a Ford Trimotor aeroplane and demand that the pilot drop propaganda leaflets over Lima.

title: USS Arizona (BB-39)
event: March 1 – The USS ''Arizona'' is placed back in full commission after a refit.

title: Finland
event: March 7 – The new House of Representatives opens in Helsinki, Finland.

title: Nevada
event: March 17 – Nevada legalizes gambling.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 23 – Indian revolutionary leaders Bhagat Singh, Rajguru and Sukhdev are hanged by the British Government.

title: Alabama
event: March 25 – The Scottsboro Boys are arrested in Alabama and charged with rape.

title: Nicaragua
event: March 31 – An earthquake destroys Managua, Nicaragua, killing 2,000 people.

title: Madeira
event: April 6 – The Portuguese government declares martial law in Madeira and in the Azores because of an attempted military takeover in Funchal.

title: Madrid
event: April 14 – The Second Spanish Republic is proclaimed in Madrid.

title: Cheverly Maryland
event: April 18 – Cheverly, Maryland is incorporated.

title: Italy
event: April 22 – Austria, Britain, Denmark, Germany, Italy, Sweden and the USA recognize the Spanish Republic.

title: New York City
event: May 1 – Construction of the Empire State Building is completed in New York City.

title: France
event: May 13 – Paul Doumer is elected president of France.

title: France
event: June 14 – The overloaded pleasure craft ''Saint-Philibert'', carrying trippers home to Nantes from Île de Noirmoutier, sinks at the mouth of the river Loire in France; over 450 drown.

title: Cambridge Massachusetts
event: July – John Haven Emerson of Cambridge, Massachusetts perfects the Emerson iron lung just in time for the growing polio epidemic.

title: Italy
event: July 1 – Milan Central Station officially opens in Italy.

title: Yangtze River
event: August 31 – The Yangtze River floods, leaving 23 million homeless.

title: Belize
event: September 10 – The worst hurricane in Belize history kills an estimated 1,500 people.

title: United Kingdom
event: September 22 – United Kingdom abandons gold standard.

title: George Washington Bridge
event: October 24 – The George Washington Bridge is dedicated; it opens to traffic the following day.

title: Corsica
event: November 8] – French police launch a large scale raid against Corsican bandits.

title: Panama Canal
event: November 8 – The Panama Canal is closed for a couple of weeks due to damage caused by a number of earthquakes.

title: Nobel Peace Prize
event: December 10  –  Jane Addams became the first American woman to be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Irish Free State
event: December 11 – The British Parliament enacts the Statute of Westminster, which establishes a status of legislative equality between the self-governing dominions of the Commonwealth of Australia, the Dominion of Canada, the Irish Free State, Newfoundland, the Dominion of New Zealand, and the Union of South Africa.

title: Ivar Kreuger
event: ''Kreuger & Toll'', the company of the Match King Ivar Kreuger, collapses.

title: Bolivia
event: June – The Chaco War begins between Bolivia and Paraguay.

title: Brazil
event: Female suffrage is granted in Brazil.

title: Yazd
event: Yezd Atash Behram becomes established in Yazd, Iran.

title: 1932 Salvadoran peasant uprising
event: January 22 – The 1932 Salvadoran peasant uprising begins, it is suppressed by the government of Maximiliano Hernández Martínez

title: Libya
event: January 24 – Marshal Pietro Badoglio declares the end of Libyan resistance.

title: HMS M2
event: January 26 – The British submarine ''HMS M2'' sinks with all 60 hands.

title: China
