event: April 13 – In Portugal, a coup attempt against António de Oliveira Salazar fails.

title: Portugal
event: April 18 – Portugal sends to Angola its first military reinforcement.

title: New York City
event: April 23 – Judy Garland performs in a legendary comeback concert at Carnegie Hall in New York City.

title: Mercury-Redstone 3
event: May 5 – Mercury program: Alan Shepard becomes the first American in space aboard Mercury-Redstone 3.

title: Anniston Alabama
event: May 14 – American civil rights movement: A Freedom Riders bus is fire-bombed near Anniston, Alabama and the civil rights protestors are beaten by an angry mob.

title: Alabama
event: May 21 – American civil rights movement: Alabama Governor John Patterson declares martial law in an attempt to restore order after race riots break out.

title: Brunei
event: May 27 – Tunku Abdul Rahman, Prime Minister of Malaya, holds a press conference in Singapore, announcing his idea to form the Federation of Malaysia, comprising Malaya, Singapore, Sarawak, Brunei and North Borneo (Sabah).

title: France
event: In France, rebel generals Maurice Challe and Andre Zelelr are sentenced to 15 years in prison.

title: South Africa
event: South Africa officially leaves the Commonwealth of Nations.

title: Karakore
event: June 1 – Ethiopia experiences her most devastating earthquake of the 20th century, with a magnitude of 6.7. The town of Majete is destroyed, 45% of the houses in Karakore collapse, 17 kilometers (11 miles) of the main road north of Karakore are damaged by landslides and fissures, and 5,000 inhabitants in the area are left homeless.

title: Vienna
event: June 4 – Vienna summit: John F. Kennedy and Nikita Khrushchev meet during 2 days in Vienna. They discuss nuclear tests, disarmament and Germany.

title: France
event: June 21 – Russian ballet dancer Rudolf Nureyev requests asylum in France while in Paris with the Kirov Ballet.

title: Iraq
event: June 25 – Iraqi president Abdul Karim Kassem announces he is going to annex Kuwait.

title: United Kingdom
event: June 27 – Kuwait requests British help; the United Kingdom sends in troops.

title: Mercury-Redstone 4
event: July 21 – Mercury program: Gus Grissom, piloting the Mercury-Redstone 4 capsule ''Liberty Bell 7'', becomes the second American to go into space (sub-orbital). Upon splashdown, the hatch prematurely opens, and the capsule sinks (it is recovered in 1999).

title: Massachusetts
event: At Fenway Park in Boston, Massachusetts, the first All-Star Game tie in major league baseball history occurs, when the game is stopped in the 9th inning due to rain (the only tie until 2002 in MLB All-Star Game history).

title: Ireland
event: Ireland submits the first ever application to join the then European Economic Community.

title: Vostok 2
event: August 6 – Vostok 2: Soviet cosmonaut Gherman Titov becomes the second human in space for more than one day.

title: East Berlin
event: August 13 – Construction of the Berlin Wall begins, restricting movement between East Berlin and West Berlin and forming a clear boundary between West Germany and East Germany, Western Europe and Eastern Europe.

title: Kenya
event: August 21 – Jomo Kenyatta is released from prison in Kenya.

title: Ferrari
event: September 10 – During the F1 Italian Grand Prix on the circuit of Monza, German Wolfgang Von Trips, driving a Ferrari, crashes into a stand, killing 14 spectators and himself.

title: France
event: September 21 – In France, the OAS slips an anti-de Gaulle message into TV programming.

title: Deutsche Oper Berlin
event: September 24 – The old Deutsche Opernhaus in the Berlin neighborhood of Charlottenburg is returned to its newly rebuilt house as the Deutsche Oper Berlin.

title: United Arab Republic
event: September 28 – A military coup in Damascus, Syria effectively ends the United Arab Republic, the union between Egypt and Syria.

title: Tristan da Cunha
event: October 10 – A volcanic eruption on Tristan da Cunha causes the whole population to be evacuated.

title: New Zealand
event: October 12 – The death penalty is abolished in New Zealand.

title: Private Eye
event: October 25 – The first edition of ''Private Eye'', the British satirical magazine, is published.

title: Novaya Zemlya
event: October 30 – Nuclear testing: The Soviet Union detonates a 58-megaton yield hydrogen bomb known as Tsar Bomba over Novaya Zemlya. It remains the largest ever man-made explosion.

title: Belmopan
event: Hurricane Hattie devastates Belize City, Belize killing over 270. After the hurricane, the capital moves to the inland city of Belmopan.

title: New Guinea
event: November 17 – Michael Rockefeller, son of New York Governor, and later Vice President Nelson Rockefeller, disappears in the jungles of New Guinea.

title: Ghana
event: December 5 – U.S. President John F. Kennedy gives support to the Volta Dam project in Ghana.

title: Australia
event: The Australian government of Robert Menzies is re-elected for a sixth term.

title: Albania
event: December 10 – The Soviet Union severs diplomatic relations with Albania.

title: Israel
event: Adolf Eichmann is pronounced guilty of crimes against humanity by a panel of 3 Israeli judges.

title: The Holocaust
event: An Israeli war crimes tribunal sentences Adolf Eichmann to die for his part in The Holocaust.

title: Brazil
event: A circus tent fire in Niteroi, Brazil kills 323.

title: India
event: December 17 – India occupies Goa.

title: Diu
event: December 18 – India occupies the Portuguese colonies of Goa, Damao and Diu.

title: India
event: Goa is officially ceded to India after 400 years of Portuguese rule.

title: O'Donoghue's Pub
event: The band The Dubliners is formed at O'Donoghue's Pub in Dublin.

title: New Zealand
event: Western Samoa becomes independent from New Zealand.

title: New York City
event: January 4 – New York City introduces a subway train that operates without a crew on board.

title: National Gallery of Art
event: Leonardo da Vinci's ''Mona Lisa'' is exhibited in the United States for the first time, at the National Gallery of Art in Washington, D.C..

title: Harmelen train disaster
event: Harmelen train disaster: 93 die in the worst Dutch rail disaster.

title: People's Republic of China
event: January 13 – Albania allies itself with the People's Republic of China.

title: Portugal
event: January 15 – Portugal abandons the U.N. General Assembly due to the debate over Angola.

title: Organization of American States
event: January 22 – The Organization of American States suspends Cuba's membership.

title: France
event: The Organisation armée secrète (OAS) bombs the French Foreign Ministry.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 4 – ''The Sunday Times'' in the United Kingdom becomes the first paper to print a colour supplement.

title: White House
event: February 14 – First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy takes television viewers on a tour of the White House.

title: Finland
event: February 15 – Urho Kekkonen is re-elected president of Finland.

title: North Sea
event: February 16 – Heavy storms flood Germany's North Sea coast, mainly around Hamburg; more than 300 people die, thousands lose their homes.

title: London
event: February 21 – Margot Fonteyn and Rudolf Nureyev first dance together in a Royal Ballet performance of ''Giselle'' in London.

title: American Airlines Flight 1
event: An American Airlines Boeing 707 crashes on takeoff at New York International Airport, after its rudder separates from the tail, with the loss of all life on board.

title: France
event: March 8–12 – In Geneva, France and the Algerian FLN begin negotiations.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: March 15 – Katangan Prime Minister Moise Tshombe begins negotiations to rejoin the Congo.

title: France
event: Évian Accords: France and Algeria sign an agreement in Évian-les-Bains ending the Algerian War.

title: France
event: ''Un premier amour'', sung by Isabelle Aubret (music by Claude-Henri Vic, text by Roland Stephane Valade), wins the Eurovision Song Contest 1962 for France.

title: India
event: April 3 – Jawaharlal Nehru is elected de facto Prime Minister of India.

title: James Hanratty
event: April 4 – James Hanratty is hanged in Bedford Gaol for the A6 murder; many believe he is innocent.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: Belgium reestablishes diplomatic relations with the Congo.

title: Yugoslavia
event: April 7 – Author Milovan Djilas is arrested in Yugoslavia.

title: France
event: April 8 – In France, the Évian Accords are adopted in a referendum with a majority of 90%.

title: Dodger Stadium
event: April 10 – In Los Angeles, California, the first MLB game is played at Dodger Stadium.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 18 – The Commonwealth Immigration Bill in the United Kingdom removes free immigration from the citizens of member states of the Commonwealth of Nations.

title: Roseville Minnesota
event: Dayton Hudson Corporation opens the first of its Target discount stores in Roseville, Minnesota.

title: Tokyo
event: May 3 – 160 die in a triple-train disaster near Tokyo.

title: Berlin Wall
event: May 5 – Twelve East Germans escape via a tunnel under the Berlin Wall.

title: Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia
event: Milovan Djilas, former vice-president of Yugoslavia, is given further sentence for publishing ''Conversations with Stalin''.

title: Unionville Missouri
event: May 22 – Continental Airlines Flight 11 crashes near Unionville, Missouri after the in-flight detonation of a bomb near the rear lavatory. All 45 passengers and crew aboard are killed.

title: Montreal
event: Drilling for the new Montreal subway commences.

title: France
event: Raoul Salan, founder of the French terrorist Organisation armée secrète, is sentenced to life imprisonment in France.

title: Israel
event: June 1 – Adolf Eichmann is executed in Israel.

title: United States Military Academy
event: June 6 – President John F. Kennedy gives the commencement address at the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York.

title: Yale University
event: President John F. Kennedy gives the commencement address at Yale University.

title: Alcatraz Island
event: Frank Morris, John Anglin and Clarence Anglin become the only apparently successful escapees from the Alcatraz Island prison. There is no conclusive evidence that they survived the attempt.

title: Italy
event: June 26 – A 2-day steel strike begins in Italy, in support of increased wages and a 5-day working week.

title: Rwanda
event: Rwanda and Burundi gain independence.

title: London
event: A heavy smog develops over London.

title: Nordic countries
event: Treaty of Nordic Cooperation of Helsinki (23 Mar 1962 signed) in force.

title: Rogers Arkansas
event: The first Wal-Mart store opens for business in Rogers, Arkansas.

title: France
event: July 5 – Algeria becomes independent from France.

title: Telstar
event: July 10 – AT&T's Telstar, the world's first commercial communications satellite, is launched into orbit, and activated the next day.

title: Marquee Club
event: July 12 – The Rolling Stones make their debut at London's Marquee Club, Number 165 Oxford Street, opening for Long John Baldry.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 13 – In what the press dubs the Night of the Long Knives, United Kingdom Prime Minister Harold Macmillan dismisses 1/3 of his Cabinet.

title: France
event: July 20 – France and Tunisia reestablish diplomatic relations.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: July 23 – Telstar relays the first live trans-Atlantic television signal.

title: South Africa
event: August 5 – The South African government arrests Nelson Mandela in Howick, and charges him with incitement to rebellion.

title: Jamaica
event: August 6 – Jamaica becomes independent.

title: Berlin Wall
event: August 17 – East German border guards kill 18-year-old Peter Fechter, as he attempts to cross the Berlin Wall into West Berlin.

title: Havana
event: August 24 – A group of armed Cuban exile terrorists fire at a hotel in Havana from a speedboat.

title: NASA
event: August 27 – NASA launches the ''Mariner 2'' space probe.

title: Trinidad and Tobago
event: August 31 – Trinidad and Tobago becomes independent.

title: Singapore
event: A referendum in Singapore supports the Malayan Federation.

title: Hong Kong
event: Typhoon Wanda strikes Hong Kong, killing at least 130 and wounding more than 600.

title: Rice University
event: September 12 – President John F. Kennedy, at a speech at Rice University,  reaffirms that the U.S. will put a man on the moon by the end of the decade.

title: India
event: A border conflict between China and India erupts into fighting.

title: Yemen
event: September 26 – Civil war erupts in Yemen.

title: California
event: September 29 – The Canadian Alouette 1, the first satellite built outside the United States and the Soviet Union, is launched from Vandenberg AFB in California.

title: Mississippi
event: The first black student, James Meredith, registers at the University of Mississippi, escorted by Federal Marshals.

title: Uganda
event: October 9 – Uganda becomes independent within the Commonwealth of Nations.

title: People's Republic of China
event: The Sino-Indian War, a border dispute involving two of the world's largest nations (India and the People's Republic of China), begins.

title: NATO
event: ''Der Spiegel'' publishes an article on a NATO exercise criticizing the weakness of the West German army.

title: New York City
event: Jazz bassist/composer Charles Mingus presents a disastrous concert at Town Hall in New York City. It will gain a reputation as the worst moment of his career.

title: Broadway theatre
event: October 13 – ''Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?'' opens on Broadway.

title: France
event: A referendum in France favors the election of the president by universal suffrage.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 31 – The UN General Assembly asks the United Kingdom to suspend enforcement of the new constitution in Southern Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe), but the constitution comes into effect on November 1.

title: Ny-Ålesund
event: A coal mining disaster in Ny-Ålesund kills 21 people. The Norwegian government is forced to resign in the aftermath of this accident in August, 1963.

title: South Africa
event: November 6 – Apartheid: The United Nations General Assembly passes a resolution condemning South Africa's racist apartheid policies, and calls for all UN member states to cease military and economic relations with the nation.

title: California
event: November 7 – Richard M. Nixon loses the California governor's race. In his concession speech, he states that this is his last press conference and that you won't have Dick Nixon to kick around any more.

title: Caribbean
event: November 20 – The Cuban Missile Crisis ends: In response to the Soviet Union agreeing to remove its missiles from Cuba, U.S. President John F. Kennedy ends the quarantine of the Caribbean nation.

title: United Airlines Flight 297
event: November 23 – United Airlines Flight 297 crashes, killing all 17 on board.

title: Brunei
event: The North Kalimantan National Army revolts in Brunei, in the first stirrings of the Indonesian Confrontation.

title: Delft
event: Former Dutch queen Wilhelmina buried at the New Church in Delft.

title: Tanzania
event: December 9 – Tanganyika (now Tanzania) becomes a republic within the Commonwealth, with Julius Nyerere as president.

title: London
event: December 10 – David Lean's epic film ''Lawrence of Arabia'', featuring Peter O' Toole, Omar Sharif, Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, and Anthony Quinn premieres in London.

title: North Sea
event: December 15 – Storm over North Sea. Belgian pirate radio Radio Uylenspiegel off anchor, never to operate again.

title: Malawi
event: December 19 – Britain acknowledges the right of Nyasaland (now Malawi) to secede from the Central African Federation.

title: Tokyo
event: January–February – Heavy snowfall causes many houses and buildings to collapse in northwestern Japan, with at least 231 reported dead from January through February. An express train delayed 106 hours 30 minutes arrived at Tokyo, because of heavy snow and adverse weather.

title: United Kingdom
event: The divorce case of the Duke and Duchess of Argyll causes scandal in the United Kingdom.

title: Semi Automatic Ground Environment
event: The Semi Automatic Ground Environment is fully deployed.

title: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
event: Ivan Sutherland writes the revolutionary Sketchpad program and runs it on the Lincoln TX-2 computer at MIT.

title: Ostankino Tower
event: Construction of Moscow's Ostankino Tower begins.

title: Sydney
event: Bogle-Chandler case: CSIRO scientist Dr. Gilbert Bogle and Mrs. Margaret Chandler are found dead (presumed poisoned), in bushland near the Lane Cove River, Sydney.

title: Alabama
event: George C. Wallace becomes governor of Alabama. In his inaugural speech, he defiantly proclaims segregation now, segregation tomorrow, and segregation forever!Public Broadcasting Service'', 2000<National Endowment for the Humanities'', [http://www.neh.gov/news/humanities/2004-03/contents.html March/April 2004]<

title: France
event: January 22 – France and Germany sign the Elysée Treaty.

title: Perth Western Australia
event: January 26 – The Australia Day shootings rock Perth, Western Australia; 2 people are shot dead and 3 others injured by Eric Edgar Cooke.

title: South Carolina
event: January 28 – African American student Harvey Gantt enters Clemson University in South Carolina, the last U.S. state to hold out against racial integration.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 29 – French President Charles de Gaulle vetoes the United Kingdom's entry into the EEC.

title: Libya
event: February 21 – An earthquake destroys the village of Barce, Libya, killing 900.

title: Iran
event: Female suffrage is enacted in Iran.

title: Kansas City Kansas
event: March 5 – In Camden, Tennessee, country music superstar Patsy Cline (Virginia Patterson Hensley) is killed in a plane crash along with fellow performers Hawkshaw Hawkins, Cowboy Copas and Cline's manager and pilot Randy Hughes, while returning from a benefit performance in Kansas City, Kansas for country radio disc jockey Cactus Jack Call.

title: Robert F. Kennedy
event: March 21 – The Alcatraz Island federal penitentiary in San Francisco Bay closes; the last 27 prisoners are transferred elsewhere at the order of Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy.

title: Denmark
event: March 23 – ''Dansevise'' by Grethe & Jørgen Ingmann (music by Otto Francker, text by Sejr Volmer-Sørensen) wins the Eurovision Song Contest 1963 for Denmark.

title: Birmingham Alabama
event: April 3 – SCLC volunteers kick off the Birmingham campaign (Birmingham, Alabama) against racial segregation in the United States with a sit-in.

title: Josip Broz Tito
event: April 7 – Yugoslavia is proclaimed to be a socialist republic, and Josip Broz Tito is named President for Life.

title: Cape Cod
event: April 10 – The U.S. nuclear submarine ''Thresher'' sinks {{convert220mikm}} east of Cape Cod; all 129 crewmen die.

title: London
event: April 15 – 70,000 marchers arrive in London from Aldermaston, to demonstrate against nuclear weapons.

title: Quebec
event: April 20 – In Quebec, Canada, members of the terrorist group Front de libération du Québec, bomb a Canadian Army recruitment center, killing night watchman Wilfred V. O'Neill.

title: Israel
event: April 21–April 23 – The first election of the Supreme Institution of the Bahá'í Faith (known as the Universal House of Justice, whose seat is at the Bahá'í World Centre on Mount Carmel in Haifa, Israel) is held.

title: Birmingham Alabama
event: Thousands of African Americans, many of them children, are arrested while protesting segregation in Birmingham, Alabama. Public Safety Commissioner Eugene Bull Connor later unleashes fire hoses and police dogs on the demonstrators.

title: NASA
event: May 15 – Mercury program: NASA launches Gordon Cooper on ''Mercury 9'', the last mission (on June 12 NASA Administrator James E. Webb tells Congress the program is complete).

title: Addis Ababa
event: May 25 – The Organisation of African Unity is established in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

title: University of Central Florida
event: June 10 – The University of Central Florida is established by the Florida legislature.

title: Vostok 6
event: June 16 – ''Vostok 6'' carries Soviet cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova, the first woman, into space.

title: Ich bin ein Berliner
event: June 26 – John F. Kennedy gives his 'Ich bin ein Berliner' speech in West Berlin.

title: Israel
event: Diplomatic relations between the Israeli and the Japanese governments are raised to embassy level.

title: Manchester
event: July 12 – Pauline Reade, 16, is abducted by Myra Hindley and Ian Brady in Manchester, England.

title: Yugoslavia
event: An earthquake in Skopje, Yugoslavia leaves 1,800 dead.

title: NASA
event: NASA launches Syncom, the world's first geostationary (synchronous) satellite.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 5 – The United States, United Kingdom, and Soviet Union sign a nuclear test ban treaty.

title: University of Mississippi
event: August 18 – American civil rights movement: James Meredith becomes the first black person to graduate from the University of Mississippi.

title: United Kingdom
event: September 5 – British prostitute Christine Keeler is arrested for perjury. On December 6 she is sentenced to 9 months in prison.

title: Canton Ohio
event: September 7 – The Pro Football Hall of Fame opens in Canton, Ohio with 17 charter members.

title: Birmingham Alabama
event: September 15 – American civil rights movement: The 16th Street Baptist Church bombing, in Birmingham, Alabama, kills 4 and injures 22.

title: Singapore
event: Malaysia is formed through the merging of the Federation of Malaya and the British crown colony of Singapore, North Borneo (renamed Sabah) and Sarawak.

title: Great Britain
event: September 25 – The Denning Report on the Profumo affair is published in Great Britain.

title: University of East Anglia
event: The University of East Anglia is established in Norwich, England.

title: Nigeria
event: Nigeria becomes a republic; The 1st Republican Constitution is established

title: Dodger Stadium
event: October 2 – Los Angeles Dodgers left-handed pitcher Sandy Koufax sets a World Series record by striking out 15 New York Yankees in a 5-2 victory in Game 1 at Yankee Stadium. The Dodgers sweep the series in four straight, with Koufax defeating the Yankees 2-1 in Game 4 at Dodger Stadium.

title: Hispaniola
event: October 4 – Hurricane Flora, one of the worst Atlantic storms in history, hits Hispaniola and Cuba killing nearly 7,000 people.

title: Vajont Dam
event: October 9 – In northeast Italy, over 2,000 people are killed when a large landslide behind the Vajont Dam causes a giant wave of water to overtop it.

title: United Kingdom
event: October 14 – A revolution starts in Radfan, South Yemen against British colonial rule.

title: New York City
event: October 28 – Demolition of the 1910 Pennsylvania Station begins in New York City.  Demolition continues until 1966.

title: Indianapolis
event: October 31 – 74 die in a gas explosion during a Holiday on Ice show at the Indiana State Fair Coliseum in Indianapolis.

title: 1963 South Vietnamese coup
event: November 2 – 1963 South Vietnamese coup: South Vietnamese President Ngo Dinh Diem is assassinated following a military coup.

title: Texas
event: Laura Welch (later Bush) causes a car accident that results in the death of Michael Dutton Douglas in her hometown of Midland, Texas.

title: Yokohama
event: A triple-train disaster in Yokohama, Japan kills 161.

title: Surtsey
event: November 14 – A volcanic eruption under the sea near Iceland creates a new island, Surtsey.

title: Toledo Ohio
event: November 16 – A newspaper strike begins in Toledo, Ohio.

title: Texas
event: John F. Kennedy assassination: In Dallas, Texas, United States President John F. Kennedy is assassinated, Texas Governor John B. Connally is seriously wounded, and Vice President Lyndon Baines Johnson becomes the 36th President. All television coverage for the next four days is devoted to the assassination, its aftermath, the procession of the horsedrawn casket to the Capitol Rotunda, and the funeral of President Kennedy. Stores and businesses shut down for the entire weekend and Monday, in tribute.

title: Great Britain
event: John Kilbride, 12, is abducted by Myra Hindley and Ian Brady in Great Britain.

title: United Kingdom
event: The first episode of the BBC television series ''Doctor Who'' is broadcast in the United Kingdom.

title: Ohio
event: The Golden Age Nursing Home fire kills 63 elderly people near Fitchville, Ohio.

title: Arlington National Cemetery
event: November 25 – U.S. President Kennedy is buried at Arlington National Cemetery. Schools around the nation do not have class on that day, millions watch the funeral on live international television.

title: Montreal
event: Trans-Canada Airlines Flight 831, a Douglas DC-8 carrying 118, crashes into a wooded hillside after taking-off from Dorval International Airport near Montreal, killing all on board (the worst air disaster for many years in Canada's history).

title: Elkton Maryland
event: A lightning strike causes the crashing of Pan Am Flight 214 near Elkton, Maryland, killing 81 people.

title: Harrah's Lake Tahoe
event: Frank Sinatra Jr. is kidnapped at Harrah's Lake Tahoe.

title: Kenya
event: December 12 – Kenya becomes independent, with Jomo Kenyatta as prime minister.

title: Great Britain
event: December 19 – Zanzibar gains independence from Great Britain as a constitutional monarchy, under Sultan Jamshid bin Abdullah.

title: Madeira
event: December 22 – The cruise ship ''Lakonia'' burns {{convert180mikm}} north of Madeira, with the loss of 128 lives.

title: Madagascar
event: February – African and Malagasy Union for Economic Cooperation (UAMCE) (Union Africaine et Malgache de Coopération Économique).

title: London
event: September – Pete Townshend of The Who destroys his first guitar in the name of auto-destructive art at the Railway Hotel, London.

title: Panama Canal Zone
event: January 9 – ''Martyrs' Day'': Armed clashes between United States troops and Panamanian civilians in the Panama Canal Zone precipitate a major international crisis, resulting in the deaths of 21 Panamanians and 4 U.S. soldiers.

title: Zanzibar
event: The predominantly Arab government of Zanzibar is overthrown by African nationalist rebels; a U.S. destroyer evacuates 61 U.S. citizens.

title: South China Sea
event: Routine U.S. naval patrols of the South China Sea begin.

title: New York City
event: ''Hello, Dolly!'' opens in New York City's St. James Theatre.

title: Ohio
event: January 17 – John Glenn announces that he will seek the Democratic nomination for U.S. Senator from Ohio.

title: World Trade Center
event: January 18 – Plans to build the New York World Trade Center are announced.

title: Northern Rhodesia
event: January 22 – Kenneth Kaunda is inaugurated as the first President of Northern Rhodesia.

title: People's Republic of China
event: France and the People's Republic of China announce their decision to establish diplomatic relations.

title: NASA
event: Ranger 6 is launched by NASA, on a mission to carry television cameras and crash-land on the Moon.

title: New York City
event: February 3 – Protesting against alleged de-facto school racial segregation, Black and Puerto Rican groups in New York City boycott public schools.

title: Florida
event: February 6 – Cuba cuts off the normal water supply to the United States Guantanamo Bay Naval Base, in reprisal for the U.S. seizure 4 days earlier of 4 Cuban fishing boats off the coast of Florida.

title: New York City
event: The Beatles arrive from England at New York City's JFK International Airport, receiving a tumultuous reception from a throng of screaming fans, marking the first occurrence of Beatlemania in the United States.

title: Limassol
event: Greeks & Turks begin fighting in Limassol, Cyprus.

title: People's Republic of China
event: The Republic of China (Taiwan) drops diplomatic relations with France because of French recognition of the People's Republic of China.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: ''Wesberry v. Sanders'' (376 US 1 1964): The Supreme Court of the United States rules that congressional districts have to be approximately equal in population.

title: Miami Beach Florida
event: February 25 – Muhammad Ali beats Sonny Liston in Miami Beach, Florida, and is crowned the heavyweight champion of the world.

title: Leaning Tower of Pisa
event: February 27 – The government of Italy asks for help to keep the Leaning Tower of Pisa from toppling over.

title: Greece
event: Constantine II becomes King of Greece, upon the death of his father King Paul.

title: New York City
event: Malcolm X, suspended from the Nation of Islam, says in New York City that he is forming a black nationalist party.

title: New Hampshire
event: March 10 – Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr., Ambassador to South Vietnam, wins the New Hampshire Republican primary.

title: New York City
event: March 13 – In a notorious incident, 38 of her neighbors in Queens, New York City fail to respond to the cries of Kitty Genovese, 28, as she is being stabbed to death.

title: Montreal
event: March 15 – Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor marry (for the first time) in Montreal.

title: European Space Agency
event: March 20 – The precursor of the European Space Agency, ESRO (European Space Research Organization) is established per an agreement signed on June 14, 1962.

title: Italy
event: March 21 – ''Non ho l'età'' by Gigliola Cinquetti (music by Nicola Salerno, text by Mario Panzeri) wins the Eurovision Song Contest 1964 for Italy.

title: Merv Griffin
event: March 30 – Merv Griffin's game show ''Jeopardy!'' debuts on NBC; Art Fleming is its first host.

title: Brazil
event: March 31 – The military overthrows Brazilian President João Goulart in a coup, starting 21 years of dictatorship in Brazil.

title: Massachusetts
event: April 2 – Mrs. Malcolm Peabody, 72, mother of Massachusetts Governor Endicott Peabody, is released on $450 bond after spending 2 days in a St. Augustine, Florida jail, for participating in an anti-segregation demonstration there.

title: Bhutan
event: April 6 – Jigme Palden Dorji, Premier of the Himalayan kingdom of Bhutan, is shot dead by an unidentified assassin in Puncholing, near the Indian border.

title: Yemen
event: April 9 – The United Nations Security Council adopts by a 9–0 vote a resolution deploring a British air attack on a fort in Yemen 12 days earlier, in which 25 persons were reported killed.

title: Brazil
event: April 11 – The Brazilian Congress elects Field Marshal Humberto de Alencar Castello Branco as President of Brazil.

title: Cape Canaveral
event: April 14 – A Delta rocket's third stage motor ignites prematurely in an assembly room at Cape Canaveral, killing 3.

title: Great Train Robbery (1963)
event: Sentences totalling 307 years are passed on 12 men who stole £2.6m in used bank notes, after holding up the night mail train travelling from Glasgow to London in August 1963 – a heist that became known as the Great Train Robbery.

title: Shea Stadium
event: Shea Stadium opens in Flushing, New York.

title: United Kingdom
event: BBC2 starts broadcasting in the UK.

title: The Little Mermaid (statue)
event: April 25 – Thieves steal the head of the Little Mermaid statue in Copenhagen, Denmark (Henrik Bruun confesses in 1997).

title: Tanzania
event: April 26 – Tanganyika and Zanzibar merge to form Tanzania.

title: Texas
event: Senator Barry Goldwater receives more than 75% of the votes in the Texas Republican Presidential primary.

title: Times Square
event: Some 400–1,000 students march through Times Square, New York and another 700 in San Francisco, in the first major student demonstration against the Vietnam War. Smaller marches also occur in Boston, Seattle, and Madison, Wisconsin.

title: Meadville Mississippi
event: Henry Hezekiah Dee and Charles Eddie Moore, hitchhiking in Meadville, Mississippi, are kidnapped and beaten by members of the Ku Klux Klan. Their badly decomposed bodies are found by chance 2 months later in July, during the search for 3 civil rights workers – Chaney, Goodman, and Schwerner.

title: San Ramon California
event: Pacific Air Lines Flight 773 crashes near San Ramon, California, killing all 44 aboard; the FBI later reports that a cockpit recorder tape indicates that the pilot and co-pilot had been shot by a suicidal passenger.

title: Fulham Road
event: May 11 – Terence Conran opens the first Habitat store on London's Fulham Road.

title: Pablo Picasso
event: Pablo Picasso paints his fourth ''Head of a Bearded Man''.

title: Argentina
event: May 24–May 25 – The crowd at a football match in Lima, Peru riots over a referee's decision in the Peru-Argentina game; 319 are killed, 500 injured.

title: Oregon
event: May 26 – Nelson Rockefeller defeats Barry Goldwater in the Oregon Republican primary, slowing but not stalling Goldwater's drive toward the nomination.

title: California
event: Senator Barry Goldwater wins the California Republican Presidential primary, making him the overwhelming favorite for the nomination.

title: Rocket experiments in the area of Cuxhaven
event: June 6 – With a temporary order, the rocket launches at Cuxhaven are terminated.

title: Kansas City Kansas
event: June 9 – In Federal Court in Kansas City, Kansas, army deserter George John Gessner, 28, is convicted of passing United States secrets to the Soviet Union.

title: Greece
event: Greece rejects direct talks with Turkey over Cyprus.

title: Pennsylvania
event: Pennsylvania Governor William Scranton announces his candidacy for the Republican Presidential nomination, as part of a 'stop-Goldwater' movement.

title: Robben Island
event: Nelson Mandela and 7 others are sentenced to life imprisonment in South Africa, and sent to the Robben Island prison.

title: Philadelphia Mississippi
event: Three civil rights workers, Michael Schwerner, Andrew Goodman, and James Chaney, are murdered near Philadelphia, Mississippi, by local Klansmen, cops, and a sheriff.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: June 26 – Moise Tshombe returns to the Democratic Republic of the Congo from exile in Spain.

title: Isle of Man
event: June 29 – Manx Radio commences broadcasting from Douglas, Isle of Man after receiving its first Low power broadcast licence from the United Kingdom's General Post Office.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 6 – Malawi declares its independence from the United Kingdom.

title: Harlem
event: Six days of race riots begin in Harlem.

title: North Vietnam
event: July 19 – Vietnam War: At a rally in Saigon, South Vietnamese Prime Minister Nguyen Khanh calls for expanding the war into North Vietnam.

title: Singapore
event: July 21 – Race riots begin in Singapore between ethnic Chinese and Malays.

title: Gulf of Tonkin
event: Vietnam War: United States destroyers USS ''Maddox'' and USS ''C. Turner Joy'' are attacked in the Gulf of Tonkin. Air support from the carrier USS ''Ticonderoga'' sinks 1 gunboat, while the other 2 leave the battle.

title: Gulf of Tonkin
event: Vietnam War: Operation Pierce Arrow – Aircraft from carriers USS ''Ticonderoga'' and USS ''Constellation'' bomb North Vietnam in retaliation for strikes against U.S. destroyers in the Gulf of Tonkin.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: The Simba rebel army in the Democratic Republic of the Congo captures Stanleyville, and takes 1,000 Western hostages.

title: Scheveningen
event: August 8 – A Rolling Stones gig in Scheveningen gets out of control. Riot police end the gig after about 15 minutes, upon which spectators start to fight the riot police.

title: United Kingdom
event: August 13 – Murderers Gwynne Owen Evans and Peter Anthony Allen become the last people to be executed in the United Kingdom.

title: Mississippi
event: Fannie Lou Hamer, civil rights activist and Vice Chair of the Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party, addresses the Credentials Committee of the Democratic National Convention, challenging the all-white Mississippi delegation.

title: Minnesota
event: August 24–August 27 – The Democratic National Convention in Atlantic City nominates incumbent President Lyndon B. Johnson for a full term, and U.S. Senator Hubert Humphrey of Minnesota as his running mate.

title: Firth of Forth
event: September 4 – The Forth Road Bridge opens over the Firth of Forth.

title: United Kingdom
event: September 21 – The island of Malta obtains independence from the United Kingdom.

title: University of California Berkeley
event: Three thousand student activists at University of California, Berkeley surround and block a police car from taking a CORE volunteer arrested for not showing his ID, when he violated a ban on outdoor activist card tables. This protest eventually explodes into the Berkeley Free Speech Movement.

title: Tokyo
event: The ''Shinkansen'' high-speed rail system is inaugurated in Japan, for the first sector between Tokyo and Osaka.

title: Berlin Wall
event: Twenty-three men and thirty-one women escape to West Berlin through a narrow tunnel under the Berlin Wall.

title: Tokyo
event: October 10–October 24 – The 1964 Summer Olympics are held in Tokyo.

title: Voskhod 1
event: October 12 – The Soviet Union launches ''Voskhod 1'' into Earth orbit as the first spacecraft with a multi-person crew and the first flight without space suits. The flight is cut short and lands again on October 13 after 16 orbits.

title: Nobel Peace Prize
event: October 14 – American civil rights movement leader Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. becomes the youngest recipient of the Nobel Peace Prize, which was awarded to him for leading non-violent resistance to end racial prejudice in the United States.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Labour Party wins the parliamentary elections in the United Kingdom, ending 13 years of Conservative Party rule.

title: Utah
event: Craig Breedlove's jet-powered car ''Spirit of America'' goes out of control in Bonneville Salt Flats in Utah and makes skid marks 9.6 km long.

title: Xinjiang
event: The People's Republic of China explodes an atomic bomb in Sinkiang.

title: Mississippi
event: A 5.3 Kiloton nuclear device is detonated at the Tatum Salt Dome, {{convert21mikm}} from Hattiesburg, Mississippi as part of the Vela Uniform program. This test is the Salmon phase of the Atomic Energy Commission's Project Dribble.

title: Perth Western Australia
event: October 26 – Eric Edgar Cooke becomes the last man executed in Western Australia, for murdering 8 citizens in  Perth, Western Australia between 1959 and 1963.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: October 27 – In the Democratic Republic of the Congo, rebel leader Christopher Gbenye takes 60 Americans and 800 Belgians hostage.

title: New York City
event: October 29 – A collection of irreplaceable gemstones, including the {{convert565caratg}} Star of India, is stolen from the American Museum of Natural History in New York City.

title: Madison Square Garden (1925)
event: October 31 – Campaigning at Madison Square Garden, New York, U.S. President Lyndon Johnson pledges the creation of the Great Society.

title: Bolivia
event: The Bolivian government of President Víctor Paz Estenssoro is overthrown by a military rebellion led by General Alfredo Ovando Candía, commander-in-chief of the armed forces.

title: Australia
event: November 10 – Australia partially reintroduces compulsory military service due to the Indonesian Confrontation.

title: University of California Berkeley
event: December 3 – Berkeley Free Speech Movement: Police arrest about 800 students at the University of California, Berkeley, following their takeover of and massive sit-in at the Sproul Hall administration building.  The sit-in most directly protested the U.C. Regents' decision to punish student activists for what many thought had been justified civil disobedience earlier in the conflict.

title: Nobel Peace Prize
event: December 10 – Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. is awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo, Norway.

title: Panama Canal
event: December 18 – In the wake of deadly riots in January over control of the Panama Canal, the U.S. offers to negotiate a new canal treaty.

title: Norco California
event: Norco, CA incorporated as a city.

title: New York City
event: Tokyo officially becomes the largest city of the world, taking the lead from New York City.[http://geography.about.com/library/weekly/aa011201a.htm]

title: United Kingdom
event: The Council for National Academic Awards is established in the UK.

title: Sydney
event: January 12 – Wanda Beach Murders: The bodies of two 15-year-olds, Christine Sharrock and Marianne Schmidt, are found at Wanda Beach, Sydney.

title: Republic of Ireland
event: January 14 – The Prime Minister of Northern Ireland and the Taoiseach of the Republic of Ireland meet for the first time in 43 years.

title: Gemini 2
event: January 19 – The unmanned ''Gemini 2'' is launched on a suborbital test of various spacecraft systems.

title: India
event: January 26 – Anti-Hindi agitations break out in India, because of which Hindi does not get National Language status and remains one of the 23 official languages of India.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 18 – The Gambia becomes independent from the United Kingdom.

title: Selma Alabama
event: March 7 – Bloody Sunday: Some 200 Alabama State Troopers clash with 525 civil rights demonstrators in Selma, Alabama.

title: Montgomery Alabama
event: March 9 – The second attempt to march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, under the leadership of Martin Luther King, Jr., stops at the bridge that was the site of Bloody Sunday, to hold a prayer service and return to Selma, in obedience to a court restraining order.  White supremacists beat up white Unitarian Universalist minister James J. Reeb later that day in Selma.

title: London Zoo
event: Goldie, a London Zoo golden eagle, is recaptured 12 days after her escape.

title: Birmingham Alabama
event: March 11 – White Unitarian Universalist minister James J. Reeb, beaten by White supremacists in Selma, Alabama on March 9 following the second march from Selma, dies in a hospital in Birmingham, Alabama.

title: Montgomery Alabama
event: March 16 – Police clash with 600 SNCC marchers in Montgomery, Alabama.

title: Montgomery Alabama
event: In Montgomery, Alabama, 1,600 civil rights marchers demonstrate at the Courthouse.

title: Voskhod 2
event: Cosmonaut Aleksei Leonov, leaving his spacecraft ''Voskhod 2'' for 12 minutes, becomes the first person to walk in space.

title: Montgomery Alabama
event: A United States federal judge rules that SCLC has the lawful right to march to Montgomery, Alabama to petition for 'redress of grievances'.

title: South Carolina
event: March 19 – The wreck of the ''SS Georgiana'', reputed to have been the most powerful Confederate cruiser ever built and owned by the real Rhett Butler, is discovered off the Isle of Palms, South Carolina, by teenage diver E. Lee Spence, exactly 102 years after she was sunk with a million dollar cargo while attempting to run past the Union blockade into Charleston.

title: NASA
event: Ranger program: NASA launches ''Ranger 9'', which is the last in a series of unmanned lunar space probes.''

title: NASA
event: March 23 – ''Gemini 3'': NASA launches the United States' first 2-person crew (Gus Grissom, John Young) into Earth orbit.

title: Harris County Texas
event: In Houston, Texas, the Harris County Domed Stadium (more commonly known as the Astrodome) opens.

title: Lansing Kansas
event: April 14 – ''In Cold Blood'' killers Richard Hickock and Perry Smith, convicted of murdering 4 members of the Herbert Clutter family of Holcomb, Kansas, are executed by hanging at the Kansas State Penitentiary for Men in Lansing, Kansas.

title: Pennine Way
event: April 23 – The Pennine Way officially opens.

title: Portugal
event: The bodies of Portuguese opposition politician Humberto Delgado and his secretary Arajaryr Moreira de Campos are found in a forest near Villanueva del Fresno, Spain (they were killed February 12).

title: Orcutt California
event: April 25 – On this Sunday morning teenage sniper Michael Clark kills three and wounds others shooting at cars from a hilltop along Highway 101 just south of Orcutt, California. Sixteen year old Clark kills himself as police rush hilltop.

title: Australia
event: April 29 – Australia announces that it is sending an infantry battalion to support the South Vietnam government.

title: New South Wales
event: Bob Askin replaces Jack Renshaw as Premier of New South Wales.

title: People's Republic of China
event: The Battle of Dong-Yin occurs as a conflict between Taiwan and the People's Republic of China.

title: University of California Berkeley
event: May 5 – The first draft card burnings take place at the University of California, Berkeley, and a coffin is marched to the Berkeley Draft Board.

title: Minnesota
event: May 6 – A tornado outbreak near the Twin Cities in Minnesota kills 13 and injures 683.

title: Israel
event: West Germany and Israel establish diplomatic relations.

title: Berkeley California
event: May 21 – The largest teach-in to date begins at Berkeley, California, attended by 30,000.

title: India
event: May 29 – A mining accident in Dhanbad, India kills 274.

title: Indianapolis 500
event: May 31 – Racing driver Jim Clark wins the Indianapolis 500, and later wins the Formula One world driving championship in the same year.

title: Florida International University
event: Florida International University is founded in Miami, FL.

title: Australia
event: June 2 – Vietnam War: The first contingent of Australian combat troops arrives in South Vietnam.

title: Gemini 4
event: June 3 – ''Gemini 4'': Astronaut Edward Higgins White makes the first U.S. space walk.

title: Kakanj
event: June 7 – A mining accident in Kakanj, Bosnia and Herzegovina, results in 128 deaths.

title: The Pentagon
event: June 16 – A planned anti-war protest at The Pentagon becomes a teach-in, with demonstrators distributing 50,000 leaflets in and around the building.

title: Tokyo
event: June 22 – The Treaty on Basic Relations between Japan and the Republic of Korea is signed in Tokyo.

title: Orange County California
event: June 25 – A U.S. Air Force Boeing C135-A bound for Okinawa crashes just after takeoff at MCAS El Toro in Orange County, California, killing all 85 on board.

title: Mont Blanc Tunnel
event: July 16 – The Mont Blanc Tunnel is inaugurated by presidents Giuseppe Saragat and Charles de Gaulle.

title: Stoke-on-Trent
event: July 23 American/English guitarist Slash is born in Stoke-on-Trent. He would go on to achieve fame with hard-rock outfit Guns N' Roses, supergroup Velvet Revolver, and as a solo artist with his eponymous debut solo album. He also would gather accreditation for authoring his autobiography, which has been called the greatest rock autobiography ever written.

title: Maldives
event: July 26 – The Maldives receive full independence from Great Britain.

title: Cam Ranh Bay
event: July 29 – Vietnam War: The first 4,000 101st Airborne Division paratroopers arrive in Vietnam, landing at Cam Ranh Bay.

title: Singapore
event: August 7 – Tunku Abdul Rahman, Prime Minister of Malaysia, recommends the expulsion of Singapore from the Federation of Malaysia, negotiating its separation with Lee Kuan Yew, Prime Minister of Singapore.

title: Singapore
event: Singapore is expelled from the Federation of Malaysia, which recognizes it as a sovereign nation.  Lee Kuan Yew announces Singapore's independence and assumes the position of Prime Minister of the new island nation.

title: Arkansas
event: An explosion at an Arkansas missile plant kills 53.

title: New York
event: August 15 – The Beatles perform the first stadium concert in the history of rock, playing at Shea Stadium in New York.

title: Chu Lai
event: August 18 – Vietnam War – Operation Starlite: 5,500 United States Marines destroy a Viet Cong stronghold on the Van Tuong peninsula in Quang Ngai Province, in the first major American ground battle of the war. The Marines were tipped-off by a Viet Cong deserter who said that there was an attack planned against the U.S. base at Chu Lai.

title: Keene New Hampshire
event: August 20 – Jonathan Myrick Daniels, an Episcopal seminarian from Keene, New Hampshire, is murdered in Hayneville, Alabama while working in the American civil rights movement.

title: Gemini 5
event: August 21 – ''Gemini 5'' (Gordon Cooper, Pete Conrad) is launched on the first 1-week flight, as well as the first test of fuel cells for electrical power.

title: Switzerland
event: An avalanche buries a dam construction site at Saas-Fee, Switzerland killing 90 workers.

title: Lahore
event: September 2 – Pakistani troops enter the Indian sector of Kashmir, while Indian troops try to invade Lahore.

title: People's Republic of China
event: The People's Republic of China announces that it will reinforce its troops on the Indian border.

title: India
event: September 8 – India opens 2 additional fronts against Pakistan.

title: Casablanca
event: September 13 – The Congress of Arab Countries begins in Casablanca; Habib Bourguiba of Tunisia boycotts the meeting.

title: France
event: September 15 – ''Mary Poppins'' comes out in theaters in France.

title: Iraq
event: In Iraq, Prime Minister Arif Abd ar-Razzaq's attempted coup fails.

title: Denmark
event: In Denmark, Palle Sørensen shoots 4 policemen in pursuit; he is apprehended the same day.

title: India
event: Soviet Premier Alexei Kosygin invites the leaders of India and Pakistan to meet in the Soviet Union to negotiate.

title: India
event: Fighting resumes between Indian and Pakistani troops.

title: Aden
event: The British governor of Aden cancels the constitution and takes direct control of the protectorate, due to the bad security situation.

title: Yokohama
event: September 27 – The largest tanker ship at the time, ''Tokyo Maru'', is launched in Yokohama, Japan.

title: Philippines
event: September 28 – Taal Volcano in Luzon, Philippines, erupts, killing hundreds.

title: South Africa
event: At least 150 killed when a commuter train derails at the outskirts of Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.

title: Yankee Stadium (1923)
event: Pope Paul VI visits the United States.   He appears for a Mass in Yankee Stadium and makes a speech at the United Nations.

title: University of California Irvine
event: The University of California, Irvine opens its doors.

title: Cheshire
event: October 6 – Ian Brady, a 27-year-old stock clerk from Hyde in Cheshire, is arrested for allegedly hacking to death (with a hatchet) 17-year-old apprentice electrician Edward Evans at a house on the Hattersley housing estate.

title: Guam
event: October 7 – Seven Japanese fishing boats are sunk off Guam by super typhoon Carmen; 209 are killed.

title: International Olympic Committee
event: The International Olympic Committee admits East Germany as a member.

title: Yale University
event: Yale University presents the ''Vinland map''.

title: United Kingdom
event: The U.N. General Council recommends that the United Kingdom try everything to stop a rebellion in Rhodesia.

title: Manchester
event: Police find a girl's body on Saddleworth Moor near Oldham in Lancashire. The body is quickly identified as that of 10-year-old Lesley Ann Downey, who disappeared on Boxing Day the previous year from a fairground in the Ancoats area of Manchester. Ian Brady, arrested for the murder of a 17-year-old man in nearby Hattersley, is charged with murdering Lesley, as is his 23-year-old girlfriend Myra Hindley.

title: Ghana
event: The OAU meets in Accra, Ghana.

title: United Kingdom
event: African countries demand that the United Kingdom use force to prevent Rhodesia from declaring unilateral independence.

title: Saddleworth Moor
event: British police find the decomposed body of a boy on Saddleworth Moor.

title: Indiana
event: Police discover the body of Sylvia Likens in Indianapolis, Indiana.

title: Brazil
event: Brazilian president Humberto de Alencar Castelo Branco removes power from parliament, legal courts and opposition parties.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: In St. Louis, Missouri, the 630-foot-tall parabolic steel Gateway Arch is completed.

title: Alaska
event: An 80-kiloton nuclear device is detonated at Amchitka Island, Alaska as part of the Vela Uniform program, code-named Project Long Shot.

title: Da Nang
event: Vietnam War: Near Da Nang, United States Marines repel an intense attack by Viet Cong forces, killing 56 guerrillas. A sketch of Marine positions is found on the dead body of a 13-year-old Vietnamese boy who sold drinks to the Marines the day before.

title: Cairo
event: November 1 – A trolleybus plunges into the Nile at Cairo killing 74 passengers.

title: New York City
event: Republican John Lindsay is elected mayor of New York City.

title: The Pentagon
event: Quaker Norman Morrison, 32, sets himself on fire in front of The Pentagon.

title: Farquhar Group
event: The British Indian Ocean Territory is created, consisting of Chagos Archipelago, Aldabra, Farquhar and Des Roches islands (on June 23, 1976 Aldabra, Farquhar and Des Roches are returned to the Seychelles).

title: New York City
event: Vietnam War: In New York City, 22-year-old Catholic Worker Movement member Roger Allen LaPorte sets himself on fire in front of the United Nations building in protest of the war.

title: Nassau Bahamas
event: November 13 – The ''SS Yarmouth Castle'' burns and sinks 60 miles off Nassau, with the loss of 90 lives.

title: North Vietnam
event: November 14 – Vietnam War – Battle of the Ia Drang: In the Ia Drang Valley of the Central Highlands in Vietnam, the first major engagement of the war between regular United States and North Vietnamese forces begins.

title: Kazakhstan
event: November 16 – Venera program: The Soviet Union launches the ''Venera 3'' space probe from Baikonur, Kazakhstan toward Venus (on March 1, 1966 it became the first spacecraft to reach the surface of another planet).

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: November 24 – Congolese lieutenant general Mobutu ousts Joseph Kasavubu and declares himself president.

title: France
event: November 26 – At the Hammaguira launch facility in the Sahara Desert, France launches a Diamant-A rocket with its first satellite, ''Asterix-1'' on board, becoming the third country to enter outer space.

title: White House
event: Tens of thousands of Vietnam War protesters picket the White House, then march on the Washington Monument.

title: The Pentagon
event: Vietnam War: The Pentagon tells U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson that if planned major sweep operations to neutralize Viet Cong forces during the next year are to succeed, the number of American troops in Vietnam will have to be increased from 120,000 to 400,000.

title: Philippines
event: November 28 – Vietnam War: In response to U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson's call for more flags in Vietnam, Philippines President-elect Ferdinand Marcos announces he will send troops to help fight in South Vietnam.

title: India
event: December 1 – The Border Security Force is established in India as a special force to guard the borders.

title: United Kingdom
event: Members of the Organization of African Unity decide to sever diplomatic relations with the United Kingdom, unless the British government ends the rebellion of Rhodesia by mid-December.

title: United Kingdom
event: Tanzania and Guinea sever diplomatic relations with the United Kingdom.

title: Gemini 7
event: ''Gemini 6'' and ''Gemini 7'' perform the first controlled rendezvous in Earth orbit.

title: North Vietnam
event: The Soviet Union announces that it has shipped rockets to North Vietnam.

title: Yemen
event: December 25 – The Yemeni Nasserite Unionist People's Organisation is founded in Taiz.

title: North Sea
event: December 27 – The British oil platform ''Sea Gem'' collapses in the North Sea.

title: Americas
event: In or about this year, one person returning to Haiti from the Congo is thought to have first brought HIV to the Americas.

title: New York City
event: January 2 – A strike of public transportation workers in New York City begins (it will end January 13).

title: India
event: The prime ministers of India and Pakistan meet in Moscow.

title: France
event: A gas leak fire at the Feyzin oil refinery near Lyon, France kills 18 and injures 84.

title: Tashkent
event: Pakistani-Indian peace negotiations end successfully in Tashkent.

title: Nigeria
event: A conference on Rhodesia begins in Lagos, Nigeria.

title: Nigeria
event: January 15 – A bloody military coup is staged in Nigeria, deposing the civilian government.

title: 1966 Palomares B-52 crash
event: A B-52 bomber collides with a KC-135 Stratotanker over Spain, dropping three 70-kiloton hydrogen bombs near the town of Palomares, and 1 into the sea, in the 1966 Palomares B-52 crash.

title: Aldo Moro
event: January 21 – Italian Prime Minister Aldo Moro resigns due to a power struggle in his party.

title: Nigeria
event: The military government of Nigeria announces that ex-prime minister Abubakar Tafawa Balewa was killed during the coup.

title: Sudan
event: The Chadian Muslim insurgent group FROLINAT is founded in Sudan, starting the Chadian Civil War.

title: Australia
event: Harold Holt becomes Prime Minister of Australia when Robert Menzies retires.

title: New York City
event: January 29 – The first of 608 performances of ''Sweet Charity'' opens at the Palace Theatre in New York City.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 31 – The United Kingdom ceases all trade with Rhodesia.

title: Tokyo
event: February 4 – All Nippon Airways Flight 60 plunges into Tokyo Bay; 133 are killed.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 19 – The naval minister of the United Kingdom, Christopher Mayhew, resigns.

title: Ghana
event: February 24 – A military coup in Ghana raises sacked General Ankrah to power while president Kwame Nkrumah is abroad.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: February 28 – U.S. astronauts Charles Bassett and Elliott See are killed in an aircraft accident in St. Louis, Missouri.

title: Guinea
event: March 2 – Kwame Nkrumah arrives in Guinea and is granted asylum.

title: Canadian Pacific Airlines Flight 402
event: March 4 – Canadian Pacific Airlines Flight 402 crashes while landing at Tokyo International Airport in Japan, killing 64 of 72 persons on board.

title: Brazil
event: A massive theft of nuclear materials is revealed in Brazil.

title: France
event: March 7 – Charles De Gaulle asks U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson for negotiations about the state of NATO equipment in France.

title: Nelson's Pillar
event: An Irish Republican Army bomb destroys Nelson's Pillar in Dublin.

title: NATO
event: French President Charles De Gaulle states that French troops will be taken out of NATO and that all French NATO bases and HQ's must be closed within a year.

title: Gemini 8
event: March 16 – ''Gemini 8'' (David Scott, Neil Armstrong) docks with an Agena target vehicle.

title: Kentucky
event: March 19 – The Texas Western Miners defeat the Kentucky Wildcats with 5 African-American starters, ushering in desegregation in athletic recruiting.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 7 – The United Kingdom asks the United Nations Security Council for authority to use force to stop oil tankers that violate the embargo against Rhodesia (authority is given April 10).

title: Parliament of the United Kingdom
event: The opening of the Parliament of the United Kingdom is televised for the first time.

title: Jamaica
event: Haile Selassie visits Jamaica for the first time, meeting with Rastafarian leaders.

title: Vatican City
event: April 27 – Pope Paul VI and Soviet Foreign Minister Andrei Gromyko meet in the Vatican (the first meeting between leaders of the Roman Catholic Church and the Soviet Union).

title: Channel Tunnel
event: Regular hovercraft service begins over the English Channel (discontinued in 2000 due to the Channel Tunnel).

title: North America
event: Uniform daylight saving time is first observed in most parts of North America.

title: Finland
event: May 1 – Floods occur on the Finnish coast.

title: Fiat
event: May 4 – Fiat signs a contract with the Soviet government to build a car factory in the Soviet Union.

title: Busch Memorial Stadium
event: The Busch Memorial Stadium opens in St Louis, Missouri.

title: Yunnan
event: Radio Peking claims that U.S. planes have shot down a Chinese plane over Yunnan (the U.S. denies the story the next day).

title: Greece
event: May 14 – Turkey and Greece intend to start negotiations about the situation in Cyprus.

title: Da Nang
event: The South Vietnamese army besieges Da Nang.

title: White House
event: Tens of thousands of anti-war demonstrators again picket the White House, then rally at the Washington Monument.

title: New York City
event: In New York City, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. makes his first public speech on the Vietnam War.

title: Uganda
event: Ugandan army troops arrest Mutesa II of Buganda and occupy his palace.

title: Nigeria
event: The Nigerian government forbids all political activity in the country until January 17, 1969.

title: St. Louis Missouri
event: In St. Louis, Missouri, U.S. Vice-President Hubert Humphrey and U.S. Secretary of the Interior Stewart Udall dedicate the Gateway Arch, as part of the Jefferson National Expansion Memorial.

title: Guyana
event: May 26 – Guyana achieves independence.

title: Philippines
event: May 31 – The Philippines reestablishes diplomatic relations with Malaysia.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: Four former cabinet ministers are executed in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, for alleged involvement in a plot to kill Mobutu Sese Seko.

title: Mississippi
event: June 6 – Civil rights activist James Meredith is shot while trying to march across Mississippi.

title: NASA
event: An XB-70 Valkyrie prototype is destroyed in a mid-air collision with a F-104 Starfighter chase plane during a photo shoot. NASA pilot Joseph A. Walker and USAF test pilot Carl Cross are both killed.

title: Topeka Kansas
event: Topeka, Kansas is devastated by a tornado that registers as an F5 on the Fujita Scale, the first to exceed US $100 million in damages.  Sixteen people are killed, hundreds more injured, and thousands of homes damaged or destroyed.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: June 13 – ''Miranda v. Arizona'': The Supreme Court of the United States rules that the police must inform suspects of their rights before questioning them.

title: Argentina
event: June 28 – In Argentina, a junta deposes president Arturo Umberto Illia in a coup, and appoints General Juan Carlos Onganía to lead.

title: United Kingdom
event: A sailors' strike, organised by the National Union of Seamen, ends in the United Kingdom.

title: NATO
event: France formally leaves NATO.

title: North Vietnam
event: North Vietnam declares general mobilization.

title: Malawi
event: July 6 – Malawi becomes a republic.

title: 1966 FIFA World Cup
event: July 11 – The 1966 FIFA World Cup begins in England.

title: Jordan River
event: Israeli and Syrian jet fighters clash over the Jordan River.

title: United Kingdom
event: Gwynfor Evans becomes member of Parliament for Carmarthen, the first Plaid Cymru MP in the UK.

title: Gemini 10
event: ''Gemini 10'' (John Young, Michael Collins) is launched. After docking with an Agena target vehicle, the astronauts then set a world altitude record of 474 miles (763 km).

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: July 23 – Katangese troops in Stanleyville, Congo, revolt for several weeks in support of the exiled minister Moise Tshombe.

title: House of Lords
event: July 26 – Lord Gardiner issues the Practice Statement in the House of Lords, stating that the House is not bound to follow its own previous precedent.

title: Nigeria
event: Nigerian army officers from the north of the country rebel and execute head of state General Aguiyi-Ironsi.

title: Wembley Stadium (1923)
event: July 30 – England beats West Germany 4–2 to win the 1966 FIFA World Cup at Wembley after extra time.

title: University of Texas at Austin
event: Sniper Charles Whitman kills 13 people and wounds 31 from atop the University of Texas at Austin Main Building tower, after earlier killing his wife and mother.

title: Nigeria
event: A military coup occurs in Nigeria; General Yakubu Gowon takes over.

title: Las Vegas Strip
event: Caesars Palace hotel and casino opens in Las Vegas.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Beatles release the legendary ''Revolver'' album in the United Kingdom.

title: Falls City Nebraska
event: Braniff Airlines Flight 250 crashes in Falls City, Nebraska, killing all 42 on board.

title: Bolivia
event: Rene Barrientos takes office as the president of Bolivia.

title: Portugal
event: The Salazar Bridge (now the 25 de Abril Bridge) opens in Lisbon, Portugal.

title: London
event: August 12 – Massacre of Braybrook Street: Harry Roberts, John Duddy and Jack Witney shoot dead 3 plainclothes policemen in London; they are later sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: People's Republic of China
event: In the People's Republic of China, Mao Zedong begins the Cultural Revolution to purge and reorganize China's Communist Party.

title: Sea of Galilee
event: Syrian and Israeli troops clash over Lake Kinneret (also known as the Sea of Galilee) for 3 hours.

title: Yemen
event: August 17 – Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Republic begin negotiations in Kuwait to end the war in Yemen.

title: Battle of Long Tan
event: August 18 – Vietnam War – Battle of Long Tan: D Company, 6th Battalion of the Royal Australian Regiment, meets and defeats a Viet Cong force estimated to be 4 times larger, at the  in Phuoc Tuy Province, Republic of Vietnam.

title: Candlestick Park
event: August 29 – The Beatles end their US tour with a concert at Candlestick Park in San Francisco, California. It is their last-ever live performance, except for the short rooftop concert at the Apple Corps offices in January 1969.

title: France
event: August 30 – France offers independence to French Somaliland.

title: Yugoslavia
event: 98 British tourists die in an air crash in Ljubljana, Yugoslavia.

title: South Africa
event: September 6 – In Cape Town, the South African architect of Apartheid, Prime Minister Hendrik Verwoerd, is stabbed to death by Dimitri Tsafendas during a parliamentary meeting.

title: NATO
event: September 9 – NATO decides to move SHAPE headquarters to Belgium.

title: Gemini 11
event: ''Gemini 11'' (Richard Gordon, Pete Conrad) docks with an Agena target vehicle.

title: New York City
event: The Metropolitan Opera House opens at Lincoln Center in New York City to the world premiere of Samuel Barber's opera, ''Antony and Cleopatra''.

title: Scotland Yard
event: September 19 – Scotland Yard arrests Buster Edwards, suspected of involvement in the Great Train Robbery.

title: Spandau Prison
event: Baldur von Schirach and Albert Speer are released from Spandau Prison.

title: Botswana
event: Botswana achieves independence.

title: West Coast Airlines Flight 956
event: October 1 – West Coast Airlines Flight 956 crashes with 18 fatal injuries and no survivors {{convert5.5mikm}} south of Wemme, Oregon. This accident marks the first loss of a DC-9.

title: United Arab Republic
event: October 3 – Tunisia severs diplomatic relations with the United Arab Republic.

title: Israel
event: Israel applies for the membership of the EEC.

title: Lesotho
event: Basutoland becomes independent and takes the name Lesotho.

title: UNESCO
event: UNESCO signs the Recommendation Concerning the Status of Teachers. This event is now celebrated as World Teachers' Day.

title: France
event: October 11 – France and the Soviet Union sign a treaty for cooperation in nuclear research.

title: Montreal
event: October 14 – The city of Montreal inaugurates its metro system (see Montreal Metro).

title: Botswana
event: October 17 – Lesotho and Botswana are admitted to the United Nations.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Aberfan disaster occurs in South Wales, United Kingdom.

title: Wormwood Scrubs (HM Prison)
event: British spy George Blake escapes from Wormwood Scrubs prison; he is next seen in Moscow.

title: Gibraltar
event: Spain demands that the United Kingdom stop military flights to Gibraltar; Britain refuses the next day.

title: Philippines
event: October 24 – Negotiations about the Vietnam War begin in Manila, Philippines.

title: Gibraltar
event: Spain closes its Gibraltar border to non-pedestrian traffic.

title: Brussels
event: October 26 – NATO moves its HQ from Paris to Brussels.

title: South Africa
event: October 27 – The United Nations takes Namibia from South Africa.

title: Ghana
event: October 29 – The Guinean delegation to the OAU meeting in Ethiopia, become hostages of the Ghanaian government in Accra.

title: United Kingdom
event: November 5 – Thirty-eight African states demand that the United Kingdom use force against the Rhodesian government.

title: Massachusetts
event: Former Massachusetts Attorney General Edward Brooke becomes the first African American elected to the United States Senate since Reconstruction.

title: California
event: Actor Ronald Reagan, is elected Governor of California.

title: Indica Gallery
event: November 9 – John Lennon meets Yoko Ono at the Indica Gallery.

title: West Bank
event: A mine kills 3 Israeli paratroopers on the West Bank border.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: ''Gemini 12'' (James A. Lovell, Buzz Aldrin), splashes down safely in the Atlantic Ocean, 600 km east of the Bahamas.

title: London
event: Harry Maurice Roberts, who killed 3 policemen in August, is caught near London.

title: Arizona
event: A spectacular Leonid meteor shower passes over Arizona, at the rate of 2,300 a minute for 20 minutes.

title: Vancouver
event: November 26 – In Vancouver, the Saskatchewan Roughriders defeat the Ottawa Rough Riders to win the 54th Grey Cup.

title: Barbados
event: November 30 – Barbados achieves independence.

title: Macau
event: December 3 – Anti-Portuguese demonstrations occur in Macau; a curfew is declared the next day.

title: Barbados
event: Barbados is admitted to the United Nations.

title: Crete
event: December 8 – The Typaldos Line's ferry ''Heraklion'' sinks in rough seas, in the Aegean Sea near Crete, leaving 217 dead.

title: South Africa
event: December 17 – South Africa does not join the trade embargo against Rhodesia.

title: California State University Long Beach
event: December 26 – The first Kwanzaa is celebrated by Maulana Karenga, founder of Organization US (a black nationalist group) and later chair of Black Studies, at California State University, Long Beach from 1989 to 2002.

title: London
event: Thieves steal millions' worth of paintings from the Dulwich Art Gallery in London.

title: Israel
event: June – Moshe Dayan becomes Israel's Secretary of Defense.

title: Albania
event: Albania is officially declared an atheist state by its leader, Enver Hoxha.

title: University of Winnipeg
event: The University of Winnipeg is founded in Canada.

title: Arizona
event: Lonsdaleite (the rarest allotrope of carbon) is first discovered in the Barringer Crater, Arizona.

title: Santorini
event: A lost city is discovered on the island of Thera, buried under volcanic debris. It has been suggested that Plato may have heard legends about this, and used them as the germ of his story of Atlantis.

title: Gdańsk
event: Lech Wałęsa goes to work in Gdańsk shipyards.

title: Israel
event: Benjamin Netanyahu joins the Israeli Army.

title: Greece
event: The Greek military junta exiles Melina Mercouri.

title: United Kingdom
event: Parker Morris Standards become mandatory for all housing built in New Towns in the UK.

title: Georgia (U.S. state)
event: January 10 – Segregationist Lester Maddox is sworn in as Governor of Georgia.

title: Golden Gate Park
event: The Human Be-In takes place in Golden Gate Park, San Francisco; the event sets the stage for the Summer of Love.

title: Kenya
event: Louis Leakey announces the discovery of pre-human fossils in Kenya; he names the species ''Kenyapithecus africanus''.

title: United Kingdom
event: The United Kingdom enters the first round of negotiations for European Economic Community membership in Rome.

title: Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum
event: Super Bowl I: The Green Bay Packers defeat the Kansas City Chiefs 35–10 at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum.

title: Parliament of the United Kingdom
event: January 26 – The Parliament of the United Kingdom decides to nationalize 90% of the British steel industry.

title: Apollo 1
event: ''Apollo 1'': U.S. astronauts Gus Grissom, Edward Higgins White, and Roger Chaffee are killed when fire breaks out in their Apollo spacecraft during a launch pad test.

title: United Kingdom
event: The United States, Soviet Union and United Kingdom sign the Outer Space Treaty.

title: Australia
event: February 3 – Ronald Ryan becomes the last man hanged in Australia, for murdering a guard while escaping from prison in December 1965.

title: NASA
event: NASA launches ''Lunar Orbiter 3''.

title: Italy
event: Italy's first guided missile cruiser, the ''Vittorio Veneto (C550)'', is launched.

title: Nicaragua
event: General Anastasio Somoza Debayle becomes president of Nicaragua.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 6 – Alexei Kosygin arrives in the UK for an 8-day visit. He meets the Queen on February 9.

title: Tasmania
event: Serious bushfires in southern Tasmania claim 62 lives, and destroys 2,642.7 square kilometres (653,025.4 acres) of land.

title: Australia
event: Mazenod College, Victoria opens in Australia.

title: New Orleans
event: February 18 – New Orleans District Attorney Jim Garrison claims he will solve the John F. Kennedy assassination, and that a conspiracy was planned in New Orleans.

title: Jamaica
event: Donald Sangster becomes the new Prime Minister of Jamaica, succeeding Alexander Bustamante.

title: Organization of American States
event: Trinidad and Tobago is the first Commonwealth nation to join the Organization of American States.

title: Kazakhstan
event: February 26 – A Soviet nuclear test is conducted at the Semipalatinsk Test Site, Eastern Kazakhstan.

title: Saitama Prefecture
event: The city of Hatogaya, Saitama, Japan is founded.

title: Sobibor extermination camp
event: Brazilian police arrest Franc Paul Stangli, ex-commander of Treblinka and Sobibór concentration camps.

title: Queen Elizabeth Hall
event: The Queen Elizabeth Hall is opened in London.

title: North Sea
event: The first North Sea gas is pumped ashore at Easington, East Riding of Yorkshire.

title: Wembley Stadium (1923)
event: Queens Park Rangers become the first 3rd Division side to win the League Cup at Wembley Stadium, defeating West Bromwich Albion 3–2.

title: Arlington National Cemetery
event: The body of U.S. President John F. Kennedy is moved to a permanent burial place at Arlington National Cemetery.

title: Greece
event: March 16 – In the Aspida case in Greece, 15 officers are sentenced to 2–18 years in prison, accused of treason and intentions of staging a coup.

title: Land's End
event: March 18 – The supertanker ''Torrey Canyon'' runs aground in between Land's End and the Scilly Isles.

title: Sierra Leone
event: March 21 – A military coup takes place in Sierra Leone.

title: Torrey Canyon
event: Fleet Air Arm and Royal Air Force bomb the ''Torrey Canyon'' and sink her.

title: Aden
event: April 2 – A United Nations delegation arrives in Aden due to approaching independence. They leave April 7, accusing British authorities of lack of cooperation. The British say the delegation did not contact them.

title: New York City
event: April 4 – Martin Luther King, Jr. denounces the Vietnam War during a religious service in New York City.

title: Israel
event: April 7 – Six Day War (approach): Israeli fighters shoot down 7 Syrian MIG-21s.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 8 – ''Puppet On A String'' by Sandie Shaw (music and text by Bill Martin and Phil Coulter) wins the Eurovision Song Contest 1967 for United Kingdom.

title: Ahmanson Theatre
event: April 12 – The Ahmanson Theatre opens in Los Angeles.

title: New York City
event: April 15 – Large demonstrations are held against the Vietnam War in New York City and San Francisco.

title: Nicosia
event: A Globe Air Bristol Britannia turboprop crashes at Nicosia, Cyprus, killing 126 people.url=http://www.planecrashinfo.com/1967/1967-31.htmwork=archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5gX4LEIUgarchivedate=2009-05-04deadurl=noaccessdate=2009-04-06}}<[http://aviation-safety.net/database/record.php?id=19670420-1&lang=en]

title: Greece
event: Greece is taken over by a military dictatorship led by George Papadopoulos; ex-Prime Minister Andreas Papandreou political prisoner to December 25.

title: Oak Lawn Illinois
event: An outbreak of tornadoes strikes the upper Midwest section of the United States (in particular the Chicago area, including the suburbs of Belvidere and Oak Lawn, Illinois, where 33 people are killed and 500 injured).

title: Soyuz 1
event: April 24 – ''Soyuz 1'': Vladimir Komarov becomes the first Soviet cosmonaut to die, when the parachute of his space capsule fails during re-entry.

title: Quebec
event: April 27 – Montreal, Quebec, Expo 67, a World's Fair to coincide with the Canadian Confederation centennial, officially opens with Prime Minister Lester B. Pearson igniting the Expo Flame in the Place des Nations.

title: United Kingdom
event: Harold Wilson announces that the United Kingdom has decided to apply for EEC membership.

title: India
event: Dr. Zakir Hussain is the first Muslim to become president of India.

title: Philippines
event: May 8 – The Philippine province of Davao is split into three: Davao del Norte, Davao del Sur, and Davao Oriental.

title: Ireland
event: May 11 – The United Kingdom and Ireland apply officially for European Economic Community membership.

title: Israel
event: Syria mobilizes against Israel.

title: Scopes Trial
event: Tennessee Governor Ellington repeals the Monkey Law (officially the Butler Act; see the Scopes Trial).

title: Guerrero
event: In Mexico, schoolteacher Lucio Cabañas begins guerrilla warfare in Atoyac de Alvarez, west of Acapulco, in the state of Guerrero.

title: Apollo 7
event: NASA announces the crew for the ''Apollo 7'' space mission (first manned Apollo flight): Walter M. Schirra, Jr., Donn F. Eisele, and R. Walter Cunningham.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Soviet Union ratifies a treaty with the United States and the United Kingdom, banning nuclear weapons from outer space.

title: Brussels
event: May 22 – The ''Innovation'' department store in the centre of Brussels, Belgium burns down. It is the most devastating fire in Belgian history, resulting in 323 dead and missing and 150 injured.

title: Red Sea
event: May 23 – Egypt closes the Straits of Tiran to Israeli shipping, blockading Israel's southern port of Eilat, and Israel's entire Red Sea coastline.

title: United Kingdom
event: Scotland's Celtic defeats Italy's Inter Milan in the European Cup Final to become the first British football team to win in Europe.

title: London
event: May 28 – The Folk-Rock band Fairport Convention plays their first gig in London.

title: Nigeria
event: May 30 – Biafra, in eastern Nigeria, announces its independence.

title: Stockport
