event: October 29 – The Black September group hijacks a Lufthansa Boeing 727 over Turkey, demanding the release of 3 comrades still held for the massacre of Israeli athletes at the Olympic Games.

title: Raidió Teilifís Éireann
event: November 19 – Seán Mac Stíofáin, a leader of the Provisional Irish Republican Army, is arrested in Dublin after giving an interview to RTÉ.

title: France
event: November 28 – The last executions in Paris, France. Roger Bontems and Claude Buffet – the Clairvaux Mutineers – were guillotined at La Sante Prison by chief executioner Andre Obrecht (already suffering from Parkinson's Disease). Bontems had been found innocent of murder by the court, but as Buffet's accomplice was condemned to death anyway. President Georges Pompidou, in private an abolitionist, upheld both death sentences in deference to  French public opinion.

title: White House
event: Vietnam War: White House Press Secretary Ron Ziegler tells the press that there will be no more public announcements concerning United States troop withdrawals from Vietnam due to the fact that troop levels are now down to 27,000.

title: United Kingdom
event: Cod War: British Foreign Secretary Sir Alec Douglas-Home says that Royal Navy ships will be stationed to protect British trawlers off Iceland.

title: Apollo 17
event: ''Apollo 17'' (Gene Cernan, Ronald Evans, Harrison Schmitt), the last manned Moon mission to date, is launched.

title: Belfast
event: The Provisional Irish Republican Army kidnaps Jean McConville in Belfast.

title: Apollo 17
event: December 11 – Apollo 17 lands on the Moon.

title: Apollo 17
event: December 14 – Apollo program: Eugene Cernan is the last person to walk on the moon, after he and Harrison Schmitt complete the third and final Extra-vehicular activity (EVA) of Apollo 17. This is the last manned mission to the moon of the 20th Century.

title: Australia
event: The Commonwealth of Australia ordains equal pay for women.

title: Portugal
event: The Portuguese army kills 400 Africans in Tete, Mozambique.

title: Apollo 17
event: December 19 – Apollo program: ''Apollo 17'' returns to Earth, concluding the program of lunar exploration.

title: Nicaragua
event: Two small earthquakes are felt at about 9:30 and 10:15 local time in Managua, Nicaragua.

title: Nicaragua
event: A 6.25 Richter scale  earthquake in Nicaragua kills 5,000–12,000 people in the capital, Managua; President Somoza is later accused of pocketing millions of dollars worth of foreign aid intended for relief.

title: Kansas City Missouri
event: December 26 – Former United States President Harry S. Truman dies in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Everglades
event: December 29 – Eastern Air Lines Flight 401 crashes into the Everglades in Florida, killing 101 of 176 onboard.

title: United Kingdom
event: The National House Building Council is formed in the United Kingdom.

title: Switzerland
event: The COSC The Swiss Official Chronometer testing Institute is founded in Switzerland by 5 Watch Cantons & Federation of the Swiss Watch Industry FH.

title: People's Republic of China
event: Confirming the descriptions of bulkhead hull compartments for Chinese sailing ships in Zhu Yu's ''Pingzhou Table Talks'' of 1119 A.D., a large Song Dynasty trade ship of c. 1277 A.D. is dredged up from the waters near the southern coast of China that had 12 bulkhead compartment rooms in its hull.

title: Denmark
event: The United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland and Denmark enter the ''European Economic Community'', which later becomes the European Union.

title: Hawaii
event: Elvis Presley's concert in Hawaii. The first worldwide telecast by an entertainer watched by more people than watched the Apollo moon landings.

title: North Vietnam
event: January 15 – Vietnam War: Citing progress in peace negotiations, U.S. President  Richard Nixon announces the suspension of offensive action in North Vietnam.

title: Philippines
event: January 17 – Ferdinand Marcos becomes President for Life of the Philippines.

title: Derbyshire
event: January 18 – Eleven Labour Party councillors in Clay Cross, Derbyshire, England, are ordered to pay £6,985 for not enforcing the Housing Finance Act.

title: Denmark
event: January 21 – The Communist League is founded in Denmark.

title: Nigeria
event: A Royal Jordanian Boeing 707 flight from Jeddah crashes in Kano, Nigeria; 176 people are killed.

title: Stonewall Texas
event: Former U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson dies at his Stonewall, Texas ranch, leaving no former U.S. President living until the resignation of Richard M. Nixon in 1974.

title: Heimaey
event: Eldfell on the Icelandic island of Heimaey erupts.

title: CN Tower
event: February 6 – Toronto: Construction on the CN Tower begins.

title: Ohio
event: February 12 – Ohio becomes the first U.S. state to post distance in metric on signs (see Metric system in the United States).

title: Court of Appeal of England and Wales
event: February 16 – The Court of Appeal of England and Wales rules that the ''Sunday Times'' can publish articles on Thalidomide and Distillers Company Limited, despite ongoing legal actions by parents (the decision is overturned in July by the House of Lords).

title: Israel
event: February 21 – Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 114 (Boeing 727) is shot down by Israeli fighter aircraft over the Sinai Desert, after the passenger plane is suspected of being an enemy military plane. Only 5 (1 crew member and 4 passengers) of 113 survive.

title: People's Republic of China
event: February 22 – Sino-American relations: Following President Richard Nixon's visit to mainland China, the United States and the People's Republic of China agree to establish liaison offices.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 26 – Edward Heath's British government publishes a Green Paper on prices and incomes policy.

title: Wounded Knee South Dakota
event: February 27 – The American Indian Movement occupies Wounded Knee, South Dakota.

title: Republic of Ireland
event: The Republic of Ireland general election is held.

title: Parliament of the United Kingdom
event: March 1 – Dick Taverne, having resigned from the Parliament of the United Kingdom on leaving the Labour Party, is re-elected as a 'Democratic Labour' candidate.

title: Wembley Stadium (1923)
event: March 3 – Tottenham Hotspur wins the Football League Cup final at Wembley, beating Norwich City 1–0.

title: United Kingdom
event: In the 'Border Poll', voters in Northern Ireland vote to remain part of the United Kingdom. Irish nationalists are encouraged to boycott the referendum.

title: Old Bailey
event: Provisional Irish Republican Army bombs explode in Whitehall and the Old Bailey in England.

title: Bermuda
event: March 10 – Sir Richard Sharples, Governor of Bermuda, is assassinated in Government House.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 20 – A British government White Paper on Northern Ireland proposes the re-establishment of an Assembly elected by proportional representation, with a possible All-Ireland council.

title: Lofthouse Colliery disaster
event: March 21 – The Lofthouse Colliery disaster occurs in Great Britain.

title: New York City
event: April 3 – The first handheld cellular phone call is made by Martin Cooper in New York City.

title: New York City
event: April 4 – The World Trade Center officially opens in New York City with a ribbon cutting ceremony.

title: Beirut
event: April 10 – Israeli commandos raid Beirut, assassinating 3 leaders of the Palestinian Resistance Movement. The Lebanese army's inaction brings the immediate resignation of Prime Minister Saib Salam, a Sunni Muslim.

title: Rochester New York
event: Federal Express officially begins operations, with the launch of 14 small aircraft from Memphis International Airport. On that night, Federal Express delivers 186 packages to 25 U.S. cities from Rochester, New York, to Miami, Florida.

title: Broken Hill New South Wales
event: April 20 – An Indian Pacific train en route to Perth, derails near Broken Hill, New South Wales, destroying a quarter mile of track.

title: County Waterford
event: April 28 – Six Irishmen, including Joe Cahill, are arrested by the Irish Naval Service off County Waterford, on board a coaster carrying 5 tons of weapons destined for the Provisional Irish Republican Army.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 1 – An estimated 1,600,000 workers in the United Kingdom stop work in support of a Trade Union Congress day of national protest and stoppage against the Government's anti-inflation policy.

title: Wounded Knee South Dakota
event: May 8 – A 71-day standoff between federal authorities and American Indian Movement activists who were occupying the Pine Ridge Reservation at Wounded Knee, South Dakota, ends with the surrender of the militants. American Indian Movement

title: United Kingdom
event: May 18 – Cod War: Joseph Godber, British Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food, announces that Royal Navy frigates will protect British trawlers fishing in the disputed 50-mile limit round Iceland.

title: Skylab 2
event: ''Skylab 2'' (Pete Conrad, Paul Weitz, Joseph Kerwin) is launched on a mission to repair damage to the recently launched ''Skylab'' space station.

title: Greece
event: June 1 – The Greek military junta abolishes the monarchy and proclaims a republic.

title: Tupolev Tu-144
event: June 3 – A Tupolev Tu-144 crashes at the Paris air show; 15 are killed., Marriage of amitabh bachchan & jaya ( both bollywood stars(JUNE 3, 1973 ).

title: Argentina
event: June 20 – The Ezeiza massacre occurs in Buenos Aires, Argentina.   Snipers shoot on left-wing Peronists, killing at least 13 and injuring more than 300.

title: Federal Bureau of Investigation
event: June 22 – W. Mark Felt (Deep Throat) retires from the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Kingston upon Hull
event: June 23 – A house fire in Kingston upon Hull, England, which kills a 6-year-old boy is passed off as an accident; it later emerges as the first of 26 fire deaths caused over the next 7 years by arsonist Peter Dinsdale.

title: White House
event: Watergate scandal: Former White House counsel John Dean begins his testimony before the Senate Watergate Committee.

title: Plesetsk Cosmodrome
event: June 26 – At Plesetsk Cosmodrome, 9 persons are killed in the explosion of a Cosmos 3-M rocket.

title: Kingman Arizona
event: The catastrophic BLEVE (Boiling Liquid Expanding Vapor Explosion) in Kingman, Arizona, following a fire that broke out as propane was being transferred from a railroad car to a storage tank, kills 11 firefighters.  This explosion has become a classic incident, studied in fire department training programs worldwide.

title: St Andrew's Cathedral Singapore
event: July 6 – St Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore is gazetted as a national monument.

title: France
event: July 11 – Varig Flight 820 crashes near Orly, France; 123 are killed.

title: White House
event: July 16 – Watergate Scandal: Former White House aide Alexander Butterfield informs the United States Senate Watergate Committee that President Richard Nixon had secretly recorded potentially incriminating conversations.

title: New Zealand
event: July 20 – France resumes nuclear bomb tests in Mururoa Atoll, over the protests of Australia and New Zealand. Bruce Lee dies.

title: Bogotá
event: July 23 – The Avianca Building in Bogotá, Colombia suffers a serious fire.

title: Skylab 3
event: ''Skylab 3'' (Owen Garriott, Jack Lousma, Alan Bean) is launched, to conduct various medical and scientific experiments aboard ''Skylab''.

title: Summerland disaster
event: August 2 – A flash fire kills 51 at the Summerland amusement centre at Douglas, Isle of Man.{{noMention}}

title: Tokyo
event: South Korean politician Kim Dae-Jung is kidnapped in Tokyo by the KCIA.

title: United Kingdom
event: September 3 – The British Trade Union Congress expels 20 members for registering under the Industrial Relations Act 1971.

title: Texas
event: September 20 – ''The Battle of the Sexes'': Billie Jean King defeats Bobby Riggs in a televised tennis match, 6–4, 6–4, 6–3, at the Astrodome in Houston, Texas.

title: Soyuz 11
event: September 27 – Soviet space program: Soyuz 12, the first Soviet manned flight since the Soyuz 11 tragedy in 1971, is launched.

title: New York City
event: September 28 – ITT is bombed in New York City by leftist terrorists protesting the restoration of the Chilean Constitution ordered by the Chilean judicial and legislative branches against the Allende administration.

title: Golan Heights
event: October 6 – Yom Kippur War: The fourth and largest Arab–Israeli conflict begins, as Egyptian and Syrian forces attack Israeli forces in the Sinai Peninsula and Golan Heights on Yom Kippur.

title: London
event: October 8 – LBC Radio  begins broadcasting on 97.3 FM in London.

title: Maryland
event: Spiro T. Agnew resigns as Vice President of the United States and then, in federal court in Baltimore, Maryland, pleads no contest to charges of income tax evasion on $29,500 he received in 1967, while he was governor of Maryland. He is fined $10,000 and put on 3 years' probation.

title: Sydney Opera House
event: The Sydney Opera House is opened by Elizabeth II after 14 years of construction work.

title: Fremont County Colorado
event: October 27 – The Canon City meteorite, a 1.4 kilogram chondrite type meteorite, strikes Earth in Fremont County, Colorado.

title: Istanbul
event: October 30 – The Bosporus Bridge in Istanbul, Turkey is completed, connecting the continents of Europe and Asia over the Bosporus for the first time in history.

title: Republic of Ireland
event: October 31 – Mountjoy Prison helicopter escape: Three Provisional Irish Republican Army members escape from Mountjoy Prison, Dublin, Republic of Ireland after a hijacked helicopter lands in the exercise yard.

title: NASA
event: Mariner program: NASA launches ''Mariner 10'' toward Mercury (on March 29, 1974 it becomes the first space probe to reach that planet).

title: Israel
event: November 11 – Egypt and Israel sign a United States-sponsored cease-fire accord.

title: Westminster Abbey
event: November 14 – In the United Kingdom, Princess Anne marries a commoner, Captain Mark Phillips, in Westminster Abbey (they divorce in 1992).

title: Cape Canaveral Florida
event: Skylab program: NASA launches ''Skylab 4'' (Gerald Carr, William Pogue, Edward Gibson) from Cape Canaveral, Florida on an 84-day mission.

title: Orlando Florida
event: Watergate scandal: In Orlando, Florida, U.S. President Richard Nixon tells 400 Associated Press managing editors I am not a crook.

title: Greece
event: The Athens Polytechnic uprising occurs against the military regime in Athens, Greece.

title: White House
event: November 21 – U.S. President Richard Nixon's attorney, J. Fred Buzhardt, reveals the existence of an 18½-minute gap in one of the White House tape recordings related to Watergate.

title: Greece
event: November 25 – Greek dictator George Papadopoulos is ousted in a military coup led by Lieutenant General Phaidon Gizikis.

title: Australia
event: December 1 –  Papua New Guinea gains self government from Australia.

title: Madrid
event: December 20 – Spanish prime minister Luis Carrero Blanco is assassinated in Madrid by the terrorist organization ETA.

title: United Kingdom
event: December 31 – In the United Kingdom, due to coal shortages caused by industrial action, the Three-Day Week electricity consumption reduction measure comes into force.

title: China
event: March – The Terracotta Army of Qin Shi Huang is discovered at Xi'an, China.

title: Brazil
event: Fire breaks out in the Joelma Building in São Paulo, Brazil; 177 die, 293 are injured, 11 die later of their injuries.

title: Kuala Lumpur
event: Kuala Lumpur, the capital of Malaysia, was declared as a Federal Territory.

title: Skylab 4
event: February 8 – After a record 84 days in orbit, the crew of ''Skylab 4'' returns to Earth.

title: Cairo
event: February 17 – A soccer stampede occurs in Cairo, killing 49.

title: Turkish Airlines Flight 981
event: March 3 – A Turkish Airlines DC-10 travelling from Paris to London crashes in a wood near Paris, killing all 346 aboard. Turkish Airlines Flight 981.

title: France
event: March 8 – Charles de Gaulle Airport opens in Paris, France.

title: Philippines
event: March 10 – A Japanese World War II soldier, Second Lieutenant Hiroo Onoda, surrenders in the Philippines.

title: Portugal
event: April 25 – ''Carnation Revolution'': A coup in Portugal restores democracy.

title: Nepal
event: An all-female Japanese team summits Manaslu in Nepal, becoming the first women to climb an 8,000 metre peak.

title: India
event: Nuclear test: Under Project Smiling Buddha, India successfully detonates its first nuclear weapon, becoming the 6th nation to do so.

title: Warsaw radio mast
event: The Warsaw radio mast is completed, the tallest structure ever built (it collapses on August 8, 1991).

title: NASA
event: May 30 – NASA's ATS-6 satellite is launched.

title: Italy
event: August 4 – A bomb explodes in an Italicus Expressen train between Italy and West Germany. Italian neo-fascist terrorists take responsibility.

title: Yugoslavia
event: August 30 – An express train bound for Germany from Belgrade derails in Zagreb, Yugoslavia (now Croatia), killing more than 150 passengers.

title: Ionian Sea
event: September 8 – TWA Flight 841 crashes into the Ionian Sea 18 minutes after take off from Athens, after a bomb explodes in the cargo hold, and kills 88 people.

title: Zaire
event: October 30 – The Rumble in the Jungle takes place in Kinshasa, Zaire, where Muhammad Ali knocks out George Foreman in 8 rounds to regain the Heavyweight title, which had been stripped from him 7 years earlier.

title: Birmingham
event: November 21 – In Birmingham, England, 2 pubs are bombed, killing 21 people (the Birmingham Six are later sentenced to life in prison for this).

title: TWA Flight 514
event: December 1 – A Boeing 727 carrying TWA Flight 514 crashes 25 miles (40 km) northwest of Dulles International Airport during bad weather, killing all 92 people on board.

title: Darwin Northern Territory
event: December 24–25 – Darwin, Australia is almost completely destroyed by Cyclone Tracy.

title: New Zealand
event: September–October – In New Zealand, Māori leader Whina Cooper leads a march of 5,000 people in support of Maori claims to their land.

title: Ciudad Perdida
event: The government of Colombia announces the finding of Ciudad Perdida.

title: Western Sahara
event: The Spanish army quits Spanish (Western) Sahara, the last remnant of Spain's Empire. The Sahrawi Republic (RASD) is created. Morocco invades ex-Spanish Western Sahara.

title: Victoria (Australia)
event: Victoria (Australia) abolishes capital punishment.

title: South Australia
event: South Australia becomes the first Australian state to decriminalize homosexual acts between consenting adults.

title: Armageddon
event: Some members of Jehovah's Witnesses, based on the group's chronology, believe that Armageddon will happen in 1975 and a few of them sell their houses and businesses to prepare for the new world paradise which they believe will exist when Jesus sets up God's Kingdom on earth.

title: Channel Tunnel
event: Work is abandoned on the British end of the Channel Tunnel.

title: Malawi
event: Malawi changes its capital city from Zomba to Lilongwe.

title: Tasman Bridge disaster
event: January 5 – The Tasman Bridge in Tasmania, Australia, is struck by the bulk ore carrier ''Lake Illawarra'', killing twelve people.

title: Tulane Stadium
event: January 12 – Super Bowl IX: The Pittsburgh Steelers defeat the Minnesota Vikings 16–6 at Tulane Stadium in New Orleans, Louisiana.

title: Shropshire
event: January 14 – Heiress Lesley Whittle, 17, is kidnapped from her home in Shropshire, England by Donald Neilson.

title: Portugal
event: Portugal grants independence to Angola.

title: India
event: Earthquake strikes Himachal Pradesh, India

title: North Vietnam
event: In Hanoi, North Vietnam, the Politburo approves the final military offensive against South Vietnam.

title: Philippines
event: February 1 – The Intercontinental Broadcasting Corporation is launched in the Philippines.

title: People's Republic of China
event: February 4 – The Haicheng earthquake, the first successfully predicted earthquake, kills 2,041 and injures 27,538 in Haicheng, Liaoning, China.

title: Madagascar
event: Colonel Richard Ratsimandrava, President of Madagascar, is assassinated.

title: World Trade Center
event: Fire breaks out in the World Trade Center.

title: White House
event: February 21 – Watergate scandal: Former United States Attorney General John N. Mitchell, and former White House aides H. R. Haldeman and John Ehrlichman, are sentenced to between 30 months and 8 years in prison.

title: London
event: A major tube train crash at Moorgate station, London kills 43 people.

title: Wembley Stadium (1923)
event: March 1 – Aston Villa wins the Football League Cup at Wembley, beating Norwich City 1–0 in the final.

title: Iraq
event: Algiers Accord: Iran and Iraq announce a settlement in their border dispute.

title: Staffordshire
event: March 7 – The body of teenage heiress Lesley Whittle, kidnapped 7 weeks earlier by the Black Panther, is discovered in Staffordshire, England.

title: Trans-Alaska Pipeline System
event: March 9 – Construction of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System begins.

title: North Vietnam
event: Vietnam War: North Vietnamese troops attack Ban Me Thuot, South Vietnam, on their way to capturing Saigon.

title: New York City
event: ''The Rocky Horror Show'' opens on Broadway in New York City with 4 performances.

title: Portugal
event: March 11 – The leftist military government in Portugal defeats a rightist coup attempt.

title: Rio de Janeiro
event: March 15 – In Brazil, the Estado da Guanabara (State of Guanabara) merges with the state of Rio de Janeiro, under the name of Rio de Janeiro. The state's capital moves from the city of Niterói to the city of Rio de Janeiro.

title: Yugoslavia
event: March 28 – A fire in the maternity wing at Kucic Hospital in Rijeka, former Yugoslavia, kills 25 people.

title: Operation Babylift
event: Vietnam War: The first military Operation Babylift flight, C5A 80218, crashes 27 minutes after takeoff, killing 138 on board; 176 survive the crash.

title: Albuquerque New Mexico
event: Bill Gates founds Microsoft in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

title: Araneta Coliseum
event: Asia's first professional basketball league, the Philippine Basketball Association, plays its first game at the Araneta Coliseum.

title: Phnom Penh
event: April 17 – Following several weeks successful fighting, the Communist Khmer Rouge guerilla forces capture Phnom Penh, prompting a forcible mass evacuation of the city.

title: West German embassy siege
event: April 24 – Six Red Army Faction terrorists take over the West German embassy in Stockholm, take 11 hostages and demand the release of the group's jailed members; shortly after, they are captured by Swedish police. (See West German embassy siege)

title: Australia
event: April 25 – Vietnam War: As North Vietnamese Army forces close in on the South Vietnamese capital Saigon, the Australian Embassy is closed and evacuated, almost 10 years to the day since the first Australian troop commitment to South Vietnam.

title: Virginia
event: May 5 – The Busch Gardens Williamsburg Theme Park opens in Virginia.

title: Mayaguez incident
event: May 12 – Mayaguez incident: Khmer Rouge forces in Cambodia seize the United States merchant ship SS ''Mayaguez'' in international waters.

title: Mayaguez incident
event: May 15 – Mayaguez incident: The American merchant ship Mayaguez, seized by Cambodian forces, is rescued by the U.S. Navy and Marines; 38 Americans are killed.

title: India
event: Sikkim accedes to India after a referendum.

title: Indianapolis 500
event: May 25 – Indianapolis 500: Bobby Unser wins for a second time in a rain-shorted 174 lap, 435 mile (696 km) race.

title: North Yorkshire
event: May 27 – The Dibble's Bridge coach crash near Grassington, North Yorkshire, England results in 32 deaths (the highest ever toll in a United Kingdom road accident).

title: Suez Canal
event: The Suez Canal opens for the first time since the Six-Day War.

title: United Kingdom
event: The United Kingdom votes yes in a referendum to stay in the European Community.

title: Georgetown Guyana
event: June 6 – Georgetown Agreement formally creating the ACP Group signed.

title: India
event: Prime Minister Indira Gandhi declares a state of emergency in India, suspending civil liberties and elections.

title: Portugal
event: Mozambique gains independence from Portugal.

title: South Dakota
event: June 26 – Two FBI agents and 1 AIM member die in a shootout, at the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation in South Dakota.

title: Sydney
event: July 4 – Sydney newspaper publisher Juanita Nielsen disappears, and is presumed to have been murdered.

title: Cape Verde
event: July 5 – Cape Verde gains independence after 500 years of Portuguese rule.

title: France
event: The Comoros declare their independence from France.

title: Portugal
event: July 12 – São Tomé and Príncipe declare independence from Portugal.

title: Finland
event: August 1 – The Helsinki Accords, which officially recognize Europe's national borders and respect for human rights, are signed in Finland.

title: Louisiana Superdome
event: August 3 – The Louisiana Superdome opens in New Orleans.

title: Banqiao Dam
event: The Banqiao Dam, in  China's Henan Province, fails after a freak typhoon; over 200,000 people perish.

title: Dili
event: Governor Mário Lemos Pires of Portuguese East Timor abandons the capital Dili, following a UDT coup and the outbreak of civil war between UDT and Fretilin.

title: Great Britain
event: August 15 – The Birmingham Six are wrongfully sentenced to life imprisonment in Great Britain.

title: Bangladesh
event: August 15 – Founder President Sheikh Mujibur Rahman of Bangladesh is killed during a coup led by Major Syed Faruque Rahman.

title: Viking 1
event: August 20 – Viking program: NASA launches the ''Viking 1'' planetary probe toward Mars.

title: Greece
event: August 24 – Officers responsible for the military coup in Greece in 1967 are sentenced to death in Athens. The sentences are later commuted to life imprisonment.

title: Sacramento California
event: In Sacramento, California, Lynette Fromme, a follower of jailed cult leader Charles Manson, attempts to assassinate U.S. President Gerald Ford, but is thwarted by a Secret Service agent.

title: Lice Turkey
event: September 6 – A Richter Scale 6.7 magnitude earthquake kills at least 2,085 in Diyarbakir and Lice, Turkey.

title: Corsica
event: September 15 – The French department of Corse, comprising the entire island of Corsica, is divided into two departments: Haute-Corse and Corse-du-Sud.

title: Australia
event: September 16 – Papua New Guinea gains its independence from Australia.

title: Portugal
event: September 19 – General Vasco Goncalves is ousted as Prime Minister of Portugal.

title: Francoist Spain
event: Francoist Spain executes five ETA and FRAP members, the last executions in Spain to date.

title: Piccadilly
event: October 9 – A bomb explosion outside the Green Park tube station near Piccadilly in London kills 1 and injures 20.

title: Balibo
event: October 16 – Five Australian-based journalists are killed at Balibo by Indonesian forces, during their incursion into Portuguese Timor.

title: Ottawa
event: October 27 – Robert Poulin kills 1 and wounds 5 at St. Pius X High School in Ottawa, Canada before shooting himself.

title: Peter Sutcliffe
event: October 29 – Peter Sutcliffe (the Yorkshire Ripper) commits his first murder, that of Wilma McCann.

title: Francisco Franco
event: October 30 – Juan Carlos I of Spain becomes acting Head of State after dictator Francisco Franco concedes that he is too ill to govern.

title: Western Sahara
event: November 6 – The Green March begins: 300,000 unarmed Moroccans converge on the southern city of Tarfaya and wait for a signal from King Hassan II of Morocco to cross into Western Sahara.

title: Lake Superior
event: The {{convert729ftmadj=on}}-long freighter ''SS Edmund Fitzgerald'' sinks during a storm {{convert17mikm}} from the entrance to Whitefish Bay on Lake Superior, killing all 29 crew on board (an event immortalized in song by Gordon Lightfoot).

title: Portugal
event: Angola becomes independent from Portugal; civil war soon erupts.

title: Italy
event: The first annual Vogalonga rowing race is held in Venice, Italy.

title: Western Sahara
event: November 14 – Spain abandons Western Sahara.

title: California
event: Former California Governor Ronald Reagan enters the race for the Republican presidential nomination, challenging incumbent President Gerald Ford.

title: Madrid
event: Spanish dictator Francisco Franco dies in Madrid, effectively marking the end of the dictatorship established following the Spanish Civil War and the beginning of Spain's transition to democracy.

title: Francisco Franco
event: November 22 – Juan Carlos is declared King of Spain following the death of dictator Francisco Franco.

title: United Kingdom
event: The Irish Republican Army is outlawed in the United Kingdom.

title: Portugal
event: November 28 – Portuguese Timor declares its independence from Portugal as East Timor.

title: Microsoft
event: The name Micro-soft (for microcomputer software) is used by Bill Gates in a letter to Paul Allen for the first time (Microsoft becomes a registered trademark on November 26, 1976).

title: Apra Harbor
event: While disabled, the submarine tender ''USS Proteus (AS-19)'' discharges radioactive coolant water into Apra Harbor, Guam. A Geiger counter at two of the harbor's public beaches shows 100 millirems/hour, 50 times the allowable dose.

title: Kea Channel
event: December 3 – The wreck of the ''HMHS Britannic'' is found in the Kea Channel by Jacques Cousteau.

title: New York City
event: December 8 – New York City is approved for bailout of 2.3 billion each year through to 1978 – 6.9 billion total.

title: Vienna
event: December 21 – Six people, including Carlos (the Jackal), kidnap delegates of an OPEC conference in Vienna.

title: LaGuardia Airport
event: December 29 – A bomb explosion at LaGuardia Airport kills 11.

title: California
event: California's sodomy law is repealed.

title: Abuja
event: Plans to move the Nigerian capital from Lagos to Abuja are approved.

title: Nevada
event: The New Jersey State Legislature passes legislation legalizing casinos in the shore town of Atlantic City commencing in 1978. After signing the bill into law, Governor Brendan Byrne declares The mob is not welcome in New Jersey! referring to the Mafia's influence at casinos in Nevada.

title: Khmer Republic
event: January 5 – The Khmer Republic is officially renamed Democratic Kampuchea as a new constitution is proclaimed by the rising Pol Pot regime.

title: West End of London
event: January 29 – Twelve Provisional Irish Republican Army bombs explode in the West End of London.

title: Pensacola Florida
event: February 5 – Nearly 2,000 students become involved in a racially charged riot at Escambia High School in Pensacola, Florida; 30 students are injured in the 4-hour fray.

title: Nigeria
event: February 13 – General Murtala Mohammed of Nigeria is assassinated in a military coup.

title: Western Sahara
event: February 26 – The Spanish Armed Forces withdraw from Western Sahara.

title: Western Sahara
event: February 27 – Western Sahara declares independence.

title: Sahara
event: Spain gives up territories in Sahara but retains its enclaves of Melilla and Ceuta.

title: Nelson New Zealand
event: Mel Courtney wins the Nelson, New Zealand by-election after the death of Stanley Whitehead.

title: London
event: The Northern Ireland Constitutional Convention is formally dissolved in Northern Ireland, resulting in direct rule of Northern Ireland from London via the British Parliament.

title: Italy
event: March 9 – A cable-car disaster in Cavalese, Italy leaves 42 dead.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 16 – Harold Wilson resigns as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

title: New Jersey
event: March 17 – Rubin Hurricane Carter is retried in New Jersey.

title: Argentina
event: Argentina military forces depose president Isabel Peron.

title: Washington Metro
event: March 27 – The first 4.6 miles of the Washington Metro subway system opens.

title: Argentina
event: March 29 – The military dictatorship of General Jorge Videla comes to power in Argentina.

title: New Jersey
event: March 31 – The New Jersey Supreme Court rules that coma patient Karen Ann Quinlan can be disconnected from her ventilator. She remains comatose and dies in 1985.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 3 – The Eurovision Song Contest 1976 is won by Brotherhood of Man, representing the United Kingdom, with their song ''Save Your Kisses for Me''.

title: Finland
event: An explosion in an ammunition factory in Lapua, Finland kills 40.

title: India
event: April 16 – As a measure to curb population growth, the minimum age for marriage in India is raised to 21 years for men and 18 years for women.

title: Melbourne
event: April 21 – The Great Bookie Robbery in Melbourne: Bandits steal A$1.4 million in bookmakers' settlements from Queen Street, Melbourne.

title: Portugal
event: April 25 – Portugal's new constitution is enacted.

title: Schiedam
event: A train crash in Schiedam, the Netherlands, kills 24 people.

title: Italy
event: May 6 – An earthquake hits the Friuli area in Italy, killing more than 900 people and making another 100,000 homeless.

title: Oregon
event: May 25 – U.S. President Gerald Ford defeats challenger Ronald Reagan in 3 Republican presidential primaries: Kentucky, Tennessee and Oregon.

title: Indianapolis 500
event: May 30 – Indianapolis 500-Mile Race: Johnny Rutherford wins the (rain-shortened) shortest race in event history to date, at 102 laps or 255 miles (408 km).

title: United Kingdom
event: June 1 – The UK and Iceland end the Cod War.

title: Boston Garden
event: June 4 – The Boston Celtics defeat the Phoenix Suns 128-126 in triple overtime in Game 5 of the NBA Finals at the Boston Garden. In 1997, the game is selected by a panel of experts as the greatest of the NBA's first 50 years.

title: Idaho
event: June 5 – The Teton Dam collapses in southeast Idaho in the U.S., killing 11 people.

title: Jordan Iowa
event: June 13 – Savage thunderstorms roll through the state of Iowa spawning several tornadoes, including an F-5 tornado that destroys the town of Jordan, Iowa.

title: Oxford
event: June 14 – The trial begins at Oxford Crown Court of Donald Neilson, the killer known as the Black Panther.

title: South Africa
event: June 16 – The Soweto riots in South Africa begin.

title: Beirut
event: Hundreds of Western tourists are moved from Beirut and taken to safety in Syria by the U.S. military, following the murder of the U.S. ambassador.

title: Italy
event: General elections are held in Italy.

title: Płock
event: June 25 – Strikes start in Poland (Ursus, Radom, Płock) after communists raise food prices; they end on June 30.

title: CN Tower
event: June 26 – The CN Tower is built in Toronto; the tallest free-standing land structure opens to the public.

title: Uganda
event: Palestinian extremists hijack an Air France plane in Greece with 246 passengers and 12 crew. They take it to Entebbe, Uganda.

title: United Kingdom
event: June 29 – Seychelles gains independence from the United Kingdom.

title: North Vietnam
event: July 2 – North Vietnam and South Vietnam unite to form the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: July 3 – ''Gregg v. Georgia'': The Supreme Court of the United States rules that the death penalty is not inherently cruel or unusual and is a constitutionally acceptable form of punishment.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 3 – The great heat wave in the United Kingdom, which is currently suffering from drought conditions, reaches its peak.

title: Entebbe
event: Entebbe Raid: Israeli airborne commandos free 103 hostages being held by Palestinian hijackers of an Air France plane at Uganda's Entebbe Airport; 1 Israeli soldier and several Ugandan soldiers are killed in the raid.

title: Italy
event: An explosion in Seveso, Italy, causes extended pollution to a large area in the neighborhood of Milano, with many evacuations and a large number of people affected by the toxic cloud.

title: New York City
event: July 15 – Jimmy Carter is nominated for U.S. President at the Democratic National Convention in New York City.

title: France
event: July 16–July 20 – Albert Spaggiari and his gang break into the vault of the Societe Generale Bank in Nice, France.

title: Quebec
event: The 1976 Summer Olympics begin in Montreal, Quebec, Canada.

title: Nepal
event: July 19 – Sagarmatha National Park in Nepal is created.

title: Viking 1
event: July 20 – Viking program: The Viking 1 lander successfully lands on Mars.

title: Los Angeles
event: July 26 – In Los Angeles, Ronald Reagan announces his choice of liberal U.S. Senator Richard Schweiker as his vice presidential running mate, in an effort to woo moderate Republican delegates away from President Gerald Ford.

title: Uganda
event: The United Kingdom breaks diplomatic relations with Uganda.

title: People's Republic of China
event: July 28 – The Tangshan earthquake flattens Tangshan, China, killing 242,769 people, and injuring 164,851.

title: New York City
event: July 29 – In New York City, the Son of Sam pulls a gun from a paper bag, killing 1 and seriously wounding another, in the first of a series of attacks that terrorize the city for the next year.

title: Argentina
event: July 30 – In Santiago, Chile, Cruzeiro from Brazil beats River Plate from Argentina and are the Copa Libertadores de América champions.

title: Viking 1
event: NASA releases the famous Face on Mars photo, taken by Viking 1.

title: Trinidad and Tobago
event: The Caribbean nation of Trinidad and Tobago becomes a republic, replacing Queen Elizabeth II with a President as its head of state.

title: Texas
event: August 2 – A gunman murders Andrea Wilborn and Stan Farr and injures Priscilla Davis and Gus Gavrel, in an incident at Priscilla's mansion in Fort Worth, Texas.  T. Cullen Davis, Priscilla's husband and one of the richest men in Texas, is tried and found innocent for Andrea's murder, involvement in a plot to kill several people (including Priscilla and a judge), and a wrongful death lawsuit. Cullen goes broke afterwards.

title: Philadelphia
event: August 4 – The first recognized outbreak of Legionnaires' disease kills 29 at the American Legion convention in Philadelphia.

title: Big Ben
event: August 10 – The chimes of Big Ben stopped when part of the chiming mechanism disintegrated through metal fatigue.

title: Korean Demilitarized Zone
event: August 18 – At Panmunjom, North Korea, 2 United States soldiers are killed while trying to chop down part of a tree in the Korean Demilitarized Zone which had obscured their view.

title: Kansas City Missouri
event: August 19 – U.S. President Gerald Ford edges out challenger Ronald Reagan to win the Republican Party presidential nomination in Kansas City.

title: Zaire
event: The first known outbreak of Ebola virus occurs in Yambuku, Zaire.

title: Turks and Caicos Islands
event: August 30 – James Alexander George Smith Jags McCartney was sworn in as the first Chief Minister of the Turks and Caicos Islands.

title: Utopia Planitia
event: September 3 – Viking program: The Viking 2 spacecraft lands at Utopia Planitia on Mars, taking the first close-up color photos of the planet's surface.

title: People's Republic of China
event: September 9 – Chairman Mao Zedong, of the People's Republic of China, dies.

title: Yugoslavia
event: Zagreb mid-air collision: A British Airways Trident and a Yugoslav DC-9 collide near Zagreb, Yugoslavia (now Croatia), killing all 176 aboard.

title: Palmdale California
event: September 17 – The space shuttle ''Enterprise'' is rolled out of a Palmdale, California hangar.

title: Barbados
event: Cubana Flight 455 crashes due to a bomb placed by anti-Fidel Castro terrorists, after taking off from Bridgetown, Barbados. All 73 people on board are killed. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/4535661.stm]

title: Bangkok
event: Students gathering at Thammasat University in Bangkok, Thailand are massacred, while protesting the return of ex-dictator Thanom Kittikachorn by a coalition of right-wing paramilitary and government forces, triggering the return of the military to government.

title: People's Republic of China
event: October 12 – The People's Republic of China announces that Hua Guofeng is the successor to Mao Zedong, as Chairman of the Communist Party of China.

title: MV George Prince ferry disaster
event: October 20 – The Mississippi River ferry ''MV George Prince'' is struck by a ship while crossing from Destrehan, LA to Luling, LA, killing 78 passengers and crew.

title: Hawaii
event: November 15 – The first megamouth shark is discovered off Oahu in Hawaii.

title: Portugal
event: November 19 – Jaime Ornelas Camacho takes office as the first President of the Regional Government of Madeira, Portugal.

title: New Mexico
event: Microsoft is officially registered with the Office of the Secretary of the State of New Mexico.

title: Zaire
event: December 23 – A new volcano, Murara, erupts in eastern Zaire.

title: Portugal
event: Portugal's traditional naming conventions change such that children's surnames can come from either the mother or the father, not just from the father.

title: Queensland
event: January 1 – The Australian state of Queensland abolishes inheritance tax.

title: Rose Bowl (stadium)
event: January 9 – Super Bowl XI: The Oakland Raiders defeat the Minnesota Vikings 32–14 at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, California.

title: Democratic Republic of the Congo
event: Mount Nyiragongo erupts in eastern Zaire (now the Democratic Republic of the Congo).

title: Hong Kong
event: Ocean Park opens in Hong Kong.

title: Utah
event: January 17 – Gary Gilmore is executed by firing squad in Utah (the first execution after the reintroduction of the death penalty in the U.S.).

title: Sydney
event: Australia's worst railway disaster at Granville, near Sydney, leaves 83 people dead.

title: Hawaii
event: Snow falls in Miami, Florida (despite its ordinarily tropical climate) for the only time in its history. Snowfall has occurred farther south in the United States only on the high mountains of the state of Hawaii.

title: 1977 Massacre of Atocha
event: January 24 – The Massacre of Atocha occurs during the Spanish transition to democracy.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 27 – Record company EMI sacks the controversial United Kingdom punk rock group the Sex Pistols.

title: Centre Georges Pompidou
event: January 31 – The Centre Georges Pompidou is officially opened by French President Valéry Giscard d'Estaing.

title: Nova Scotia
event: February 11 – A 20.2-kg (44-lb.-9-oz.) lobster is caught off Nova Scotia (the heaviest known crustacean).

title: 1977 Vrancea earthquake
event: March 4 – The 1977 Bucharest Earthquake kills 1,500.

title: Kyalami
event: March 5 – Formula One driver Tom Pryce dies after colliding with a track marshal at the South African Grand Prix in Kyalami.

title: Parliament of Australia
event: March 8 – The Australian parliament is opened by Elizabeth II, Queen of Australia.

title: Melbourne Cricket Ground
event: March 12 – The Centenary Test between Australia and England begins at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

title: Focus on the Family
event: March 26 – Focus on the Family is founded by Dr. James Dobson.

title: Canary Islands
event: March 27 – Tenerife disaster: A collision between KLM and Pan Am Boeing 747s at Tenerife, Canary Islands, kills 583 (the worst single aviation accident on record).

title: Grundy Virginia
event: April 4 – Grundy, Virginia experienced a major flood that made around $15 million in damages to 228 residential and commercial structures.To date the town is still recovering.

title: Karlsruhe
event: German Federal Prosecutor Siegfried Buback and his driver are shot by 2 Red Army Faction members while waiting at a red light near his home in Karlsruhe. The Ulrike Meinhof Commando later claims responsibility.

title: Istanbul
event: May 1 – The Taksim Square massacre in Istanbul results in 34 deaths, hundreds of injuries.

title: Italy
event: May 14 – In Milan, Italy, during a far-left demonstration, a hooded person shoots at the police, killing a policeman, Antonio Custra. The scene is photographed and the picture of the hooded man shooting in the middle of the street appears in many magazines around the world.

title: Israel
event: The Likud Party, led by Menachem Begin, wins the elections in Israel.

title: World Trade Center
event: May 26 – George Willig climbs the South Tower of the World Trade Center.

title: Edinburgh Airport
event: Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom opens the new Air Terminal Building at Edinburgh Airport.

title: Southgate Kentucky
event: May 28 – The Beverly Hills Supper Club in Southgate, Kentucky is engulfed in fire, killing 165 inside.

title: United Kingdom
event: June 6 – 9 – Jubilee celebrations are held in the United Kingdom to celebrate 25 years of Elizabeth II's reign.

title: Miami-Dade County Florida
event: June 7 – After campaigning by Anita Bryant and her anti-gay Save Our Children crusade, Miami-Dade County, Florida voters overwhelmingly vote to repeal the county's gay rights ordinance.

title: Petros Tennessee
event: June 10 – James Earl Ray escapes from Brushy Mountain State Prison in Petros, Tennessee (he is recaptured on June 13).

title: Francisco Franco
event: June 15 – Spain has its first democratic elections, after 41 years under the Franco regime.

title: Larry Ellison
event: June 16 – Oracle Corporation is incorporated in Redwood Shores, California as Software Development Laboratories (SDL) by Larry Ellison, Bob Miner and Ed Oates.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: The Supreme Court of the United States rules that states are not required to spend Medicaid funds on elective abortions.

title: New South Wales
event: July 15 – Anti-drug campaigner Donald Mackay disappears near Griffith, New South Wales (presumed murdered).

title: People's Republic of China
event: July 22 – The purged Chinese Communist leader Deng Xiaoping is restored to power 9 months after the Gang of Four was expelled from power in a coup d'état.

title: Valdez Alaska
event: July 28 – The first oil through the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System reaches Valdez, Alaska.

title: Mount Usu
event: August 7 – The Japanese Usu volcano erupts.

title: New York City
event: August 10 – David Berkowitz is captured in Yonkers, New York, after over a year of murders in New York City as the Son Of Sam.

title: NASA
event: August 12 – The NASA Space Shuttle, named ''Enterprise'', makes its first test free-flight from the back of a Boeing 747 Shuttle Carrier Aircraft (SCA).

title: Caelian Hill
event: Herbert Kappler escapes from the Caelian Hill military hospital in Rome.

title: Memphis Tennessee
event: August 16 – Elvis Presley, the king of rock and roll dies in his home in Graceland at age 42. 75,000 fans lined the streets of Memphis for this funeral.

title: South Africa
event: September 6 – Steve Biko suffers a massive head injury in police custody in South Africa, later dying.

title: Panama Canal
event: September 7 – Treaties between Panama and the United States on the status of the Panama Canal are signed. The U.S. agrees to transfer control of the canal to Panama at the end of the 20th century.

title: London
event: September 16 – Glam rock pioneer Marc Bolan dies in a car crash in Barnes, London.

title: Nicaragua
event: September 19 – Under pressure from the Carter Administration, President Anastasio Somoza Debayle lifts the state of siege in Nicaragua.

title: Mogadishu
event: October 17 – 18 – German Autumn: GSG 9 troopers storm a hijacked Lufthansa passenger plane in Mogadishu, Somalia; 3 of the 4 hijackers die.

title: France
event: October 19 – German Autumn: Kidnapped industrialist Hanns-Martin Schleyer is found murdered in Mulhouse, France.

title: Gillsburg Mississippi
event: October 20 – Three members of the rock band Lynyrd Skynyrd die in a charter plane crash outside Gillsburg, Mississippi, 3 days after the release of their fifth studio album ''Street Survivors''.

title: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
event: October 26 – The last natural smallpox case is discovered in Merca district, Somalia.   The WHO and the CDC consider this date the anniversary of the eradication of smallpox, the most spectacular success of vaccination and, by extension, of modern science.

title: Hong Kong
event: Hong Kong police forces attack the ICAC headquarters.

title: United Kingdom
event: ''Never Mind The Bollocks Here's The Sex Pistols'' is released in the United Kingdom.

title: Toccoa Georgia
event: November 6 – The Kelly Barnes Dam, located above Toccoa Falls Bible College near Toccoa, Georgia fails, killing 39.

title: Vergina
event: Greek archaeologist Manolis Andronikos discovers the tomb of Philip II of Macedon at Vergina.

title: Bolivia
event: November 9 – Gen. Hugo Banzer, president of the military government of Bolivia, announces that the constitutional democracy will be restored in 1978 instead of 1980 as previously provided.

title: Israel
event: Egyptian President Anwar Sadat becomes the first Arab leader to make an official visit to Israel, when he meets with Israeli Prime Minister Menachem Begin, seeking a permanent peace settlement.

title: Portugal
event: TAP Portugal Flight 425 crashes at Madeira Airport, Funchal, Portugal, killing 131 and leaving 33 survivors.

title: New York City
event: British Airways inaugurates regular London to New York City supersonic Concorde service.

title: University of Evansville
event: December 13 – A DC-3 charter plane carrying the University of Evansville basketball team to Nashville, Tenn., crashes in rain and dense fog about 90 seconds after takeoff from Evansville Dress Regional Airport. Twenty-nine people die in the crash, including 14 members of the team and head coach Bob Watson.

title: Italy
event: Abortion is legalized in Italy for the first time.

title: Air India Flight 855
event: Air India Flight 855, a Boeing 747 passenger jet, crashes into the ocean near Bombay, killing 213.

title: Nicaragua
event: January 10 – Pedro Joaquín Chamorro Cardenal, a critic of the Nicaraguan government, is assassinated.   Riots erupt against Somoza's government.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 18 – The European Court of Human Rights finds the United Kingdom government guilty of mistreating prisoners in Northern Ireland, but not guilty of torture.

title: Northwest Territories
event: Soviet satellite Cosmos 954 burns up in Earth's atmosphere, scattering debris over Canada's Northwest Territories.

title: Republic of Ireland
event: Rose Dugdale and Eddie Gallagher become the first convicted prisoners to marry in prison in the history of the Republic of Ireland.

title: Australia
event: A bomb explodes outside the Hilton Hotel in Sydney, Australia, killing 2 garbagemen, a policeman and injuring several others.

title: France
event: Hollywood film director Roman Polanski skips bail and flees to France, after pleading guilty to charges of engaging in sex with a 13-year-old girl.

title: New York metropolitan area
event: February 5–February 7 – The Northeastern United States blizzard of 1978 hits the New England region and the New York metropolitan area, killing about 100 and causing over US$520 million in damage.

title: People's Republic of China
event: The People's Republic of China lifts a ban on works by Aristotle, William Shakespeare and Charles Dickens.

title: Pensacola Florida
event: Serial killer Ted Bundy is captured in Pensacola, Florida.

title: Switzerland
event: March 1 – Charlie Chaplin's remains are stolen from Cosier-sur-Vevey, Switzerland.

title: Soyuz 28
event: March 2 – ''Soyuz 28'' (Aleksei Gubarev, Vladimir Remek) is launched on a rendezvous with ''Salyut 6'', with the first cosmonaut from a third country (besides the  Soviet Union and United States) – Czechoslovak citizen Vladimír Remek.

title: Ogaden
event: Ethiopia admits that its troops are fighting with the aid of Cuban soldiers against Somalian troops in Ogaden.

title: Lawrenceville Georgia
event: March 6 – American porn publisher Larry Flynt is shot and paralyzed in Lawrenceville, Georgia.

title: Soyuz 28
event: March 10 – ''Soyuz 28'' lands.

title: Israel
event: March 11 – Coastal Road Massacre: Palestinian terrorists kill 34 Israelis.

title: Israel
event: March 14 – Operation Litani: Israeli forces invade Lebanon.

title: Aldo Moro
event: March 16 – Former Italian Premier Aldo Moro is kidnapped by the Red Brigades; 5 bodyguards are killed.

title: Brittany
event: March 17 – The oil tanker ''Amoco Cadiz'' runs aground on the coast of Brittany.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: March 28 – ''Stump v. Sparkman'' (435 U.S. 349): The Supreme Court of the United States hands down a 5–3 decision in  a controversial case involving involuntary sterilization and  judicial immunity.

title: Air New Zealand
event: New Zealand National Airways Corporation the Domestic airline of New Zealand was merged with New Zealand's international airline, Air New Zealand.

title: Port Jackson
event: Dick Smith of Dick Smith Foods tows a fake iceberg to Sydney Harbour.

title: Dorothy Chandler Pavilion
event: April 3 – The 50th Academy Awards are held at the Dorothy Chandler Pavilion in Los Angeles, California with ''Annie Hall'' winning Best Picture.

title: New Stanton Pennsylvania
event: April 10 – Volkswagen becomes the second (after Rolls-Royce) non-American automobile manufacturer to open a plant in the United States, commencing production of the Rabbit, the North American version of the Volkswagen Golf, in New Stanton, Pennsylvania with a unionized (UAW) workforce (the plant closes in 1992.)

title: Panama Canal
event: April 18 – The U.S. Senate votes 68–32 to turn the Panama Canal over to Panamanian control on December 31, 1999.

title: Israel
event: Izhar Cohen & the Alphabeta win the Eurovision Song Contest 1978 for Israel (on that country's first appearance in the contest) with their song A-Ba-Ni-Bi.

title: Florida
event: April 25 – St. Paul, Minnesota becomes the 2nd U.S. city to repeal its gay rights ordinance after Anita Bryant's successful 1977 anti-gay campaign in Dade County, Florida.

title: Battle of Cassinga
event: Battle of Cassinga occurs in southern Angola.

title: Aldo Moro
event: May 9 – In Rome, the body of Aldo Moro, the Italian president of the Christian Democrats, is found in a parked car.

title: Kolwezi
event: May 12 – In Zaire, rebels occupy the city of Kolwezi, the mining centre of the province of Shaba.   The Zairean government asks the U.S., France and Belgium to restore order.

title: University of Tehran
event: May 15 – Students of the University of Tehran riot in Tabriz; the army stops the riot.

title: Zaire
event: May 19–May 20 – French Foreign Legion paratroopers land in Kolwezi, Zaire, to rescue Europeans in the middle of a civil war.

title: Northwestern University
event: May 25 – A bomb explodes in the security section of Northwestern University, wounding a security guard (the first Unabomber attack).

title: Atlantic City New Jersey
event: May 26 – In Atlantic City, New Jersey, Resorts International, the first legal casino in the eastern United States, opens.

title: Indianapolis 500
event: May 28 – Indianapolis 500: Al Unser wins his third race, and the first for car owner Jim Hall.

title: Argentina
event: June 1 – The 1978 FIFA World Cup starts in Argentina.

title: California
event: June 6 – California voters approve Proposition 13, which slashes property taxes nearly 60%.

title: Greece
event: June 20 – A magnitude 6.5 earthquake hits Thessaloniki, Greece's second largest city, killing 45 people, injuring hundreds and damaging some of the city's Byzantine landmarks.

title: Yemen Arab Republic
event: Yemen Arab Republic President Ahmad al-Ghashmi is killed.

title: Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras
event: The Gay & Lesbian Solidarity March is held in Sydney, Australia to mark 10th Anniversary of the Stonewall Riots (which later becomes the annual Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras; later incorporating a festival).

title: Brittany
event: June 26 – A bombing by Breton nationalists causes destruction in Versailles.

title: Supreme Court of the United States
event: ''University of California Regents v. Bakke'': The Supreme Court of the United States bars quota systems in college admissions but affirms the constitutionality of programs which give advantages to minorities.

title: United Kingdom
event: July 7 – The Solomon Islands become independent from the United Kingdom.

title: Costa Daurada
event: July 11 – More than 200 tourists die in an explosion of a tanker-truck at a campsite in Costa Daurada, Spain.

title: Cerro Maravilla incident
event: Cerro Maravilla incident: Two Puerto Rican pro-independence activists are killed in a police ambush.

title: Manchester
event: Louise Brown, the world's first test tube baby, is born in Oldham, Manchester, UK.

title: France
event: August 17 – Double Eagle II becomes the first balloon to successfully cross the Atlantic Ocean, flying from Presque Isle, Maine, to Miserey, France.

title: Israel
event: September 17 – The Camp David Accords are signed between Israel and Egypt.

title: California
event: PSA Flight 182, a Boeing 727, collides with a small private airplane and crashes in San Diego, California; 144 are killed.

title: Estonia
event: September 27 – The last Forest Brother guerilla movement fighter is discovered and killed in Estonia.

title: United Kingdom
event: Tuvalu become independent from the United Kingdom.

title: Fenway Park
event: October 2 – The New York Yankees defeat the Boston Red Sox 5–4 at Fenway Park to clinch the AL East after being 14 games out of first place only two months earlier.  The Yankees would eventually go on to defeat the Kansas City Royals and Los Angeles Dodgers and win the World Series.

title: New South Wales
event: October 7 – ''Wranslide'' in New South Wales: the Wran government is re-elected with an increased majority.

title: Australia
event: October 8 – Australia's Ken Warby sets the current world water speed record of 317.60 mph at Blowering Dam, Australia.

title: Kenya
event: Daniel arap Moi becomes president of Kenya.

title: Los Angeles
event: October 17 – The New York Yankees clinch their 22nd World Series championship, defeating the Dodgers 7–2 in Los Angeles and winning the Series 4 games to 2.

title: Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras
event: October 20 – The first Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras is held as a protest march and commemoration of the Stonewall Riots.

title: Nobel Peace Prize
event: October 27 – Egyptian President Anwar Sadat and Israeli Prime Minister Menachem Begin win the Nobel Peace Prize for their progress toward achieving a Middle East accord.

title: United Kingdom
event: November 3 – Dominica gains its independence from the United Kingdom.

title: Tehran
event: November 5 – Rioters sack the British Embassy in Tehran.

title: Jonestown
event: November 18 – Jonestown incident: In Guyana, Jim Jones leads his Peoples Temple cult in a mass murder-suicide that claims 918 lives in all, 909 of them at Jonestown itself, including over 270 children.  Congressman Leo J. Ryan is assassinated by members of Peoples Temple shortly beforehand.

title: New York City
event: Lufthansa heist: Six men rob a Lufthansa cargo facility in New York City's John F. Kennedy International Airport.

title: Iran
event: Two million demonstrate against the Shah in Iran.

title: Xi'an
event: December 16 – Train 87 from Nanjing to Xining collides with train 368 from Xi'an to Xuzhou near Yangzhuang railway station in China, killing 106, injuring 218.

title: Beijing
event: The pivotal Third Plenum of the 11th National Congress of the Communist Party of China is held in Beijing, with Deng Xiaoping reversing Mao-era policies to pursue a program for Chinese economic reform.

title: Argentina
event: Argentina started the Operation Soberanía against Chile.

title: People's Republic of China
event: The One Child Policy is implemented in China in this year.

title: Duke University
event: The first usenet experiments are conducted by Tom Truscott and Jim Ellis of Duke University.

title: People's Republic of China
event: The United States and the People's Republic of China establish full diplomatic relations.

title: Kent State shootings
event: January 4 – The State of Ohio agrees to pay $675,000 to families of the dead and injured in the Kent State shootings.

title: Phnom Penh
event: January 7 – Vietnam and Vietnam-backed Cambodian insurgents announce the fall of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, and the collapse of the Pol Pot regime. Pol Pot and the Khmer Rouge retreat west to an area along the Thai border.

title: Ireland
event: January 8 – The French tanker ''Betelgeuse'' explodes at the Gulf Oil terminal at Bantry, Ireland; 50 are killed.

title: Iran
event: January 16 – Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi of Iran flees Iran with his family, relocating to Egypt after a year of turmoil.

title: Florida
event: January 21 – Super Bowl XIII: The Pittsburgh Steelers defeat the Dallas Cowboys 35–31 at the Miami Orange Bowl in Miami, Florida.

title: Iran
event: Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini returns to Tehran, Iran after nearly 15 years of exile.

title: Hood Canal Bridge
event: February 13 – The intense February 13, 1979 Windstorm strikes western Washington and sinks a 1/2-mile-long section of the Hood Canal Bridge.

title: Warsaw
event: February 15 – A suspected gas explosion in a Warsaw bank kills 49.

title: People's Republic of China
event: February 17 – The People's Republic of China invades northern Vietnam, launching the Sino-Vietnamese War.

title: United Kingdom
event: February 22 – Saint Lucia becomes independent of the United Kingdom.

title: North America
event: February 26 – A total solar eclipse arcs over northern Canada, and a partial solar eclipse is visible over almost all of North America and Central America.  [http://www.eclipse.org.uk/eclipse/0111979/]

title: Grenada
event: March 13 – Maurice Bishop leads a successful coup in Grenada.

title: Beijing
event: March 14 – In China, a Hawker Siddeley Trident crashes into a factory near Beijing, killing at least 200.

title: Penmanshiel Tunnel
event: March 17 – The Penmanshiel Tunnel in the U.K. collapses, killing 2 workers.

title: Lancashire
event: March 18 – Ten miners die in a methane gas explosion at Golborne Colliery near Wigan, Lancashire.

title: Israel
event: March 26 – In a ceremony at the White House, President Anwar Sadat of Egypt and Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel sign a peace treaty.

title: United Kingdom
event: March 28 – In Britain, Jim Callaghan's minority Labour government loses a motion of confidence by 1 vote, forcing a general election which is to be held on 3 May.

title: Three Mile Island accident
event: America's most serious nuclear power plant accident, at Three Mile Island, Pennsylvania.

title: Malta
event: The last British soldier (belonging to the Royal Navy) leaves the Maltese Islands, after 179 years of presence. Malta declares its Freedom Day (Jum il-Helsien).

title: Israel
event: Gali Atari and Milk and Honey win the Eurovision Song Contest 1979 for Israel, with the song ''Hallelujah''.

title: Iran
event: Iran's government becomes an Islamic Republic by a 98% vote, overthrowing the Shah officially.

title: Wichita Falls Texas
event: April 10 – A tornado hits Wichita Falls, Texas, killing 42 people (the most notable of 26 tornadoes that day).

title: Uganda
event: April 11 – Tanzanian troops take Kampala, the capital of Uganda; Idi Amin flees.

title: Albania
event: April 15 – 1979 Montenegro Earthquake: A major earthquake (7.0 on the Richter scale) strikes Montenegro (then part of Yugoslavia) and parts of Albania, causing extensive damage to coastal areas and taking 136 lives; the old town of Budva is devastated.

title: United States National Academy of Sciences
event: April 22 – The Albert Einstein Memorial is unveiled at The National Academy of Sciences in Washington, DC.

title: Blair Peach
event: April 23 – Fighting in London between the Anti-Nazi League and the Metropolitan Police's Special Patrol Group results in the death of protestor Blair Peach.

title: United Kingdom
event: May 4 – Counting in the previous day's British general election shows that the Conservatives have won and Margaret Thatcher becomes the country's first female prime minister.

title: Manchester
event: May 8 – The Manchester, England Woolworth's in city centre is seriously damaged by fire; 10 shoppers die.

title: Northwestern University
event: May 9 – A Unabomber bomb injures Northwestern University graduate student John Harris.

title: Federated States of Micronesia
event: May 10 – The Federated States of Micronesia becomes self-governing.

title: American Airlines Flight 191
event: American Airlines Flight 191: In Chicago, a DC-10 crashes during takeoff at O'Hare International Airport, killing 271 on board and 2 people on the ground.

title: Florida
event: John Spenkelink is executed in Florida, in the first use of the electric chair in America after the reintroduction of death penalty in 1976.

title: Indianapolis 500
event: May 27 – Indianapolis 500: Rick Mears wins the race for the first time, and car owner Roger Penske for the second time.

title: India
event: The Vizianagaram district is formed in Andhra Pradesh, India.

title: Gulf of Mexico
event: A blowout at the Ixtoc I oil well in the southern Gulf of Mexico causes at least 600,000 tons (176,400,000 gallons) of oil to be spilled into the waters, the worst oil spill to date. Some estimate the spill to be 428 million gallons, making it the largest unintentional oil spill until it was surpassed by the Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill in 2010.

title: Italy
event: General elections are held in Italy.

title: Ghana
event: Flight Lieutenant Jerry Rawlings takes power in Ghana after a  military coup in which General Fred Akuffo is overthrown.

title: European Parliament
event: June 7 – The first direct elections to the European Parliament begin, allowing citizens from across all then-9 European Community member states to elect 410 MEPs. It is also the first international election in history.

title: English Channel
event: June 12 – Bryan Allen flies the man-powered Gossamer Albatross across the English Channel.

title: Vienna
event: June 18 – Jimmy Carter and Leonid Brezhnev sign the SALT II agreement in Vienna.

title: Nicaragua
event: June 20 – A Nicaraguan National Guard soldier kills ABC TV news correspondent Bill Stewart and his interpreter Juan Espinosa. Other members of the news crew capture the killing on tape.

title: New South Wales
event: June 23 – Sydney: New South Wales Premier Neville Wran officially opens the Eastern Suburbs Railway. It operates as a shuttle between Central & Bondi Junction until full integration with the Illawarra Line in 1980.

title: Italy
event: June 24 – Bologna (Italy): foundation of the Permanent Peoples' Tribunal, an international opinion tribunal, at the initiative of Senator Lelio Basso.

title: NATO
event: June 25 – Belgium: NATO Supreme Allied Commander Alexander Haig escapes an assassination attempt by the Baader-Meinhof terrorist organization.

title: Los Angeles
event: July 8 – Los Angeles passes its gay and lesbian civil rights bill.

title: France
event: July 9 – A car bomb destroys a Renault owned by Nazi hunters Serge and Beate Klarsfeld at their home in France.  A note purportedly from ODESSA claims responsibility.

title: NASA
event: July 11 – NASA's first orbiting space station ''Skylab'' begins its return to Earth, after being in orbit for 6 years and 2 months.

title: United Kingdom
event: Kiribati declares independence from the United Kingdom.

title: Comiskey Park
event: A ''Disco Demolition Night'' publicity stunt goes awry at Comiskey Park, forcing the Chicago White Sox to forfeit their game against the Detroit Tigers.

title: Iraq
event: July 16 – Iraqi President Hasan al-Bakr resigns and Vice President Saddam Hussein replaces him.

title: Nicaragua
event: July 17 – Nicaraguan dictator General Anastasio Somoza Debayle resigns and flees to Miami, Florida.

title: Nicaragua
event: The Sandinista National Liberation Front concludes a successful revolutionary campaign against the U.S. backed Somoza dictatorship and assumes power in Nicaragua.

title: Portugal
event: Maria de Lurdes Pintasilgo becomes prime minister of Portugal

title: Western Sahara
event: August 11 – The Mauritanian province of Tiris al-Gharbiyya in Western Sahara is annexed by Morocco.

title: Fastnet Race
event: August 14 – A freak storm during the Fastnet Race results in the death of 15 sailors.

title: Warrenpoint ambush
event: August 27 – Lord Mountbatten of Burma and 3 others are assassinated by the Provisional Irish Republican Army. He was a British admiral, statesman and an uncle of Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh. On the same day, the Warrenpoint ambush occurs: Provisional Irish Republican Army members attack a British convoy at Narrow Water, County Down, killing 18 British soldiers.

title: Bouvet Island
event: September 22 – The South Atlantic Flash is observed near Bouvet Island, thought to be a nuclear weapons test.

title: Hong Kong
event: September 30 – The Hong Kong MTR begins service with the opening of its Modified Initial System (aka Kwun Tong Line).

title: Nigeria
event: October 1 – Nigeria terminates military rule, and the Nigerian Second Republic is established.

title: France
event: October 16 – A tsunami in Nice, France kills 23 people.

title: Camp Fuji
event: October 19 – 13 Marines die in a fire at Camp Fuji, Japan as a result of Typhoon Tip.

title: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
event: October 27 – Saint Vincent and the Grenadines gains independence.

title: Israel
event: November 1 – Iran hostage crisis: Iranian Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini urges his people to demonstrate on November 4 and to expand attacks on United States and Israeli interests.

title: Greensboro North Carolina
event: November 3 – In Greensboro, North Carolina, 5 members of the Communist Workers Party are shot to death and 7 are wounded by a group of Klansmen and neo-Nazis, during a Death to the Klan rally.

title: Tehran
event: November 4 – Iran hostage crisis begins: 3,000 Iranian radicals, mostly students, invade the U.S. Embassy in Tehran and take 90 hostages (53 of whom are American). They demand that the United States send the former Shah of Iran back  to stand trial.

title: Taiwan
event: November 6 – At Montevideo, Uruguay, the International Olympic Committee adopts a resolution, whereby Taiwan Olympic and sports teams will participate with the name Chinese Taipei in future Olympics Games and international sports tournaments and championships.

title: Fort Ritchie Maryland
event: Nuclear false alarm: the NORAD computers and the Alternate National Military Command Center in Fort Ritchie, Maryland detected purported massive Soviet nuclear strike. After reviewing the raw data from satellites and checking the early warning radars, the alert was cancelled.

title: Iran
event: Iran hostage crisis: In response to the hostage situation in Tehran, U.S. President Jimmy Carter orders a halt to all oil imports into the United States from Iran.

title: Iran
event: November 14 – Iran hostage crisis: U.S. President Jimmy Carter issues Executive Order 12170, freezing all Iranian assets in the United States and U.S. banks in response to the hostage crisis.

title: Bucharest
event: November 16 – Bucharest Metro Line One is opened, in Bucharest, Romania (from Timpuri Noi to Semanatoarea stations, 8.63 km).

title: Tehran
event: November 17 – Iran hostage crisis: Iranian leader Ruhollah Khomeini orders the release of 13 female and African American hostages being held at the U.S. Embassy in Tehran.

title: Islamabad
event: November 21 – After false radio reports from the Ayatollah Khomeini that the Americans had occupied the Grand Mosque in Mecca, the United States Embassy in Islamabad, Pakistan is attacked by a mob and set afire, killing 4 (see Foreign relations of Pakistan).

title: Ireland
event: November 23 – In Dublin, Ireland, Provisional Irish Republican Army member Thomas McMahon is sentenced to life in prison for the assassination of Lord Mountbatten of Burma.

title: Antarctica
event: November 28 – Air New Zealand Flight 901: an Air New Zealand DC-10 crashes into Mount Erebus (in Antarctica) on a sightseeing trip, killing all 257 people on board.

title: Kingston upon Hull
event: December 4 – The Hastie fire in Kingston upon Hull, England, leads to the deaths of 3 boys and begins the hunt for Bruce George Peter Lee, the UK's most prolific killer.

title: Smithsonian Institution
event: December 6 – The world premiere for ''Star Trek: The Motion Picture'' is held at the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C.

title: Southern Rhodesia
event: The unrecognised state of Zimbabwe Rhodesia returns to British control and resumes using the name Southern Rhodesia.

title: London
event: December 21 – A ceasefire for Rhodesia is signed at London.

title: Klein Matterhorn
event: December 23 – The highest aerial tramway in Europe, the Klein Matterhorn, opens.

title: European Commission
event: January 4 – U.S. President Jimmy Carter proclaims a grain embargo against the USSR with the support of the European Commission.

title: Israel
event: January 26 – Israel and Egypt establish diplomatic relations.

title: Switzerland
event: January 27 – Canadian caper: Six United States diplomats, posing as Canadians, manage to escape from Tehran, Iran as they board a flight to Zürich, Switzerland.

title: Iran
event: February 4 – Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini names Abolhassan Banisadr as president of Iran.

title: Tanna (island)
event: February 15 – In Vanuatu, followers of John Frum's cargo cult on the island of Tanna declare secession as the nation of Tafea.

title: Iran
event: February 23 – Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini states that Iran's parliament will decide the fate of the American embassy hostages.

title: Warsaw
event: March 14 – In Poland, a plane crashes during an emergency landing near Warsaw, killing a 14-man American boxing team and 73 others.

title: Plesetsk Cosmodrome
event: March 18 – Fifty people are killed at the Plesetsk Cosmodrome in Russia, when a Vostok-2M rocket explodes on its launch pad during a fueling operation.

title: Philadelphia
event: Mafioso Angelo Bruno is assassinated in Philadelphia.

title: Elbert County Georgia
event: March 22 – The Georgia Guidestones are erected in Elbert County, Georgia.

title: Australia
event: The Australia Olympic Committee announces it will send an Olympic delegation to Moscow, despite objections by Prime Minister Malcolm Fraser.

title: South Africa
event: March 26 – A mine lift cage at the Vaal Reef gold mine in South Africa falls 1.2 miles, killing 23.

title: Alexander L. Kielland (platform)
event: The Norwegian oil platform Alexander L. Kielland collapses in the North Sea, killing 123 of its crew of 212.

title: Talpiot Tomb
event: March 28 – Talpiot Tomb is found in Jerusalem.

title: New York City
event: New York City's Transport Works Union Local 100 goes on strike, which continues for 11 days.

title: Bristol
event: April 2 – The St. Pauls riot breaks out in Bristol.

title: Iran
event: April 7 – The United States severs diplomatic relations with Iran and imposes economic sanctions, following the taking of American hostages on November 4, 1979.

title: Gibraltar
event: April 10 – Spain and the United Kingdom agree to reopen the border between Gibraltar and Spain, closed since 1969.

title: Liberia
event: Samuel Kanyon Doe takes over Liberia in a ''coup d'état'', ending over 130 years of democratic presidential succession in that country.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 18 – Zimbabwe gains independence from the United Kingdom; Robert Mugabe becomes Prime Minister.

title: Iran
event: April 24–April 25 – Operation Eagle Claw, a commando mission in Iran to rescue American embassy hostages, is aborted after mechanical problems ground the rescue helicopters. Eight United States troops are killed in a mid-air collision during the failed operation.

title: Dan-Air Flight 1008
event: April 25 – Dan-Air Flight 1008 crashes in Tenerife, killing all 146 occupants and marking the worst air disaster involving a British-registered aircraft in terms of loss of life.

title: St Kilda Victoria
event: April 26 – Louise and Charmian Faulkner disappear from outside their flat in St Kilda, Victoria, Australia.

title: Special Air Service
event: Iranian Embassy Siege: Six Iranian-born terrorists take over the Iranian embassy in London, UK. SAS retakes the Embassy on May 5; 1 terrorist survives.

title: Josip Broz Tito
event: May 4 – Yugoslav President Josip Broz Tito dies. The funeral ceremony later becomes the world's biggest diplomatic meeting and media event ever, with more than 140 state delegations in Belgrade from all over the world (only the funeral of Pope John Paul II in April 2005 will have more news coverage and a higher number of delegations).

title: Tampa Bay
event: In Florida, the Liberian freighter ''Summit Venture'' hits the Sunshine Skyway Bridge over Tampa Bay, sending 35 people (most of whom were in a bus) to a watery death as a 1,400-foot section of the bridge collapses.

title: Norco shootout
event: The Norco shootout takes place in California.

title: New Jersey
event: James Alexander George Smith Jags McCartney the Turks and Caicos Islands’ first Chief Minister, is killed in a plane crash over New Jersey.

title: Ayacucho
event: Internal conflict in Peru: On the eve of presidential elections, Maoist guerrilla group Shining Path attacks a polling location in the town of Chuschi, Ayacucho.

title: Washington (U.S. state)
event: Mount St. Helens erupts in Washington, killing 57 and causing US$3 billion in damage.

title: Gwangju
event: May 18–May 27 – Gwangju Massacre: Students in Gwangju, South Korea begin demonstrations, calling for democratic reforms.

title: Quebec
event: May 20 – 1980 Quebec referendum: Voters in Quebec reject by a vote of 60% a proposal to seek independence from Canada.

title: Tehran
event: The International Court of Justice calls for the release of U.S. Embassy hostages in Tehran.

title: Indianapolis 500
event: May 25 – Indianapolis 500: Johnny Rutherford wins for a third time in car owner Jim Hall's revolutionary ground effect Chaparral car; the victory is Hall's second as an owner.

title: Tanna (island)
event: John Frum supporters in Vanuatu storm government offices on the island of Tanna. Vanuatu government troops land the next day and drive them away.

title: Fort Wayne Indiana
event: Vernon Jordan is shot and critically injured in an assassination attempt in Fort Wayne, Indiana by Joseph Paul Franklin (the first major news story for CNN).

title: Grand Island Nebraska
event: June 3 – A series of deadly tornadoes strikes Grand Island, Nebraska, causing over $300m in damage, killing 5 people and injuring over 250.

title: Los Angeles
event: June 9 – In Los Angeles, comedian Richard Pryor is badly burned trying to freebase cocaine.
