event: September 12 – A Metrolink train collides head-on into a freight train in Los Angeles, California, killing 25 and injuring 130.

title: Aeroflot Flight 821
event: September 14 – Aeroflot Flight 821 crashes near the city of Perm, Russia, killing all 88 on board.

title: Taiwan
event: September 19–25 – Typhoon Hagupit kills 17 in China, eight in the Philippines, one in Taiwan, and 41 in Vietnam.

title: Islamabad
event: September 20 – A suicide truck bomb explosion destroys the Marriott Hotel in Islamabad, Pakistan, killing at least 60 and injuring 266.

title: South Africa
event: September 21 – President Thabo Mbeki of South Africa resigns after accepting a call by the African National Congress.

title: Diet of Japan
event: September 24 – The Diet of Japan elects Taro Aso as the new Prime Minister of Japan.

title: People's Republic of China
event: September 25 – Shenzhou 7, the third manned Chinese spaceflight and the first with three crew members, is successfully launched. China becomes the third country ever to conduct a spacewalk.

title: India
event: September 30 – A Jodhpur temple stampede in western India kills over 224 people, and injures 400.

title: NASA
event: October 6 – NASA's MESSENGER spacecraft makes its second of three flybys of Mercury, decreasing the velocity for orbital insertion on March 18, 2011.

title: 2008 Kyrgyzstan earthquake
event: October 6 – An earthquake measuring 6.6 magnitude kills at least 65 in Kyrgyzstan.

title: 2008 TC3
event: October 7 – The meteoroid 2008 TC<sub>3</sub> impacts Earth, becoming the first such object to be discovered prior to impact.

title: Uganda
event: October 17 – The United Nations General Assembly elects Turkey, Austria, Japan, Uganda, and Mexico to two-year terms on the Security Council.

title: Large Hadron Collider
event: October 21 – The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) is officially inaugurated. It is a collaboration of over 10,000 scientists and engineers from over 100 countries as well as hundreds of universities and laboratories.

title: Bhutan
event: November 6 – King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck of Bhutan is crowned, having ascended to the throne in 2006.

title: Pétionville
event: November 7 – The 2008 Pétionville school collapse kills at least 92 in Pétionville, Haiti.

title: Palm Jumeirah
event: November 11 – The RMS Queen Elizabeth 2 departs on her last voyage from Southampton, UK to Dubai, UAE. She will become a floating hotel at Palm Jumeirah.

title: Lima
event: November 22 – 23 – The APEC Peru 2008 Summit is held in Lima.

title: Brazil
event: November 24 – The 2008 Santa Catarina floods in Santa Catarina, Brazil kill 126 and force the evacuation of over 78,000 people.

title: Denmark
event: November 25 – Greenland holds a referendum for increased autonomy from Denmark. The vote is over 75% in favour.

title: India
event: November 26 – November 29 – A series of terrorist attacks in Mumbai, India by Pakistan-based Islamic militants kills 195, and injures at least 250.

title: Sark
event: December 10 – The Channel Island of Sark, a British Crown Dependency, holds its first fully democratic elections under a new constitutional arrangement, becoming the last European territory to abolish feudalism.BBC Guernsey  date=9 December 2008 url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/guernsey/content/articles/2008/11/18/sark_election_candidates_2008_feature.shtml  accessdate=11 December 2008 }}<

title: Switzerland
event: December 12 – Switzerland becomes the 25th European country to join the Schengen Agreement, whereby cross-border passport checks will be abolished.

title: International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda
event: December 18 –  The International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda convicts Théoneste Bagosora and two other senior Rwandan army officers of genocide, crimes against humanity and war crimes and sentences them to life imprisonment.CNN  date=18 December 2008 url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/africa/12/18/rwanda.tribunal/index.html  accessdate=18 December 2008 }}<

title: Gwadar port
event: December 21 – Gwadar port, Pakistan becomes fully operational.

title: Guinea
event: December 23 – A military coup d'état is announced in Guinea shortly after the death of long-time President Lansana Conté.CNN  date=24 December 2008 url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/africa/12/23/guinea.president.dead/index.html  accessdate=24 December 2008 }}<

title: Gaza Strip
event: December 27 – Israel initiates Operation Cast Lead in the Gaza Strip after launching an extensive wave of airstrikes against military targets, police stations and government buildings within the Gaza Strip with the stated aim of stopping rocket fire from and arms import into the territory.Christian Science Monitor, December 26, 2008.< As a result, Hamas intensified its rocket and mortar attacks against Southern Israel, reaching the major cities of Beersheba and Ashdod for the first time.

title: Bangladesh
event: December 29 – Bangladesh holds its general elections after two years of political unrest over the interim government.BBC News  date=29 December 2008 url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7802529.stm  accessdate=30 December 2008 }}<

title: Uganda
event: January 1 – Austria, Japan, Mexico, Turkey, and Uganda assume their seats on the United Nations Security Council.

title: France
event: January 1 – The Czech Republic takes over the presidency of the Council of the European Union from France.

title: Vilnius
event: January 1 – Asunción, the capital of Paraguay, becomes the American Capital of Culture and Vilnius and Linz become the European Capitals of Culture.

title: Gaza Strip
event: January 3 – Israel launches a ground invasion of the Gaza Strip as the Gaza War enters its second week.

title: Rwanda
event: January 22 – Congolese rebel leader Laurent Nkunda is captured by Rwandan forces after crossing over the border into Rwanda.

title: International Criminal Court
event: January 26 – The first trial at the International Criminal Court is held. Former Union of Congolese Patriots leader Thomas Lubanga is accused of training child soldiers to kill, pillage, and rape.

title: Australia
event: February 7 – The deadliest bushfires in Australian history begin; they kill 173, injure 500 more, and leave 7,500 homeless. The fires come after Melbourne records the highest-ever temperature (46.4°C, 115°F) of any capital city in Australia. The majority of the fires are ignited by either fallen or clashing power lines or deliberately lit.

title: Siberia
event: February 10 – A Russian and an American satellite collide over Siberia, creating a large amount of space debris.

title: Sudan
event: February 17 – The JEM rebel group in Darfur, Sudan sign a pact with the Sudanese government, planning a ceasefire within the next three months.

title: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
event: February 26 – Former Serbian president Milan Milutinović is acquitted by the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia regarding war crimes during the Kosovo War.Reed Stevensonpublisher=Reutersaccessdate=2009-03-11}}<

title: Lahore
event: March 3 – Gunmen attack a bus carrying Sri Lankan cricketers in Lahore, Pakistan, killing eight people and injuring several others.BBC Newsaccessdate= 3 March 2009}}<

title: Darfur
event: March 4 – The International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for Sudanese President Omar Hassan al-Bashir for war crimes and crimes against humanity in Darfur. Al-Bashir is the first sitting head of state to be indicted by the ICC since its establishment in 2002.Reutersaccessdate= 4 March 2009}}<

title: Florida
event: March 7 – NASA's Kepler Mission, a space photometer which will search for extrasolar planets in the Milky Way galaxy, is launched from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station, Florida, USA.

title: Antananarivo
event: March 17 – The President of Madagascar, Marc Ravalomanana, is overthrown in a ''coup d'état'', following a month of rallies in Antananarivo. The military appoints opposition leader Andry Rajoelina as the new president.BBC Newsaccessdate= 17 March 2009}}<

title: NATO
event: April 1 – Albania and Croatia are admitted to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).

title: London
event: April 2 –  The second G-20 summit, involving state leaders rather than the usual finance ministers, meets in London. Its main focus is an ongoing global financial crisis.

title: Denmark
event: April 3–4 –  The 21st NATO Summit is held, 60 years after the founding of the organization. Former Danish Prime Minister Anders Fogh Rasmussen is appointed as the new Secretary General of NATO.

title: North Korea
event: April 5 – North Korea launches the Kwangmyŏngsŏng-2 rocket, prompting an emergency meeting of—but no official reaction from—the United Nations Security Council.CNNaccessdate= April 5, 2009}}<

title: Italy
event: April 6 – A 6.3 magnitude earthquake strikes near L'Aquila, Italy, killing nearly 300 and injuring more than 1,500.

title: Fiji
event: April 10 – A political crisis begins in Fiji when President Josefa Iloilo suspends the nation's Constitution, dismisses all judges and constitutional appointees and assumes all governance in the country after the Court of Appeal rules that the government of Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama is illegal.

title: Bangkok
event: April 11–12 – The Fourth East Asia Summit is postponed after Thai Prime Minister Abhisit Vejjajiva declares a state of emergency in Bangkok and surrounding areas.

title: Trinidad
event: April 17 – Thirty-four heads of state and government meet in Port of Spain, Trinidad for the 5th Summit of the Americas.

title: Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Russia)
event: April 29 – Amidst Russia's effort to improve relations with NATO and with the West in general, NATO expels two Russian diplomats from NATO headquarters in Brussels over a spy scandal in Estonia. Russia's Foreign Ministry criticises the expulsions.Reutersaccessdate= May 7, 2009}}<

title: North Hamgyong
event: May 25 – North Korea announces that it has conducted a second successful nuclear test in the province of North Hamgyong. The United Nations Security Council condemns the reported test.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: June 1 – Air France Flight 447, en route from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to Paris, crashes into the Atlantic Ocean, killing all 228 on board.

title: Iran
event: June 13 – Following the reelection of Iranian president Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, supporters of defeated candidate Mir-Hossein Mousavi accuse the government of fraud, and launch a series of sustained protests.

title: Organization of American States
event: June 28 – The Supreme Court of Honduras orders the arrest and exile of President Manuel Zelaya, claiming he was violating the nation's constitution by holding a referendum to stay in power. The ''coup d'état'' is condemned by the United Nations, the Organization of American States, and multiple nations around the world.

title: Moroni Comoros
event: June 30 – Yemenia Flight 626 crashes off the coast of Moroni, Comoros, killing all but one of the 153 passengers and crew.

title: Organization of American States
event: July 4 – The Organization of American States suspends Honduras due to the country's recent political crisis after its refusal to reinstate President Zelaya.

title: Xinjiang
event: July 5 – Over 150 are killed when a few thousand ethnic Uyghurs target local Han Chinese during major rioting in Ürümqi, Xinjiang.

title: Iran
event: July 15 – Caspian Airlines Flight 7908 crashes near Qazvin, Iran, killing all 168 on board.

title: Bolivia
event: August 3 – Bolivia becomes the first South American country to declare the right of indigenous people to govern themselves.

title: North Korea
event: August 4 – North Korean leader Kim Jong-il pardons two American journalists, who had been arrested and imprisoned for illegal entry earlier in the year, after former U.S. President Bill Clinton meets with Kim in North Korea.

title: Taiwan
event: August 7 – Typhoon Morakot hits Taiwan, killing 500 and stranding more than 1,000 via the worst flooding on the island in half a century.

title: Libya
event: August 20 – Abdelbaset al-Megrahi, imprisoned for the 1988 bombing of Pan Am Flight 103, is released by the Scottish government on compassionate grounds as he has terminal prostate cancer. He returns to his native Libya.

title: Philippines
event: September 26 – Typhoon Ketsana begins to cause record amounts of rainfall in Manila, Philippines, leading to the declaration of a state of calamity in 25 provinces.

title: Guinea
event: September 28 – At least 157 demonstrators are killed in a clash with the Guinean military.

title: American Samoa
event: September 29 – An 8.3-magnitude earthquake triggers a tsunami near the Samoan Islands. Many communities and harbors in Samoa and American Samoa are destroyed, and at least 189 are killed.

title: Sumatra
event: September 30 – A 7.6-magnitude earthquake strikes just off the coast of Sumatra, killing around 1,000 in Indonesia.

title: Rio de Janeiro
event: October 2 – The International Olympic Committee awards the 2016 Summer Olympics to Rio de Janeiro.

title: Republic of Ireland
event: October 2 – Ireland holds a second referendum on the EU's Lisbon Treaty. The amendment is approved by the Irish electorate,

title: Czech Republic
event: November 3 – The Czech Republic becomes the final member-state of the European Union to sign the Treaty of Lisbon, thereby permitting that document's initiation into European law.

title: NASA
event: November 13 – Having analyzed the data from the LCROSS lunar impact, NASA announces that it has found a significant quantity of water in the Moon's Cabeus crater.NASAdate=2009-11-13accessdate=2009-11-21quote=Preliminary data from NASA's Lunar Crater Observation and Sensing Satellite, or LCROSS, indicates the mission successfully uncovered water in a permanently shadowed lunar crater.archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nasa.gov%2Fhome%2Fhqnews%2F2009%2Fnov%2FHQ_09-265_LCROSS_Confirms_Water.html&date=2009-11-21archivedate=2009-11-21}}<

title: Large Hadron Collider
event: November 20 – CERN restarts the Large Hadron Collider particle accelerator in Geneva, Switzerland; they had shut it down on September 19, 2008.BBC News Online}}<

title: Philippines
event: November 23 – In the Philippines, at least 58 are abducted and killed in an election-related massacre in the province of Maguindanao. This appears to be the deadliest attack on journalists in recent history.Philippine Daily Inquirerpublisher=date=2009-11-26 accessdate=2009-11-26}} {{Dead linkdate=September 2010bot=H3llBot}}<

title: Dubai
event: November 27 – Dubai requests a debt deferment following its massive renovation and development projects, as well as the late 2000s economic crisis. The announcement causes global stock markets to drop.

title: Denmark
event: December 7 – December 18 – The UNFCCC's United Nations Climate Change Conference 2009 conference is held in Copenhagen, Denmark.

title: 2010 Lakki Marwat suicide bombing
event: January 1 – A suicide bombing occurs at a volleyball game in northwestern Pakistan, killing at least 95, and injuring over 100.The Nationurl=http://www.nation.com.pk/pakistan-news-newspaper-daily-english-online/Politics/02-Jan-2010/Bomber-rams-car-into-volleyball-venueaccessdate=2 January 2010}}<

title: Dubai
event: January 4 – The tallest man-made structure to date, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, is officially opened.USA Todayaccessdate=4 January 2010location=Dubai}}<BBC Newsaccessdate=2010-01-04}}<

title: 2010 Haiti earthquake
event: January 12 – A 7.0-magnitude earthquake occurs in Haiti, devastating the nation's capital, Port-au-Prince. With a confirmed death toll over 230,000 it is one of the deadliest on record.

title: Beirut Rafic Hariri International Airport
event: January 25 – Ethiopian Airlines Flight 409 crashes into the Mediterranean Sea shortly after take-off from Beirut Rafic Hariri International Airport, killing all 90 people on-board.

title: London
event: February 3 – The sculpture ''L'Homme qui marche I'' by Alberto Giacometti sells in London for £65 million (US$103.7 million), setting a new world record for a work of art sold at auction.

title: Whistler British Columbia
event: February 12–28 – The 2010 Winter Olympics are held in Vancouver and Whistler, Canada.

title: Pacific Ocean
event: February 27 – An 8.8-magnitude earthquake occurs in Chile, triggering a tsunami over the Pacific and killing 497. The earthquake is one of the largest in recorded history.

title: Uganda
event: March 16 – The Kasubi Tombs, Uganda's only cultural World Heritage Site, are destroyed by fire.

title: North Korea
event: March 23 – The ''ROKS Cheonan'', a South Korean Navy ship carrying 104 personnel, sinks off the country's west coast, killing 46. In May, an independent investigation blames North Korea, which denies the allegations.

title: Bishkek
event: April 7 – Kyrgyz President Kurmanbek Bakiyev flees Bishkek amid fierce rioting, sparking a sociopolitical crisis. Former foreign minister Roza Otunbayeva is placed at the head of an interim government as the opposition seizes control.

title: 2010 Polish Air Force Tu-154 crash
event: April 10 – The President of Poland, Lech Kaczyński, is among 96 killed when their airplane crashes in western Russia.

title: People's Republic of China
event: April 13 – A 6.9-magnitude earthquake occurs in Qinghai, China, killing at least 2,000 and injuring more than 10,000.

title: 2010 eruptions of Eyjafjallajökull
event: April 14 – Volcanic ash from one of several eruptions beneath Eyjafjallajökull, an ice cap in Iceland, begins to disrupt air traffic across northern and western Europe.Norwegian Air Shuttleaccessdate=2010-04-15}} {{Dead linkdate=September 2010bot=H3llBot}}<

title: Deepwater Horizon oil spill
event: April 20 – The Deepwater Horizon oil platform explodes in the Gulf of Mexico, killing eleven workers. The resulting oil spill, one of the largest in history, spreads for several months, damaging the waters and the United States coastline, and prompting international debate and doubt about the practice and procedures of offshore drilling.msnbc.comaccessdate=2010-09-06}}<

title: Greece
event: April 27 – Standard & Poor's downgrades Greece's sovereign credit rating to junk four days after the activation of a €45-billion EU–IMF bailout, triggering the decline of stock markets worldwide and of the Euro's value, and furthering a European sovereign debt crisis.

title: New York
event: May 4 – ''Nude, Green Leaves and Bust'' by Pablo Picasso sells in New York for US$106.5 million, setting another new world record for a work of art sold at auction.

title: Libya
event: May 12 – Afriqiyah Airways Flight 771 crashes at runway at Tripoli International Airport in Libya, killing 103 of the 104 people on board.

title: Bangkok
event: May 19 – Protests in Bangkok, Thailand ends with a bloody military crackdown, killing 91 and more than 2,100 injured.

title: India
event: May 22 – Air India Express Flight 812 overshoots the runway at Mangalore International Airport in India, killing 158 and leaving 8 survivors.

title: Gaza flotilla raid
event: May 31 – Nine activists are killed in a clash with soldiers when Israeli Navy forces raid and capture a flotilla of ships attempting to break the Gaza blockade.

title: 2010 South Kyrgyzstan riots
event: June 9 – Ethnic riots in Kyrgyzstan between Kyrgyz and Uzbeks results in the deaths of hundreds.

title: South Africa
event: June 11 – July 11 – The 2010 FIFA World Cup is held in South Africa, and is won by Spain.

title: Oaxaca
event: September 28 – Seven people are reported to have been killed and around 100 are missing after a landslide in Oaxaca, Mexico.

title: San José Mine
event: October 13 – Thirty-three miners near Copiapó, Chile, trapped 700 metres underground in a mining accident in San José Mine, are brought back to the surface after surviving for a record 69 days.MSNBCaccessdate=14 October 2010location=Chile}}<

title: Sumatra
event: October 25 – An earthquake and consequent tsunami off the coast of Sumatra, Indonesia, kills over 400 people and leave hundreds missing.BBC Newsdate=2010-10-25accessdate=2010-10-26}}<

title: Aero Caribbean Flight 883
event: November 4 – Aero Caribbean Flight 883 crashes in central Cuba, killing all 68 people on board.The New York Timesaccessdate=6 November 2010}}<

title: Aung San Suu Kyi
event: November 13 – Burmese opposition politician Aung San Suu Kyi is released from her house arrest.BBC Newsdate=13 November 2010}}<

title: CERN
event: November 17 – Researchers at CERN trap 38 antihydrogen atoms for a sixth of a second, marking the first time in history that humans have trapped antimatter.

title: Raidió Teilifís Éireann
event: November 21 – Eurozone countries agree to a rescue package for the Republic of Ireland from the European Financial Stability Facility in response to the country's financial crisis.RTÉ News and Current Affairspublisher=Raidió Teilifís Éireannaccessdate=21 November 2010}}<

title: Phnom Penh
event: November 22 – A stampede during Bon Om Thook (Khmer Water Festival) celebrations in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, kills 347.

title: Yeonpyeong Island
event: November 23 – North Korea shells Yeonpyeong Island, prompting a military response by South Korea. The incident caused an escalation of tension on the Korean Peninsula and prompted widespread international condemnation. The United Nations declared it to be one of the most serious incidents since the end of the Korean War.The Chosun Ilbo date=2010-11-23 accessdate=2010-11-23}}<Reuters date=2010-11-23 accessdate=2010-11-23}}<

title: Raidió Teilifís Éireann
event: November 29 – The European Union agree to an €85 billion rescue deal for Ireland from the European Financial Stability Facility, the International Monetary Fund and bilateral loans from the United Kingdom, Denmark and Sweden.RTÉ News and Current Affairspublisher=Raidió Teilifís Éireannaccessdate=29 November 2010}}<

title: NASA
event: December 2 – NASA announces the discovery of the bacteria GFAJ-1 which may be able to partially replace phosphorous with arsenic in some of its biomolecules.

title: Southern Hemisphere
event: December 21 – The first total lunar eclipse to occur on the day of the northern winter solstice/southern summer solstice since 1638, takes place.

title: Universal House of Justice
event: The Universal House of Justice will announce the new Five Year Plan.

title: Blue Waters
event: Blue Waters, a petascale supercomputer being designed and built as a joint effort between the National Center for Supercomputing Applications, the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and IBM is expected to be completed in this year.

title: Deutschlandfunk
event: A new definition of the kilogram, based on universal constants, is likely to be announced at the 24th General Conference on Weights and Measures.Deutschlandfunk date=28 March 2010 first=Jan last=Lublinski postscript= }} {{de icon}}.<

title: Estonia
event: January 1 – Estonia joins the Eurozone.

title: Southern Sudan
event: January 9 – Southern Sudan holds a referendum on independence.

title: Brazil
event: January 11 –  Flooding and mudslides in the Brazilian state of Rio de Janeiro kill more than 480.

title: Bangladesh
event: February 19 – April 2 – 2011 Cricket World Cup will be held in India, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh.

title: NASA
event: March 18 – NASA's ''MESSENGER'' spacecraft is scheduled to arrive in orbit around Mercury.

title: NASA
event: March 18 – NASA's Pluto probe ''New Horizons'' will cross the orbit of Uranus, after a five-year journey. This will be faster than ''Voyager 2'', which took eight years.

title: India
event: June 15 – Total lunar eclipse, mainly visible in Africa, India, and the Middle East.

title: Antarctica
event: July 1 – Partial solar eclipse off the coast of Antarctica.

title: International Olympic Committee
event: July 6 – In Durban, South Africa, the International Olympic Committee will announce the host city of the 2018 Winter Olympics.

title: Madrid
event: August 15–21 – XXVI World Youth Day will be held in Madrid, Spain.

title: New Zealand
event: September 9 – October 23 – New Zealand will host the 2011 Rugby World Cup.

title: Antarctica
event: November 25 – Partial solar eclipse in Antarctica.

title: Alaska
event: December 10 – Total lunar eclipse, visible mainly in Asia, Australia and Alaska.

title: Iraq
event: December 31 – All United States troops are scheduled to leave Iraq

title: People's Republic of China
event: China will launch the Kuafu spacecraft.

title: Ames Research Center
event: ''Pleiades'', a proposed supercomputer built by Intel and SGI for NASA's Ames Research Center, will be completed, reaching a peak performance of 10 Petaflops (10 quadrillion floating point operations per second).

title: Caucasus
event: The Kars–Tbilisi–Baku railway across the Caucasus is scheduled to be completed sometime in 2012. National Geographic'', August 2010, page 62. <

title: NASA
event: January 31 – 433 Eros, the second-largest Near Earth Object on record (size 13×13×33 km) will pass Earth at {{convert0.1790AUkm mi0abbr=offlk=on}}. NASA studied Eros with the NEAR Shoemaker probe launched on February 17, 1996.

title: New Zealand
event: February 6 – Diamond Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II marking the 60th anniversary of her accession to the Thrones of the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia & New Zealand (as well as the 60th anniversary of her becoming Head of the Commonwealth).

title: Iran
event: March 20 – Spring Equinox, Persian New Year (Nouruz), also known as Ostara

title: Yeosu
event: May 12 – August 12 – The  2012 World Expo is to be held in Yeosu, South Korea.

title: California
event: May 20 - Annular solar eclipse. Path of annularity runs through the Pacific Ocean from northern China to California.

title: London
event: July 27 – Opening ceremony of the 2012 Summer Olympics begins in London at 19:30 UTC, 20:30 BST.

title: London
event: August 12 – Closing ceremony of the 2012 Summer Olympics in London.

title: London
event: August 29 – Opening ceremony of the 2012 Summer Paralympics begins in London.

title: London
event: September 9 – Closing ceremony of the 2012 Summer Paralympics in London.

title: Australia
event: November 13 - Total solar eclipse (visible in northern Australia and the South Pacific).

title: People's Republic of China
event: China will make its first unmanned Moon landing.

title: NASA
event: NASA's Venus In-Situ Explorer mission to Venus (part of the New Frontiers program).

title: NASA
event: NASA's Mars Atmosphere and Volatile Evolution Mission (MAVEN) is set to launch.

title: Hong Kong
event: The Hong Kong MTR West Island Line is due to start service in late 2013.

title: Denmark
event: In the BBC mockumentary ''Time Trumpet'', British retail chain, Tesco launches an invasion of Denmark on January 21 of this year.

title: France
event: January 1 – Marseille in France and Košice in Slovakia become European Capitals of Culture.

title: Australia
event: May 10 – Annular solar eclipse in the South Pacific, visible in Australia.

title: Buenos Aires
event: September 7 - Election of the host city of the 2020 Summer Olympics, in Buenos Aires

title: National September 11 Memorial & Museum
event: The entire World Trade Center site is estimated to be completed by 2014, including 1 World Trade Center, 200 Greenwich Street, 175 Greenwich Street, 150 Greenwich Street, 130 Liberty Street, and the National September 11 Memorial & Museum.

title: Masdar City
event: The Masdar City is scheduled to be completed. Its goal is to be the world's first fully sustainable, zero-carbon, and zero-waste city.

title: Smithsonian Institution
event: The International Cometary Explorer, a NASA solar probe that was re-tooled for a mission to explore comets, will approach Earth 31 years after leaving its gravitational influence.  Unless it is again reactivated for a new mission, it has enough propellant to be re-captured in the Earth system and potentially recovered.  It has already been donated to the Smithsonian Institution if it is ever recovered.

title: Brazil
event: June 13 - July 13 - 2014 FIFA World Cup is held in Brazil

title: NASA
event: February – NASA's Dawn spacecraft is expected to arrive at the dwarf planet Ceres.

title: ITER
event: The first plasma operation of the fusion reactor ITER is expected.

title: USS Gerald R. Ford (CVN-78)
event: The United States Navy will commission USS ''Gerald R. Ford'', the first ship in a new class of supercarriers.

title: International Olympic Committee
event: The winning nation for the 2022 Winter Olympics will be announced by the IOC.

title: European Space Agency
event: ESA Solar Orbiter (SOLO), will orbit the Sun to perform close observations of the polar regions of the Sun

title: European Space Agency
event: 2015 is the earliest year the European Space Agency might launch the Darwin Mission to search for exoplanets that could possibly harbor life.

title: 2015 Rugby World Cup
event: 2015 Rugby World Cup, in England.

title: New Zealand
event: 2015 Cricket World Cup, in Australia and New Zealand.

title: London
event: ''Star Trek: Deep Space Nine'' (Past Tense, 1995): By 2015, London has its own Major League Baseball team, the London Kings.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: March 20 – Total solar eclipse (visible in the North Atlantic).

title: Diego Garcia
event: The right for the U.S. forces to use Diego Garcia in the Chagos Islands as a military base will end at this year, but there will be a provision for an automatic extension for another 20 years for the US forces to remain stationed on the island.

title: ITER
event: ITER, an international scientific experiment (2nd largest worldwide ever) into developing nuclear fusion as an energy source will boot up for the first time.

title: NASA
event: NASA Juno, Jupiter orbiter

title: Italy
event: The world's largest suspension bridge - the Strait of Messina Bridge - will be completed, connecting Sicily and mainland Italy.

title: Brazil
event: August 5 - 21 - 2016 Summer Olympics will be held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

title: Brazil
event: September 7 - 18 - 2016 Summer Paralympics will be held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

title: People's Republic of China
event: The government of China has announced it will start sending probes to the Moon in 2017, resulting in a manned Chinese landing on the moon in a few years.

title: Denmark
event: In Copenhagen (Denmark), the City Circle Line extension of the metro will open.

title: France
event: In France the case-documents regarding the execution of assumed World War I double spy Mata Hari will be revealed.

title: Alcochete Airport
event: In Lisbon, the new Alcochete Airport starts operations.

title: European Extremely Large Telescope
event: The European Extremely Large Telescope is scheduled to be completed.

title: India
event: India will complete construction on the Dibang Valley Dam near Roing and Anini.

title: Republic of Macedonia
event: January 1 – Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Macedonia, Montenegro, Serbia and Turkey are set to enter the European Union.

title: Yucca Mountain nuclear waste repository
event: March 31 – The Yucca Mountain nuclear waste repository is scheduled to begin accepting nuclear waste.

title: Hong Kong
event: July 1 – The first possible government in Hong Kong elected by universal suffrage is scheduled to take office.

title: Kentucky
event: August 21 – From 16:50 to 20:02 UTC, the first total solar eclipse of the 21st century for the United States, and the first visible in the continental U.S. since February 26, 1979, takes place. Totality will occur along a path curving from Oregon to South Carolina, and will last at most 2 minutes 40.2 seconds.  The location and time of greatest eclipse will be on the western edge of Christian County, Kentucky at 36.9715 degrees North and 87.6559 degrees West occurring at 18:25.4716 UTC.

title: ITER
event: The International nuclear fusion project ITER is expected to be completed.

title: Fehmarn Belt Fixed Link
event: The Fehmarn Belt Fixed Link is expected to be completed.

title: Giant Magellan Telescope
event: The Giant Magellan Telescope will be completed.

title: United Kingdom
event: January 1 – Estonia takes over the Presidency of the Council of the European Union from the United Kingdom.

title: Estonia
event: July 1 – Bulgaria takes over the Presidency of the Council of the European Union from Estonia.

title: United Kingdom
event: The papers providing reason or reasons for the deportation of Gerald Haxton from Britain as an undesirable alien will be open to public view.

title: Hong Kong
event: Completion of the North-south line of the Hong KongMTR.

title: Singapore
event: 2019 Rugby World Cup will be held in Japan, with some matches played in Hong Kong and Singapore, first time for the Rugby World Cup to be hosted in Asia.

title: Hong Kong
event: This is the year that the Hong Kong MTR South Island Line east section is expected to be completed.

title: Queensland
event: In Australia, Queensland is expected to overtake Victoria as the second most populous state of the nation.

title: NASA
event: NASA Venus Surface Explorer mission to Venus (part of the New Frontiers program)

title: Trinidad and Tobago
event: Trinidad and Tobago becomes a developed country under the Vision 2020 development plan initiated by Former Prime Minister Patrick Manning. (Current Prime Minister, as of May 24th, 2010: The Hon. Kamla Persad-Bissessar) [http://www.vision2020.info.tt/].

title: India
event: India becomes a developed country as pledged by President A P J Abdul Kalam.

title: Philippines
event: Philippines becomes a developed country as pledged by Former President Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo.

title: Shanghai
event: Shanghai is set to become an international financial centre and global shipping hub.

title: Aral Sea
event: If current trends continue, according to the United Nations, the Aral Sea could disappear completely by this year.

title: FIFA
event: FIFA's World Cup will be hosted by Qatar.

title: Marshall Islands
event: The Compact of Free Association between the United States and the Federated States of Micronesia and the Marshall Islands expires.

title: Thames Barrier
event: ''Doomsday'' (2008): briefly mentions the extension of the Thames Barrier due to torrential floods in 2023

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: April 8 – Total solar eclipse (Central Pacific Ocean, northern Mexico, eastern and central United States, southeastern Canada and northern Atlantic Ocean).

title: Oceania
event: The 23rd FIFA World Cup will take place.The three most eligible canadidates are Canada, the USA or Colombia . Other possible regions to bid for the World Cup are the CONMEBOL (South America), CAF (Africa) and the OFC (Oceania)

title: People's Republic of China
event: At current population growth rates, India will surpass China as the world's most populous country.

title: Sagrada Família
event: Having begun in 1882, construction of the Sagrada Família in Barcelona will be finished.

title: United Kingdom
event: April 21 – the 100th anniversary of the birth of Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom.

title: Czech Republic
event: Lease on Moldauhafen port lot in Hamburg, Germany to the Czech Republic is set to expire.

title: NASA
event: NASA's New Horizons spacecraft is scheduled to leave the solar system.

title: New Zealand
event: All New Zealand cars will be hybrid, bio-fuel, or electric.{{Citation neededdate=January 2011}}

title: India
event: ''Super'': A Kannada-language movie directed by Upendra set in a Utopian India in the year 2030. It begins in 2030, regresses back to the current (2010), and ends in 2030.

title: Apollo 12
event: Projected return to Earth orbit of object J002E3, the discarded S-IVB third stage of the Apollo 12 Saturn V.

title: Diego Garcia
event: The U.S. military's contract with the United Kingdom to use Diego Garcia as a military base would end, if the contract were extended in 2016.

title: New York City
event: Most of the ''Once Upon a Time Machine'' episode of the 1987 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles cartoon series is set in the year 2036. It's an era of peace and without any crimes in New York City, when Shredder, Bebop and Rocksteady travel in time from 1991 to 2036 in an attempt to rule the future  .

title: Epcot
event: The popular Epcot ride, Mission Space, takes place this year.

title: Royal Archives
event: Certain documents relating to Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon's wishes to preserve a monarchy if the Nazis occupied the UK are to be released from the Royal Archives.

title: Old Bailey
event: In the film ''V for Vendetta'', V destroys the Old Bailey with homemade explosives on November 5 of this year.

title: London
event: In ''V for Vendetta'', the Palace of Westminster in London is destroyed by V on November 5.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: January 5 – Annular solar eclipse in the Caribbean Sea, Atlantic Ocean, and western Africa.

title: Atlantic Ocean
event: July 2 – Annular solar eclipse in northern South America, the Atlantic Ocean, and Africa.

title: New Zealand
event: December 26 – Total solar eclipse in Australia and New Zealand.

title: United Kingdom
event: September 2 – The Destroyers for Bases Agreement's ninety-nine-year rent-free leases granted to the United States by the United Kingdom will expire.

title: NASA
event: NASA predicts that by this year it will cost only tens of dollars per pound to launch humans or cargo into space.NASA accessdate=2010-01-06}}<

title: Nickelodeon Studios
event: April 30 – The Nickelodeon time capsule will be dug up.

title: Northern Hemisphere
event: A devastating nuclear war destroys most of the Northern Hemisphere in John Wyndham's ''The Outward Urge''.

title: John F. Kennedy Library
event: May 19 – The Kennedy Library will release to the public a 500-page transcript of an oral history about John F. Kennedy given by Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis (if her last child has died). {{Citation neededdate=January 2008}}

title: Normandy American Cemetery and Memorial
event: June 6 – The time capsule at the Normandy American Cemetery and Memorial will be opened.

title: North Dakota
event: August 23 – Total solar eclipse from Montana to North Dakota.

title: South Africa
event: In South Africa white minority rule comes to an end as most of the whites are massacred in an uprising, in John Wyndham's ''The Outward Urge''.

title: Florida
event: August 12 – A solar eclipse will occur from northern California to Florida.

title: Hong Kong
event: Contrary to some pre-release speculations, the 2004 film ''2046'' does not entirely take place in this year. Rather,  a science fiction subplot set in that year does form part of the narrative. The date is a reference to the end of the fifty year period of  One country, two systems that allows Hong Kong to remain a separate Administrative Region. In 2047 Hong Kong will no longer maintain its separate capitalist political and economic system and its own way of life protected under the Sino-British Joint Declaration.

title: Los Angeles
event: In the Star Trek universe the city of Los Angeles is struck by the Hermosa Earthquake causing parts of the city to fall into the sea.

title: Rio de Janeiro
event: In the SimCity video game, floodings hit Rio de Janeiro due to global warming.

title: People's Republic of China
event: July 1 – The present one country, two systems in Hong Kong is scheduled to end, as it was guaranteed for 50 years starting from July 1, 1997, provided under the Hong Kong Basic Law. The agreement was raised by Deng Xiaoping to deal with Hong Kong's reunification with the People's Republic of China in 1997, and stipulated in the Sino-British Joint Declaration of 1984. What will be done is not stated in any document. See also the transcript of Deng's dialogue with Margaret Thatcher: [http://202.99.23.245/deng/newfiles/c1320.html].

title: Macau
event: December 20 – The present One country, two systems with Macau, guaranteed for 50 years starting from December 20, 1999 provided under the Basic Law, will expire.

title: European Commission
event: Another study done by the European Commission, community research said that the world population is expected to grow at a decreasing rate to 8.9 billions in 2050 and after 2030, the population in several countries including Europe and China will decrease. Stabilization in the population will happen in the second half of the century.

title: People's Republic of China
event: Goldman Sachs predicts that by 2050, the five largest economies in the world along with the United States will be Brazil, Russia, India, China, and Mexico.N11 nations, Global Economics Paper No: 153, March 28, 2007.<

title: George Orwell
event: ''Nineteen Eighty-Four'' by George Orwell (1948): The language Newspeak will become the official language of Oceania.

title: Institute of Psychiatry
event: Over 1.7 million people in the United Kingdom will be suffering from dementia according to reports published in 2007 by the London School of Economics and Institute of Psychiatry.BBC News url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/health/6389977.stm }}<

title: United Kingdom
event: In the United Kingdom a centennial national exhibition should in theory be held in keeping with the precedent set by the Great Exhibition of 1851 and the 1951 Festival of Britain.

title: NASA
event: This year will see the very rare occurrence of '''two''' total solar eclipses in a single calendar year (on January 3 and December 26). The last time this occurred was 1889. The next time it will occur is 2252. (Eclipse predictions by Fred Espenak, NASA/GSFC.)

title: M6 Toll
event: In the UK Midland Expressway Limited (MEL) contract to run the M6 Toll expires.

title: Pixar
event: The mega-corporation Buy 'N Large is founded in the year 2057 in the Pixar Animation Studios film WALL-E.

title: Albury New South Wales
event: Paralleled by 2 Victorian steam trains towards Albury at Aus Steam '88   ''(22 October 1988)''

event: A4040 road, a road in Birmingham, England

event: The Post Code for Inala, Queensland, Australia.

event: The Postcode for Tolaga Bay, Gisborne Region, New Zealand
